review_body: Based on location it’s a great place. Easy to access from Ueno main station or Skyliner from Narita even with suitcases. 3-4 minute walk. Rooms smallish - but standard for Japan. But clean and an efficient service all round. The hotel is in the heart of lively Ueno with cafes, bars, good restaurants and a shopping mall nearby and easy access to central Tokyo and Shibuya on Ginza lineRecommended!
hotelName:
0    Mitsui Garden Hotel Ueno
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Mitsu Gardens Ueno Hotel for 2 nights. Glad it wasn't any longer. A so called double bed was small, put against the wall which made it difficult to get out of the bed in the ight. A desk against the window, a small bathroom. Nothing to get excited about. Check-in was efficient and friendly. As it was Golden week in Japan, we were told to arrive at breakfast early as there would be a lot of guests there. We arrived at 0650 am, the restaurant was already full and a long line already formed. We had prepaid breKfSt at booking, months prior and were not happy to queue for 30 mins or more to get breakfast. Apoarantly there was a sign at reception saying there will be delays with breakfast, but we wernt aware of this when booking and paying. We asked for a refund on Breakfast and got breakfast out. It's close to Ueno railway station, the shrines, zoo, park and there's a convenience store across the road
hotelName:
0    Mitsui Garden Hotel Ueno
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is very conveniently placed near to Ueno Station and also the Skyliner station which we needed to use at 6.20 am back to the airport on our final day. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Check in and out were easy. I had booked the Sakura panda room as a final treat for our last 3 days in Tokyo. The room was a good size (by Tokyo standards!) as was the bathroom. The Sakura panda room was super cute and made us smile. The room was clean and fresh and I liked the little extra touches such as the samples of Shisiedo products, the hair straighteners and free water. The room was cleaned and made up each day. There were two lifts, which, as this is quite a large hotel, were very useful. The hotel was mainly quiet in the room where were were situated and we slept well. We both struggled with the unusual pillows so it would have been good to have had a choice of pillows in the room. Breakfast was quite expensive given that neither of us eat Asian food for breakfast (although we like it at other times of the day). I just had cereal and croissants and my daughter ate very little. This is quite usual for Japan but we would have liked a bit more choice of continental breakfast. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
0    Mitsui Garden Hotel Ueno
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: this hotel is very covenient location near ueno station. (come from narita by Keisei skyliner) Location near Ueno garden and shopping street (Ameyoko). This hotel is clean with all necessary facilities in the room, and good breakfast.
hotelName:
0    Mitsui Garden Hotel Ueno
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Mitsui Garden hotel is a popular (and therefore busy) 3 star establishment, very conveniently located about 50m from Exit 1 of the Ueno station complex. This means that it is possible to arrive from Narita Airport straight to Ueno and then carry or roll your luggage under one covered roof without needing additional transport or assistance. It is a few hundred metres from the arrival platform and there are a couple of small flights of stairs without lifts but it’s pretty convenient.Other than its location as a good base to explore Tokyo, the hotel is clean and modern with all necessary facilities in the rooms and refrigerated drinks dispensers on each floor. The staff speak good English and will also store your luggage whilst you go out sightseeing before check-in or after check-out and operate a service to forward your luggage to your next destination if you don’t want to carry it for a fee of around USD 18 per case. This is particularly useful if your next destination is Hakone which involves about 5 changes of public transport.On the down side, in common with many Japanese hotels, the rooms are small. Breakfast is mainly Japanese plus a few items such as croissants and sausages. The dining room, which doubles as an Italian restaurant in the evening is relatively small and a wait can be expected at peak times in the morning. On balance, to be recommended.
hotelName:
0    Mitsui Garden Hotel Ueno
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are staying in a semi-double room. Bed size is fine. Good location and convenient. Just less than 10 minutes walk and convenient store nearby. Panasonic hair dryer and nanocare were perfect. Steam the face anytime. Room is bigger than other Tokyo city hotel. Really expressive. The worst thing is pillow is too thin use for one. Two pillows are too high. For my past experience stayed at Sapporo Mitsui Garden did not have this problem.
hotelName:
0    Mitsui Garden Hotel Ueno
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Plus:1. Very good location, with Ueno Station just opposite. About 30 min train ride to Shinjuku and Shibuya.2. Room size was just nice, I would think that it’s slightly bigger than other Japanese hotels that I had stayed in the past. 3. Friendly and helpful front desk. Minus:1. Bed was slightly sinking and pillows were flat.. ouch, my neck..2. But of all things, this left the deepest impression on me.. the toilet floor was dirty and it reeked of pee smell..
hotelName:

review_body: My room was big for Japan, with a comfortable toilet and a big bathtub. The staff were helpful, and they gave me Shiseido skincare amenities for my stay, which was definitely appreciated. Best thing about the hotel is its location: a few minutes walk away from the Keisei station and even nearer the JR Ueno Asakusa gate. It's also very near Ameyoko market and is surrounded by restaurants and malls. Will definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
0    Mitsui Garden Hotel Ueno
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Arrived in Ueno station mid morning and walked to hotel to see if I could leave my luggage for a day of sightseeing. Staff was extremely helpful and accommodating. Spent the day exploring the area and when I returned to check in the staff had placed my luggage in my room already. Check in was quick, staff at the desk spoke English well. Room is great. Nice size and well furnished. Very convenient location to Ueno station and to catch skyliner to Narita airport.
hotelName:
0    Mitsui Garden Hotel Ueno
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel itself is small and less facilities when compared with other Mitsubishi Garden hotels. It’s clean but there are odours from the washroom even though after cleaning up everyday from the housekeeping. I guess it’s a structural issue. The staff are very friendly and efficient. When compared with the hotel rates, I think it’s a bit over-priced but there is room to improve.
hotelName:
0    Mitsui Garden Hotel Ueno
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stay for 3 nights Travel with Family on 3 adults for one room, upgrading from Standard type to Superior type room (double bed) with extra bed, however, found that no space for extra bed to fill in the room!. also, a bed size is quite bigger than normal and can accommodate 3 persons.room size claim 25sq.m. but seems not bigger than Standard type. I can said its so small for 3 persons, admitted that this is a city center hotel in Tokyo.A bed size is good but a bit hard, not comfortable for person that love a soft bed.Staffs are excellence and professional, small lobby need to fast check-in or out, staffs do the job very well. Breakfast is so Japanese style, if you stay more than 3 nights you may consider getting some breakfast outside due to the same menu every day.location is king, you can travel for city and outside Tokyo, great for Airport departure or arrival, you can walk 10 mins from Keisei Skyline to and from Narita AirportPro: location, can go by Metro, JR, Keisei Sky liner to any location easily.Staffs is very good training and prof.Con: - Breakfast is may not worth to spend if you don't like local Japanese tofu.- Small space for the breakfast room, sometimes you need to wait for a queue- Room size is smaller than expected- Shampoo and Body soap is not that good Its not a high grade, compare with Mitsui Garden Kyoto.

review_body: Great location, just few steps to Ueno Station. Hotel's lobby is very small but feel warmly welcome by all staffs. Quite small both guest's room and bathroom but functional and well designed. Loved the hotel 's TV which has relax music mode, it made us feel comfortable while stay in room :) Amenities are perfect ex. shower cap, Face soap, shower gel, Shampoo, conditioner, toothbrush, comb, shaving, slipper and bottle of water, only should have body lotion as well. Housekeeping did a very good job and meet our requirement. Front staffs are professional, service minded and can speak English very well. Wifi is good and fast. Shops, restaurants, Ueno park, Ameyoko and departmenstore are around hotel. Recommend if you plan to stay around Ueno.

review_body: Clean, friendly efficient staff.Very conveniently located just opposite the Ueno Station.Plenty of shops & eateries within walking distance.Healthy, delicious Japanese breakfast.Rooms a little small but that is expected in Tokyo. Overall a good hotel & a good balance.

review_body: We have enjoyed our stay here. After arriving via Keisei skyline rat Ueno Keisei skyliner station, it’s easy to find as once you step outside it is one of the tallest buildings in Ueno with its name clearly written at the top of the building. Head towards jr Ueno statin, or any signs that say Atre stores towards the big walkway overpass and you are heading in the right direction. If raining you can also make you way underground from Ueno to exit 1 that comes out directly next to the hotel entrance. Location is excellent and central to all of yen unless included in your package. It has Japanese, continental and some pasta options. We enjoyed the variety especially the tofu options, 5 different types! Many eating optiions a few minutes walk from hotel.

review_body: Its a cozy and nice place with a great location. you have access to JR and all other public transport as its just 5min walk to UENO train station. Nightlife is also very close and offers a great selection of eateries, etc. Overall a beautiful place, although the rooms are small.
hotelName:
0    Mitsui Garden Hotel Ueno
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent four days at the Mitsui Ueno a double room with Sakura Panda decorations(which was fun). Room as expected was small, but was spotless; shower was strong with plenty of hot water. Location of hotel is fantastic-just across from Ueno Park, which has so many things to see you could spend a week there alone. Take Keisei Skyliner in from Narita and you're just a couple of minutes walking from the station to the hotel. Many, many, many restaurants in local area, as well as shopping opportunities, and subway is right there for getting around Tokyo. Staff was wonderul; overall great stay and highly recommend.
hotelName:
0    Mitsui Garden Hotel Ueno
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Slightly over my budget but worth every penny and more! Female travelling alone I wanted to be in a safe and convenient location, the hotel is pretty much part of the Ueno Station! Hotel room (I chose female friendly floor) was small but larger than I anticipated and filled with an entire shop full of products and toiletries! Housekeeping were both thorough and considerate (they don't disturb you!). Staying for six nights I felt at home, you can come and go with a sense of independence but with the added security of front desk 24/7 if needed. Great WiFi, Air Conditioning and another air purifying system, not sure what it was!Only downfall, arriving at midnight I didn't receive any precise walking directions from Ueno Station, which exit etc - the station is quite large with many exits and tunnels. It was quite stressful (even with Google Maps) dragging my luggage across busy roads having just arrived in Tokyo and trying to find the hotel alone and late at night following a 20 hour journey. If supplied, it would have made my stay even better.
hotelName:

review_body: This is a wonder Hotel. Excellent staff. Very very friendly and professional. The location is walking distance from the train station. We were able to roll our luggages from the subway to the hotel without any problem. Location is great. It is walking distance to many stores and restaurants. Did I mention it’s takes 5-6 minutes to walk to the subway station. Japanese subway system is top notch. It takes you everywhere; very convenient. Back to the hotel. The room is good size and extremely clean. All toiletries included; you don't need to bring anything. It even has a hepa air filtration machine in the room. Bed is nice and firm. AC is quiet and functioning flawlessly. Free wifi that is strong and consistent. The cleaning crew are excellent. The room is all tidied up when we returned in the afternoon. I give this Hotel a big thumbs up. I will definitely stay here again if I return to visit.

review_body: Good location, close to Ueno train station so easy to get around town or visit other small cities near Tokyo. Room is basic and not too big but provides everything you need while travelling. Staff are friendly and speak good English. Hotel is surrounded by other buildings so forget about the view. There are many shops and restaurants nearby as Ueno is also a hot spot for shopping in Tokyo.
hotelName:
0    Mitsui Garden Hotel Ueno
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was a really convenient hotel to check out at the beginning of a trip: it is right near the Ueno train station, which is one of the only hubs the Narita Airport Skyliner hits. So, if you're jetlagged and don't want to think too much about getting from Narita to Tokyo, this is a great way to go.Our stay itself was fantastic. The rooms are small, but it's Tokyo, so that's completely expected. It had fantastic amenities: there was a trouser press, a fabric deodorizer bottle, 2 robes, tea, cups, hot water kettle, bottle opener, and a spa setup with a set of women's loungewear, a hair drier, a straightener, and a face steamer (?). And that's not even getting to the bathroom! The soaps in the bath were lovely, and there was a giant basket of everything you might need/want in a hotel. I held off on using the bath salts (!) because if you had the willpower not to touch any of the single-use items, the hotel would make a donation to an environmental charity. My only minor quibble was they had traditional-style buckwheat pillows, which I personally don't find comfy. But when in Japan...At check-in, our reservation was flagged because we had a package delivered there (our SIM cards) - we didn't even need to ask for it. When the lady at the desk couldn't find it immediately, she apologized profusely, and brought it up about 1 minute later - it had been put in the safe, rather than the drawer with the normal letters. On a similar note, one of the elevators was down, and the staff was incredibly apologetic when we checked out... despite the fact we still never actually had to wait for a ride.Overall, they had great service and really comfortable rooms. I'd definitely stay here again!
hotelName:
0    Mitsui Garden Hotel Ueno
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for a week. This was my first trip to Japan and I used Tokyo as my base for day trips. The hotel is located right across from the Ueno station. Plenty of restaurants in the area. Room was small, which I understand to be normal for Tokyo. They provided pajamas, which was a nice touch. Room was immaculate and bed and pillows were incredibly comfortable. Bathroom was well-stocked with toiletries. Staff was polite and helpful. I didn’t eat at the hotel, so can’t comment on the food. There is a coffee shop adjacent to the hotel entrance which has breakfast set menus for $6-7. There is also a Starbucks in Ueno station.Suggestions for improvement: there was only one English language channel - CNN. Would be nice if they can add 1-2 more. While the bathroom was clean, an unpleasant smell emanated through the pipes.This is a great value and I would stay here again!
hotelName:
0    Mitsui Garden Hotel Ueno
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is right next to Exit 1 of the Ueno subway, JR Ueno station, and Keisei Ueno station. You can easily get to all the Tokyo sites from here by using the subway, JR line, or walking. We had a Superior Twin Non-smoking room, not large, but we did not feel cramped. Nice bathroom, comfortable beds, hard pillows, quiet, complimentary water every day (hidden in cupboard next to frig), pajamas, and other nice toiletries. Ameyoko market, Ueno park, many restaurants, and convenience stores are nearby. Staff are friendly, but we did not have occasion to ask them for help because Tokyo is easy to get around if you have a subway map and the Lonely Planet Tokyo guide. We definitely would stay here again if back in Tokyo.One big plus for us was how easy it is to get to the hotel from Narita Airport. Take the Keisei Skyliner from Narita to Ueno. You can buy vouchers for your tickets online before you leave home. You will have a reserved seat and there is space for your luggage. It was pouring rain when we arrived in Tokyo so we took the underground subway tunnels to get from Keisei Ueno to the hotel. Head in the direction of the Ginza subway (don't take the Ginza, this is just to get you started in the right direction). You are looking for Exit 1 which is around a half mile walk. When you leave exit 1, turn right and the hotel is just steps away. (Bikes ride on the sidewalk so look before you step out) (To avoid most of the stairs on Exit 1, use Exit 3 which has elevators. When you exit the elevator to the sidewalk, make a U turn to the left (staying on the same sidewalk) and the hotel is close by). We found exiting the JR Ueno station confusing the first time we used the JR Yamanote line. So a tip - to get to the hotel, use the Central Gate exit and then look for Exit 1. At this hotel and several others in Japan, our Alaska visa card did not "work" (basically was not accepted). Be sure to bring more than one type of credit card with you to Japan.

review_body: My stay in Tokyo was the best because of Mitsui Garden Ueno Hotel. It's good for me and my daughter as it is the best location to go around Tokyo, and also going to the airport. All train lines are around and below the hotel. Value for money as all the ammenities are available and more! The room has the following: iron, refrigerator, heater, hair straightener and curler, facial steamer, bathrobe, Shiseido mouthwash, shampoo, bathtub soak etc... so cool!

review_body: We recently stayed at Mitsui Garden Ueno for six nights and were delighted with our choice.The room was spotlessly clean and bed linen was changed every day. The bathroom was a good size and had some nice extras e.g. toothbrushes, razor, mouthwash etc.Check in and out was very easy and the staff had enough English to explain all the basics.The location of the hotel was great for us and we could walk to quite a few of the attractions and sites we wanted to visit. For all others, Ueno stations were perfectly located.We were also very well located for the train to Narita airport.Ueno Park was a lovely facility to have so close to us and a wander around the park and browsing the many food stalls is a must.Overall, this is a lovely quiet hotel and I would stay again in the morning:-)

review_body: The location is great. Subway is next to the hotel and JR train is just across the road. From airport train station to hotel is easy. It's just 5-10 minutes walk. Room quite small but comfortable. Ameyoko market is in 10 minutes walking distance and there were many shops and restaurants around. If I go to Tokyo, I'll come back to stay here again.

review_body: It is literally 5 minutes away from the Ueno station. Very easy to get to and find. Staff was very accommodating and they spoke English which was a huge plus. Room was always cleaned and the restaurant downstairs always had good food. Would stay here again when we come back to Tokyo!

review_body: Because it is a close suburb to airport and also close to Ueno park and Sen-so Ji direction. It is nice to rest here for the first 1-2 days and visit above places, then move on to other parts of Tokyo.

review_body: Mitsui Garden UenoLocation is very good. Five minutes from Ueno park (peak blossom season!) Easy to get to different Ueno stations. Staff are good, rooms seem very small with little storage space but this is Japan.

review_body: Great location, opposite the Ueno train station. Direct train from Narita Airport to Ueno Station. Also a direct train to Nagano to get to Hakuba. Great for snow travelers wanting to break up their trip to/from Hakuba. Clean and modern rooms. English speaking staff. Plenty of restaurants nearby.
hotelName:
0    Mitsui Garden Hotel Ueno
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was our fourth stay at Mitsui Garden Ueno. We normally stay here after a few weeks at the snow and in Tokyo for a few days on the way home. We choose Mitsui Ueno for an number of reasons - great location for transport, well priced and a very clean and comfortable hotel. Ueno is on the Shinkansen line direct from Nagano and Iiyama so this works well with our ski trips. The train station entrances also surround the hotel and you can jump onto one of the many train lines including Metro and JR Li es from there to access any part of the city. A few blocks away are extensive markets that sell anything from clothing, sporting goods, electronics and lots of restaurants. The hotel itself is exceptionally clean. Yes, the rooms are small, but that is Japan. It is perfunctory and has everything you need. We send our ski gear directly to the airport (with Black Cat) so usually only have small back packs. We have struggled in the past when we have had ski gear to stow in the room. Staff are very polite and many of them understand English. This stay we arrived at 1.30pm and even though check in starts at 3pm, because our room was ready we were able to get access. Prices are good (about $210 per night) for this quality hotel.
hotelName:
0    Mitsui Garden Hotel Ueno
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: You may find JR Ueno St. and Skyliner Ueno St. right across the street and Tokyo metro St. beside the hotel. Plenty of sights can be reached within 5 mins of walk including Ameyoko and Ueno zoo. Staff are warm and willing to assist. Children travel pack was provided for free. Room is quiet and clean. Good choice for family tourists.
hotelName:
0    Mitsui Garden Hotel Ueno
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Transiting enroute to Nagano this hotel was in a perfect location for us.Easily accessible within walking distance to train station (including lifts to walkways) and in close proximity to restaurants and shops. Breakfast in a nearby cafe was Y320 - though hotel buffet looked good for Y1,600.The rooms were the typical small size for Japan but extremely clean with thoughtful extras - pyjamas, tourist tablet, extensive bathroom supplies etc.The next morning we took a stroll through Ueno Park before heading to Ueno to catch our Shinkansen to Nagano.
hotelName:
0    Mitsui Garden Hotel Ueno
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Mitsui Garden Hotels are usually a good bet when it comes to lodging. Although this was our first time at the Ueno location, we weren't disappointed. Centrally located right across the street from Ueno JR station, this was extremely convenient for walking. We checked in on a busy night and the staff accommodated us with smiling faces. They were also nice enough to make a last minute restaurant reservation for us. The room was small but not uncomfortably small. After all, this is the standard for Japanese rooms. We had two large luggages that we had to move some furniture around to make them fit. This hotel is clean and does what it's supposed to do, keeps your luggages, gives you a place to clean up, and sleep.
hotelName:

review_body: Hotel is very near the train stations - the Keisei Express from Narita airport and the Ueno metro subway stations. The stations are linked. One of the exits (exit 1) is just a few doors away from the hotel entrance in the same building. Check-in and check-out was very busy but guests were well attended to. Plenty of restaurants in and around the vicinity. Ueno park is nearby (just next to the Keisei station). Rooms are reasonably sized for Japan with adequate amenities. Umbrellas were available for a raining day, which we appreciate very much.
hotelName:

review_body: 5 minutes walk from Ueno station. There are convenient stores around the hotel. The room is very clean and larger than normal Japan’s hotel as most of the room of Japan’s hotel are small. The staff are polite and can speak fluent English. Will stay again for next trip.

review_body: Room was small and it and the bathroom could have done with more shelves and hooks to compensate. But otherwise pleasant and clean. Staff were very helpful. Breakfast better on Japanese options than western though latter available, but note that if you want a cheaper option there is a small cafe next door at the entrance to the under ground. Hotel is about ten mins from the Ueno station where the airport Skyliner train terminates, and about the same distance from Ueno park and museums.

review_body: This is a good hotel conveniently located few minutes away from the Ueno railroad hub which includes the last stop of the Skyliner service to/from Narita airport. Rooms are nice and - of course - clean. Breakfast buffet is available at the hotel restaurant Il Bosco and includes local and international options. Free internet is available in the rooms (reliable but somewhat slow).
hotelName:
0    Mitsui Garden Hotel Ueno

review_body: Checked in to find out the room was very small. Talked to the front staff and was relocated to a slightly larger room at no extra cost. Location is excellent as the Ueno station is just cross the street and many cultural attractions near by. Famous Menya Musashi ramen is close by and Ameyoko traditional market as well. Three museums, Tokyo Metropolitan Art Museum, Takyo National Museum and Museum of Nature and Science are all walking distance.
hotelName:
0    Mitsui Garden Hotel Ueno

review_body: The hotel is located right next to the Ueno train station. If you navigate the station correctly (not an easy task) you come out right next door to the hotel entrance. Staff are welcoming but speak little / no English. Room is clean and modern but small. Comfortable beds and pillows. Modern bathroom. TV and hot water kettle. Breakfast room is small with very attentive staff with a mixture of Japanese and western cuisine. We stayed two nights and the buffet selection was different each day which was a nice touch. When staying in Ueno (go to the Museum of Science and Natural History!!) then I would recommend this hotel

review_body: It's next to Metro and JR, skyliner, very convenient . Many restaurants and markets around. Staffs are very friendly and all good in English, room is a bit small but cozy for two adults to stay for 5nights, they clean up the room everyday !
hotelName:

review_body: The room is small but very well designed and its space is well utilised and super clean.Our room has the Ueno Station view. This hotel is very close to the Ueno station which was the reason for us selecting this hotel.I loved the efficient and helpful attitude of the staff. They speak English which makes it easy for communication.We arrived late at night and we check in procedure was simple and quick. Our departure was late in the evening and we could leave our luggage at the lobby while we enjoy our last day in Tokyo. When our taxi arrived, I was waiting on one side of the hotal while the taxi was on the other side. The taxi called the front desk and the hotel staff searched for me to lead me to the taxi. I was super grateful for their sincerity.Every item in the hotel room worked well. It was a wonderful stay for us. I had only one challenge...how to control the seat bidet and air conditioning since it was in Japanese. However after a few try i managed learn how to use the electronic equipment.

review_body: My four night stay in the Ueno Mitsui Garden Hotel was great. It has everything you need and the staff there are very polite and welcoming. Although it isn't a big room, it's more than good enough for a relatively cheap and satisfying stay. The hotel is also quite close to the metro and the Ueno Park so it's a very good location to stay in. Definitely would recommend this hotel.
hotelName:

review_body: I stayed for two nights in the Hotel before leaving Japan. The Hotel is just opposite to Ueno station. Rooms are clean, comfortable and not at all expensive. Convenient to tour Tokyo since the hotel is close to Ueno station. Hotel offered complementary breakfast and the food was delicious. Hotel staff are polite and many can speak english. I recommend this hotel to the tourists who would like to explore Tokyo.

review_body: We booked the biggest room (not suite), the space to move about was quite limited. Not complaining since we understand this is a business hotel. Great location, short walk to all Ueno stations and the park.

Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Enjoying our stay here. We arrived at 10pm, greeted by two nice gentleman who understood far more English than expected by two visitors with no Japanese language despite our Japanese surname! We are fulfilling a "bucket list" item. The amenities far exceed our expectations. Everything from toothbrushes, toothpaste, razor, full sized shampoo, conditioner, body wash, even a facial steamer & night clothes as advertised. The bathtub is deep, the water pressure very good and a full featured toilet. There is space in our room for a suitcase. Free bottled water, a hot pot, small fridge, and fresh towels and bed linens daily to boot! Booked thru Hawaiian Airlines vacation packages, our only negative is that we could not book twin beds thru Hawaiian Air's website so our queen sized bed sets flush against the wall requiring one to crawl out of bed! The pedestrian walkway to Ueno Stations - both JR & Keisei Skyliner is very convenient. The Shitamachi bus stops right there also. Once outside the station, we simply turned left and climbed the stairs to the pedestrian bridge where we saw the hitel's rooftop sign. A coffee shop (Precious Coffee)next door and a family mart & 7-eleven convenience stores are just around the corner. All the museums, the park, and shopping anyone could hope for are also convenient. Area safe. What a deal with air from HNL & hotel at $2100USD with no additional fees nor taxes collected at checkin!!!
hotelName:
0    Mitsui Garden Hotel Ueno
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is allright. It's very affordable and offers big rooms for Japan. It's clean and very functional. The area, however, is not so nice, I must admit. But, you can access the Japan Railways very easily from there
hotelName:
0    Mitsui Garden Hotel Ueno
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is very clean and nice. Room is a bit small, but it's the japanese standard of the rooms. Breakfast is only japanese style and small part of sweet breakfast. By the way I suggest this hotel close to Ueno station for a logistic reason.
hotelName:
0    Mitsui Garden Hotel Ueno
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were a party of 3 adults and two rooms. The amenities were excellent - you couldn't have asked for more. The location is just a short walk from Ueno Station. We got the express train to here from Narita. All very convenient. Went for a run in the morning around Ueno Park. Just beautiful.
hotelName:
0    Mitsui Garden Hotel Ueno
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed 4 nights on business. Hotel located a short walk from Ueno station on the opposite side from Ueno Park. Lots to do and see within 5 minutes walk.The hotel room was clean and the bed was comfortable. Wifi performance was outstanding.Only things missing was a gym and laundry service (but there is a laundry you can use).Will not hesitate to book again on next trip to Japan.
hotelName:
0    Mitsui Garden Hotel Ueno
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: For our last night in Tokyo, we chose this hotel to be close to Ueno Station and the Keisei Express station that takes passengers direct to Narita Airport in 41 minutes! Fare cost 2500Y. Even though we were facing the main road and the Ueno station, the room was quiet with the double windows to afford us a good night's sleep.Exit the hotel, you’ll find stairs to the overhead walkway to Ueno Station or a short distance to the left, there’s an elevator. Off the hotel lobby is a very nice Italian restaurant, Bosco il Chiantiwith a great menu and reasonable prices. And next to that in the elevator foyer, is a computer and printer. The newspaper rack to the right contains Japanese newspapers and also Japan Times in English. Overall, the hotel is kept very neat and clean. Our room was on the 7th floor with a view of Ueno Station. Although facing the main road, the room was very quiet due to the double windows. We had no problems sleeping through the night. Amenities were the usual safe (in the night table drawer), fridge, humidifier, electric pants press and TV with CNN in English. One minor deficiency was the grungy looking bathroom floor tiles. The coarse sandpaper finish is difficult to clean unless a scrub brush is used. Very apparent as you walk in. Although this room was 16 sq.m., the queen bed was pushed against the wall, making it difficult for one person to get out of bed, unlike the Mitsui Garden Hotel in Kashiwanoha. Some English is spoken at the Reception.Staff ere very attentive and polite.
hotelName:
0    Mitsui Garden Hotel Ueno
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great service. Superior twin room decent size. Very quiet nice italian restaurant on ground floor. Easy to reach from skyliner frim Narita ( last stop). Staff very helpful. Beds nice and firm. Couid use a secind pillow
hotelName:
0    Mitsui Garden Hotel Ueno
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in Mitsui Garden Hotel Ueno station for 5 days during July 2016. It was a wonderful stay. The hotel 's clean, well-organised and the room facilities're not only modern and new but also well kept. All the staffs are helpful and hospitable.We will certainly make a reservation at Mitsui Garden hotel Ueno station again if we go to Tokyo.
hotelName:
0    Mitsui Garden Hotel Ueno
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I've been stay in this hotel many times. This hotel is my first choice when I visit Tokyo and want to stayin Ueno area. Hotel is very close to JR and Skyliner station. Every staffs are very nice. Room is small as usual in Japan but enough for 2 persons. There is washing machine, free water, free amenities.Enjoy your stay here.
hotelName:
0    Mitsui Garden Hotel Ueno
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very small rooms but allright for 2 days though.A few minutes walk only to Ueno- and Keisei Station which make it easy to explore Tokyo from there and easy for departure to Narita airport.The staff is very friendly but the lobby is too small for the size of the hotel.
hotelName:
0    Mitsui Garden Hotel Ueno
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I appreciate that this hotel doesn’t pretend to be something it’s not—it is not a new or luxury property, and it is priced accordingly. The rooms are very dated and not in the best condition, but certainly fine as you really aren’t paying for a luxury room. I asked for a quiet room on a high floor and was upgraded to a larger room, which was very much appreciated. The view was fantastic and the free wifi was decent. I would stay again.
hotelName:
1    Hotel East 21 Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Having only stayed in 3 star hotels up until this point, this really felt like being spoiled. Housekeeping seemed to go above and beyond for us. Everything was spotless upon returning each day. Some days even pyjamas were folded neatly on the bed. Very close to Toyocho station. Have shuttle buses to airport and station ad Disney resort. For a small fee of course. Lots of restaurants in the area. And grocery store was open until 10:00-11:00 most nights which was perfect. Definitely recommend.
hotelName:
1    Hotel East 21 Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location about 10 minute walk to the nearest metro. But lots of eateries nearby, even a supermarket nearby. They provide free shuttle to disney resort and paid shuttle to skytower and odaiba. Staff provided excellent serviceOverall, would stay here again.
hotelName:
1    Hotel East 21 Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I would have given the hotel high review score. It's big, clean, nice. Except, for a theft from my room. I fell asleep with my Kindle and it must have fallen between the sheets. Next morning I went on my business. Never saw the Kindle again, gone with many personal documents and being unlocked. I kept calling the hotel over the next 10 days since I am still in Japan. The Kindle was never found (see arched under the bed, etc.). Whoever did my room must have either tossed it away, or appropriated it. Either way, I can't believe this has happened in Japan. I have been coming here for over a decade, and lived here too.
hotelName:
1    Hotel East 21 Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: East 21 is a very comfortable hotel in a great location, when I booked I asked for a view of the Skytree and was delighted when to find I'd been given one when I arrived !It is very close to the metro and provides transport which is handy if you have luggage. Lots of choice for breakfast, the staff were helpful and the single room was a good size, I would stay here again when in Tokyo
hotelName:
1    Hotel East 21 Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is nice and very clean hotel. Staff is very friendly and helpful. The hotel is located close to disney and other attractions, restaurants etc. Hotel provides free transportation to many locations tourists would like to go eg train station, disney
hotelName:
1    Hotel East 21 Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Never heard of this hotel before, and been to Tokyo 3 or 4 times, always stayed at the Prince at the Minato due to the room size of the hotel and extra luxury for that that hotel. And Hotel East 21 at toyocho surprised me with the service from the staffs and roomy size of the room, walkable distance to the transport. Can’t go wrong with this little piece of luxury.
hotelName:
1    Hotel East 21 Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 10 days with my husband and 2 little kids in a twin-with-extra-bed room. The room is quite small for us. We had the pool view and the room was clean and bright. Bathroom is spacious and provides all the necessities required.Being a Disney good neighbor hotel, they provide free shuttle to Disneyland. Be sure to make reservation for this shuttle service to & fro once you have set your date to Disneyland as it could be fully-reserved with no available seats. They provide free shuttle to nearest train stations too. Anyway, we took our morning walk to Toyocho station everyday as it is less than 10mins walk away. We also took the paid shuttle to Odaiba which takes less than 20mins compared to taking train which would take longer. The hotel area has some restaurants and Lawson is just nearby. So this hotel is quite convenient. The only problem for us is that they do not have a laundromat within the hotel building. As ours is a long vacation trip, I already planned to do laundry and you can image how big is my jaw-drop when the hotel told me that they do not have a laundry in the hotel. Anyway, they took out a map and pointed us the way to the nearest laundromat. So my husband walked to the laundromat to do the laundry, carrying a big bag of clothes looking like santa-claus (we were there near Christmas by the way... hohoho...)Overall, I'm still quite happy with my stay here. Price is reasonable and location is convenient for eateries, convenience stores and train station.
hotelName:
1    Hotel East 21 Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: the location- very good in a nice and pleasant neighborhood vicinity - very good, connected with the property various restaurants, convenience stores, supermarket, just cross the street and you have more 24hr convenience stores like lawsons, family mart etc rooms - spacious for Tokyo city and were clean and nice, well cleaned dailystaff- helpful and friendly english speaking stafftransport - airport buses from both Haneda and Narita , Disney parks buses FOC , buses to few local attractions , local trains/mrt stations nearby overall very nice place to stay in Tokyo
hotelName:
1    Hotel East 21 Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We recently stayed at this hotel and it's very easy to find and get around. There's plenty of nice inexpensive restaurants and convenience stores around, makings a pleasant location. Also a nice park next to hotel
hotelName:
1    Hotel East 21 Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room was nice, but a bit smelly... facilities are nice, breakfast is overpriced ! The room was quite beautiful, unfortunately there was a strong smell, I think from the bathroom pipes.Breakfast id nearly $30 and I think it is overpriced, for what they have on offer. The breakfast buffet is big, but by far, nothing special that require such a price...Cheap cheese, and mostly cheap items. Good, but cheap. Some other hotel with a tag price like that for breakfast, will put some better cheese, and better juice... Staff is nice and helpful.
hotelName:
1    Hotel East 21 Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Part of a tour of Japan. Convenient location. Near metro stations. Full facilities. Very supportive staff.Several restaurants and others within easy walk.Rooms relatively small but typical for Japanese hotel rooms
hotelName:
1    Hotel East 21 Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A decent business hotel, with many restaurants and shops in the same complex, offers good comfort and space.The over-friendliness of Japanese staffs makes one even slightly embarrassed by not knowing how to react.However, Gym and sauna are costing extra, 30 USD, the grill restaurant, rated by TripAdvisor as moderate priced, costs easily more than 100 USD each, an expensive gourmet experience for miniatures of food.
hotelName:
1    Hotel East 21 Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Well located. Rooms are oldish and no refreshed but clean. Wifi is working well. Breakfast at 3000 jpy is ... i let you see. Staff very friendly and helpfull. You are 7 min walk from metro station. Over all good value for money bur a but far from everything.
hotelName:
1    Hotel East 21 Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Came to Japan the first time with family. Staffs are very polite. When we first arrived, I asked for a room with a view to Skytree tower. He was not able to but he gave us our room on the 19th floor and we can see the Skytree tower when we go to the elevator. Room is clean but the carpet is old which I have expected since I had read past reviews. Disadvantage of the room is the bathroom, noticed some hair on the wall and when I wiped it with wet wipes it was black. Noticed mold in between the gap of wall. Door also had mold. No ventilation and door would not stay open. We thought it was a great location. Lots of convenient stores, supermarket and a lot of close by restaurants with only locals which we like. There was this one restaurant that we went to where there was no English menu but it was OK. We just pointed the photos of what we wanted to order. Overall a great hotel except for the bathroom. 4 of us travelling and each of us got our own bed. One being a sofa bed and one is a potable bed.
hotelName:
1    Hotel East 21 Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for a few nights at the East 21 for business. Booked in on the Friday evening and first impressions were not the greatest. Reception area is ok and the staff were helpful on checking in. The decor though looked a bit tired in the lifts, corridors and the room I was in. The bedroom was clean but just needs some time spent doing it up. The bed was comfy and the bathroom linen was always clean and fresh. The TV is limited to a few channels. One of the main plus points would seemed to be the link buses to take you to Disney. There is a voucher system for breakfast with both western and local foods available with a great variety of food on offer. The hotel is about a 10 minutes walk from the local tube station that gets you round the rest of Tokyo. As the hotel was for business it was ok but I don’t think I would stay there if I was travelling independently on holiday.
hotelName:
1    Hotel East 21 Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice hotel with rooms that are a bit worn. Lobby area is nice. A medium sized area in the lobby has chairs and tables with cafe style table service and is open from 10am to 630pm. Buffet breakfast was good with many food and drink options. Plenty of Japanes fare. It takes about 35 to 45 minutes to get downtown on the metro (including walking to Toyoxho station). Was 95 deg F (32 deg C) while I was there. My room was comfortable for me but the air conditioner was probably maxed out. I'd definitely stay again.
hotelName:
1    Hotel East 21 Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a joke of a hotel ! Run down building that needs updating .. A portable AC unit in the rooms with dirty floors . I was welcomed into my room with a big poo in the toilet !! They charge 45 per day to swim !!! Not advertised before you book this hotel !!! No tattoos aloud on premises !?!? Funny thing is even after seeing this review the Managment won't do anything still ... Do yourself a favor and find another place that doesn't have fecis in the toilet when you arrive This hotel doesn't even deserve 1 star !!!
hotelName:
1    Hotel East 21 Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Pros - location: nearby and at the hotel itself is a plaza including many restaurant and a supermarket that opens until 11pm.Walking to Toyocho station is not that far with 7 mins walk. In addition, u can walk to the park in 5 mins. - staffs are great in generalCons- room size is too small for 3 people room- air conditioning is poor and feeling humid and hot in the guest room- though the hotel is like a 4-Star ( convention / conference hotel ) the large space is not relevant to my stay- entire building and facilities are built back in early 90s which needs major renovation- swimming pool requires 4000 yen ! But the website did not mention- gym is small and old if you care
hotelName:
1    Hotel East 21 Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel old but very clean,the room is quite big for Japan. The location is great. There are lots of shop n restaurant near by.Service is good, the bus to Disneyland is a bonus. Will definatly stay here again!!!!
hotelName:
1    Hotel East 21 Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Front desk was nice, ordinary for a larger hotel. Room was satisfactory given it had 4 singles. The room smelled old and soiled which was evident in the carpet. The mattresses were comfortable but the box springs had stains on the sides. The only plus - the water pressure from the shower head. Hotel restaurants are expensive and if you want to use the amenities, it's extra.
hotelName:
1    Hotel East 21 Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great priced, included breakfast buffet or lunch menu set coupons. Good location near a few restaurants and a large local market to buy everything you need. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Staff spoke enough English to get by.
hotelName:
1    Hotel East 21 Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Too bad we only stayed here for 1 night... the hotel has great location, because we can find many restos so easily on ground floor, also a drugstore and a supermarket. all walking distance from hotel lobby.the room is not too small and not too spacious as well. just enough for us to sleep very comfortably. love the amenities.. breakfast was exquisit. i remember the grape they served during bfast. well done :)
hotelName:
1    Hotel East 21 Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a fantastic stay at Hotel East 21. Stayed for one night with my parents and my two young children. Booking request for a baby cot was met, and the cot was ready in the room when we arrived. Two single beds for my parents, one sofa-bed for me and my son. A nice, big room for us all with plenty of space for the children to play and explore. A great view across Tokyo from the window.Hotel was easy to find. A five minute walk from the Metro station. Supermarket, shops and restaurants by the base of the hotel too.Sleep quality was great. Nice comfy beds. A little bit of noise from the corridor, but nothing too bad.Breakfast was superb. Plenty of choice and tasty food. Good for young children too, with rice, cereal, yoghurt, fresh fruit and plenty of other choices.All in all, a really great stay. Would stay again, and would definitely recommend.
hotelName:
1    Hotel East 21 Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Checked in to this hotel during 1st visit to Tokyo. Room is spacious but faraway from train station, at least 15min walk and another 15min subway ride to central area. Buffet breakfast is good. There is a small shopping centre downstairs with a supermarket and a few restaurants. Plenty of convenience stores closeby too.
hotelName:
1    Hotel East 21 Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Myself and 3 girlfriends stayed here for 2 or 3 nights, the service was amazing, breakfast was great and the room was nice! There were a few good places near buy to get a few groceries, eat dinner etc. We also went to DisneySea and a bus picked us up from right at the hotel. Would stay here again.
hotelName:
1    Hotel East 21 Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice hotel, friendly staff, but a bit far from toyocho station. Free shuttle to station offered by hotel but very limited number of trips per day. A lot of restaurants nearby the hotel. A supermarket where you can buy cooked food and a microwave is ready available. A cosmetic store also around. So far not that bad for basic needs. Airport limousine bus will pick up up at the lobby but only 2x a day.
hotelName:
1    Hotel East 21 Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Economical hotel. I believe there is a free shuttle bus to Disney world from the hotel. there is also a cheap but tasty sushi restaurant at the first floor of the hotel.. a very nice hotel afterall!!!
hotelName:
1    Hotel East 21 Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very beautiful and attractive hotel location.very delicious food being served.lots of food varities are placed in the buffet.very friendly staff service.hotel security is great. High technology being used in the hotel.
hotelName:
1    Hotel East 21 Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It's about 7minutes walk away from the Toyochyo station of the Metro Tozai line. Various restaurants and convenience stores within walking distance. Offers free shuttle buses to and from TDR everyday! (Only about 30minutes ride from the hotel.) Although Sky Tree was on the otherside, I still really enjoyed the beautiful night scenary of Tokyo from my room. Skyscrapers were glittering in the sky! Hotel staff are very polite and helpful, willing to make you feel comfortable. Not sure about their western food restaurant, but "Toh-En", the Chinese restaurant is superb!! Reservation is recommended, because it is usually very crowded.
hotelName:
1    Hotel East 21 Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: the subway station was just a few minutes walk from the hotel and there was a big 24-hour supermarket less than 10 min walk (Seiyu). at the ground floor, there is burger king and Saizeriya which was convenient. Although room was small, still a good place to stay. the buffet breakfast was ok
hotelName:
1    Hotel East 21 Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice and clean hotel with free shuttle buses to nearest subway station and Disneyland. Helpful and friendly staff. Big supermarket just below and many restaurants around the area. Only issue is the room is a bit small for 4 persons (2 adult & 2 children) but still acceptable with 4 single beds for each person. Overall, a great hotel to stay. May stay here again if visit Tokyo.
hotelName:
1    Hotel East 21 Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room was a good size, clean, and comfortable. Hotel Staff were all very friendly and attentive and the Breakfast Buffet was delicious with many options. While the hotel is a ways away from the city center (depending on what you consider the city center, that is), it was incredibly easy for us to walk to the subway and reach all of the tourist destinations quickly. I would just suggest steering clear of morning rush hour if you can - it can be difficult to board the subway headed into the city at that time. But as long as you're bold and don't mind cramming yourself in, you'll be fine.
hotelName:
1    Hotel East 21 Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I’ve stayed here on business trips many times over the last 15 years. I stay here because my company is walking distance. The staff is friendly and attentive. In-house dining is good. American selections for the breakfast buffet is basic but good quality. Asian selections are numerous. The rooms are typical of Japan, small but very clean and well maintained. A bit basic but perhaps because I just get the single corporate rate room. It’s still nice tho. My only complaint is that for me, the bed is extremely firm. A bit too firm for my taste. Access to subway station is only a couple blocks, 5-10 min walk at most. From there, anywhere is easily accessible a fairly short ride away. Subways are very easy to navigate and cheap. There are many resturants nearby, of all different types, several in the same complex. There is a large grocery store next door and an ATM for easy cash access. The hotel itself is probably rated a four star but the atmosphere is very comfortable. I see a lot of business people staying here but then I also see a lot of families and student groups as well. You feel just as at home wearing sweats or a suit and tie. It’s also a short distance to the Tokyo Skytree, a great sightseeing attraction and restraunt/shopping mall. It’s also a great view from one whole side of the hotel. I enjoy looking over the city from my room at night, just beautiful. There are several resturants in-house and a top of the hotel bar with a piano and singer. A bit pricy but not unexpected. I’m not sure if I would call it mid range or luxury. Check out thier website for rates. I don’t think it’s overpriced but it’s not cheap either, but then it’s Tokyo. What’s cheap here? Service, location and values all rate a 4 with me. This form won’t let me use the ratings below. Overall a good place to stay, I recommend it.
hotelName:
1    Hotel East 21 Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed with my family for 9 nights and the hotel was a disappointment. Some good things are the fact that it is surrounded by a supermarket, coffee shops and restaurants of all kinds (however, it takes between 7-10 min to walk to get to Toyocho train station, the closest to hotel). Also, it is good that the Airport Limousine Bus from/to Narita and Haneda Airport stops here. The concierge service is good and they were efficient in booking our Airport Limousine Bus tickets and giving us the right information about things related to Tokyo. Room service was also good, they responded immediately.Unfortunately, the good things end here. There are a lot of things that are not matching average international standards. If the service continues this way, I don't see how the hotel can attract international visitors for the Rugby World Cup 2019 and the Tokyo Olympics 2020. These are the things were the hotel did not do well during our stay:1) Since we traveled with a 1-year old kid, the hotel installed a child guard in one of the beds. The problem was that one day after staff cleaned the room, the child guard was installed in the wrong way, there was a big hole and our son could have fallen through it.2) After check-in, we noticed our room had not been cleaned properly, we found a sock from a previous guest behind a sofa.3) This is the only hotel in the world that I know where guests have to pay to use the gym4) After we checked-out, the front desk forgot to give us a parcel that a friend had sent to us. They only noticed after we had arrived to the airport and they had to send it to us by airmail.(They acknowledged they forgot to give it to us)5) Staff in the lobby lounge were not considerate. One morning, my son asked me to take him to the fountain in the lounge lobby. The lounge was almost empty, one two tables taken. I sat with my son in a sofa next to the fountain and I am asked what I wanted to order. When I told them I was just staying here for my son to watch the fountain, they asked us to leave the lobby lounge, no matter I explained we were staying in this hotel. 6) Some staff in the front desk cannot understand English well.7) Trash bins in the hotel rooms are too small.8) Only one English channel on TV (CNN)My advice is to only stay here if you did not find accommodation in another hotel in Tokyo and/or you have to do something around Koto, Toyocho area
hotelName:
1    Hotel East 21 Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for four nights and I felt like a rich man , the service is friendly and welcoming . We booked the family room which had three single beds and a good quality fold out bed which had a great mattress . We were on the 20 floor which had stunning views Highly recommend this hotel for a family A+
hotelName:
1    Hotel East 21 Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had low expectations for this hotel based on my previous experiences in Japan, but this hotel is definitely a hidden gem. The hotel staff service is impeccable, and the hotel itself is well-maintained and clean. The incredibly convenient and large (relative to Japanese standard) supermarket and convenience stores downstairs along with the restaurants downstairs and the short 5 to 10 minute walk to the T line subway (the hotel is near subway stop T-14) make Hotel East 21 Tokyo a "go-to" hotel for me in the future.
hotelName:
1    Hotel East 21 Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was a great hotel, location was good near to shops , restaurants and subway. Staff were very friendly and helpful, amazing view from room, room was huge and comfortable with clean towels every day.
hotelName:
1    Hotel East 21 Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: i booked this hotel purposly for the pools. it was expensive to me for one person $32.00usd to use the pool for 1-2 hours only as I wasn't going to use it the whole day anyway. The hotel is nice and well equipped. customer service at the desk were friendly. I didn't know at the time I did the reservation that there is a surcharge to use the pools otherwise I would have booked another hotel with no pools and right in the city area of Tokyo as mostly we were inside the city. we didn't use the pool anyways. if you are looking to go to the city area 3 times a day, the taxi cost is about 21.00 usd one way. thank you
hotelName:
1    Hotel East 21 Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed in this hotel with my family for a week. It was my first time in Japan and I got to say, it was really quite fun and I love it in that hotel. Staffs were really nice. Despite my family know little to no Japanese, my family enjoyed their time there and staff really tried their best to communicate well with us. My Japanese is really poor, yet they still understand it and tried their best to help us. Inside the hotel is really fancy and nice. The room we stayed was amazing and had a really nice view of the city and Tokyo Skytree. Lots of places for food in and around the hotel. There is a small plaza that has a mall, superstore, convenience stores, and groceries below the hotel floor. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Toyo, Koto-ku. I would love to return to this hotel if I need a place to stay in Tokyo. PS: Downside is that it is pretty expensive.
hotelName:
1    Hotel East 21 Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: On our trip to Japan, we stayed in four hotels. This was a favourite with our group of 6 people. The staff are lovely, and very helpful. We were given a printed map of the nearest coin laundry - no problem, we appreciated it made so easy to locate. Check in was seamless and we had paid for breakfast which was very nice with a huge variety of foods for everyone. The room was big enough to fir 3 people with luggage and have bit of space which was nice. Beds comfy and best pillows. Bathroom was a good size and had room for your 'stuff' and was very clean and functioned well. Nice views near the elevators of skytree at night. Not far from Toyocho station, but if you have yound children it may be a distance. Has a shuttle to disneyland but must be booked in advance and doesnt run very often. The hotel felt nice and staff were happy and smiled and made you feel welcome. Would stay here again. Heaps of places to eat near hotel and mall underneath with supermarket, bakery etc very good location. wifi was good.
hotelName:
1    Hotel East 21 Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Although it is bit fat from metro(yet there is a shuttle bus) the location was ok. There is a shopping centre nearby and few eateries around. Room was clean, breakfast choice decent and tasty. Only issue for me as a family party was that kids can't use swimming pool and that it also requires additional charge
hotelName:
1    Hotel East 21 Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Big hotel. Not in the center at all but very easy to get by the underground. A 10 minute walk from the station. Large room ( we were three) coffee pot and glasses. Bring coffee from home. ATM machine in the hotel- bad rate for your money. Next to the hotel; center with variety of restaurants, supermarket, coffee shop.
hotelName:
1    Hotel East 21 Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Overall, we had a good stay at this hotel. We booked the family room which had 4 beds so although the adults were also in single beds, it was very comfortable and quite spacious, especially considering Tokyo size rooms. We had a little table were we ate the nights that we were too exhausted to go out and a fridge. A walking closet and plenty of tables/night stands. Large windows that although you cannot open, had incredible views. Lots of sunshine. Large bathroom with the typical extras on toilet features so the little one kept pushing the warming toilet seat button :)Breakfast was included and excellent considering we were in Asia. Both, Asian and Western options available. Very good espressos and lattes. Service at the restaurant was quick to replace items and the kids ate eggs in every imaginable form of cooking so they were happy. Fresh fruit and all sort of pancakes, waffles, etc.The hotel had a bit of 80/90's look but all was very well maintained. Few options around in case you are tired at night to have dinner or shop to take to your room. Once night we just grabbed chicken sandwiches from BK and were happy with those. After all the walking with the kids, by night, we had very little energy to do much more. They offered a trip to the Tokyo Tower. I didn't go buy my husband/kids enjoyed the views but also mentioned that they kept asking for more and more money to get higher in the tower so find out exactly what is offered before going. They also took a long time to get back. Tube is around 400 mtrs (4 blocks) away. Not too far but something to take into consideration.
hotelName:
1    Hotel East 21 Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is where we stay for our first couple days in Japan. The room is spacious and comes with toiletries, slippers and robe. The room we had offered a great view of the Tokyo Skytree. The staff are all courteous and assisted us in booking a cab.
hotelName:
1    Hotel East 21 Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 4 nights ,1 night before travelling by train through Japan and upon our return 3 nights. We chose this hotel for 2 reasons, we could store our luggage while traveling and hotel offered airport limousine to Narita - twice a day at 8.10am and 2.20pm( not a lot of hotels offer that option).Location is very good, walking distance to Toyocho Station on Tozai Line, only 4 stops to Nihombashi Station - central part of Tokyo. The hotel offers free shuttle bus to the station as well as to Tokyo Disney Resort. Very friendly staff, rooms quite big, some with a view of Tokyo Tower. Very pleasant stay.
hotelName:
1    Hotel East 21 Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The front office staff are very courteous , the Rooms are comparatively big and the Break fast at the restaurant at the Lobby Level was excellent, the spread was grand and oriental. Enjoyed every minute of my stay
hotelName:
1    Hotel East 21 Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great choice for tokyo stay.Price decent. Rooms clean and relatively large for tokyo.Great to have decent and good priced eatery below hotel. And supermarket there a v big plus.Direct shuttle to disney.7 mins walk to train station.Better to take train from airport than shuttle bus.Definitely top on the list for next stay.
hotelName:
1    Hotel East 21 Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved our stay at East 21. Staff were amazing up graded our room helpful in showing us how to get around. Room was spotless nice bed kettle etc in room. Close to Tokyo Tower. From airport we arranged a private pick up service that cost 60$each Aus, from Green Tomato.. to get to train station we got a taxi at the hotel 2100yen.
hotelName:
1    Hotel East 21 Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Its in east part of Tokyo but 8-10 min walk gets you to a subway station. Then you are anywhere you wanna go. As any Japanese hotel I have been in, this one has excellent staff, rooms with baths that even 5star hotels in US would be ashamed by.One thing about Japan hotels is that you get everything you need . I mean everything including the hairbrush ! Rooms are comparable to business suite hotels around US but for half the price. I was amazed that Tokyo was not that expensive coming from California where everything became arm and leg priced.
hotelName:
1    Hotel East 21 Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent 2 nights at the East 21 at the start of a Japanese tour. We were on the 9th floor which had good views but they will be even better on the 20th floor. The room had all the usual amenities and the staff were all great. We only had breakfast at the hotel which was excellent apart from the queue to enter the breakfast room on the second morning. The hotel sits on top of a small shopping mall including some eating places and there is a Seven Eleven just up the road with an ATM.
hotelName:
1    Hotel East 21 Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We originally chose to stay here because they offered a free shuttle service to the Disney resort. Ended up being a bonus when we walked into our beautiful room! Fancy Japanese style room (was called the "concept room") we were on the 20th floor and the view was incredible. The staff spoke very good English and helped us with many questions and enquirers. The train/subway station was a very easy and quick 9 minute walk straight down the road. The bus was also a very quick 20 minute drive to Disney sea and very easy to organize. You do have to reserve a seat but it's very easy to do at the hotel or online. (Simply change the language to English if need be) there are plenty of food options around the hotel with convenience stores, super markets, bakery, subway, cafe, Italian etc within walking distance. We also ended up staying an extra night but due to it being booked out we had to switch rooms to a regular double-bed room for our third night. It was a lot smaller but it did the job. If your willing to fork out the extra $$$ go for the concept room it's gorgeous and big! Definitely recommend we had a very pleasant stay! (Unfortunately, we regretfully didn't take any photos, it didn't do the view justice anyway)
hotelName:
1    Hotel East 21 Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A beautiful relatively small hotel. The staff was friendly, helpful and polite. The pool area is absolutely beautiful. The guest rooms are fairly small by American standards, but more than adequate. Amenities were wonderful. We had a very enjoyable stay and highly recommend this hotel to any Tokyo travelers.
hotelName:
1    Hotel East 21 Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Will return, great staff and rooms a good size. Helpful staff, good food, supermarkets, coffee shops and cafes available with walking distance. Train lines within walking distance of hotel and walking areas along river banks easy to access.
hotelName:
1    Hotel East 21 Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is exactly as I expected it to be. It's an economical choice, has a great location, is safe, clean, and hospitable. Just FYI, there are two hotel sunroutes in Shinjuku. This one is closest to the Higashi-Shinjuku station.

review_body: Situated about 20m from gate B2 at the nearby metro this unpretentious hotel is clean, surprisingly quiet and efficient. Everything one wants albeit in a tight space. Shower works well and staff helpful.
hotelName:
2    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
6    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku

review_body: This hotel was very clean and modern, staff very friendly. Directly underneath the hotel is is one of the subway lines and other lines are just a short walk. Many stores and restaurants are all around. Would recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
2    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
6    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked a room with two separate beds , which was a bit more ecpensive but more spacious. Nice room. Breakfast not included but you can buy a ticket for the restaurant breakfast from the reception. The breakfast is a buffet, amix of Asian and western style, which was ok for a couple of days. The hotel has a self-service laundry, which made life easy. Close to Shinjuku central station and you can walk but of course it is easier to just change trains with luggage. Great for the price we got.
hotelName:
2    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
6    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked this hotel because it was high atop Trip Advisor's list of Best Value hotels in Tokyo. Either that ranking is unwarranted or Tokyo hotels in general provide little value. (This was my first visit.) After my outstanding experience at Cross Hotel Kyoto, this one felt a bit shabby. The hallway was hot, as was the room when I got there. The thermostat instructions were in Japanese, so it took awhile to get the temperature to normal (Googling the serial number bailed me out). The bathroom was a couple inches off the main floor, making it easy to stub one's toe. The water pressure in the sink was inadequate. The shower head was portable, but the fixture for it was inflexible, so getting a comfortable angle was not possible. That said, it was easy enough to get a good night's sleep, and the location was good (walkable to the heart of Shinjuku and to trains, but in a quiet area). Your options might be better in other neighborhoods -- I would try Harajuku or Koenji on my next visit.
hotelName:
2    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
6    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As with all Japanese hotels, this hotel is very small. However, it is very clean and quiet.I contacted the hotel prior and they shared 3 ways of getting there:1. The most convenient wayTaking ''Airport limousine bus'' (120min. 3,100Yen) to Busta Shinjuku, then take taxi from there to our hotel (10min. approx. 800 Yen) or walk to Shinjuku Nishiguchi station of Oedo line (subway) and take Oedo line to Higashi Shinjuku Station (1 stop). We are very close to B2 exit.2. Faster wayTaking ''JR Narita Express'' (train) to Shinjuku station (90 min. 3,190Yen), then take taxi from there to our hotel (10min. approx. 800 Yen) or walk to　Shinjuku Nishiguchi station of Oedo line (subway) and take Oedo line to Higashi Shinjuku Station.3. The fastest and cheapest wayTaking Keisei Skyliner (train) to Ueno station (40 min. 2,500Yen), then walk underground street (10 minutes) to Ueno Okachimachi station of Oedo line (subway) and take Oedo line to Higashi Shinjuku Station (15 min. about 230 Yen).I went with Option 3 and it was pretty convenient. Go to Exit B2, turn left. The hotel is just a 2 minute walk from Exit B2.There is also a lift to the ground level, incase you need to lug your luggage.
hotelName:
2    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
6    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I recently spent two weeks in Japan, and the first three days were here in Tokyo.The room was tiny by American standards but that’s just the way it is everywhere in Japan unless you’re willing to shell out some Big Yen. Besides, why would we want to stay in our room for anything other than sleeping and washing up? So, the room was fine. It was clean, and the bed was comfortable. Check-in and check-out was easy, and the staff spoke some English.The location is great. It’s in Shinjuku (the entertainment district) but on the outer edges where it’s a bit quieter. There are plenty of bars, restaurants, and shopping within an easy walking distance.We paid a little extra and got the breakfast buffet included during our stay. You go through the lobby to get to the restaurant next door – The Royal Host. It’s a chain restaurant comparable to a Denny’s I guess. You exchange your breakfast ticket (that you get at the hotel when you check-in) for a card to leave on the table that tells others it’s occupied. You flip the card over to show that you’re done and then leave.The buffet itself has a wide variety of options. There are the standard western breakfast staples like scrambled eggs, bacon, and fruit as well as traditional Japanese items like rice, miso soup, netto (fermented soy beans), pickled veggies, and a variety of fish. It’s nothing fancy but it will fill you up.The only issue we had with the hotel was actually finding it. We landed in Narita after a 13 hour flight, took JR’s Narita Express into the city and got off in Shinjuku Station. The station is absolutely enormous, crowded and overwhelming … especially if you haven’t slept in 24 hours. We stumbled around a while trying to find the train to the Higashi Station until we discovered that you have to switch from the JR line to the city’s Metro system. Once we understood that everything was fine.So, overall, this is a fine base of operations while you enjoy this fabulous city!
hotelName:

review_body: Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku has 3 stars but feels like a 4 star hotel. The staff is very professional and polite. It is really clean here. You also have a possibility to do your laundry. Couldn't be better location: The metro entrance is less than 50 meters away.
hotelName:

6    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
