review_body: Good location. Nearest Metro station is Higashi-Shinjuku which is just around the corner (4 mins walk) and the JR line is right beside the hotel. There are many restaurants around the hotel (Mcdonalds, Tully Coffee, Coco Curry House, Pepper Lunch, Tsukiji Kiyomura Sushi-Zanmai Higashi Shinjuku-ten). 20 mins walking distance to Shinjuku.Our family (husband and my 3 yo daughter) stayed in the Standard Twin room (21 sqm). The room is spacious as compared to the regular Japan hotel size. We highly recommend this hotel for anyone who wish to stay in Tokyo!
hotelName:
2    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
6    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: While Hotel Sunroute has an ideal location. The services and hidden fees make this a terrible hotel. Upon arrival my friend and I had to pay extra for twin beds instead of a single bed even though our reservation specified (and we showed our confirmation) twin beds. We were then informed that to make local phone calls we would have to pay a fee if we used the hotel phone. We would also be charged for using the TV (mind we weren’t looking to rent anything, just watch local channels). When asked if the hotel could call us a taxi my friend was told they would charge us and when I later asked they flat out told me no because it was too early (it was 8am). Overall, I would say stay away and find better accommodations. I know I’ll never stay here again.
hotelName:
2    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
6    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel was perfect location. Easy walk to piss alley and robot restaurant. Subway located next door. Air con worked in room. The shower had excellent power and it had Japanese toilets which were a treat. Cleaned everyday to a high standard. Highly recommend.
hotelName:
2    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
6    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were 10 people in Total staying at the hotel and we had an extremely good service. Early check-in worked perfect for all of us. Changing doubleroom to twinroom prior to arriving worked perfect.The washingmachines broke down twice but the hotel kept it going for us so we could continue washing twice a day.Cleaningladies did a good job of remembering everyday that we needed extra towels. Rooms Were standard Tokyo not-very-big but big enough for our purpose - sleep. The service provided by the staff was excellent.
hotelName:
2    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
6    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here our first time in Japan because of TripAdvisor reviews. They were pretty on point. Firstly if your coming via subway take the B2 exit. This is the exit right next to hotel, until you get your bearings.Check in was fast (it was 11at night) very welcoming and efficient speaking very good English. Check out so much faster.The rooms are so small, however I’m guessing this is the normal. My husband and l felt like we stood on top of each other however only in the room to sleep. T.v. Only has BBC as the English Channel but have option to pay for movies.The room was clean and bathroom had shower over a tub and was very clean. Toothbrush and brush and razor available.The towels are dated and very flimsy but somehow still dried you fast.No noise from other rooms however the road/outside noise is really loud and if your a light sleeper like me then you will wake easy.
hotelName:

review_body: Great location! Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku is extremely near exit B2 of Higashi-Shinjuku station. We stayed one night in a Standard Twin Room and the room was clean, comfortable, and spacious (by Tokyo’s standard).

review_body: I was coming back form a business trip and took a 3 night break before heading home. It is a not fancy, quaint, quite hotel that his in a great location in Shinjuku. Very close to transportation and waking distance from lost of food choose and activities. The staff was great and helpful helping with questions that I had. I couldn't work the TV :) and the room did not have a 3 prong outlet but that was not a big issue for me since I spent little time in the room. Loved the deep tub.

review_body: Right next to the station. Staff were very informative and helpful. Room was a great size for Japan standards. Beds were very comfortable. Bathroom decent and provided lots of useful travel essentials.
hotelName:

6    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku

review_body: Great location as hotel is on Exit B2 of Higashi-Shinjuku Station though an easy 10 minute walk from the main Shinjuku Train Station. Good area to be in with lots to do and see. The hotel, which we just used for sleeping in, had twin beds and enough room to empty our cases for a few days. Beds comfy, AC worked, bathroom good with great shower, desk area for PC and good power points, a bedside clock for those sleepless moments, kettle but bring your own tea and fridge to store milk bought locally. Breakfast, not as western as some was passable; our rate was inclusive but available to purchase for 1620 yen pp. Good nights sleep in quiet high room. Reception staff bored and unhelpful and there was never any concierge service to help with external restaurant bookings; reception will only help if you know where you want to go and have the phone number, if you don’t know the area, this can be difficult!
hotelName:
2    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
6    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location as hotel is right to your left from Exit B2 of Higashi-Shinjuku Stn. Housekeeping made it a point to clean the room, refill all toiletries and provide all necessities everyday. We never had to call them.
hotelName:
2    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
6    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku

review_body: Hotel is clean and modern,with close proximity to Shinjuku higashi subway station. The hotel are happy to store your luggage on check in & check out. The walk from the main Shinjuku station is about 1.8km.The room was good, we haven’t stayed in Tokyo before so I can’t compare it to other hotels but we found it more than adequate, takes a bit of organising to open suitcases but that is half the fun. We would stay here again.

review_body: The room was small but it was plenty enough for one person. I had room for my suitcase on the stand and I was still able to get around. . Breakfast was great. It had some options for Asian patrons and ones from Western countries. The hotel is right next to a subway entrance so it made it really easy to use public transportation. Great value for Tokyo!

review_body: We stayed for four nights at this hotel. The rooms are small but contain everything you need for a comfortable trip. Breakfast was very varied and you could order pancakes.The hotel is right next door to the metro train so very convenient. We had an excellent stay in Tokyo and felt this hotel was very good value and ticked all the boxes for us.

review_body: We spent 9 nights here.The location is perfect just minutes walk to train station,Mcdonalds and convenience stores.The reception was welcoming and assisted us in what ever way possible.The rooms are a bit small but didnt matter as we were only spending nights. We would love to go back to this hotel.

review_body: There must be a hospital near by because at least 1-2x an hour an ambulance or police siren wails on the street below. I stayed in the 9th floor with the windows shut and still was bothered. The secondary metro is near by and easy to learn after riding a few times. It connects to the major JR lines at Shinjuku or it’s a half mile walk to the main line. A few restaurants and coffee shops near by. The hotel rooms are decent size and clean. They provide a lot of amenities. Pajamas, razor, tooth brush and paste, shampoo and conditioner. You don’t need to bring much. I would like a bottle of water would’ve topped it off. There is an attached restaurant you can eat at looks like a diner.

review_body: Location - quite good; it s far from JR Shinjuku Station but just 1 minute to two private subway lines. It takes about 10 minutes to walk to Shinjuku 2 chome. There is also a car park. There are several convenient stores and a 24-h supermarket within walking distance. Room - quite small but functional. Still look quite new. Check-in and out - extremely efficient and politeBreakfast - what I like about the arrangement is that they give out the breakfast coupons that can be used at lunch or dinner if you wake up late like me. Each coupon worths 1,080yen. Definitely we would return.
hotelName:

review_body: Located only less then a 10 walk into the heart of Shinjuku! Stayed here for 4 nights when in Tokyo, clean hotel with small but comfortable size rooms, bathroom ok size for Tokyo hotel, clean and safe street, we walk in and out from Shinjuku each day and night and felt safe in the area. Metro below the hotel and some 7-Elevens and 24 restaurants located on the street too , would stay at this hotel again when in Tokyo as we got good price for the room. It all nice spot.

Receptionist/Staff: Very accommodating and considerate! Overall Score √ Excellent3. Location, very good and strategically situated in the heart of the metro-a very nice hotel to stay indeed! Overall Score √ Excellent4. Tariff? Very reasonable! Overall Score? √ Excellent!Service Value and Quality √ Excellent!I love this hotel! I do hope that I can stay in here again!LARCY Pascual, Philippines!
hotelName:

6    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at this hotel due to the location and the price. I thought I was prepared for the size of the rooms in Japan but I was not. The room we had was tiny, the bed was up against the wall, there was not enough room for both our suitcases, so they had to be closed against the wall in order to move around the room. There is not enough space for both people to move around the room, so be prepared.  The hotel itself is fine, it is an average 3 star hotel. We certainly did not pick it because it was luxurious. However, it was very clean, the cleaning staff were very friendly and we had no issues with noise at all during our stay. The staff on the front desk were not very friendly and would ignore you as you arrive back to the hotel in the evening. The location is excellent you are talking about a 10-15 minute walk into the centre of Shinjuku. There is so much to see along the way that you wont even notice the walk. I cannot fault the location at all. The hotel is located on what seemed to be a main roadway and its basically a straight walk into the centre. Its probably more of a 20-25 minute walk to Shinjuku station. I would advise getting a taxi from the station to the hotel with your luggage as its too far to walk with luggage. If you are staying here, you would be staying here out of pure convenience of the location and for the price of the room, nothing more.
hotelName:

6    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku

review_body: Metro right next door to the hotel, room is actually bigger than I expected. Very comfortable room,bed. Bathroom is bit small but enough for what you need.Shower gel, shampoo, conditioner provided. Toothbrush, hair comb and razor also in the bathroom, hairdryer in the bathroom, only thing you might need to bring is sugar n milk for tea n coffee, they provide green tea powder sachet n English tea, no coffee thoug if you a coffee drinker, there’s a McDonald’s open 24 hours just 1 min walk from the hotel. Very handy. Hugh shopping area n a few shopping mall just 10 mins walk away.H&M , Zara, Louis Vuitton, Gucci, etc all in the area. I stayed in the hotel for 5 nights.Taxi - Circa 9000¥ from HND airport it take limousine bus 1600¥to shinjuku thrm taxi 1500¥ to hotel,

review_body: Start from perfect place, with many convenience store and Fast Food stall. Decent room space and amenities, wifi with a good speed also simple easy check in and check out process. Also there is vending machine for exchange currency.
hotelName:
2    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
6    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here again because it was great the last time we visited in April 2016. We stayed her twice in 2016 because we arrived in Tokyo just to stay overnight before taking the Shinkansen to Hiroshima early the next morning, and returned for the last 3 days before leaving for home from NRT. We love the hotel because it’s 1) super clean and modern (newly renovated again), 2) quiet rooms (hotel faces lower traffic street, windows sound-insulated, high floor, and quiet fellow travelers in hallways), 3) located within 50m of entrance-B of Higashi-Shinjuku station where 2 subway lines can be accessed and 2 stops from the big Shinjuku Sta., 4) lots of convenience stores nearby, 5) nice English-speaking staff, 6) relatively inexpensive, and 7) walkable to parks, shopping, night life, and restaurants. Most hotels we stayed at have very firm (hard) beds and pillows but this hotel had one of the softer ones.
hotelName:
2    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
6    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 6 nights while holidaying in Tokyo with my sister. Reception staff were formal but pleasant. We booked the economy double to try and keep the price reasonable as Tokyo hotel prices are expensive, but we had not realised how small the room would be and there was only just enough floor space around two sides of the bed to put our suitcases down, so we had to constantly step over them to get into bed. Room was clean though and the location to the metro station is amazing as it's just next door.
hotelName:

review_body: We stayed for a week in mid November. Would definitely stay at again. Rooms typically small, but well laid out. Comfy beds. Plenty of outlets. Mini fridge. Clean with great maid service. Quiet. Very helpful desk staff. Window views. Excellent on site laundry facilities. Very reasonable and good breakfast buffet at the attached restaurant. Superbly located for metro access and local walkable destinations. Plenty of great restaurants and shopping nearby.

6    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is just 1 min walk from metro exit B2. There’s convenience stores nearby too. Room is rather small however enough for two people to stay. They provided every amenities except spoon. They do Housekeeping Everyday! I will definitely go back!
hotelName:
2    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
6    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice, clean, not spacious but sufficient. Very nice bathroom with tub. TV, desk and fridge. For dining would highly recommend the local diner just across the street. They speak very little English but helpful and many nice, small, cheap dishes to choose from. 15-20 min from Shinjuku central station but connecting subway within 100 metres from hotel.
hotelName:
2    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
6    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spent a week at the Sunroute Higashi in October of this year. Checking in the staff was friendly and helpful and speak reasonable English. Our room was 14 sq.m which is about standard in Shinjuku. The decor of the room made me feel at home so I had no problem sleeping well at night or taking a good afternoon nap.What I really liked about this hotel is that they give a good discount for long stay which I believe is four days or more, and their breakfast buffet. I stuffed myself each morning with potatoes. bacon and perfect scrambled eggs. My Asian wife had a wide selection of Japanese food to choose from. Now the reason why I mention the breakfast buffet is that food in Tokyo is very expensive and you can easily save 2000 yen by eating at the buffet before going out sightseeing. Speaking of sightseeing, this hotel is located just a few yards from a minor metro station which is easy to navigate but which can take you anywhere in Tokyo. It is a short walk to korea town with some very good restaurants and there is a mini mart not far away. In conclusion one can save money and energy staying at this hotel.
hotelName:
2    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
6    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Sunroute chain is fantastic for offering affordable, comfortable, clean and centrally located hotels all across Japan. The Higashi-Shinjuku hotel is located a short walk north of Shinjuku Station (and about a minute walk to H-S Station). It is close to tons and tons of food/drink outlets and is in an ideal location right next to Golden-Gai - you can drink all night and forget about last trains! The staff service was exceptional and the fact that there are money changing machines in the lobby is a big bonus too. I'd definitely stay here again and I hope that the Sunroute chain keeps their prices relatively low in the future. This was my fourth time staying at a Sunroute from Sapporo to Tokyo!
hotelName:
2    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
6    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location-wise it is of no complaint, right next to Higashi-Shinjuku station. Room size is of Japanese standard and works well if you are carrying a small luggage. Plenty of food choices nearby and some are 24-hrs. Economic choice of stay.The greatest disappointment, and certainly a more helpful act would be needed here, was that the hotel refused to assist in restaurant reservation (never mind it was a Michelin-star). Before check-in I was told that my credit card details were needed before they could proceed. Ended up was told that they simply did not provide assistance at all except language support. Quite a contrast from my other encounters in the city during my short stay.
hotelName:
2    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
6    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great stay during our vacation in Tokyo! Highly recommended.Our first time in Tokyo with our 2 kids. We spend a total of 2.5 days and made the most of our our time spent in the city.The hotel is very clean and located in a great central location. We will definitely be back.
hotelName:
2    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
6    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you need a hotel quieter and convenient as well as cheaper, this is the hotel you wanted to be. The room is a standard room , small room is Japan trademark but it’s next to higashi shinjuku station. When you have a long walking day hahah.. this would be a good choice and the place is more quite but still there was few eateries and 24/7 mart nearby. Compare to shinjuku is less convenient but the train route are more easier. Main station shinjuku is way to difficult to learn, you need to learn for an hour only you know which is East, west, South and North station. She be ready to explore. Anyway, this is the cheaper one compare to others.
hotelName:
2    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
6    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Small rooms like about the size of a cupboard, but clean and comfortable breakfast is very good and I thought the best on the trip staff at reception helpful it is next to the metro line and close to Shin Shinjuku station about a $10.00 taxi ride, I thought the cost of the room was outrageous at $175.00 on Agoda paid the same rate for a large well-equipped room at Sheraton Hiroshima
hotelName:
2    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
6    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: the room was okay for such price, really recommend this hotel, the location was really near to shibuya, at late night , its really easy to find a good supper, the staff was very nice and welcoming, you wont regret
hotelName:
2    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
6    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you’re on a budget and simply want somewhere to rest your head while taking in the sights of Tokyo, this is the place to book. Yes the rooms are small, but most Japanese hotel rooms are similar. The location is perfect (next door to a metro stop) and the bed is comfortable.
hotelName:
2    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
6    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean rooms in the heart of the city. Good service. Help with the guide.Not for the first time for Silom. And not the last one absolutely. With excellent service from staff. And welcome back home every time. And travel is very comfortable. Not to walk 5 minutes to the train to anywhere. I have to tell the course.
hotelName:
2    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
6    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: There was a lot of things we liked about this hotel during our eight-day stay, but the convenience of its location clearly tops the list. It is literally just one door away from the subway entrance. Considering that Tokyo is a subway intensive city, this fact goes a long ways. We also enjoyed staying in Shinjuku. Visiting other Tokyo districts, we felt we took the right decision staying in that neighborhood.But everything else was great as well. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful, always ready to provide some change for your money or lend power adapters or make reservations for a special dinner (in this regard, please honor any reservations you make, because foreigners missing their restaurant reservations has been an issue in Tokyo lately, from what I read).As with any property in this price range in Tokyo, the rooms are small and Sunroute makes this very clear on their website. We had reserved a standard double, but when we got to the room we concluded that because of our luggage we would not be comfortable. We checked with the front desk and fortunately they had a slightly larger room available for an upgrade, which was fine for us.Amenities included a hair dryer, slippers, bathrobes, and good-quality toiletries. The shower was powerful and mattress and bedding were exceptionally comfortable. As with just about everything in Japan, the room was spotlessly clean.On the second floor, there are coin-operated washers and dryers, something very convenient for longer travels. We used and found them very convenient and easy to use.Breakfast is not included in the basic rate, but you can have this meal at the adjoining restaurant (Royal Host) for JPY 1,030, a steal for the generous buffet they offer. Get your voucher at the reception.In a nutshell, I believe one cannot find a better hotel deal in Tokyo in this price range.
hotelName:
2    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
6    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 6 nights in July 2018. We had traveled around Japan for 10 days before this and stayed in a few different hotels, this was our favourite one of the bunch.The room size was good, the air conditioning was controlled and good. The bathroom is a nice size, the room had storage space for suitcases. Honestly couldn't fault the hotel really.Location wise, the B2 exit from the metro is like a minute walk from the hotel. The main transport in Japan is train, so if you have never been before, this hotel is a perfect location for you, as you can get around the city quite easily from this hotel.There is also shops close by and a Mcdonalds, which always is handy ! If I went back to Japan, and the price was right, I would happily stay here again. No problems at all, and a lovely hotel !
hotelName:
2    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
6    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is very good. It was clean, and the front staff are very nice and friendly. However, It is missing some of the finer details of other Japanese hotels, there is some small mold in the shower, the decore is very dated and old. Overall I recommend staying here.There are small coffee shops and restaurants close, the subway F and E lines are very close. 7-11 is across the street. And it is a 10minute walk to bustling Shinjuku.
hotelName:
2    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
6    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room is very clean and spotless especially the bathroom. Though the size is small but it has everything it needs and it looks neat and even the room looks better than the one near Shinjuku station (newer).The reception is very helpful and just walk 10 steps you will arrive at the metro station so it's quite easy to go everywhere.The area is a bit quiet, but walk a bit further you can find a lot of restaurants that open until midnite.But for me, I prefer Sunroute Plaza due to simplicity to go from and to the airport.Here there is no bus limo service, so it's more complicated to commute to the airport, while in Sunroute Plaza the bus will stop right in front of your hotel.But overall experience is very good and recommended.
hotelName:
2    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
6    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked this hotel based on price, value and location, and we were very happy. It was easy for catching the metro. I had previously stayed at the other Sunroute hotel in Shinjuku, nearer to Shinjuku JR station, and while the location was probably better there, I think the Sunroute Higashi hotel seemed newer, rooms were very clean and our room rate included breakfast, which was very good, and you would have to be fussy person to not find something likable. It was a solid 30 minute walk to all the shopping in the Shinjuku area, and there were lots of food options nearby to the hotel. Would be happy to stay here again on my next visit to Tokyo.
hotelName:
2    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
6    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I would highly recommend this hotel to any budget-conscious travelers in Tokyo. We booked our rooms well in advance and got an excellent rate through the early bird special. Because the nightly rate was so low, we weren't sure what to expect, but were pleasantly surprised at how nice the hotel was. The facilities were excellent, and we had fantastic interactions with all the staff members. We also loved breakfast in the Royal Host restaurant, and even had dinner there one night, when we were too tired to venture out further. The hotel's location is excellent: literally next door to a metro station! Also, it is close enough to the center of Shinjuku for an easy walk to nightlife, but far enough from the busiest areas to never be loud at night. We had a great stay! Highly recommend!
hotelName:
2    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
6    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: it is my first ever trip to Tokyo. Having read good reviews abt Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku online, I decided to go ahead and book it via Expedia. Whilst the rooms were small, the amenities was in no way lacking. I liked that the hotel was near tk Subway Higashi Shinjuku stop and within a stone's throw from the B2 exit. Loved that it was near all the other subway lines which required interchange of lines. It was also only a stop away from the main Shinjuku Line where the Odaykyu Romance Car was to travel to Hakone and other parts of Tokyo. it is also within walking distance to Shinjuku itself. As it is not too centralized to Shinjuku, it was relatively quiet and I enjoyed my stay after a long day of sightseeing. Family Mart was next door and loads of eateries around. I would definitely stay at Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku again.
hotelName:
2    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
6    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good size room for 2 ppl. Bathroom is considered medium, comfy bed however pillow is too flat even they give u two. The hotel located right next to train station. Very convenient n easy access to everything!
hotelName:
2    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
6    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I originally booked this hotel based on its price and location in Shinjuku. If you book 6+ nights the direct Hotel website also gives you a discount. Upon arrival, the hotel surpassed my expectations for a few reasons. It’s right next door to Higashi-Shinjuku station (direct line- 4 stops to Shibuya station or even Yokohama) and just a 10 minute walk to the neon-lit centre, where most of the restaurants are, as well as the big department store, ‘Isetan’ - worth visiting the basement level for their food hall and trying lots of different things!The hotel itself is spotless and the staff are very welcoming and helpful. The rooms are bigger than the last hotel I stayed in (APA Hotel) with desk space, mini fridge & kettle, a small rail to hang clothes and a full double bed (for single occupancy). Note, the room size is still not huge which is typical for Tokyo. The bathroom also has a mini bath and all the toiletries you need - I didn’t once use my own in the end.I also had the best sushi of my stay in Tokyo just around the corner at ‘Sushi-Zambia Higashi Shinjuku’ - check it out!Would definitely recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
2    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
6    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Need a medium size room to be confortable (24 sq. Meters).Reception on the 15th floor with nice view from balcony.Modern and clean property.Breakfast a bit expensive but worth the money since you can eat enough of the buffet style food to avoid the need for dinner afterwards.Nice onsens on the top floor if you do not mind bathing naked with Japanese men or women.Very close to metro station or Yamanote train line (access from 4th floor of Remy store). The Remy store offers a wide variety of prepared food that you can eat in your room if you want.Definitely recommand this place to visit Tokyo.Used the Willer Express Bus from the Narita Airport to the Osaki station next to Gotanda. Less expansive than the Narita Express train.
hotelName:
3    Mitsui Garden Hotel Gotanda
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is conveniently located near JR Gotanda station and just 3 stops from Shibuya Station. The hotel is in a quieter suburb however we saw many restaurants near the hotel. Reception is on the 15th floor and Lawson on the ground floor. Check in was at 3 pm so staff moved our luggage into our rooms before we got back to the hotel later that night. There is a a nice rooftop area near the reception desk that overlooks the city. The bed was big and comfortable. Complimentary bottled water is supplied daily. Plenty of amenities supplied. Three elevators available however we did have to wait a while for the elevators each time.
hotelName:
3    Mitsui Garden Hotel Gotanda
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location is very convenient, around 3-5 minutes walk from the Gotanda station, and many restaurants around, convenience store right at the ground floor of the hotel. The room is very nice and comfortable with all the amenities you need. Love the hot bath at the top floor, especially the outdoor one. Really relaxing spot after a long day.
hotelName:
3    Mitsui Garden Hotel Gotanda
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed 4 nights and this is a very new and clean hotel in a great location, 3 minute walk from Gotanda station (Yamanote line - free with the JR pass) and close to Shinagawa (and Tokyo) - for Bullet trains and to Hamamatsucho for the monorail to Haneda, as well as the night life at Shinjuku and Shibuya. There is also a great food store right by the station ( pastries were excellent and very cheap).The room was average size and had all you need including a table and 2 x chairs and fridge with free bottles of water daily. Kettle and coffee/tea. The bathroom is a little compact with a bath/shower over. Reception and terrace on the 15th Floor with Japanese Onsen on the top floor (16th). We had a room only rate and did not dine in the restaurant at all. we would have tried breakfast but found the menu a little off putting. So we had all we required from the foodstore every morning, fresh fruit, pastries etc. Would stay here again if in Tokyo, without hesitation.
hotelName:
3    Mitsui Garden Hotel Gotanda
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: we sent 9 days in this Hotel, close to the JR Gotanda station. When arriving from Tokyo, Shinagawa enter in the last car of the Yamanote train, and then up the stairs. This saves carriying your suitcases across the street. Rooms are small, like most in Tokyo. Breakfast was more suited for Asians, but we found enough for our European taste.
hotelName:
3    Mitsui Garden Hotel Gotanda
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Overall, we had a pleasant stay at this Hotel. It is located in a more quieter location, very close to train station, a supermarket and a lot of restaurants within walking distant. Staff is friendly and efficient. Probably the only thing to comment is on the breakfast selection and variation especially when you are staying more than 2 days like us. Anyway you can grab something outside nearby
hotelName:
3    Mitsui Garden Hotel Gotanda
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel opened a few minutes walk from Gotanda Station.Both facilities and services are of higher quality than hotels in the same price range.It is an image of a slightly superior hotel-type inn located in a hot spring area.The reception is very smooth.room design is also efficient.The staff also received an impression that they are well educated.It would be nice to be at the lounge in front of the reception desk while watching the view of Tokyo.Although I did not expect much, I could use the rooftop open-air bath very comfortably because it was a cold season.
hotelName:
3    Mitsui Garden Hotel Gotanda
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 7 nights. Everything was perfect; our room was clean, beautiful and comfortable, staff members were just amazing. Almost everyone speaks English in this hotel. Location, is the best; literally next to a JR station. This means with a JR pass travel to and from the hotel is a breeze. You have a 7/11 and a Lawson just next door. Really good tea and coffee provided in the room. Sound proofing is amazing.Hopefully we get to go back there again.TIP: If it is your first time in Tokyo, trust me , you do not want to stay close to one of the big stations. Instead, pick a location like Gotanda.
hotelName:
3    Mitsui Garden Hotel Gotanda
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for a week with family, and had a good stay.The good:* Excellent location - it is 5 minutes from the Gotanda station. Within short walking distance, there is also plenty of food choices.* Great staff - very friendly - helped us with our luggage multiple times, booked a taxi for us and even helped with the luggage down, I can't say enough good things about the staffs.* Clean rooms, spacious given the price and our location.* Amenities are good - my wife tried the public bath, which she said was good. There are 2 washing machines and vending machines, and there is a Lawson in the building as well.The not so good:* I really can't think of anything major - perhaps it would be nice to have USB charging ports as an addition. They do have a multi-adapter charger in the room, so that's covered.* Hotel
hotelName:
3    Mitsui Garden Hotel Gotanda
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our night at Mitsui was relaxing, and the staff were available to help with things such as printing off flight tickets and throwing extra shopping/rubbish bags out when we had no more use for them. Overall, highly recommended if staying in the area!
hotelName:
3    Mitsui Garden Hotel Gotanda
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very clean and very modern. Quiet. The bathroom amenities were outstanding ....anything you might need is right there, also pjs and slippers every day. The hotel is very near the Gotanda train station so it was easy getting around Tokyo. I understand the rooms are large by Japanese standards but still seemed a tad small. The only downside is there wasn’t a lot of storage space for clothes, and I overpacked slightly for a 10 day stay. Housekeeping was very reliable, and very respectful of door signs (didn’t disturb, cleaned during time requested, never skipped, etc.). The price was very reasonable for the quality of the hotel and services, Highly recommend.
hotelName:
3    Mitsui Garden Hotel Gotanda
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was located at on quiet lane off the main street with only 5-minute short walk from JR Gotanda Station. It was a clean, neat Japanese city hotel. Its lobby was set on 15th floor with a alfresco windy balcony for the panoramic views of Gotanda. Its has clean simple Japanese onsen provided for guests on 16th floor which needed guest room keycards to electronically open onsen’s door. Its guest rooms was decorated in a minimalist modern style which well mad use of limited space. The only drawback was its daily buffet breakfast was bland and repetitious with a limited array of good-quality dishes.
hotelName:
3    Mitsui Garden Hotel Gotanda
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was one of our top hotels during my last trip to Japan. Very good located near Gotanda Station in between of Shinagawa and Sibuya. Yhe hotel is modern, new and has nice facilities. What made it for us special was the lovely trainee at the reception desk. This girl is a true gem and she was really caring for my mother and made her trip unforgettable. Breakfast here is very good too. If you book in time you find yourself here a very good deal.
hotelName:
3    Mitsui Garden Hotel Gotanda
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First, the hotel is very new. It is just a few minutes walk from Gotanda Station. Most convenient amongst the hotels that I have stayed - one doesn't have to walk down or up lots of stairways inside/outside stations unlike many hotels that I had stayed before, though are also very close to railway stations but they are comparatively larger and more complicated.The shower pressure is one of the best. Most impressive of all, the air conditioning is really maneuverable, unlike many of the hotels in Japan.Another pro is that the supermarket annexed to Gotanda Station operates until midnight.If you wish to rent a car for day trip like I had done, this hotel is perfect as car rental is just about two hundred meters away so you don't have to worry finding a carpark for the night, which is always expensive in downtown Tokyo.
hotelName:
3    Mitsui Garden Hotel Gotanda
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Mitsui Garden GotandaThis is a relatively new hotel near Gotanda Station. Here are some of the salient points about the hotel as follows:The location is very good. It is about 5 minutes walk from JR Yamanote Line platform. If you are coming from Hamamatsucho Station and taking Yamanote Line, you are advised to take the back half of the train. It will be nearer for you to take the escalator up to 4th floor of Tokyu Remy Departmental Store, and then take the escalators in the store all the way down to ground floor. Go straight out of the main entrance across the road to the next junction, then turn right. The surrounding is quiet compared to Shinjuku or Ikebukuro. Not so jam packed with people but it is still relatively easy to look for food. There are lots of eateries around the area. The staff at the front desk are super friendly and helpful. They are well trained, English speaking, efficient, accommodating and helpful. One of its staff help me to book an e-ticket online to TeamLab Borderless. There is a Lawson convenient store on ground floor.There is a quick check out option available. You just need to drop your card keys into the check out box at the lift lobby and walk out. Is that easy?The room is big by Japanese standard with basic facilities.They offer you free use of WiFi plus the spa and public bath facilities on 16th floor.The breakfast spread is simply wonderful. Plenty of choices and of good quality. Simply put, it is a gem in Tokyo.
hotelName:
3    Mitsui Garden Hotel Gotanda
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed this hotel for almost 2weeks. Convenient to everywhere by JR line There’s a supermarket whenever to & fro train station Supermarket sell many cooked food and all veri fresh sushi and sashimi. Many locals buy from there too. Hotel staffs veri helpful and like the public bath veri much. Choice this hotel Cos of the public bath as we had stayed at their other hotels with public bath Veri good after a full day out in the cold Hotel room has nice view too.
hotelName:
3    Mitsui Garden Hotel Gotanda
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As a recently opened hotel , it was very modern and clean. Has decent room space and has onsen on the top floor . Also near the Jr Yamanote line in Gotanda. weirdly the reception is not on the ground floor
hotelName:
3    Mitsui Garden Hotel Gotanda
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice, modern, smart hotel right next to Gotanda train station. The room is very clean and tidy with modern features. Staff were very friendly and the breakfast was pretty good if a little pricey. Overall I would recommend this hotel!
hotelName:
3    Mitsui Garden Hotel Gotanda
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Got the most basic room which was good value for money for the central location. The room was clean and size was very reasonable for Tokyo. Loved the full bath tub and washlet. The public bath upstairs was crowded and the water had chemical small, so only used it once during my week long stay. There are many different restaurants and little stores within walking distance from the hotel. The most convenient is the Remy building connected to the Gotanda station, with various shops and a supermarket (Tokyu Store). The most convenient way to get to/from the hotel is via the 4/F of Remi building as it is connected to the exit of JR and Tokyu train lines.
hotelName:
3    Mitsui Garden Hotel Gotanda
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at this hotel for 4 days but sorry to shared that the experience was disappointing.Staff at front desk not very helpful, maybe is due to language issues (?) they cannot communicate well when I made requests or when I ask simple questions for help.Also, I was surprised by the clean up services : Bedsheets were changed BUT none of the cups and glasses were cleaned or replaced also the trash bin not cleaned.The toilet smells odour (bad).The second day I departed the room a bit late and left a “make up the room” tag outside But when I returned, the room was still not cleaned and I have no new towels or replacements for the night.I just want to express my disappointment and hopefully can help the hotel to improve the services to future customers But as for me, I do not think I will be returning to this hotel for my next visit given this time’s experience.
hotelName:
3    Mitsui Garden Hotel Gotanda
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at this hotel after staying for a week at one of the Hilton hotels. We are a family off four so we needed to book 2 rooms. At first we found it hard to find from the station even though it so close. The station has many exits stay on the road level otherwise you will need to carry all of your luggage up over a bridge.The location is the advantage of this hotel. Gotanda itself is nothing to stay for; however, the location is a great base for all of your touring. We purchased a tourers Pasmo pass which meant we didn’t have to worry about what train we went on. Put about $25 for 4 days if you are going to do a lot of sight seeing.Okay... the rooms, yes they are tiny. We had the moderate rooms as these were what was offered on the site we booked on. They were very tight. We struggled with our luggage in the rooms which gave little area to move around in. The bathroom ( was not even 1.5 metres wide). The bath is a sit in one with legs scrunched. The walls are panelled like a caravan. The hotel is clean, house keeping was ok but not consistent and things like the jug and cups and saucers were not cleaned up. My husbands room got complimentary water each day we got it once?This room in this hotel would suit a single traveller/business traveller not 2 people with luggage. So be careful of you book online on a booking site as the Hotels site says they are suited for business people but the site we booked on did not and used a different name for the rooms. A note on the Onsen’s, we did not use it as my family could not get pass the fact that you cannot wear swimwear in them. Staff were friendly and helpful. The Restaurant Tanto Tanto was lovely with a good variety of dishes and very friendly staff. Reasonable pricing.There is a small shopping mall very close with a Starbucks and a few variety stores. A Lawson is next door which was great for drinks etc. the hotel has a small sitting area at reception and they are happy to store your bags in the foyer.We would not stay here again as a family unless we booked two larger rooms.If all you need is a bed at night and you are going to be out for the rest then this could be a central hotel for the city and the airports.
hotelName:
3    Mitsui Garden Hotel Gotanda
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had a good experience staying in other Mitsui Garden Hotel so when I found out that this is newly opened in June, I booked it without hesitant.The hotel is conveniently located near the station but as I do not have the right directions to it when I first arrive, took us a while in the rain to find it. If you arrive by train on the JR Yamanote line, walk to the end of the platform before you exit the gantry. There, it is linked to a mall and there’s escalators or lift if you have luggage. The hotel is round the corner of the 2nd crossing after you exit the supermart.We stayed here for 4 nights and it’s a great base for travelling around Tokyo. No complains about the rooms since the hotel is new and WiFi is strong. Breakfast at the hotel has quite a good option but it does get quite crowded. Anyway the supermart near the hotel has such great options of food & pastries for breakfast or supper. There are also many eateries around the hotel that you will not be short of food choices.Definitely be staying here again when I come back to Tokyo.
hotelName:
3    Mitsui Garden Hotel Gotanda
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent 2 nights at this new hotel. The hotel is about 5 minutes walk from the Gotanda station, for those travelling with big luggages please be aware that you would actually need to use the overhead pedestrian pass to get to the hotel. This hotel is near to Tokyu supermarket which is operates almost 24 hours! Hotel wise, rooms were clean and bigger than most hotels in Tokyo. The spa located in the highest floor is not bad, but be aware of some tourists who bring their phone into the big bath.(most probably their first time?) I would like to give thanks to Ms Iwase who had been most helpful during our stay, especially when we were catching our bus to Narita airport. She was so kind to arrange taxi and waited with us to make sure we could catch our bus. Really 5 star service, thanks to her! Will definitely stay in this hotel again when I come back to Tokyo!
hotelName:
3    Mitsui Garden Hotel Gotanda
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Decent hotel! The check in lobby is bright with free drink.The room is sparkling clean with comfortable pillows and duvet! The open area near the lobby is good to see the night view of Tokyo!veryclose to Gotenda station!Only three minutes of walk to the station!There is a convenient store and one supermarket near the entrance of the hotel.easy and convenient to go there to buy snacks and drink!The breakfast is good but no changes at all! We stayed there for four nights but the breakfast is the same every day.There is also a roof top spa pool for people to relax.The water is not hot spring but still good for us to relax after shopping!The location is good.you can take the jr train to Shibuya and harajuku within 10 mins!we enjoyed to stay there!
hotelName:
3    Mitsui Garden Hotel Gotanda
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rooms were clean and like new. Location was great with the metro station right across the street. Staff was very friendly and recommended areas around to eat. We asked them to call a taxi for us and a staff member took us downstairs and waited till we drive off to make sure everything was good and to see if the driver had any questions. I would highly recommend this hotel!
hotelName:
3    Mitsui Garden Hotel Gotanda
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent, by far the best hotel I have stayed in Tokyo and is 5 star quality in any other part of the world - a lot better than Mitsui Garden Ginza. The hotel is very clean and modern and the rooms are a decent size. The room we stayed at was the Superior room for 4 nights and it was worth the extra money. The shower and toilet are modern and separate and complimentary water is provided daily. There is also a spa on the top floor, vending machines, laundry area and a microwave as well. Staff at reception are excellent, friendly and courteous. Location is terrific with a lot of restaurants within the vicinity including a shopping mall and super market. JR line Gotanda is just a 2 minute walk away as well. Wifi is fast, reliable and they provide a smartphone similar to what we saw in Hong Kong so you have internet without the need to buy a sim. Highly recommended and will definitely stay here again
hotelName:
3    Mitsui Garden Hotel Gotanda
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A value for money hotel in Tokyo. Almost everything was excellent...friendly staff, delicious breakfast with japanese and italian cuisine, wonderful design and interesting views of the city. A decent choice in the heart of Tokyo, if you don’t mind about how spacious your room is.
hotelName:
3    Mitsui Garden Hotel Gotanda
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Literally a 5 min walk to the Yamanote Line. Quite alot of food options in the walking vicinity. Good strong wifi, with a supermarket just convenience store within 2 min walking distance.The onsen is really great - indoor and outdoor (with a great view) gender seperated pools. Overall hotel was in a good shape and really clean!
hotelName:
3    Mitsui Garden Hotel Gotanda
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: For those of you who haven’t ever been to japan I ask one question.... ‘what are you waiting for?’ It’s the greatest place in the world and the mitsui hotel has the perfect spot with regards to location. Room is clean, staff speak English (not always common) facilities are good too. They need to relax the check-in time (I waited from 9am till 3pm as did a few others) and possibly review the tv channel list but all in all a very good deal.Will be back.
hotelName:
3    Mitsui Garden Hotel Gotanda
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 4 days having booked at short notice and found the room to be very clean, modern and comfortable with tea/coffee making, safe etc in place. decent wi-fi too. the wardrobe was small and the double bed was against the wall on one side. Bathroom and shower were fine. The reception is on the 15th floor but there's a terrace with good views of the city and a spa on the 16th too. We tried the ground floor restaurant for breakfast once but found it to be poorly run, expensive for what you get, running out of items all the time and on top of all that made me ill. There are plenty of decent cafes nearby offering far better at less cost. The hotel is a 2 minutess from The Gotanda JR line and another metro line.
hotelName:
3    Mitsui Garden Hotel Gotanda
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We've just checked out of Mitsui Garden Hotel Gotanda after staying there for 4 nights. We cannot fault the hotel and staff. We found the hotel cozy, the room clean, well decorated and fully stocked with travel accessories, and relatively spacious compared to Japanese standard. The hotel staff were so helpful, providing us with useful transport information, assisted us with our bus tour reservation and responding efficiently with our enquiries. The hotel also provided a mobile phone for guests to take with them during the day with free internet and local/international calls. We didn't need the mobile for calls, but having access to free internet on the go was most helpful, especially preventing us from getting lost where ever we went.The hotel's location is also excellent, a few minutes walk from the train station, which covers a number of train lines, including JR Yamanote line that stops at all the major train stations. The hotel is also surrounded by numerous supermarkets, restaurants and cafes, which offered a variety of foods for all budgets. We highly recommend staying at this hotel and would return with our future trips to Japan.
hotelName:
3    Mitsui Garden Hotel Gotanda
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice place to stay, nice staff, almost all speak English, nice rooms, a restaurant in the ground floor, breakfast is nice, same range everyday, close to Gotanda Train Station, plenty of eateries, supermarket close by, overall a good hotel to stay
hotelName:
3    Mitsui Garden Hotel Gotanda
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice and new hotel. Amazing guest service and facilities, very satisfying room size for two people (bigger than conventional business hotels), relaxing separate gender spa (men have a cityscape view to look forward to in the outside area, women can enjoy a mini zen garden in the outside space). Otherwise, the reception on the 15th floor also boasts great views of the cityscape.Amazing cleanliness, slippers and pajamas changed daily.Breakfast was satisfying and tasty, good coffee too! Really good location, just two minutes from Goranda station on the JR Yamanote line which takes you around the whole city easily. Around the hotel in the Higashigotanda district are many supermarkets ("konbinis") and plenty of cafés and eating joints to our convenience. There's a riverbank two buildings next to the hotel, which makes for a relaxing contrast. Overall a perfect experience, thank you!
hotelName:
3    Mitsui Garden Hotel Gotanda
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Professional service.Clean and modern and spacious by Tokyo standards.Location right beside JR line station.Bath on top floor was amazing. Great to soak away after a long day.Would recommend to anyone staying in Tokyo on vacation.
hotelName:
3    Mitsui Garden Hotel Gotanda
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed here as it was close to Haneda airport. We arrived at 1am the reception was friendly and the room was very clean. We requested to extend our stay by one night and the rate quoted was the same for the two night stay and the lady at feh front desk sniggered with her colleague when we declined. This was not the usual politeness experienced everywhere else. I am vegetarian and there was very little for me to eat. Will not visit this hotel again. Access from the metro is difficult as you have to lag bags up stairs and over a bridge to get to it.
hotelName:
3    Mitsui Garden Hotel Gotanda
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The stay was definitely good value for money and ticked all the boxes- safety, comfortable room, friendly staff and convenient location, at a good price! I was travelling alone in Tokyo and I am so glad I chose this hotel to stay, which offered comfort and safety to ladies. On my request, they put me on the ladies’ floor. I booked the superior room on the high floor and my room was not that close to adjacent buildings so I could keep the curtains up at night. The room was brand-new and modern. It was small though quite common in Tokyo. The staff was well-trained and up to the standard of Japanese hospitality. I was especially impressed by the onsen on the top floor. The onsen was not big but getting to enjoy it in Tokyo downtown was delightful experience. There is no gym or carpark that is why it doesn’t have a 4-or 5- star. The hotel is conveniently located near Gotanda station. My advice if you have luggage with you is that you exit the JR from the Tokyu Store 東急ストア exit (same level as the gates) and take its elevator to the ground floor so you don’t need to hold the luggage through the stairs.
hotelName:
3    Mitsui Garden Hotel Gotanda
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This brand new hotel has the best location in tokyo its only 5 minutes walk from Gotanda station. Just enter the tokyu store go to level 4 en from here you enter the subway station Gotanda. When you come from the subway just walk straight go up the escalator and than to the left you enter tokyu store.The hotel is very new and clean you even have a ice machine on every floor and an microwave on level 16. The beds are super good and soft. The shower is very strong and very good water pressure. The service is very good and fast when i asked for extra towels the receptionist give it directly i didn't had to wait a minute.The reception is on the 15th floor btw. This is hotel is very clean and nice my compliments to the staff of this hotel. You even have a Lawson only 2 minutes behind the hotel. but the best option is to walk to tokyu store they have everything and a big supermarket. I really like this hotel and will definelty come back next time when i go to tokyo
hotelName:
3    Mitsui Garden Hotel Gotanda
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was an ideal location. Staff was fantastic. Laundry (with rare dryers) made our trip manageable. Would stay with this chain again, as it’s hard to find rooms to accommodate 4 people. Mostly, just easy to see much of the city.
hotelName:
4    MIMARU TOKYO UENO INARICHO
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent staff and spacious, clean rooms. You live in the middle of the mega-city, but there is really no noise from outside. The hotel is a short walk from the Ueno train station, and nearest metro station is only a couple of blocks away.
hotelName:
4    MIMARU TOKYO UENO INARICHO
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was very clean. Ueno is a fantastic location with a beautiful park nearby. We were able to walk to the zoo, the museum and the local market area. The hotel was nice a quiet.
hotelName:
4    MIMARU TOKYO UENO INARICHO
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was a perfect room for 4 member family. Very clean room and convenient location from Skyline Station, Ueno Station and Inaricho Station but still quite street.Front desk staff speaks fluent english.Definitely recommend it
hotelName:
4    MIMARU TOKYO UENO INARICHO
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We live family room in 6/14~6/16 2019 , two adults two kidsbig space in Tokyo Hoteland good location has kitchen can heat food but can't open windows , and windows glass is not transparentlyit is very important for me , light and air flow
hotelName:
4    MIMARU TOKYO UENO INARICHO
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: At Mimaru you get small apartments that are well suited for families with children. There us only one room, but with separated areas for children and parents. Small kitchen with microwave is available.
hotelName:
4    MIMARU TOKYO UENO INARICHO
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 4 nights after arriving in Tokyo and after a week in Fuji/Kyoto/Hiroshima, we can back to stay another 3 nights. We were so comfortable here! the room: more like a small apartment was plenty for our family of 4 (kids 16,14) Small kitchen allowed us to prep/microwave food from nearby stores. Room was clean and it helps that the hotel is newer than the other Mimaru locations nearby. Small dining area allowed us to simulate family meals when we weren't eating out. the room design separated the area for toilet, shower, and bathroom sink so it never felt cramped. location: hotel is located in a very quiet and safe neighborhood but just close enough to metro stations and attractions. It's a great home base to see all of Tokyo. We round-tripped on the Keisei Skyliner from Narita to Keisei-Ueno station. While our 7 day JR pass was still in effect, we used the Yamanote loop from Ueno station to get to the west side of Tokyo (Shinjuku, Harajuku). If no JR pass, very nearby Inaricho station on the Ginza line is a straight shot to Shibuya. 24hr supermarket/convenience stores made it easy to bring food back to the room and eat as a family. staff: Hats off to Kyran, Amber and the rest of the staff for making us absolutely feel at home during our 7 nights. Kyran was like a old friend from the the very first night we checked in. I highly recommend this hotel!
hotelName:
4    MIMARU TOKYO UENO INARICHO
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We just returned from a great 5 night stay. The hotel pictures of the rooms accurately reflect how large and clean the rooms are. The room can comfortably fit a family of 4 or 5. Each floor of the hotel has only 3 rooms which are very similar, but with slightly different configurations. Our group had 3 families and the hotel was able to assign us rooms on the same floor, so we had the entire floor to ourselves. It was so nice for the kids in our group to be able to go in/out of each other's rooms without bothering other guests. Each of the bathrooms has the toilet, shower/bath, and sink area divided from each other, which makes the bathroom easier to share. As others have mentioned, the hotel has a partial cleaning policy so they empty the trash cans each day, but only change linens/make beds every several days (our 4th night of 5 nights. That worked for us just fine, and they have daily cleaning as an option for an extra fee for those who desire it.It was very helpful to have the laundry facility on the ground floor. There are 3 washers and 3 dryers. There is a change machine that will break a 1000 yen bill. The laundry detergent is 100 yen (and takes 1 100 yen coin). Washers are 300 yen, and dryers are 100 yen for 30 minutes. You'll likely need 2 - 30 minute drying cycles to fully dry your clothes. The hotel even provides a small container to hold dirty laundry. The hotel is very close to both the Ueno and Inaricho stations, and various amenities. Ueno station can take you to almost anywhere in Tokyo very readily. We took the Skyliner from Narita (which was very easy), and we took the JR train (with 1 very easy transfer) to get to Haneda airport. Each trip took just under an hour, door to door. I highly recommend this hotel and look forward to another great stay there.
hotelName:
4    MIMARU TOKYO UENO INARICHO
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed in this apartment hotel for 5 days and had a smooth and comfortable experience. It comes with a full kitchen and a modern room. The subway station is a 5 minute walk and there are plenty of convenience stores and restaurants nearby. There are plenty of amenities such as coin laundry and vending machine. The only downside would be that they don't change your sheets daily since it is an apartment hotel style.
hotelName:
4    MIMARU TOKYO UENO INARICHO
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 當媽後第一次帶兩個小孩來東京，很幸運找到這麼舒適的旅店，大、寧靜、乾淨，可煮食洗衣，近24小時超市，員工非常友善。This is not the first time I have been to Ueno but the first family travel with 2 toddlers. The family for 4 adults and 2 children is big, clean and comfortable. We really appreciate the service, kindly and friendly staff here and definitely will come back in the future!
hotelName:
4    MIMARU TOKYO UENO INARICHO
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Was great location, close to transport, supermarkets and places to dine as well as some Tokyo tourist spots. Apartment was clean, comfortable, spacious and had everything we needed. Staff were very helpful. All in all a great stay.
hotelName:
4    MIMARU TOKYO UENO INARICHO
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Friendly and helpful staff, spatious room, fresh and clean! Great for familys, perfekt for kids with the rooms with tatami part. Very close to supermarket and subway station on Ginza line. Though very central its a quiet and calm area, really nice.
hotelName:
4    MIMARU TOKYO UENO INARICHO
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Welcoming and helpful staff. Spacious room with kitchen, refrigerator and microwave. We were able to borrow a barbecue grill and rice cooker so we can cook our own lunch or dinner. We enjoyed our stay and would surely stay here again next time we are in the Ueno area. Wish they had more washer and dryers, anyways u need to pay JPY300 for every washer load and JPY100 for the dryer.
hotelName:
4    MIMARU TOKYO UENO INARICHO
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room is so clean and comfortable, and the staff are nice. The location is also great, take only 10 minutes to walk from JR Ueno station, and is quite quiet ouside. Overall, it's really a recommended hotel.
hotelName:
4    MIMARU TOKYO UENO INARICHO
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great rooms with full kitchen, comfortable beds, nice washrooms, and a smartphone for using data. Employees were very helpful and friendly. Walking distance from train stations and a variety of restaurants.
hotelName:
4    MIMARU TOKYO UENO INARICHO
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We only stayed 1 night at the hotel, but regret we did not book more nights. The reception and room was very new and stylish. Very good size hotelroom and only 3 rooms in each floor. Hotel is located in a quite street but close to restaurants, Ueno station and supermarket.
hotelName:
4    MIMARU TOKYO UENO INARICHO
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have just finished a 6 night stay here and I cannot speak highly enough of this property. We stayed in the Japanese Style room and it was perfect, so much space for the family and it came with a Kitchen and everything we needed. Travelling with 2 small children, this is a rare find indeed in Tokyo, and what made our trip even more special was the staff. They were endlessly helpful, nothing was ever a problem. 2 mins from the Hotel was a 24hr local supermarket that stocked everything, so we had breakfast self catered in our room and often take away dinners from some of the local restaurants the other nights. Having the freedom of the kitchen was priceless. As location goes, located in a quiet street, 3mins walk from Inaricho Subway Station, 10mins walk from the Keisei Skyliner direct to Narita at Ueno. Ueno Park and Zoo are ajacent to the station. Food Street is opposite Ueno Station so its all here. Tokyo is not easy to find family hotel solutions but the Mimaru is a step ahead and I cannot speak highly enough of them. The property was spotless, even had a laundry! We will definately be back. Thanks so much for a wonderful stay!
hotelName:
4    MIMARU TOKYO UENO INARICHO
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rooms are not so big but you can get anything you need to use, even can borrow the toaster,and the front desk are so kind gave us some good recommendation for where to go and where to eat.Hotel's location is very convenient to the subway and some popular places (Asakusa and Skytree).It was a very excellent experience staying at MIMARU.
hotelName:
4    MIMARU TOKYO UENO INARICHO
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent facilities and friendly, helpful staff. Great location close to Ueno with easy access to the metro. Local restaurants and a close supermarket make staying here easy and enjoyable. Highly recommend it !
hotelName:
4    MIMARU TOKYO UENO INARICHO
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a great time in Tokyo. Staying at the Mimaru hotel was great. Nice designed in japanese style. Hidden windows. Nice traditional dining area in the room. Super nice and helpfull staff. Perfect cleaning. Totally recomend it. The kids loved it as well.
hotelName:
4    MIMARU TOKYO UENO INARICHO
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: we stayed here for 3nights. There are kitchen, dining table and high speed of wifi. The room very large compare with other hotel in Tokyo. Location not too far from the station (about 450meter from Ueno station) staff friendly and called taxi for us to Keisei line on the day we left.
hotelName:
4    MIMARU TOKYO UENO INARICHO
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I really liked the apartment. We wanted to stay in Ueno. These apartments were quite close to ueno station. The complex is new and I loved the styling! You get a complete kitchen and lot of toiletries. For Tokyo it was also a quite big room.
hotelName:
4    MIMARU TOKYO UENO INARICHO
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 5~10mins from ueno 入谷 exit. Supermarket just on the next corner. Although not the best location in ueno area, but if you want a bigger room for the whole family and excellent service. This hotel still a very good choice.
hotelName:
4    MIMARU TOKYO UENO INARICHO
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We found the staff very helpful. The rooms were spacious by Japan standards. We had a lovely stay. Not too far from Ueno or Inaricho station. Quiet spot. Food options in Asakusa and Ueno. Excellent value.
hotelName:
4    MIMARU TOKYO UENO INARICHO
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We just stayed at the Mimaru Ueno Inaricho location. This is a great location and a wonderful hotel. Initially, I wanted to stay at the Grand Park Tokyo but my husband wanted to be in this location. We have two children and it was a great atmosphere for them. The room was big, clean and the hotel near everything and everywhere. The rooms even have somewhat of a balcony, which is nice to get fresh air. Really, I can't say enough about the staff (very kind), the location (close to so much) and the accommodations (great!). Add to all of this, the hotel provides you with a phone you can carry around with you and you sightsee so you an plan activities and Google map everything so you don't get lost. If we come back to Tokyo, we're staying here!!! Thank you so much to the staff for being kind to us (and holding our luggage as we toured the city on our final day). PS. I loved the beds. They were so comfortable!
hotelName:
4    MIMARU TOKYO UENO INARICHO
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Glad that Mimaru provides, pans, knife, chopping board, ladles, special for Muslims so that we can cook our food worry free.Prayer mat and Qiblat compass are also provided. We took the room for 4 (futon beds).. It’s huge! Very clean room, clean toilet, friendly workers. Recommend for everyone. Please take Inaricho Station for a short walk to hotel, about 200 metres. Ueno Station is about 800 metres walk to the hotel.
hotelName:
4    MIMARU TOKYO UENO INARICHO
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wonderful apartment hotel. Perfect room, kitchen and bathroom. Receptionist was very kind, he always gave me very clear guide and very useful information. This is the best apartment hotel for family in Tokyo. I’ll always stay here when I come back Tokyo. Thanks everything.
hotelName:
4    MIMARU TOKYO UENO INARICHO
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location was in the middle between Ueno and Asakusa, so both were accessible by foot.Staff were friendly and really helpful. Left my phone there and they forwarded it onto the next hotel I was staying at.This aparthotel is great for families, room was spotless/clean, amenities are good, kitchenette was awesome, just bring your own shower cap and facial tissues.
hotelName:
4    MIMARU TOKYO UENO INARICHO
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 我們真的很開心能住在這麼棒的飯店裡面，服務人員的服務真的很棒，尤其是中國的女服務人員，真的很謝謝您的幫助，下次我們還會再來。謝謝櫃檯人員、房務人員讓我們住在一個這麼舒適的環境裡。We are really happy to live in such a great hotel. The service of the service staff is really good, especially the Chinese female service staff. I really appreciate your help. We will come back next time. Thanks to the counter staff and the room staff for letting us live in such a comfortable environment.
hotelName:
4    MIMARU TOKYO UENO INARICHO
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent customer service.All the staff so caring and helpful.Great location.Value of Money.Very Clean.Provided all what i need during my stay.Definitely will recommend my friend and visit here again
hotelName:
4    MIMARU TOKYO UENO INARICHO
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: - The room is clean and spacious; can comfortably accommodate 4pax in the room- Well equipped with the required amenities- Good design with the bathroom, toilet and washing basin separate so that we can use them simultaneously- Friendly and helpful front desk, especially Kyran who replied to my enquiries promptly- The hotel also helps me to receive the parcels for my order at amazon jp- about 8-10mins walk to Ueno JR
hotelName:
4    MIMARU TOKYO UENO INARICHO
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great apartment hotel with great location and friendly service. The hotel is located with walking distance to station and supermarket. Very suitable for family as they provide kitchenware and special rentals. We rented an oven and stone BBQ for our room and brought some wagyu beef from the supermarket and enjoyed nice dinner in the room. The night staff member Kyran provided great service and treated us like friends. I will recommend this hotel and we will definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
4    MIMARU TOKYO UENO INARICHO
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel in good location for a family of 4Rooms were very clean and good size for Tokyo Easy walking distance to ueno station.Great value for money Front desk / reception staff all spoke English and were very happy to help.
hotelName:
4    MIMARU TOKYO UENO INARICHO
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent accommodation - extremely well appointed with a beautiful bathroom. Well laid out mini kitchen and dining area. Very clean and well maintained rooms, would stay again and happy to recommend.Very lovely and helpful staff. Close to public transport.
hotelName:
4    MIMARU TOKYO UENO INARICHO
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After a bad stay in Hong Kong, coming in here was like a breath of fresh air.Beautiful, clean and conveniently laid out rooms with everything you need for an extended stay. Shower and bath were excellent as well as the amenities they provided. I loved the washer and driver which we used a few times. Right around the corner was a good sized grocery store where we bought items for breakfast and enjoyed having it o the spacious tables. The cellphone was also a nice touch.Girls loved the extra room and couldn't stop talking about how nice the room was.The hotel is quite close to the JR Ueno station and Metro Hibiya station. It is a bit further walk to the Keisei Skyliner. The only thing was not being familiar with Ueno it took us some time to find the hotel. But once we figured out where we were it wasn't a problem after that.Love the hotel, the staff and would definitely recommend to anyone especially families.
hotelName:
4    MIMARU TOKYO UENO INARICHO
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Mimaru Tokyo Uneo Inaricho was excellent! The staff were friendly and went out of their way to help us. The room was very clean and totally equipped with everything we needed plus more. There was plenty of space for our family of 4 in the one room. Location easy to find with a medium walk to Ueno Station.
hotelName:
4    MIMARU TOKYO UENO INARICHO
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent apartment hotel to stay in Tokyo.Very conveniently located in Ueno with easy access to Tokyo Metro (subway) and JR.The hotel is very new with quality furnitures and equipments. Staff members are very friendly and helpful. Very glad for this choice.
hotelName:
4    MIMARU TOKYO UENO INARICHO
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed there during our year end vacation and it was a good experience. The staff was helpful and communicative. The apartment hotel was operating in an efficient way. What could be better is to include some optional equipments like bread toaster to the standard kitchen equipment.
hotelName:
4    MIMARU TOKYO UENO INARICHO
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have been to Tokyo the 3rd time and Mimaru Tokyo Ueno Inaricho is probably the best i have experienced so far in tokyo. The room is big enough to accomodate my family of 5 (2 adults 3 childrens). The staffs are attentive, speak good english, and always helpful. The best thing is their room is clean, the mattress and pillow are extremely comfortable that make me have a good rest during my stay. Inaricho station is just approx 3 mins walk whereas Ueno Station is just approx 5 to 6 mins walk.
hotelName:
4    MIMARU TOKYO UENO INARICHO
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located 5 minutes from Ueno Station so easy to get to and only a hop skip and jump away from the buzzing Asukusa shopping district and the eclectic Ueno Park.Based on advice from the friendly staff we spent yesterday at Ueno enjoying the beautiful gardens, temples, street performances, and reknowned Ueno zoo before heading back to the Hotel for a much needed rest (one of the benefits to having accomodation in such a good location) before heading out to Asukusa for market shopping, dinner, drinks and some karaoke :).Looking forward to seeing the various new years eve light shows throughout tokyo and the new years countdown at rappongi.Staff helping and sharing their recommendations in English was a great bonus to a great holiday in Japan.
hotelName:
4    MIMARU TOKYO UENO INARICHO
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in family Apartment for three nights (24-27 Dec 2018). Room was just like the pictures that was great with lots of facility like smartphone that you can bring it with you , kitchen , bathtub etc.  Staff spoke English and was very friendly!Location was good. Near to Ueno station about 6-8 minutes or Inraicho about 5 minutes with mary convenience store.
hotelName:
4    MIMARU TOKYO UENO INARICHO
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for five nights in Japanese deluxe room, which is large by Tokyo standards. For a family of four, it worked well. The small kitchen, fridge and cupboard spaces all made it easy. Hotel is new, so everything was in great working order. Staff were friendly and helpful. We loved the small little restaurant on side street (has two large red lanterns). Walking distance supermarket was convenient. Ueno was a good base to explore the city with good transport access. We would stay at Mi aru again on next visit to Tokyo.
hotelName:
4    MIMARU TOKYO UENO INARICHO
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean and comfort, near Ueno station. Train to downtown and narita airport very convenient. We just walk for 6 mins between hotel and station. Beside station is Aymeyoko Market, Selling cheap stuffs. ........................
hotelName:
4    MIMARU TOKYO UENO INARICHO
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object
