review_body: Location is near to train station and convenient to access other destinations . Room is comfortable unless the toilet is a little bit small but all staff are nice. Is a good experience to stay mimaru hotel.
hotelName:
4    MIMARU TOKYO UENO INARICHO
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Bed is super comfy... really enjoy staying with Mimaru Inaricho, a bit walk (700M) from Ueno station or taking GInza line to Inaricho and walk 230M to hotel. Staff is very helpful. Room is big enough for small group of 4 ppl.
hotelName:
4    MIMARU TOKYO UENO INARICHO
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel's environment is comfortable and clean. it is generally near Asakusa (by train) and Ameyoko, which is wonderful for shopping. I think it is a great place to stay if you intend to visit places near Ueno.Will also like to commend on one of the staff, Sai, for his patience during our stay. He is fluent in English and was able to go the extra mile to help us with our baggage issues. Thanks!
hotelName:
4    MIMARU TOKYO UENO INARICHO
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was a great first impression. All the staff very hospitable. Definitely love the convenient huge suite,loved that the room had a futon,microwave and complete kitchen stuff! Next time will stay here again
hotelName:
4    MIMARU TOKYO UENO INARICHO
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 6 nights and was really impressed with the cleanliness and how spacious the studio unit was. We were very comfortable as a family of 4 (2 grown teenagers). Reception staff very friendly and helpful, in particular the young gentleman originally from Nepal. Absolutely would return on future trips.
hotelName:
4    MIMARU TOKYO UENO INARICHO
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spacious room for family of four. Teens love it. Friendly and helpful staff. Convenient location as it's near 2 train stations. There are lots of food if you spend time exploring the area. Enjoy shopping at Ameyoko Market which is a walking distance from the hotel.
hotelName:
4    MIMARU TOKYO UENO INARICHO
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was nice, clean, spacious for 4 people, and it feels like home. The kitchen appliances are complete for you to cook in the room. The staff were nice, helpful, friendly and speak english fluently. It’s recommended for moslem traveller too, they prepared the prayer mat. I will be coming back here.
hotelName:
4    MIMARU TOKYO UENO INARICHO
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Its my last night at the hotel. Located about 3 minutes walk fr the Inaricho station and around 15 min walk fr Ueno station. Took the skyliner from Narita airport and walked to the hotel. Nice and friendly staff and they can speak English well. Room is very big for Tokyo standard and price reasonable. Have all amenities you need, stove, pots, pans, bathtub even humidifier. They even have smartphones with free mobile internet where you can bring with you when you explore Tokyo. There is also paid laundry, 300yen for wash and 100yen per 30min for dryer. Will definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
4    MIMARU TOKYO UENO INARICHO
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I’m not someone who will spend time writing comments and/or reviews most of the time but the reason of doing so is I’m really impressed by the employees dedication and passionate work ethic towards the hotel and their guests’. Especially the concierge staff, they’re friendly and caring to utmost on whatever your needs are. The employee that etched a deep positive impression in me and my family is Mr Kyran. We need more people like this in the society. In terms of the comfort level of the hotel is also rated as excellent. It feels like home. Returning to Mimaru after a long day walk is just something to look forward to.Highly recommended hotel to stay ! ❤️
hotelName:
4    MIMARU TOKYO UENO INARICHO
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: located in very good location. Spacious room and good amenities. You have your own kitchen, you can borrow Tepanyaki for grill or rice cooker from reception for free. Convenient store just 5 mins. Hotel located near to Inaricho Metro Station 5 min by walk and 10-15 min to Ueno Staion and Ameyoko market. Good staffs and service. You can go to Asakusa just only 2 station and Harajuku by 25 mins ride on Metro Ginza line.I stay here for 4 nights with 3 adault and 1 infant and use Tokyo Metro for travel around. Recommend for family and friend trip. Keisei Ueno Station just 10-15 mins by walk here you can Skyliner train for/from to Ueno Narita Int Airport about 45 mins.Note: Hotel provides normal daily cleaning service only for cleaning floor, changing towel and collect trash but They will change you bed sheet on your 3rd night stay.
hotelName:
4    MIMARU TOKYO UENO INARICHO
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My family enjoyed our stay for 5days. Very convenient since it is just a walking distance from the train stations Euno and Hibiya Lines, very accesible and easy to visit some attractions and restaurants. Our room was clean with small kitchen and sofa beds. The staffs were accomdating and friendly, keep it up guys! Thanks!
hotelName:
4    MIMARU TOKYO UENO INARICHO
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: this is basic Dormy Inn--clean, small rooms, nothing fancy, decent location half way between Shibuyu and Harajuku stations, close to Cat and Otamosendo Street. More like a college dorm than a fancy hotel, but if you're just looking for a good night sleep and no concierge, this will do fine. Plus, on the floor with the spa there is a free choice of pillow types. First I've seen of this great idea. No longer can anyone complain the pillow was too this or that, although a word from the otherwise efficient staff about this feature might be useful. I gave three stars not that there was anything wrong with the hotel; it excels at its niche. It's just like a five star with concierge, English fluency, swimming pool, real onset with natural mineral water, etc. Half the rooms face the train tracks, which I suspect can be noisy although I was on the other side so I'm not sure. Only negative is that spa area smelled like mold or dirty socks or something mildly unpleasant. Might have been transitory; might have been why they put a dozen or more whole oranges in the hot bath.
hotelName:
5    Dormy inn Premium Shibuya Jingumae
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As others have said, great location, and good breakfast. Rooms are small but super clean. The spa was a great bonus, I used this instead of my room shower. Wifi was strong. The staff were helpful throughout my stay.
hotelName:
5    Dormy inn Premium Shibuya Jingumae
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for two nights in a Hollywood Twin room. We chose the hotel on location and it was great for access to rail and metro. The space was not as tight as other twin rooms in Japan and we appreciated the phone charger adapter provided. Definitely nice and clean with storage niches, slippers, and bath robes for the spa. But there was only one towel rail :-(Our biggest problem was the sensor light in the lobby area designed to light your way to the bathroom at night. It shows through a slit in the door and comes on and off all night with the slightest movement. Take some blue tac and a couple of sheets of paper to block it out! The sound insulation from the adjacent rail way was very effective.
hotelName:
5    Dormy inn Premium Shibuya Jingumae
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location. My family had two rooms - one was very small and was a special rate. The non-special rate room was more spacious. We loved the location and evening ramen. Free shuttle to JR station was also handy when we departed with luggage. Helpful staff.
hotelName:
5    Dormy inn Premium Shibuya Jingumae
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is close to the subway, nice and clean, and the rooms are okay in size.The breakfast is good, but take care, if you sleep too long you will miss it. They offer a spa and free ramen soup in the evenings.
hotelName:
5    Dormy inn Premium Shibuya Jingumae
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We wanted to find a hotel near Shibuya and Harajuku / Omotesando or our second trip to Japan. It is central, friendly / helpful staff and cheap. We used the hotel as a pit stop in between shopping, sight seeing and meals. Hence, the five score rating (it is all relative based on expectations).If you want luxury this is not the place to go. If you want flexibility, clean and value for money this is a suitable location.
hotelName:
5    Dormy inn Premium Shibuya Jingumae
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My son and I stayed there for a few days visit to Tokyo and we loved it. True, the rooms are small but we expected it. Still, the nightly soba noodles, the onsen, the massage, the great breakfast, the excellent location and the great staff all contributed to us wanting to go back any time. I’d love to find out where I can buy the cozy lounge clothes they offered in the rooms.
hotelName:
5    Dormy inn Premium Shibuya Jingumae
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location is nearer to Harajuku, it is better to just alight at Harajuku to avoid confusion for first-time travelers traveling to Shibuya. if you alighted to Shibuya can take the Hachiko exit.The hotel room itself is quite small, there will be no room for your big luggage, the shower room is standard (No bathtub, as there is onsen in level 2). I will recommend not to order their breakfast as menu never change and you will eat the same thing every day (Apart from one pasta dishes that will be changed every day).There are a lot of vending machines which is good. You can also rent an extra pillow, which I'm not quite sure how it works and it looks dirty as anyone can grab the pillow and return it in the communal area. Washing machine is in the common room, which is good if you wan to wash your clothes.
hotelName:
5    Dormy inn Premium Shibuya Jingumae
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This room is so small where we could barely open our luggages or even walk, but this is expected, as with most affordable Japanese hotels. The room was very clean which I very much appreciated!! Only complaint is that you have to pay to watch television.... Not sure if this is the norm here but it seemed weird to charge for this.Location is about 15-20 minutes walk away from Shibuya. A little tough if you are carrying a lot of luggages from the train station to the hotel.Anyway, I loved that this hotel has an onsen!! There were oranges floating in it perhaps to keep it smelling nice and fresh.
hotelName:
5    Dormy inn Premium Shibuya Jingumae
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Overall had a good experience. I went with my wife and 9 year old and initially had the double room, which supposedly slept 2 adults and a child under 11. First the caveat - we're not big people (I'm 5'8) and have stayed in plenty of small hotel rooms through the world but this was the smallest by far. It was about 15 sq m and had literally zero room to move around (the bed occupies 3/4 of the room space). We were able to upgrade to a "triple" (3 single beds) on the 6th floor and that was much more spacious at 32 sq m, you could actually walk around and the bathroom shower was more standard western sized. It was about 6000Y more per night but definitely worth it because the hotel itself is relatively inexpensive.That initial room size shock aside, the hotel was great. Very clean, the front desk and overall service was excellent, the staff goes out of their way to help and they spoke English (if that's important to you). The location is actually pretty sweet, right between Shibuya and Harajuku, for shopping and eating excursions. It's about a 10-12 minute walk to either the Shibuya or Harajuku station lines. I suggest departing from Shibuya as the walk to Harajuku is more uphill (but come back from Harajuku). The hotel does have a shuttle to Shibuya station on mornings only every half-hour, but you have to reserve a spot.The wifi on both the 4th and 6th floors was great; contrary to a few other reviews, we really didn't hear the train at all, though we ran the A/C unit on auto mode non-stop. Each room has a mini-fridge and the hotel gives you 2-3 free water bottles daily. They have free soba ramen noodles every night from 9:30-11pm and an onsen spa on the 2nd floor (we didn't have time to partake but open men, women, children - read up on etiquitte!).Overall, I think the value was incredibly good. We've typically stayed at the Cerulean Tower or Westin Tokyo; I realize those are higher class but much more pricey. Honestly, if I were just sightseeing and spending a lot time walking Shibuya/Harajuki most of the day (i.e. not just hanging in hotel), I'd go for this hotel - save some $$ and spend it on great food or fashionable clothing!
hotelName:
5    Dormy inn Premium Shibuya Jingumae
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I loved my little room, it was compact and so efficient and very very clean. The bed was so comfortable. Comfy loungewear was provided for the guest.The front desk are very polite and nice, they allowed me to check in early, as well as assisted me when I had a problem with my return flight.The washer and dryer are a great amenity! Breakfast was delicious and always well presented.The hotel is in a fantastic location between Harajuku and Shibuya; it was in a quiet spot. Lots of great food and shopping close by.
hotelName:
5    Dormy inn Premium Shibuya Jingumae
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Noise from the train.. internet not working at the level 6 room 607.. smeling pillows.. tiny room.. and finally problems with the room light.. not Tokyo standard. I would say the location and the price does not worth the problems
hotelName:
5    Dormy inn Premium Shibuya Jingumae
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was there 2-years ago and glad to see the quality of the hotel is exactly the same as before. Small room but it is normal in Tokyo. It is super clean.. 10-min interesting walk to Shibuya.. Coin laundry on premise.. Definitely will go back again.
hotelName:
5    Dormy inn Premium Shibuya Jingumae
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Brilliant location with some interesting add ons, laundry and spa.. But the room whilst fully functional and clean but is too tiny for comfort. Breakfast, despite having several chefs in attendance is unremarkable and frankly just not worth it.Staff young, enthusiastic and helpful.
hotelName:
5    Dormy inn Premium Shibuya Jingumae
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Small room .. with the window opening to graveyard .. though it is not patently unusual in Japan as I heard. Great location in Shibuya. Nice public baths separate for man and woman. Laundry room available.They told us upfront that they will not be able to accommodate our gluten allergy which was disappointing and dismissive
hotelName:
5    Dormy inn Premium Shibuya Jingumae
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I enjoyed the breakfast and public bath. I never tried the evening noodles-too exhausted from my work schedule and I just wanted to soak my weary bones in the hot spring bath. The staff was very helpful. It's got a shuttle to Shibuya station in the morning but not from Shibuya to the hotel nor any shuttle in the afternoon. However, it's not too expensive by taxi especially if your luggage is heavy.
hotelName:
5    Dormy inn Premium Shibuya Jingumae
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My single room was small but very clean and of a high standard. Everything I needed in a compact space.The highlight was the Onsen, hot pool, sauna, cold plunge pool and showers. The breakfast was OK, buffet style, not always hot but a good selection Japanese and European. The only annoying thing was that music in the Onsen was stuck on one track and the staff claimed they could do nothing about it. After a week we wanted to attack the sound system with an axe.
hotelName:
5    Dormy inn Premium Shibuya Jingumae
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is my second time staying at the hotel.The hotel is located within a 10 minute walk to Shibuya station which is a main hub of many of Tokyo's subway lines and will get you to most of the main attractions.The hotel is clean and well kept with a friendly multilingual staff.Breakfast is available and is available in Japanese or English style buffets.Room amenities include: TV, free WiFi, Tea/Coffee and toiletries.
hotelName:
5    Dormy inn Premium Shibuya Jingumae
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I really liked this hotel. I usually change rooms often but funnily enough I didn’t this time & in hindsight I should’ve. Our room faced the train track so it was noisy. There is also a logistics company which is based pretty much opposite the entrance of the hotel. They start operating at 6:00am and it gets very noisy by the trucks coming & going as well as the goods being put on and off them. Having said the above, I highly recommend this hotel but.... insist on a quiet room & if there are 2 of you, stay in the twin room and push the beds together. The rooms are tiny but comfortable. The location is superb & the train station is literally around the corner. The little extra things the hotel offers goes a long way ie. The hot spring, the consistent tea & coffee, the selection of pillows, the friendly staff.
hotelName:
5    Dormy inn Premium Shibuya Jingumae
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I recently stayed here from March 22-26th b/c I was in town to support the MAN/WOMAN tradeshow during the tail end of Amazon Fashion Week and man, I loved it here. It was centrally located to Shibuya and Harajuku (which was perfect for me to check out all the great shops and brands and to be so close to Yamanote line, which connects you everywhere in Tokyo!)I loved the breakfast, I loved the free ramen noodles at night and I loved the comfy robes to wear around the premises to maintain a nice, comfortable atmosphere after leaving the hustle bustle of the city right outside. I would highly recommend these rooms b/c they were affordable and enough for a single traveller like myself. The rooms were not big, but that is to be understood, since you are in Tokyo. But everything was clean and comfortable which are way more important factors for booking a room. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone trying to be close to Shibuya and on a budget.
hotelName:
5    Dormy inn Premium Shibuya Jingumae
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Dormy is tucked away in a little alley in Shibuya. It's a fantastic location, quiet, and within walking distance to the metro and JR. The hot spring and breakfast make this place a winner in my book. I would totally stay here again.
hotelName:
5    Dormy inn Premium Shibuya Jingumae
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean place with small rooms, robotic toilets, and big decent breakfasts. Also, hangover curing onsen. Perfect for the solo traveller and in a central location. A group of friends stayed here and we had s great time. This is a value hotel that is of very good quality. I highly recommend this place.
hotelName:
5    Dormy inn Premium Shibuya Jingumae
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here with my family of 7. It’s Sakura season so the hotel was fully booked. The staff was helpful to all our questions on where to go and best enjoy the Cherry Blossoms.Hotel is not located on the Main Street but it is just at the back of Abahouse which is on the main street Jingumae. Nearest station you can use is harajuku or Shibuya exit 13a. Hotel is 900m to Shibuya, Harajuku and Ometesando is about 600m. Room is compact, good for 2 persons with 2 small luggages. We have 2 large luggages so it was quite a challenge.We love the Dormy Inn hospitality of free onsen and ramen at 9:30 pm.. makes you feel at home from all day walking and a hot ramen is waiting for you.
hotelName:
5    Dormy inn Premium Shibuya Jingumae
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect hotel! HUGE room for Japanese standards (3x bigger than our previous and more expensive one in Shinjuku), sauna + spa for both sexes, complimentary ramen from 9:30-11:30PM, great toiletries, and in walking distance to so many shops and restaurants, Yoyogi Park, etc. I will totally recommend this hotel for any friends/family that come to Tokyo!
hotelName:
5    Dormy inn Premium Shibuya Jingumae
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room size is good among Japanese hotels. It is not like the rooms of those compact hotels. The tub is full-sized. The room is clean and the onsen is good.Its closest JR station is Harajuku JR station. The walk takes about ten minutes. During the winter, you may want to avoid walking outside. Then you could walk from Harajuku JR station into Exit no. 2 of Meiji-jingumae <Harajuku> Station 明治神宮前〈原宿〉駅, and then walk out of Meiji-jingumae through Exit no. 7. Is this way, most of the walk will be underground.
hotelName:
5    Dormy inn Premium Shibuya Jingumae
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My 2nd stay at the Dormy Inn, this time for 7 nights for business trip, again I was very happy with all aspects of the hotel! Breakfast is great with plenty of choice, complimentary shuttle to Shibuya station is a very good service. Onsen is outstanding and the staff are extremely courteous and efficient! Very comfortable bed, and very quiet room, I could see the railway line from my room, but was never disturbed by any noise.Will definitely stay here during my next visit to Tokyo!
hotelName:
5    Dormy inn Premium Shibuya Jingumae
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Poor customer service, boring breakfast with the same menu everyday. We are a family of 3 with 1 infant with us and reach hotel at 9am and was hoping to get a room earlier which we did indicate in our booking request as well. The staff had first informed that no room is available and we have to wait until 1pm earliest to get the room. therefore as it was raining heavily outside, we have stayed at the lobby to wait. Throughout, we were not even offered a drink. At 1215, the staff approach us and say the room is now available! We were so grateful but when we proceed to the counter for check-in, they made us pay for the early check-in. What a service is this? I was thinking should I wait till 1pm to get the room without a top up! My girl is so tired and I have no choice to pay unwillingly for the early check-in. Dormy Inn! Please Do NOT do this to your customers especially with infants, they will NV return!
hotelName:
5    Dormy inn Premium Shibuya Jingumae
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rooms are sooooo tiny, but we’re from Canada & all we have is space. Great hospitality (the cutest lounge outfits to wear around the hotel).We really enjoyed the breakfast & all its variety. Loved the proximity to Harajuku. Would recommend to friends!
hotelName:
5    Dormy inn Premium Shibuya Jingumae
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for a couple of nights. We arrived by train and lugged our cases for quite a few blocks to get there - it isn't the easiest place to find!The staff are very helpful, particularly at the desk - nothing is too much trouble for them.The room is typically small, a little more so than others in Tokyo but the facilities are good. Effective a/c, cable tv, wifi all good.Being some distance from the subway was a pain - but local shopping and dining was excellent!The best coffee in Tokyo was just around the corner (Abahouse) - after extensive research.The hotel is in the backstreet with a variety of delivery companies etc in front of it so there are always vans, drivers etc bustling around.They do offer a shuttle bus service to the railway but only in the morning. Apparently nobody who stays at this hotel flies after 12 noon. Our flight was in the evening so we lugged our suitcases past the idle shuttle bus to the not so near station. I found this pretty bizarre if I'm honest - hardly a customer focused system - just convenient for the hotel.So it's a mixed bag I'm afraid - lovely people in a nice hotel in a secondary location and selective transport arrangements.
hotelName:
5    Dormy inn Premium Shibuya Jingumae
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here 2 years ago on my first ever solo trip. It quickly became my favorite place to stay and I often compare other hotels I stay at to this one. I'm always very relaxed and happy here, and I think they've actually gotten better since my last stay.The rooms are small, but actually, after traveling all over Japan, I find these are the biggest rooms I've stayed in on my trip.I loved the breakfast last time I was here, and they've added a lot to the food selection since. There was fresh fruit every morning (which surprised me because fruit is so expensive in Japan), Western and Japanese style breakfast, cereal/milk/yogurt bar, and drink bar. They have a machine with different types of tea, a peach smoothie and tomato smoothie machine, and coffee. The mini waffles and french toast are my favorite, though I think they taste better if you go earlier in the morning.There is also free noodles at night after 9:30PM though I've yet to try it. It seems moderately popular as I see people slurping noodles in their hotel pajamas at night sometimes. It's nice though, if you want a late dinner and nothing is open.I personally love the ambience of the rooms. They have cool sliding doors and everything is in a dark wood veneer tone. It feels more modern than most hotels and makes you feel relaxed after a day of exploring. There is also a spa on the second floor, gender separated. There is a code that changes every day for the women's spa that you must obtain at reception. The spa is great for achy muscles; there is a hot bath and cold bath, and even a sauna. I regretfully didn't make use of it last time, but I enjoyed relaxing in the bath. The laundry is also in the same room. Kirkland detergent is provided and you can get a key to lock the machine if you like.I found sometimes the halls can be noisy depending on the guests who stay. I didn't have this experience the last stay, but at some point, I would always hear kids or people talking/screaming loudly in the hall in Korean. I stayed in the Dormy Inn in Sapporo and also had this experience with Korean guests. They seem to stay in separate rooms and would knock loudly (continuously) on the doors at night. But I guess it's not the hotel's fault. Maybe travel during a season with less Korean tourists.There seem to be more English speaking staff available this time, though I mostly communicated in broken Japanese. They were very nice when I checked in. I left my baggage with them as it was early, and when I came back later in the evening, they had already sent it to my room.The hotel is a bit tricky to find. If you can, I recommend getting off at Harajuku Station with your luggage rather than Shibuya Station. The path has less obstacles and weird bumps in the ground. It is located in an alleyway off Meiji Dori. There's a Chinese restaurant called Bamiyan lit in pink across the street from the alley. It's a hard sign to miss, so when you see it, turn into the alley in front of you. It will be on your right from Harajuku, if coming from Shibuya, it'll be the left. They offer free shuttle service to Shibuya Station for guests checking out. But it only goes until about 12PM and you have to book in advance. I hope to come back soon! I miss it already.
hotelName:
5    Dormy inn Premium Shibuya Jingumae
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 2 nights at the beginning of our trip and the last night before flying back to the States. We loved this hotel and especially enjoyed the late night Ramen which was perfect for our jet lag hunger and the breakfast. We didn't have the breakfast for the first 2 nights of our trip and we we're so envious of the spread when we woke up super early and desperate for food. Not many places in the area were open for breakfast (something we learned about Japan in general), but we did find good eats in nearby Harajuku at the Yoshinoya(sp?). It's the Japanese version of fast food and I believe its 24hours but it's fantastic! Super fresh and high quality. I had the beef and Salmon and it was my first traditional Japanese breakfast which I loved. Long story short, opt for the breakfast at Dormy but if you don't you have options at Harajuku.
hotelName:
5    Dormy inn Premium Shibuya Jingumae
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 3 nights.Look, its probably not as bad as average rating but its not very good.Rooms very small (not that this is weird).Has wifi and breakfast. Weird pillow set up were you go and select your pillow. Has bikes to use which is good.Location, this would rank very good. Great location.Staff were polite just not overly helpful You do become accustom to awesome Japanese manners and assistance.This place is a chain. We will not go ut of our way to stay again but would stay again.
hotelName:
5    Dormy inn Premium Shibuya Jingumae
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Hot Spring Dormy Inn Premium Shibuya Jingumae is such a long name. That's the first thing I remember thinking. Besides the free ramen at night (tastes fine for being free), I think it's main strong points are location and friendly staff. Price... not so much. I'd give this 3.5 stars if I could. The location is pretty good, as Harajuku and Omote-sando are interesting and convenient neighborhoods, and you can do a longer walk to Shibuya... but if you're traveling via metro and walking, be aware that getting here from Meiji-jingu Mae station is a lot faster than Harajuku station... if you're walking from the latter, you have to do a U-turn/fishhook shaped turn to get the hotel (you're on the right path if you pass a Starbucks on your right, just before you turn left for the U-turn). You can't take what seems like the shortest route from the map, due to wire fences blocking the way. It's hard to tell from the map, so be forewarned.. once you get close though, finding it on the side street is pretty easy.Checking in was easy, as every worker in the hotel seemed friendly. I could tell they are accustomed to serving foreign customers. I quickly got to my room. It was about the normal size for a Tokyo hotel; the bed was not large, but comfortable enough. AC worked well, as did the free wifi. The TV is only medium sized, but I believe there was an English language channel or 2. A small fridge was handy for the summer. The bathroom is your usual fairly cramped affair, with just enough sink space. The shower was not a bathtub, but a stand-up type... not my favorite, as the ones in Japan tend to feel wanting for space. Everything seemed clean though, and overall I had no issues with housekeeping. I never really had a problem with outside noise. On my last day, checking out was pretty easy. The hotel also has other amenities, like the bath, which I didn't get to check out due to time constraints. The biggest weak point is the price - for what you pay, it feels like it should be a little nicer hotel. I agree with others who said the price is a bit too high for what you get, even with the amenities. Overall it's a decent establishment though, comfortable enough for a few days. I could picture returning sometime.
hotelName:
5    Dormy inn Premium Shibuya Jingumae
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is conveniently situated between Harajuku and Shibuya which we wanted access to on our first night in Tokyo. Room is small, beds are super comfortable! Although our room faced the train side of the hotel, I thought the noise level was fine. My niece who is vegetarian thought the buffet breakfast had a nice selection. Overall pleased with our choice!
hotelName:
5    Dormy inn Premium Shibuya Jingumae
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Pros- -Nice bathroom amenities -Alarm clock-Free wifi-Free breakfast which was good. Cons- -Rate is too much for what you get. -Area is in front of hotel is a dump, with garbage everywhere and a loading dock for trucks. - room is very small - concierge was rude and was put out when we asked for help with making a phone call for the airport limousine bus. I mean really rude. I hadn't encountered ANY rude people in my 10 days there because Japanese people are the kindest of them all. But she was not nice.
hotelName:
5    Dormy inn Premium Shibuya Jingumae
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Okay...maybe the hotel breakfast isn't why you stay somewhere, but this thing was amazing. Half Japanese and half Western, the chef who puts this out clearly takes great pride because this would easily be a $30 breakfast buffet back in NY!Now for the hotel, the rooms were nice but small, but similar to other typical Japanese hotels. Location was fine on a side street...probably a 10-15 minute walk to the center of Shibuya. Would be okay staying here again, great from a value perspective.
hotelName:
5    Dormy inn Premium Shibuya Jingumae
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I am in love with Dormy Inn chain. Stayed with this chain in several locations. It is a bit far from Harajuku and Shibuya, honestly. You need to walk quite a while.Room is good and clean.They have public bath which is quite small but help ease the pain from walking.
hotelName:
5    Dormy inn Premium Shibuya Jingumae
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 1 night during a couple of weeks travelling around Japan. Facilities are Top notch and the staff are super helpful. FOOD - Definitely worth opting for the breakfast as there is something for everyone, the breakfast are is split into 'Japanese' and 'Western' cuisine and has a great selection - the coffee there is great too! The hotel do offer free Ramen noodles in the evening too, but unfortunately we had plans and missed out. LOCATION - pretty much equidistant from Harajuku and Shibuya. The hotel doesn't look like anything special from the exterior but I side is pretty good. FACILITIES - Hotel comes with Spa/Laundry Machines/free ramen in the evening. They also offer a free shuttle bus to Shibuya station in the mornings. Would definitely recommend.
hotelName:
5    Dormy inn Premium Shibuya Jingumae
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: That was a good surprise. Hotels in Tokyo can be tricky ... But this one is nice. Hotel rooms are small, compared to hotels from other cities in the world, but hey ! you are in Tokyo ! Rooms are small but functional, and nice and clean. I asked for a room in the upper levels ? I got a room as such. The personel is friendly and very efficient. The hotel offers a good breakfast, big enough to get some energy until lunch, and at night, offers some very good ramen in the lobby. Quite convenient when you arrive late from abroad, or if you are too lazy to get out.Wifi is fast and stable. And free.The hotel is conveniently located, very close to Shibuya and its crazyness. But also very close to the Yogi Park, which is a must see.To sum up, a very good hotel, offering a good quality/price rate.
hotelName:
5    Dormy inn Premium Shibuya Jingumae
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is in a very convenient location right between Shibuya and Harajuku stations. Both stations are walkable, however if traveling on the JR Yamanote Line, Harajuku station is a better option as it is a much smaller station and easier to navigate. The area has tonnes of shopping and great restaurants all within walking distance as well as the famous Shibuya crossing! The staff was extremely helpful and very pleasant. Breakfast had many great options, both Japanese and Western, Hot and Cold. I found the rooms to be very cozy and had enough space for myself. I was in a single room and it was both very clean and quiet.Overall this was a perfect location for my first stay in Tokyo and I would not hesitate to stay here again or recommend to others.
hotelName:
5    Dormy inn Premium Shibuya Jingumae
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It's a good basic hotel within walking distance in between Shibuya and Harajuku. It's affordable and with everything basic that you need from a hotel. It's tiny small but expected from hotels in Tokyo. Plus point are it's sumptuous breakfast buffet spread, onsen public bath, and also night time free ramen!
hotelName:
5    Dormy inn Premium Shibuya Jingumae
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a fairly new hotel located about a 10-minute walk from the Shibuya train station. The room was the smallest we encountered in Japan, but it was clean and functional, and we made it work. The hotel staff were reasonably helpful, but for some reason they were very aggressive about collecting breakfast tickets. And, unfortunately, there is only limited seating in the breakfast area, which meant that many guests had to eat in the rather dull conference room adjoining the breakfast area. The food itself, however, was good. For me, one of the best points about this hotel is the onsen, which is a great place to relax for a few minutes at the end of a day of sightseeing.
hotelName:
5    Dormy inn Premium Shibuya Jingumae
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is hard to beat: you are smack in Shibujia and the free shuttle bus takes you in two minutes to the gigantic intersection you heard about (it's a roughly ten-minute walk along a high-end shopping street). The free dinner (!) is nice, too as is the massage service offered (not free) and the fast wifi. The rooms are small but well-equipped with soft beds. There is no view as nearly all windows are glazed over with a non-transparent coating. The rooms are completely quiet even though there is a train line next to it.
hotelName:
5    Dormy inn Premium Shibuya Jingumae
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is recently renovated and within walking distance to Harajuku and Shibuya.You can either walk, hop a train, or ent one of their bicycles. The rooms are typical Japan size - so small by western standards - but supremely clean, comfortable, and well equipped. The hotel has a massage area for a fee by appointment on the second floor. Also there are lovely hot spring public baths. The baths and hotel are tattoo friendly and provide cover up stickers for them. If your tattoo over large areas you won't be able to use the baths - this is a cultural nuance.Breakfast has amazing selection and is worth the minimal extra charge when booking.
hotelName:
5    Dormy inn Premium Shibuya Jingumae
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for a week while visiting Tokyo. The room was small, typical of most Japanese hotel rooms. For two people it would have been a squeeze. Room was very clean and very quiet (even though the rail line was next door). The hotel is close to the metro and 2 railway stations, convenience stores, restaurants and shopping. Staff were very helpful and always polite and all day free coffee was appreciated (as well as the free noodles every night). Excellent wi-fi throughout. The only complaint is about the breakfast. Although the food was very fresh, the hot food was always practically cold. Also the fried eggs were as hard as rocks. OK for those who don't like their yolks runny. This is the 3rd time I have stayed at a Dormy Inn and each time the rooms and service and location have been fantastic. Recommend this chain ++++++
hotelName:
5    Dormy inn Premium Shibuya Jingumae
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Dormy inn has become my home away from home in Tokyo. You CANNOT beat the location. Walking distance to harajuku station, Shibuya, and everything omotesando has to offer. Dormy inn is small, clean, cozy, and has excellent service. I recommend including the breakfast. It is a great way to start your day and they have selections to suit all taste buds. This is a great affordable alternative to the overpriced luxury hotels. Best value in Tokyo!!!
hotelName:
5    Dormy inn Premium Shibuya Jingumae
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here in April 2017 for 2 nights. The hotel is located around 5-7 minutes from JR Shibuya station and around 7-10 minutes from JR Harijuku station. We arrived at around 10:30pm and check in was easy and quick. The staff we dealt with spoke English very well. We had a double room which was on par for Japanese room sizes. The room was clean and well appointed. We ate breakfast in the restaurant on level 1 both days and found it to have a good selection of Japanese and western options. Between 9:30 and 11pm nightly they offer free noodles in the restaurant on level 1. There is a convenient shuttle bus which will take you to Shibuya station in the mornings. This service finishes at 11:30 on week days and 12:00 on weekends. There is a spa on level 2 which can be used by guests. Women require a separate spa coupon. Overall it was a very comfortable stay with excellent staff and the hotel is in a great location. I would have no hesitation in staging here again.
hotelName:
5    Dormy inn Premium Shibuya Jingumae
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The little bathhouse downstairs is cute and a really nice perk. So is the "wall of pillows" along the entrance to the bathhouse, where you can choose from many different styles and firmness...each one neatly nestled in a bag with pillowcase already on it. Other useful amenities: a scale for weighing baggage in the lobby, and a branch of Yamato delivery service just across the street so if you want you can have your bags delivered to the airport instead of shlepping them around.Rooms are small...but not impossibly small. It's clean. Like all Japanese hotels they are very strict about check-in and check-out times (and check-out here is early!) Staff is helpful and my bag was waiting in my room when I returned later at night.Breakfast is OK. Would have rather paid less and not had it included.The only real problem is this place is not at all as convenient as it looks. On the map it seems perfect: catty-corner from "Cat Street", smack dab in between Shibuya and Harajuku, but really it's not that close to either. If you have a lot of luggage, forget it. The Chiyoda subway line is fairly close but JR is not. They do have a shuttle bus to Shibuya station but there's a lot of construction right now (not the hotel's fault) so it often takes longer on the bus than it would to walk. So you need to give yourself extra time and fortitude.Also, it's not a residential area at all. Finding a coffee shop or pub for a late night meeting turned out to be impossible. On the plus side, Kyushu Jangara-ramen, which is pretty good and very foreigner friendly, is nearby.
hotelName:
5    Dormy inn Premium Shibuya Jingumae
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Right between Shibuya and Harajuku stations. Staff was super helpful and amenities were A+. All inclusive breakfast buffet was also great. Family Mart is close by for those quick japanese food stop with all the snacks, sandwiches and drinks you could ask for
hotelName:
5    Dormy inn Premium Shibuya Jingumae
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just the thing after a long journey, this was perfectly relaxing - comfortable rooms, wonderful hot baths (onsen), helpful staff, and a good location, down a quiet side street but easily walkable to both Shibuya and Harajuku. There was even a free ramen noodle soup at the restaurant at the end of the evening, although we didn't get to try it - nice touch though.Do be warned that tattoos are not allowed in the shared baths, but for small ones, the staff will happily give you a waterproof plaster to cover them.
hotelName:
5    Dormy inn Premium Shibuya Jingumae
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a nice hotel located halfway between Shibuya and Harajuku. We walked to the hotel from Shibuya Station's Hachiko exit which was not a wise decision since we had large and heavy luggage. Better to take a short taxi ride instead.The rooms are small but comfortable enough. The public hot bath is also very nice and a really added bonus. We loved the breakfast which is the best we had, even better than Keio Plaza or Mitsui Millenium breakfast spreads.This hotel is highly recommended.
hotelName:
5    Dormy inn Premium Shibuya Jingumae
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is tucked away from the busy streets of Shibuya. Shibuya crossing is only about a five minute walk from the hotel, so great location! The hotel also provided a breakfast buffet of western food and Japanese breakfast. Never the less the hotel is great for a one night layover or the convenience of experiencing Tokyo for the first time.
hotelName:
5    Dormy inn Premium Shibuya Jingumae
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a quick overnight in Tokyo on our way to Bangkok. The hotel was very close to Shibuya crossing, allowing us to see a lot of downtown Tokyo in just a few hours. The hotel was very clean and modern and the staff had great customer service. Breakfast was good as well. Only a few min walk to Shibuya crossing and station.
hotelName:
5    Dormy inn Premium Shibuya Jingumae
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is good, close to main shopping area, around 10 minutes walk from Shibuya JR station and just 5 minutes walk from metro station. The room is clean and well-equipped. There are microwave and ice-machine on the 4th floor. The breakfast is very nice with choose of both Japanese and western style.
hotelName:
5    Dormy inn Premium Shibuya Jingumae
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is exactly as I expected it to be. It's an economical choice, has a great location, is safe, clean, and hospitable. Just FYI, there are two hotel sunroutes in Shinjuku. This one is closest to the Higashi-Shinjuku station.
hotelName:
2    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
6    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Situated about 20m from gate B2 at the nearby metro this unpretentious hotel is clean, surprisingly quiet and efficient. Everything one wants albeit in a tight space. Shower works well and staff helpful.
hotelName:
2    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
6    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was very clean and modern, staff very friendly. Directly underneath the hotel is is one of the subway lines and other lines are just a short walk. Many stores and restaurants are all around. Would recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
2    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
6    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked a room with two separate beds , which was a bit more ecpensive but more spacious. Nice room. Breakfast not included but you can buy a ticket for the restaurant breakfast from the reception. The breakfast is a buffet, amix of Asian and western style, which was ok for a couple of days. The hotel has a self-service laundry, which made life easy. Close to Shinjuku central station and you can walk but of course it is easier to just change trains with luggage. Great for the price we got.
hotelName:
2    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
6    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked this hotel because it was high atop Trip Advisor's list of Best Value hotels in Tokyo. Either that ranking is unwarranted or Tokyo hotels in general provide little value. (This was my first visit.) After my outstanding experience at Cross Hotel Kyoto, this one felt a bit shabby. The hallway was hot, as was the room when I got there. The thermostat instructions were in Japanese, so it took awhile to get the temperature to normal (Googling the serial number bailed me out). The bathroom was a couple inches off the main floor, making it easy to stub one's toe. The water pressure in the sink was inadequate. The shower head was portable, but the fixture for it was inflexible, so getting a comfortable angle was not possible. That said, it was easy enough to get a good night's sleep, and the location was good (walkable to the heart of Shinjuku and to trains, but in a quiet area). Your options might be better in other neighborhoods -- I would try Harajuku or Koenji on my next visit.
hotelName:
2    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
6    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As with all Japanese hotels, this hotel is very small. However, it is very clean and quiet.I contacted the hotel prior and they shared 3 ways of getting there:1. The most convenient wayTaking ''Airport limousine bus'' (120min. 3,100Yen) to Busta Shinjuku, then take taxi from there to our hotel (10min. approx. 800 Yen) or walk to Shinjuku Nishiguchi station of Oedo line (subway) and take Oedo line to Higashi Shinjuku Station (1 stop). We are very close to B2 exit.2. Faster wayTaking ''JR Narita Express'' (train) to Shinjuku station (90 min. 3,190Yen), then take taxi from there to our hotel (10min. approx. 800 Yen) or walk to　Shinjuku Nishiguchi station of Oedo line (subway) and take Oedo line to Higashi Shinjuku Station.3. The fastest and cheapest wayTaking Keisei Skyliner (train) to Ueno station (40 min. 2,500Yen), then walk underground street (10 minutes) to Ueno Okachimachi station of Oedo line (subway) and take Oedo line to Higashi Shinjuku Station (15 min. about 230 Yen).I went with Option 3 and it was pretty convenient. Go to Exit B2, turn left. The hotel is just a 2 minute walk from Exit B2.There is also a lift to the ground level, incase you need to lug your luggage.
hotelName:
2    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
6    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I recently spent two weeks in Japan, and the first three days were here in Tokyo.The room was tiny by American standards but that’s just the way it is everywhere in Japan unless you’re willing to shell out some Big Yen. Besides, why would we want to stay in our room for anything other than sleeping and washing up? So, the room was fine. It was clean, and the bed was comfortable. Check-in and check-out was easy, and the staff spoke some English.The location is great. It’s in Shinjuku (the entertainment district) but on the outer edges where it’s a bit quieter. There are plenty of bars, restaurants, and shopping within an easy walking distance.We paid a little extra and got the breakfast buffet included during our stay. You go through the lobby to get to the restaurant next door – The Royal Host. It’s a chain restaurant comparable to a Denny’s I guess. You exchange your breakfast ticket (that you get at the hotel when you check-in) for a card to leave on the table that tells others it’s occupied. You flip the card over to show that you’re done and then leave.The buffet itself has a wide variety of options. There are the standard western breakfast staples like scrambled eggs, bacon, and fruit as well as traditional Japanese items like rice, miso soup, netto (fermented soy beans), pickled veggies, and a variety of fish. It’s nothing fancy but it will fill you up.The only issue we had with the hotel was actually finding it. We landed in Narita after a 13 hour flight, took JR’s Narita Express into the city and got off in Shinjuku Station. The station is absolutely enormous, crowded and overwhelming … especially if you haven’t slept in 24 hours. We stumbled around a while trying to find the train to the Higashi Station until we discovered that you have to switch from the JR line to the city’s Metro system. Once we understood that everything was fine.So, overall, this is a fine base of operations while you enjoy this fabulous city!
hotelName:
2    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
6    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku has 3 stars but feels like a 4 star hotel. The staff is very professional and polite. It is really clean here. You also have a possibility to do your laundry. Couldn't be better location: The metro entrance is less than 50 meters away.
hotelName:
2    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
6    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location. Nearest Metro station is Higashi-Shinjuku which is just around the corner (4 mins walk) and the JR line is right beside the hotel. There are many restaurants around the hotel (Mcdonalds, Tully Coffee, Coco Curry House, Pepper Lunch, Tsukiji Kiyomura Sushi-Zanmai Higashi Shinjuku-ten). 20 mins walking distance to Shinjuku.Our family (husband and my 3 yo daughter) stayed in the Standard Twin room (21 sqm). The room is spacious as compared to the regular Japan hotel size. We highly recommend this hotel for anyone who wish to stay in Tokyo!
hotelName:
2    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
6    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: While Hotel Sunroute has an ideal location. The services and hidden fees make this a terrible hotel. Upon arrival my friend and I had to pay extra for twin beds instead of a single bed even though our reservation specified (and we showed our confirmation) twin beds. We were then informed that to make local phone calls we would have to pay a fee if we used the hotel phone. We would also be charged for using the TV (mind we weren’t looking to rent anything, just watch local channels). When asked if the hotel could call us a taxi my friend was told they would charge us and when I later asked they flat out told me no because it was too early (it was 8am). Overall, I would say stay away and find better accommodations. I know I’ll never stay here again.
hotelName:
2    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
6    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel was perfect location. Easy walk to piss alley and robot restaurant. Subway located next door. Air con worked in room. The shower had excellent power and it had Japanese toilets which were a treat. Cleaned everyday to a high standard. Highly recommend.
hotelName:
2    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
6    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were 10 people in Total staying at the hotel and we had an extremely good service. Early check-in worked perfect for all of us. Changing doubleroom to twinroom prior to arriving worked perfect.The washingmachines broke down twice but the hotel kept it going for us so we could continue washing twice a day.Cleaningladies did a good job of remembering everyday that we needed extra towels. Rooms Were standard Tokyo not-very-big but big enough for our purpose - sleep. The service provided by the staff was excellent.
hotelName:
2    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
6    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here our first time in Japan because of TripAdvisor reviews. They were pretty on point. Firstly if your coming via subway take the B2 exit. This is the exit right next to hotel, until you get your bearings.Check in was fast (it was 11at night) very welcoming and efficient speaking very good English. Check out so much faster.The rooms are so small, however I’m guessing this is the normal. My husband and l felt like we stood on top of each other however only in the room to sleep. T.v. Only has BBC as the English Channel but have option to pay for movies.The room was clean and bathroom had shower over a tub and was very clean. Toothbrush and brush and razor available.The towels are dated and very flimsy but somehow still dried you fast.No noise from other rooms however the road/outside noise is really loud and if your a light sleeper like me then you will wake easy.
hotelName:
2    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
6    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location! Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku is extremely near exit B2 of Higashi-Shinjuku station. We stayed one night in a Standard Twin Room and the room was clean, comfortable, and spacious (by Tokyo’s standard).
hotelName:
2    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
6    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was coming back form a business trip and took a 3 night break before heading home. It is a not fancy, quaint, quite hotel that his in a great location in Shinjuku. Very close to transportation and waking distance from lost of food choose and activities. The staff was great and helpful helping with questions that I had. I couldn't work the TV :) and the room did not have a 3 prong outlet but that was not a big issue for me since I spent little time in the room. Loved the deep tub.
hotelName:
2    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
6    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Right next to the station. Staff were very informative and helpful. Room was a great size for Japan standards. Beds were very comfortable. Bathroom decent and provided lots of useful travel essentials.
hotelName:
2    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
6    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location as hotel is on Exit B2 of Higashi-Shinjuku Station though an easy 10 minute walk from the main Shinjuku Train Station. Good area to be in with lots to do and see. The hotel, which we just used for sleeping in, had twin beds and enough room to empty our cases for a few days. Beds comfy, AC worked, bathroom good with great shower, desk area for PC and good power points, a bedside clock for those sleepless moments, kettle but bring your own tea and fridge to store milk bought locally. Breakfast, not as western as some was passable; our rate was inclusive but available to purchase for 1620 yen pp. Good nights sleep in quiet high room. Reception staff bored and unhelpful and there was never any concierge service to help with external restaurant bookings; reception will only help if you know where you want to go and have the phone number, if you don’t know the area, this can be difficult!
hotelName:
2    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
6    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location as hotel is right to your left from Exit B2 of Higashi-Shinjuku Stn. Housekeeping made it a point to clean the room, refill all toiletries and provide all necessities everyday. We never had to call them.
hotelName:
2    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
6    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is clean and modern,with close proximity to Shinjuku higashi subway station. The hotel are happy to store your luggage on check in & check out. The walk from the main Shinjuku station is about 1.8km.The room was good, we haven’t stayed in Tokyo before so I can’t compare it to other hotels but we found it more than adequate, takes a bit of organising to open suitcases but that is half the fun. We would stay here again.
hotelName:
2    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
6    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was small but it was plenty enough for one person. I had room for my suitcase on the stand and I was still able to get around. . Breakfast was great. It had some options for Asian patrons and ones from Western countries. The hotel is right next to a subway entrance so it made it really easy to use public transportation. Great value for Tokyo!

review_body: There must be a hospital near by because at least 1-2x an hour an ambulance or police siren wails on the street below. I stayed in the 9th floor with the windows shut and still was bothered. The secondary metro is near by and easy to learn after riding a few times. It connects to the major JR lines at Shinjuku or it’s a half mile walk to the main line. A few restaurants and coffee shops near by. The hotel rooms are decent size and clean. They provide a lot of amenities. Pajamas, razor, tooth brush and paste, shampoo and conditioner. You don’t need to bring much. I would like a bottle of water would’ve topped it off. There is an attached restaurant you can eat at looks like a diner.

review_body: Location - quite good; it s far from JR Shinjuku Station but just 1 minute to two private subway lines. It takes about 10 minutes to walk to Shinjuku 2 chome. There is also a car park. There are several convenient stores and a 24-h supermarket within walking distance. Room - quite small but functional. Still look quite new. Check-in and out - extremely efficient and politeBreakfast - what I like about the arrangement is that they give out the breakfast coupons that can be used at lunch or dinner if you wake up late like me. Each coupon worths 1,080yen. Definitely we would return.

review_body: Located only less then a 10 walk into the heart of Shinjuku! Stayed here for 4 nights when in Tokyo, clean hotel with small but comfortable size rooms, bathroom ok size for Tokyo hotel, clean and safe street, we walk in and out from Shinjuku each day and night and felt safe in the area. Metro below the hotel and some 7-Elevens and 24 restaurants located on the street too , would stay at this hotel again when in Tokyo as we got good price for the room. It all nice spot.

Receptionist/Staff: Very accommodating and considerate! Overall Score √ Excellent3. Location, very good and strategically situated in the heart of the metro-a very nice hotel to stay indeed! review_body: We stayed at this hotel due to the location and the price. I thought I was prepared for the size of the rooms in Japan but I was not. The room we had was tiny, the bed was up against the wall, there was not enough room for both our suitcases, so they had to be closed against the wall in order to move around the room. There is not enough space for both people to move around the room, so be prepared.  The hotel itself is fine, it is an average 3 star hotel. We certainly did not pick it because it was luxurious. However, it was very clean, the cleaning staff were very friendly and we had no issues with noise at all during our stay. The staff on the front desk were not very friendly and would ignore you as you arrive back to the hotel in the evening. The location is excellent you are talking about a 10-15 minute walk into the centre of Shinjuku. There is so much to see along the way that you wont even notice the walk. I cannot fault the location at all. The hotel is located on what seemed to be a main roadway and its basically a straight walk into the centre. Its probably more of a 20-25 minute walk to Shinjuku station. I would advise getting a taxi from the station to the hotel with your luggage as its too far to walk with luggage. If you are staying here, you would be staying here out of pure convenience of the location and for the price of the room, nothing more.

review_body: Metro right next door to the hotel, room is actually bigger than I expected. Very comfortable room,bed. Bathroom is bit small but enough for what you need.Shower gel, shampoo, conditioner provided. Toothbrush, hair comb and razor also in the bathroom, hairdryer in the bathroom, only thing you might need to bring is sugar n milk for tea n coffee, they provide green tea powder sachet n English tea, no coffee thoug if you a coffee drinker, there’s a McDonald’s open 24 hours just 1 min walk from the hotel. Very handy. Hugh shopping area n a few shopping mall just 10 mins walk away.H&M , Zara, Louis Vuitton, Gucci, etc all in the area. I stayed in the hotel for 5 nights.Taxi - Circa 9000¥ from HND airport it take limousine bus 1600¥to shinjuku thrm taxi 1500¥ to hotel,

review_body: We stayed here again because it was great the last time we visited in April 2016. We stayed her twice in 2016 because we arrived in Tokyo just to stay overnight before taking the Shinkansen to Hiroshima early the next morning, and returned for the last 3 days before leaving for home from NRT. We love the hotel because it’s 1) super clean and modern (newly renovated again), 2) quiet rooms (hotel faces lower traffic street, windows sound-insulated, high floor, and quiet fellow travelers in hallways), 3) located within 50m of entrance-B of Higashi-Shinjuku station where 2 subway lines can be accessed and 2 stops from the big Shinjuku Sta., 4) lots of convenience stores nearby, 5) nice English-speaking staff, 6) relatively inexpensive, and 7) walkable to parks, shopping, night life, and restaurants. Most hotels we stayed at have very firm (hard) beds and pillows but this hotel had one of the softer ones.
hotelName:

review_body: Stayed here for 6 nights while holidaying in Tokyo with my sister. Reception staff were formal but pleasant. We booked the economy double to try and keep the price reasonable as Tokyo hotel prices are expensive, but we had not realised how small the room would be and there was only just enough floor space around two sides of the bed to put our suitcases down, so we had to constantly step over them to get into bed. Room was clean though and the location to the metro station is amazing as it's just next door.

review_body: We stayed for a week in mid November. Would definitely stay at again. Rooms typically small, but well laid out. Comfy beds. Plenty of outlets. Mini fridge. Clean with great maid service. Quiet. Very helpful desk staff. Window views. Excellent on site laundry facilities. Very reasonable and good breakfast buffet at the attached restaurant. Superbly located for metro access and local walkable destinations. Plenty of great restaurants and shopping nearby.

review_body: Nice, clean, not spacious but sufficient. Very nice bathroom with tub. TV, desk and fridge. For dining would highly recommend the local diner just across the street. They speak very little English but helpful and many nice, small, cheap dishes to choose from. 15-20 min from Shinjuku central station but connecting subway within 100 metres from hotel.
hotelName:
2    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
6    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spent a week at the Sunroute Higashi in October of this year. Checking in the staff was friendly and helpful and speak reasonable English. Our room was 14 sq.m which is about standard in Shinjuku. The decor of the room made me feel at home so I had no problem sleeping well at night or taking a good afternoon nap.What I really liked about this hotel is that they give a good discount for long stay which I believe is four days or more, and their breakfast buffet. I stuffed myself each morning with potatoes. bacon and perfect scrambled eggs. My Asian wife had a wide selection of Japanese food to choose from. Now the reason why I mention the breakfast buffet is that food in Tokyo is very expensive and you can easily save 2000 yen by eating at the buffet before going out sightseeing. Speaking of sightseeing, this hotel is located just a few yards from a minor metro station which is easy to navigate but which can take you anywhere in Tokyo. It is a short walk to korea town with some very good restaurants and there is a mini mart not far away. In conclusion one can save money and energy staying at this hotel.
hotelName:
2    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
6    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Sunroute chain is fantastic for offering affordable, comfortable, clean and centrally located hotels all across Japan. The Higashi-Shinjuku hotel is located a short walk north of Shinjuku Station (and about a minute walk to H-S Station). It is close to tons and tons of food/drink outlets and is in an ideal location right next to Golden-Gai - you can drink all night and forget about last trains! The staff service was exceptional and the fact that there are money changing machines in the lobby is a big bonus too. I'd definitely stay here again and I hope that the Sunroute chain keeps their prices relatively low in the future. This was my fourth time staying at a Sunroute from Sapporo to Tokyo!
hotelName:

review_body: Location-wise it is of no complaint, right next to Higashi-Shinjuku station. Room size is of Japanese standard and works well if you are carrying a small luggage. Plenty of food choices nearby and some are 24-hrs. Economic choice of stay.The greatest disappointment, and certainly a more helpful act would be needed here, was that the hotel refused to assist in restaurant reservation (never mind it was a Michelin-star). Before check-in I was told that my credit card details were needed before they could proceed. Ended up was told that they simply did not provide assistance at all except language support. Quite a contrast from my other encounters in the city during my short stay.

review_body: Great stay during our vacation in Tokyo! Highly recommended.Our first time in Tokyo with our 2 kids. We spend a total of 2.5 days and made the most of our our time spent in the city.The hotel is very clean and located in a great central location. We will definitely be back.

When you have a long walking day hahah.. this would be a good choice and the place is more quite but still there was few eateries and 24/7 mart nearby. Compare to shinjuku is less convenient but the train route are more easier. Main station shinjuku is way to difficult to learn, you need to learn for an hour only you know which is East, west, South and North station. She be ready to explore. Anyway, this is the cheaper one compare to others.

review_body: Clean rooms in the heart of the city. Good service. Help with the guide.Not for the first time for Silom. And not the last one absolutely. With excellent service from staff. And welcome back home every time. And travel is very comfortable. Not to walk 5 minutes to the train to anywhere. I have to tell the course.

6    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku

review_body: There was a lot of things we liked about this hotel during our eight-day stay, but the convenience of its location clearly tops the list. It is literally just one door away from the subway entrance. Considering that Tokyo is a subway intensive city, this fact goes a long ways. We also enjoyed staying in Shinjuku. Visiting other Tokyo districts, we felt we took the right decision staying in that neighborhood.But everything else was great as well. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful, always ready to provide some change for your money or lend power adapters or make reservations for a special dinner (in this regard, please honor any reservations you make, because foreigners missing their restaurant reservations has been an issue in Tokyo lately, from what I read).As with any property in this price range in Tokyo, the rooms are small and Sunroute makes this very clear on their website. We had reserved a standard double, but when we got to the room we concluded that because of our luggage we would not be comfortable. We checked with the front desk and fortunately they had a slightly larger room available for an upgrade, which was fine for us.Amenities included a hair dryer, slippers, bathrobes, and good-quality toiletries. The shower was powerful and mattress and bedding were exceptionally comfortable. As with just about everything in Japan, the room was spotlessly clean.On the second floor, there are coin-operated washers and dryers, something very convenient for longer travels. We used and found them very convenient and easy to use.Breakfast is not included in the basic rate, but you can have this meal at the adjoining restaurant (Royal Host) for JPY 1,030, a steal for the generous buffet they offer. Get your voucher at the reception.In a nutshell, I believe one cannot find a better hotel deal in Tokyo in this price range.
hotelName:
2    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
6    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 6 nights in July 2018. We had traveled around Japan for 10 days before this and stayed in a few different hotels, this was our favourite one of the bunch.The room size was good, the air conditioning was controlled and good. The bathroom is a nice size, the room had storage space for suitcases. Honestly couldn't fault the hotel really.Location wise, the B2 exit from the metro is like a minute walk from the hotel. The main transport in Japan is train, so if you have never been before, this hotel is a perfect location for you, as you can get around the city quite easily from this hotel.There is also shops close by and a Mcdonalds, which always is handy ! If I went back to Japan, and the price was right, I would happily stay here again. No problems at all, and a lovely hotel !

review_body: This hotel is very good. It was clean, and the front staff are very nice and friendly. However, It is missing some of the finer details of other Japanese hotels, there is some small mold in the shower, the decore is very dated and old. Overall I recommend staying here.There are small coffee shops and restaurants close, the subway F and E lines are very close. 7-11 is across the street. And it is a 10minute walk to bustling Shinjuku.

review_body: The room is very clean and spotless especially the bathroom. Though the size is small but it has everything it needs and it looks neat and even the room looks better than the one near Shinjuku station (newer).The reception is very helpful and just walk 10 steps you will arrive at the metro station so it's quite easy to go everywhere.The area is a bit quiet, but walk a bit further you can find a lot of restaurants that open until midnite.But for me, I prefer Sunroute Plaza due to simplicity to go from and to the airport.Here there is no bus limo service, so it's more complicated to commute to the airport, while in Sunroute Plaza the bus will stop right in front of your hotel.But overall experience is very good and recommended.

review_body: We booked this hotel based on price, value and location, and we were very happy. It was easy for catching the metro. I had previously stayed at the other Sunroute hotel in Shinjuku, nearer to Shinjuku JR station, and while the location was probably better there, I think the Sunroute Higashi hotel seemed newer, rooms were very clean and our room rate included breakfast, which was very good, and you would have to be fussy person to not find something likable. It was a solid 30 minute walk to all the shopping in the Shinjuku area, and there were lots of food options nearby to the hotel. Would be happy to stay here again on my next visit to Tokyo.
hotelName:
2    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
6    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I would highly recommend this hotel to any budget-conscious travelers in Tokyo. We booked our rooms well in advance and got an excellent rate through the early bird special. Because the nightly rate was so low, we weren't sure what to expect, but were pleasantly surprised at how nice the hotel was. The facilities were excellent, and we had fantastic interactions with all the staff members. We also loved breakfast in the Royal Host restaurant, and even had dinner there one night, when we were too tired to venture out further. The hotel's location is excellent: literally next door to a metro station! Also, it is close enough to the center of Shinjuku for an easy walk to nightlife, but far enough from the busiest areas to never be loud at night. We had a great stay! Highly recommend!
hotelName:
2    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
6    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: it is my first ever trip to Tokyo. Having read good reviews abt Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku online, I decided to go ahead and book it via Expedia. Whilst the rooms were small, the amenities was in no way lacking. I liked that the hotel was near tk Subway Higashi Shinjuku stop and within a stone's throw from the B2 exit. Loved that it was near all the other subway lines which required interchange of lines. It was also only a stop away from the main Shinjuku Line where the Odaykyu Romance Car was to travel to Hakone and other parts of Tokyo. it is also within walking distance to Shinjuku itself. As it is not too centralized to Shinjuku, it was relatively quiet and I enjoyed my stay after a long day of sightseeing. Family Mart was next door and loads of eateries around. I would definitely stay at Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku again.

review_body: Good size room for 2 ppl. Bathroom is considered medium, comfy bed however pillow is too flat even they give u two. The hotel located right next to train station. Very convenient n easy access to everything!
hotelName:
2    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
6    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I originally booked this hotel based on its price and location in Shinjuku. If you book 6+ nights the direct Hotel website also gives you a discount. Upon arrival, the hotel surpassed my expectations for a few reasons. It’s right next door to Higashi-Shinjuku station (direct line- 4 stops to Shibuya station or even Yokohama) and just a 10 minute walk to the neon-lit centre, where most of the restaurants are, as well as the big department store, ‘Isetan’ - worth visiting the basement level for their food hall and trying lots of different things!The hotel itself is spotless and the staff are very welcoming and helpful. The rooms are bigger than the last hotel I stayed in (APA Hotel) with desk space, mini fridge & kettle, a small rail to hang clothes and a full double bed (for single occupancy). Note, the room size is still not huge which is typical for Tokyo. The bathroom also has a mini bath and all the toiletries you need - I didn’t once use my own in the end.I also had the best sushi of my stay in Tokyo just around the corner at ‘Sushi-Zambia Higashi Shinjuku’ - check it out!Would definitely recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
2    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
6    Hotel Sunroute Higashi Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: There are a few high points here; the sky view bar, the breakfast choice and the generally good service. This is let down for me at least by a few things. Some easy to fix, some not so easy.My room was very small, normal for Tokyo maybe but for me, very small. The toilet for example has a half width door that misses the toilet by millimetres on opening and a only had a half sized bath. The decor is dated and a little shabby and in my case, although a non smoking room, stank of stale cigarettes, the carpet too was stained and in generally poor condition. One complimentary bottle of water is provided, with more available in the mini bar at £5 for 500ml.... not acceptable in my opinion. The last ‘equivalent’ hotels I stayed in the last two months provided multiple free bottled water. (Sofitel Sentosa Singapore, Wanda Reign Shanghai). The hotel has reasonable facilities, a free 24h gym (gets quite busy), a sauna and a 20m outdoor pool (£30 a time though, even for guests) so understandably empty. This by the way is the ONLY outside space in the hotel, so if you want to sit outside and read a The water thing and £30 for the pool is a bit of a rip off in my view. Small rooms I get, Tokyo isn’t a big place but for nearly £250 a night I’m not prepared to put up with dated, shabby decor, carpets and a smoky room.

7    ANA InterContinental Tokyo
