review_body: Ok so the rooms aren't the most modern ever but the 24/7 gym makes up for itBuffett also decent In a good spot7/11, Starbucks, coin laundry...all pretty closeAlso Roppongi So lots to doBut again Rooms are a bit dated

review_body: Direct airport limousine service. Plenty of restaurants around. Nice breakfast spread. Rooms are small, and expensive, but reasonable considering Tokyo standard.Walkable distance to metro station. Ideal for business trips.
hotelName:
7    ANA InterContinental Tokyo

review_body: I had a single room which was quite compact, but comfortable and efficiently designed with all the expected amenities well organized in a fairly small space. Everything spotlessly clean. The cafe restaurant was great for breakfast, good selection. I made use of the gym, which although not huge was big enough and pretty well-equipped. The airport shuttle bus worked very well. Overall a good experience.
hotelName:
7    ANA InterContinental Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: just returned from a two night stay, my only disappointment was that I didn't stay longer. As an Ambassador member I was upgraded to a jnr suite. Whilst not a huge space it was perfectly formed, beautifully decorated and had the most perfect view.We were greeted in the club lounge by Young, who was the perfect host. Young was very warm, professional and knowledgeable, she was a on a mission to delight us. Throughout our stay every staff member interaction was excellent.The Club lounge offering was excellent, loved the breakfast and evening canapes. We also enjoyed the Tokyo bike experience which is complimentary with the lounge.We were celebrating a 1st wedding anniversary and i would like to thank Young and Elvin (F&B experience manager) and the restaurant team in Pierre Gagnaire for making the evening so special and truly memorableMy friends and I live in Dubai and have been spoilt with eating and drinking some the worlds best hotels, however our stay at the Intercontinental Tokyo redefined hospitality.Thank you and we look forward to staying again
hotelName:
7    ANA InterContinental Tokyo

review_body: Gorgeous hotel in a great location. It is perfect for business travellers. Wifi was really good. Great choice for breakfast. The lifts were a bit confusing initially but other than that I honestly couldn't fault the hotel at all.
hotelName:
7    ANA InterContinental Tokyo

review_body: ANA Intercontinental is located in the heart of the city. The hotel is a little far from the train station. There is a direct luxury coach from Narita airport taking about one and a half hour plus to the hotel. The check in process is efficient and is located on the first floor. The rooms are a little small by international standards but are comfortable
hotelName:
7    ANA InterContinental Tokyo

review_body: I hesitated to comment because It’s relatively judged based on its surrounding venues.. but by far its customer service lacks ingenuity and knowledge compared to others...once I called the main number, got re-routed twice to the bell desk, and all I wanted was to schedule an airport bus. I was instructed to do so online! Why would people pay and stay at a hotel if all the concierge assistance was re-directed to myself?I’m giving it a1 star for its location and convenience of access from the airport (both Haneda and Narita has a direct limousine bus route with flexible schedule), and the solid fact that I have to press one to submit a review.Hotel Okura would be a much better option, and if you wish to be closer to metro station access, Roppongi Villa Fontaine. Grand Hyatt Roppongi if you prefer the full bonanza (one station away, busier district with a lot more tourists).
hotelName:

review_body: Arriving after an 11 hour flight I wanted to go for a swim but it closed at 5 pm What a shame. Had a shower instead. Massive buffet breakfast in the falls restaurant and was pleased by the service. Great.
hotelName:
7    ANA InterContinental Tokyo

review_body: I only stayed one night at the Intercontinental but would absolutely stay again. The rooms are large and comfortable, service is excellent, and the hotel is well located in Asaka. I only sampled the breakfast buffet which was fine but lacked much in the way of fresh fruit options. The hotel was running a Matscha promotion in its restaurants and I wished that I could have had the chance to enjoy!
hotelName:
7    ANA InterContinental Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As a Spire member staying at this IC for the first time, it’s such a let’s down. Where to start... I know my company paid for this room, but as a Spire member, you would think I’m at least get my welcome points or complimentary drink, or acknowledged as a Spire member. Nope, I had to give them my number, asked for my points, like begging for 600 points! Hahaha, I have been to other IHG properties when my company paid for my stays, and I was given my welcoming amenities without asking for its. Then to my room, the pictures speak for itself. Molds in the bathtub, Japanese love to take their baths, I was gonna such, but for sure I won’t be bathing in this tub. On the the sofa chairs, I can safely said I won’t be sitting on its. Anyway, IC never consistent with how they treating their loyal customers when it’s come to weather you paid for your stays or your company does. So disappointed.
hotelName:
7    ANA InterContinental Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel breakfasts are fantastic- probably the best, day after day, in a top quality hotel anywhere in the world! The huge range of foods appealed to the mainly Japanese, Chinese, Indian and European palates. Amazing!The hotel was full when we checked in and we were allocated a very small cramped double even though it had all the equipment but just felt claustrophobic.We got an upgrade, and apart from sealed windows (no fresh air) this new room was great.The other restaurants and bars in the building are well presented, all with charming staff, high quality food at lunchtimes and dinner. The only shocks are the minuscule centimetres of wine for truly exorbitant prices. The cheaper malt whiskies are just OK.The concierges tried hard but we struggled with tubes, trains and taxis and finding the names of shops and restaurants around the Dome and the Ginza areas often standing outside but failing to see them on our google searches.
hotelName:
7    ANA InterContinental Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I made reservations here as this is the best located Intercontinental in Tokyo. Reviews made me hesitate, but after our stay, I was very satisfied. Before we arrived, I requested a paid upgrade to a Premier room. These rooms have been renovated. We had used a 2 for 1 coupon for 2 nights and points for our other 3 nights.All in all, I like this hotel. The location is excellent. The Airport Limo bus makes a stop at this hotel from both Tokyo airports. The hotel is close to 2 metro stops. There is a huge amount of places with a 1/2 mile to eat. There are many restaurants in the hotel. There is a small coffee/pastry shop as well. The hotel's breakfast buffet is very large but a little high priced. We did the buffet once. We had 2 mornings that we had to be out of the hotel by 7AM, so doing a buffet isn't worth it.The room was a decent size and very clean. The room size was more like an American hotel room. I found the bathroom again, very clean and decently sized. I do not understand these complaints about the bathroom being small. We had a king bed room. We had a sitting area with a loveseat. Which I used for one of our suitcases. Overall, I felt we had plenty of room. I did much research and then chose to pay for a small upgrade to get a renovated room. I think it was $25 US and seeing other room pics, it was definitely worth $25.Service in the hotel was very good. The concierge and the bell captain were both very helpful to us.Would we stay here again? Yes, providing that a good rate was available.
hotelName:
7    ANA InterContinental Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for 2 nights as a preference given I am a IHG member.Check in was smooth and the staff spoke English. I was upgraded on arrival to a club room as none of the category above what I had booked were available - excellent!I have now stayed here three times and this time was the best - service, room quality etc all high class. In contrast to my last IHG experience in Chicago this was so much betterI would stay here again
hotelName:
7    ANA InterContinental Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had a mixed experience at this hotel and felt there was a large difference between the hotel generally and the Club Intercontinental - it was like 2 different hotels. On arrival after a long flight and transfer via the limousine bus we found the entrance unattended by any staff, there were no bell staff to assist with luggage. The bus drops passengers at the level below the lobby where the reception is located so you need to navigate a large lower level, find the elevators and take your luggage upstairs yourself. This was contrasted with the hotel the bus stopped at before we arrived at the Intercontinental. At that hotel, there were multiple bell staff waiting to greet the bus and passengers with trolleys for the luggage and a friendly greeting. I was quite surprised that Intercontinental didn't have even 1 staff member available. I expressed my disappointment about this on checkin, but the staff member didn't seem to be concerned about this, there was certainly no apology given. As I had a Club Intercontinental room I should have been directed to the club for checkin, however I was kept standing at the main reception for checkin. Again, after a long flight I would have preferred to go straight to the club.The 'other' hotel, the club experience was excellent. The staff are exceptionally warm and helpful, taking time to chat to guests and provide assistance, information and tips about Tokyo. Breakfast was exception with 3 or was it 4 seperate menus. I had the breakfast from the french restaurant which was very innovative, along with a traditional western breakfast. Afternoon tea and evening canapés were available, but unfortunately they didn't vary from day to day. The room was newly refurbished and very comfortable. Blackout blinds ensured a restful sleep, and the room was very quiet. There were very limited English speaking channels on TV and I was disappointed that there were no pay to view movies available. I used the gym one morning, but after that preferred to walk around the local area in the morning. The subway is very handy and there are a range of places to eat in the Ark shopping centre next door. The main hotel lobby area was always very busy and crowded when I passed through, again in contrast to the peace and calm atmosphere in the club.
hotelName:
7    ANA InterContinental Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Having a group visiting this hotel, on their arrival at 5pm, their keys were not ready and they had to wait for the keys. After a long flight from the USA, this is not a way you want to start your travel experience. They had given our keys out to a larger group of the Olympic Committee and here we are a 4th time repeat group waiting. I found that very inconsiderate and selfish of this hotels management staff decision making. And our reservations were 2 years advance reserved! Bad Form! Saving factor: Julian the Concierge and the Breakfast at Cascades Restaurant. Steakhouse steaks are thin rather then the thick steak I envisioned. Pictures show thick steaksRoom 2315 Executive room, tattered worn furniture, scratches all over the dresser.
hotelName:
7    ANA InterContinental Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Overall, this is a good, big style hotel. Many amenities to chose from. Room was a nice size, although the bath room was a bit small. Decor is a little tired and I was expecting more for an Intercontinental. Staff was very helpful and service was good. They offer a very extensive breakfast and we had a very nice (but pricey) meal at their steakhouse. Feel it is more like a 3.5 but willing to round up given the service.
hotelName:
7    ANA InterContinental Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed there for two nights after a Viking ocean cruise. The hotel was in an excellent location, with the convenience of the subway on the same block. The hotel was very clean, the room well appointed, and the breakfast buffet was excellent, with numerous choices. We enjoyed the extension of our trip to Tokyo and found some nice restaurants around the area as well. The lobby was lovely and there was also a great view from the 32nd floor bar. There were some very nice high-end stores in the hotel as well as a small variety of restaurants.
hotelName:
7    ANA InterContinental Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for one night, it seems a very classic hotel but it is tired. Service is nice. Room size is average, but the hardware in the room seems very old. But location is not bad, there is few restaurants nearby.
hotelName:
7    ANA InterContinental Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked this hotel during the golden week with my friends. As IHG ambassador member I was expecting a lot of this property. I have requested the price to take the club intercontinental to the reservation of the hotel they ask me to pay 200€ extra per night and per room for that witch is the exact amount difference between the rate paid and the club room rate. Usually I get 20% discount with my membership status. When we arrived my room was beautiful but the bathroom was too small and they are not doing turndown at night. The sofa of my friend’s room was stained and burned by cigarette and the room furnishings were horrible. After complaining about the second room the first response were « we are aware of the rooms in poor conditions » but they continue to sell it, it was taking two nights of our 4 nights stay for my friend to change room. The second thing is that avoid to go to the cascade restaurant just to have coffee, they charged us 3250¥ for two coffees it’s unacceptable for just American coffee. Then we wanted to book a sukiyaki restaurant we had the name of the restaurant and ask the concierge to book it. Even with a simple restaurant booking we had an issue again they book a different restaurant.The only goods points were the bars of the hotel the Mixx bar on 36th floor with beautiful views is amazing, the champagne bar on lobby floor with very professional and kind staff and to finish the Da Vinci bar and cigar lounge to have a good after-dinner cocktail.In my opinion it will be better for you to avoid this property which is not up to the intercontinental standard. There is an other intercontinental in Tokyo Bay witch is much better than this one.
hotelName:
7    ANA InterContinental Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 2 nights before and then again after a cruise around Japan.Firstly if arriving at Narita airport book the airport limo bus service.It drops off at the hotel and is a fraction of the Uber price.We arrived late morning and had to wait a few hours for our room.Avoid the Cascade café unless you want to pay 1400 yen for a cappuccino,the coffee shop is less than a third of the cost.However we did get an upgrade to 34th floor with fantastic views of the city and all mod cons.On our second visit our 16 th floor room was spacious but dated and a bit shabby.We didn’t use the restaurants apart from the coffee shop for croissants and coffee.We did use the 36th floor bar which has great views but again is expensive £31 for a beer and gin and tonic.The restaurants and bars in the Ark centre are expensive but the gardens are beautiful.
hotelName:
7    ANA InterContinental Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in this hotel for one night when in Tokyo. We were impressed with the decoration and size of the place. There was an excellent choice of shops/restaurants/bars. Whilst there, we tried a bakery and the bar on the top floor. Our rooms were spacious and clean. The location is ideal for nightlife and visiting the Tokyo tower. Would recommend for couples, friends and families with older children.
hotelName:
7    ANA InterContinental Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Have just had a six night stay at this hotel and have had a great experience there. Right from the start the Reception Staff were very helpful and as it was our first time at the hotel gave us a free room upgrade (two room levels according to what they said) giving us a room on the 30th Floor (3025). The room was spacious with a very large, comfortable double bed. Mattress was lovely and the pillows gave just the right amount of support. Good size flat screen TV with two English channels available, well stocked mini bar (Not used), room safe, settee, desk space and chair. Good lighting and air con as well. Also had a Nespresso coffee machine which saw a lot of use from me. The bathroom was large with the WC having heated seat and all the bells and whistles you expect from a Japanese toilet. (Wifey now wants to find out how we got one like it in the UK!) There was even a TV in the bathroom although no English channels on that one. The bath itself was just about big enough for an average sized woman to bathe in should she desire but us bigger types would not be able to lay out in it. That said the shower was powerful and hot so no problem for me. Usual good quality toiletries available if needed including a Pandora's box of goodies like sewing kits, cotton buds and the like. The room was quiet enough for a good nights sleep and the air-con quiet enough it could be left on overnight without disturbing you - something i appreciate being a very light sleeper. We cannot comment on the food available at the hotel even though there a number of restaurants forming part of the hotel experience. For out taste we felt they were all quite expensive with even the basic breakfast buffet starting at over 2000Y a head (£14 at the current rate of exchange)We felt the hotel was well located with access to the subway only about a hundred yards from the lobby (with a Doutor Coffee Shop right next to it if you need it) Family Mart and 7/11 also close by. Al the staff we encountered were incredibly helpful and most spoke very very good English. All in all a very pleasant stay and we would be happy to go back.
hotelName:
7    ANA InterContinental Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Arrived early on a red-eye and the hotel let me use their excellent gym facilities to shower and change for a morning meeting. Came back and checked in later in the afternoon. Hotel room was decent sized. Though I have stayed here a number of times and they do have smaller rooms and it can be quite hit and miss what room you’ll end up with. Overall a really good hotel, great location and easy to get to and from the airport with a shuttle bus to both Haneda and Narita.
hotelName:
7    ANA InterContinental Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I'm sorry, but this is far away from a real 5 star hotel and also for its price and its brand.It's hard to write about a hotel that you return after a good experience and also because you chose it considering i am a high level loyalty member. The level of disappointment made me write just after I arrive on the hotel where I am now .The room looks old, outdated and they have curtains on the shower, wich has together with a bathtub wich I consider very dangerous for older people...The bathroom is so tiny that you can't use it without closing its door ... and had to beg
hotelName:
7    ANA InterContinental Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: ANA Intercontinental hotel, I have stayed in this hotel on several occasions in all my business trip to Tokyo, Japan. The staff are all very competent and sensitive to your needs. The breakfast is really great. Location is good because easy to move around with- the place i would come back to for my business trip all the time. The staff are very competent and the venue location is good.
hotelName:
7    ANA InterContinental Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the ANA InterContinental for two nights after arriving from Melbourne and prior to travelling to other prefectures.The rooms are spacious and luxurious, was welcome after the flight. We needed to organise our bullet train passes and there was an office less than 10 minutes walk from the hotel - remember to take your passports with you or you won't get your passes - I learned that the hard way!The staff were very courteous and were able to help us with directions. I would definitely recommend the InterContinental for anyone staying in Tokyo!
hotelName:
7    ANA InterContinental Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is my preferred hotel when in Tokyo, the service is attentive but not intrusive and the staff look after you very well. The rooms are sensibly sized and despite the usual scary toilets they are very well appointed.
hotelName:
7    ANA InterContinental Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It’s been 5 years since I last stayed. Surprisingly room deign has been renewed. It’s cleaner than before. It was so...dirty. It was the reason I decided to change a hotel I stay during business trip. Although I am positive room design was renewed, looks like...cheap hotel such as “business hotel” called in Japan. Room is so small. Particularly shower space is really cramped... Service level of this hotel is worse than before. Particularly takes time when you call to room service, bell desk or reception.5年ぶりの滞在。驚いたことに部屋のデザインはリニュアルされて以前に比べてだいぶん綺麗になりました。このホテルを使わなくなった理由がそれだったので、嬉しい驚きでした。ただ部屋は相変わらず狭い。特にシャワールームが狭くて。。。サービスレベルは以前よりも悪くなっている気がします。特にどこに電話かけても他のホテルと比べ出るまでが遅い。ここは改善したほうがいいです。
hotelName:
7    ANA InterContinental Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My April trip to Japan was timed to perfection with the cherry blossoms open in full bloom. Unfortunately it also meant that all hotels in Tokyo were full or at exorbitant rates. The ANA was the only place available.Couple of points to note:1. Location wise, Akasaka and where the ANA is located are not the most convenient of locations. It’s a bit of a walk to the metro station, so not quite your tourist hotel.2. The property itself is quite old. It didn’t look as though it changed much from when I was last there (15yrs ago) though I’m sure it’s had a face lift in most parts of the hotel.3. Be mindful that some of the rooms (singles can be VERY small 22sqm).The experience for me as a whole was fine. 1. Check-in was smooth (✅) 2. Staff very courteous (✅)3. Room was decent (32sqm) (✅)4. The bathroom was a bit outdated (❌)I would recommend that when booking you ask for a queen bed or double. Don’t eat at the hotel, there are great places to eat around Akasaka and Ginza and roppongi are close enough if you want to splurge and eat. When checking out avoid 7:00-7:15am. I made the mistake of thinking it was early enough and I should be fine and done in 15mins. At that time there were only two people at the front desk and all it took was one guy checking out to ask a hundred and one questions for the line behind me to go 10 deep. After 7:15am I noticed (or maybe the hotel finally noticed) that there were 4 more people helping out with check outs, but it didn’t help me as I was first in line and there for 20mins just waiting.
hotelName:
7    ANA InterContinental Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I am a loyal ihg member and love intercontinentals. This is NOT anywhere near the standard of the others. It is a poor version and twice the price.Bad points-the porter broke my case by splitting the zip. Accidents happen. However the reception giggled and offered me no help with it at all.-my partner booked the hotel. Apparently even though I had paid for it and had my ihg card and stayed for four days they wouldn’t honour any of the rewards as my name wasn’t the lead name on the booking-the rooms are tiny - I mean really tiny!-the water in the rooms had an expiry date of 2015 (its 2019)- the bathroom was tired, had a style of 1970s avacado plastic and the grouting was dirty-our bed wasn’t made because we didn’t notice that you had to leave a plastic card on the bed to tell the maid you wanted it made(what?!?!)-the hotel bars and reception are by far the most expensive place to eat and drink we found in the city. And it isn’t worth it! The same beer and wine a few feet away will cost about a fifth of the price- when we arrived we were recommended by reception to drink in the 36th floor bar. Half of which was smoking and the other non. However the bar shares the same air with no divider so it stank. As did our clothes. We had to leave the bar because our throats became sore. When we asked if we could drink anywhere else in the hotel we were told no, they were all closed (it was 10pm)- the minibar is astronomically expensive. With a kit kat costing 5 pounds and a half bottle of cheap wine 30 pounds. Minibars are expensive but.... Good points-the main entrance is prettyOverall, this hotel is greedy, lacks good service and is very tired. I would not recommend anyone comes here. For less money you can stay in far nicer authentic and value for money hotels. If you want to burn money for little return then this is the hotel for you.Ihg - if you would like more information then contAct me. This hotel is letting your brand down. It is not a scratch on somewhere like the intercontinental in Bangkok which is far cheaper and much much better. Maybe the managers needs to go and see what an intercontinental is supposed to look and feel like.Bad bad hotel :-(
hotelName:
7    ANA InterContinental Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed 3 nights during my tokyo visit. The location was good. Very close to metro station. It is not a hub like Shinjuku. But you can stay in a quality hotel with reasonable rates and visit all the must see places via metro. Recommended for families. Nice friendly staff, clean hotel.
hotelName:
7    ANA InterContinental Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The ANA Intercontinental staff is extremely friendly and helpful. I stay here quite a bit and the rooms are nice and large and the beds very comfortable. A much nicer gym than most business hotels I stay in and its available 24 hours a day. The internet is acceptable for streaming (5mps up and down) and the Wi-Fi strong throughout the hotel. Lots of restaurants are a short walk away and you can even find a Craft Beer bar within 15 mins.
hotelName:
7    ANA InterContinental Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I wanted to rate this hotel "Excellent" because the newly renovated Tori Suite is spacious, well-designed and has a sofa bed which is good for families. The staff at the Club lounge are nice and helpful too. However, the horrible check-in experience and poor housekeeping marred our entire stay. As a Platinum member I had thought that we could get an early check in but we had to wait till 6 pm as the previous guest checked out late. This ruined our plans for the day. We were not offered a complimentary upgrade. In fact, nothing was offered. It wasn't until we voiced our displeasure that we were finally given an extended check out and token points. This is in stark contrast to the Intercontinental Osaka where we were given an upgrade without asking, a welcome fruit basket, a bottle of wine and a personalised note from the GM.Housekeeping too was a disappointment. I noticed fluff from our clothing lying on the carpet after the room was cleaned and the next day I placed a small piece of tissue on the carpet as a test. When we returned in the evening, the tissue was still on the carpet.Platinum members - you'll probably get better value with a regular room.
hotelName:
7    ANA InterContinental Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 3 nights on a short personal holiday to Japan. The hotel its situated in the government district but it's a half hour walk go most places of interest (quicker in a taxi).We arrived at 10am and were allowed go check in early / this I have to say was amazing - thank you guys so much.Our room was on a high floor (junior suite) andrew delightful - and the included breakfast scrumptious.Loved it - hope to stay again one day
hotelName:
7    ANA InterContinental Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Arrived from the airport on a crowded limousine bus and was about fifth in the checkin queue. Within seconds five extra staff were operating on the checkin desk which was a great start, the customer always comes first and they were demonstrating that. The room was a nice size, bed was a bit soft, and pillows were a choice of very soft or very hard which was unusual. I had a twin room to myself and the pillows were the same on both beds. Breakfast had a good choice, I tended to go quite early and noticed the queue was quite long around 8-8:15am when leaving, perhaps the breakfast area is a bit small for the size of the hotel. All in all a good place to stay and I’d go there again when visiting Tokyo.
hotelName:
7    ANA InterContinental Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Accommodation ( and most things ) in Tokyo is expensive, for the location, size of rooms and quality of food, ANA is pretty good. Service is generally very good in Tokyo and this hotel is up there. Very handy for the business district. 2 minutes from the Metro and 10 minutes walk to Roppongi. I wouldn’t bother to upgrade for lounge access, not worth the money. Breakfast is a nice spread. Other restaurants in hotel have decent food but I think you could do better and certainly cheaper elsewhere.
hotelName:
7    ANA InterContinental Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I’m staying at the ANA Incontinental Hotel in Tokyo for the first time.It’s well located for what I need and if you like walking, it’s easy enough to get around.The hotel is good for what it is with a huge entrance with two restaurants (more later).The rooms (33rd Floor) are big enough although the see through dividing wall between the roon and the bathroom and shower stall was a surprise until I stepped into it and the glass fogged over! Very clever.Bed was big and comfy and the all important pillow was great.Breakfast was pretty standard for this sort of hotel with a lot of choice and the all important omelette chef.Things I didn’t like.Lifts are slow, but at least they indicate which lift to wait in front of - forever.Gym - big a well lit but pretty standard equipment with no spin bikes (someone tell them that cycling is getting bigger and those typical hotel bikes with plush seats, one adjustable setting and an old screen are so yesterday). Also needs more space for yoga/stretching.Last but certainly not least, I had lunch at the Atrium restaurant and had a rather good burger with two, 190ml bottles of coke. Just got the bill (literally just now) and found it was AUD60 not including tip (“service charge”) and tax. The coke alone was AU$12.Seriously? OMG I hate to think what my 2x bourbon cost last night.....Would stay again tho, good location.BTW, the additional questions below are, while a nice thought, not really relevant to a great many travellers.
hotelName:
7    ANA InterContinental Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 4 nights for a few days holiday before a business engagement in Tokyo. We had booked a Kaze suite (upgraded from the level below with Ambassador IHG group). The suite on the 32nd floor had a living area with sofa, table and chairs, TV and bar. Next to it was the bedroom and bathroom, separated with a sliding door. The room was very clean, cozy and practical. We also had access to the lounge on the 35th floor. The lounge at this hotel is huge with a lounge area, dining area and business corner. You can also use a small meeting room if needed. The lounge serves breakfast and warm+cold tapas for dinner time. The quality of the food was excellent. It's always quiet so you can really relax. We also went to MiXX lounge and bar for Saturday brunch. That was another outstanding experience with a wide range of Italian inspired food. The King Crab legs were awesome. We also had breakfast at the ground floor restaurant once. It has a huge variety of food (Japanese, Chinese, western) but it can get busy there between 8 and 9. The staff at the hotel is extremely helpful and very efficient. No problem with English language at all. I wholeheartedly recommend the ANA InterContinental Tokyo.
hotelName:
7    ANA InterContinental Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Due to a miscommunication (not the hotel's fault, my office's), I arrived a day earlier than expected. After a bit of back and forth, I got a decent room though not with a very good view and with two double beds rather than a queen as I had desired. The staff were amazingly responsive throughout my more than 2 week stay. I would gladly stay here again. Thanks!
hotelName:
7    ANA InterContinental Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room and service is good, lots of international staff at the hotel can speak English very well. I love their breakfast buffet! The bathroom is clean, has a bathtub & automatic toilet-but as expected Tokyo bathrooms are smaller than in other countries.
hotelName:
7    ANA InterContinental Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is just good enough. I think they can do better. Other hotels in this class have it all. Nice modern gym, amenities, updated rooms, friendly staff. This one is just shy of all that. It’s busy and maybe they can’t slow down enough to add the personal touches? Update the rooms to lighten them up. It’ll do, if your company is paying, but their competitors are nearby and easily outdo this older property.
hotelName:
7    ANA InterContinental Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for a 3 day business trip in Shibuya and it was a nice respite each day. The room was nice, functional; the hotel quiet for jet lag sleeping and multiple restaurant options within the property
hotelName:
7    ANA InterContinental Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was a wee bit concerned after reading the reviews on TA, but I had an absolutely wonderful stay.Stayed from 26-31 Jan.I am an IHG member.Booked a Club room.Was Upgraded to a suite.The Club facilities are World class. Up there with any top Hotel in the World.The service is unparalleled. Everyone is always smiling and extremely helpful.The room was very clean.The Bathroom new.The location is Excellent. Next to the UG Metro.We walked to Roppongi, Ginza and Torra... and took the train to everywhere else.If we ever visit Tokyo again, this is where we will stay.
hotelName:
7    ANA InterContinental Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at the ANA 3 WEEKS ago with my family in 4 rooms. This time I am back for 6 nights by myself on business. The ANA is a great hotel with nice rooms and very friendly staff. The manager Julian San was very helpful to us due to a late checkin issue. The restaurants in the hotel are pricey but good. The gym is great and the location is very close to Roppongi and walking distance to many bars and restaurants. I would definitely recommend it for business or pleasure
hotelName:
7    ANA InterContinental Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good rooms, large and comfortable. Quiet despite being central and in busy city area. Good restaurants within, particularly pastry shop and Japanese restaurant. Sometimes extravagant decoration, see the macaroon Eiffel tower on the picture!
hotelName:
7    ANA InterContinental Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A beautiful hotel with a great view of Tokyo Tower and Mt Fuji. Large by Tokyo standards. The staff are very professional and welcoming. A great selection restaurants and bars serving quality food and drinks. I stayed in both a standard room and a club room and I would definitely recommend spending a bit extra to get a club room!
hotelName:
7    ANA InterContinental Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed there in early January to what can only be described as complete chaos - huge breakfast queues, staff unable to conduct basic tasks (checking-out was astonishingly handled, forcing me to walk out without a copy of my invoice and settled things via email) and the rooms are dated beyond reason whilst very expensive... It's a huge hotel for groups and airline staff so staying there can only make sense at hugely discounted rates otherwise there are so many better ones to pick.
hotelName:
7    ANA InterContinental Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nicer than the regular holiday Inn hotels... Wish the ladies locker room had a sauna like the men's... Has four or five restaurants and three or more bars... Live music was nice in the evenings... Staff was very friendly
hotelName:
7    ANA InterContinental Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed four nights with family and booked two rooms. We arrived early in the morning and requested early check-in. They were kind enough to provide one room so we could leave our luggage and freshen up. Facilities are really good with a decent size gym and sauna. Breakfast was good but the Japanese option could do with a bit of an upgrade. Especially on the protein options where there was only grilled fish which was very dry in all four days we had breakfast. The metro Tameike-Sanno Ginza line is very close by and provides access to Shibuya, Asakusa and Ginza which are all popular tourist destinations.
hotelName:
7    ANA InterContinental Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As the many reviews written before, yes, this hotel is in dire need of a face lift. Bed felt a bit sunken in, and hotel is very dated. Nevertheless there were several elements that overlooked this for us. Staff was all kind and helpful. Breakfast buffet was pretty phenomenal and YES - the green tea muffins are life. Bathroom had a good sized tub, and room was rather large for Tokyo standards.Overall, had a decent stay.
hotelName:
7    ANA InterContinental Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed there for almost a week during a business trip and everything was what would be expected of a solid 4 stars hotel. Make sure to get a remodeled room as the lower floors one seemed a bit dated. Everything else was fine and the location seemed quite good (we had many tours organized but many points were interest were within 30 minutes walk)
hotelName:
7    ANA InterContinental Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Extremely small rooms and we specifically requested for wheelchair accessible room which was not provided as they don't have any. The attitude is 'take it or leave it'. Breakfast was ok. The subway is not wheelchair accessible and it's either a long walk to trains or take a cab. Halal meal available in room service menu but nothing fancy. Good service. All in all we were disappointed.
hotelName:
7    ANA InterContinental Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I’m not a big fan of flying and I’ve been on United airline, Virgin, Delta, Southwest, ChinaAir, even a private chartered jet and few others. ANA impressed myself & my husband. It was smoother & more quiet than others we’d been on. Given that it’s probably a newer model but they have a nicer place to plug in our phone charger, a removable remote for our tv and a comfy headset. Oh and they have this awesome feature on their windows. You can adjust how dark or light it is without closing anything. It was so awesome! So you can make it darker so the sun won’t shine through like a car window tint but still be able to see outside!! How awesome! Sadly we didn’t get a window seat this time. The food wasn’t too bad either. We had rice & curry with cold noodles and fruits. Our 10-11 hrs flight went more comfortably than we had hoped. Thanks ANA airline!
hotelName:
7    ANA InterContinental Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is an award winning amazing hotel. I truly enjoyed my stay and the way we were taken care. All of the restaurants have fabulous service and menus. Breakfast service was the least joyful one as it was always packed and you can feel the staff is not coupling up with turning the table covers timely.The service we had in the at the Chinese restaurant was the best. Our service assistant Mi-Yu was a great recommender and assisted so politely. Great asset to the hotel. Next visit to Tokyo , I cant even think of staying anywhere else. Thanks ,
hotelName:
8    Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Mandarin Oriental is always ranked as the best hotel chain in the world, this one really lives up to its reputation. Staff are amiable and helpful, always be able to anticipate our needs. They give us a home-away-from-home feel. The hotel is located in the posh area in Tokyo, right above the Mitsukoshi Mae sta. which is serviced by the two most important train lines. Getting around is very easy. The room has a great view of Tokyo. For shopping, the Mitsukoshi original store is just next door. There are some nice shops in the Coredo Mall across the street. There are many nice restaurants in the neighbourhood, and Ginza is just 2 stops away. This is definitely my hotel of choice in Tokyo!
hotelName:
8    Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location, excellent service. The only thing missing in this hotel is a swimming pool.View from room is good but nothing special. Breakfast is exact the same everyday. Would be nice to have some variation between each day.
hotelName:
8    Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is amazing and the staff certainly treat you like royalty with care. There was only a few things we were surprised about considering price. - no iron in room so you are forced to pay for services- no pool or complimentary use of steam and sauna- people are allowed to smoke inside which left a strong smell in the bar and lobby. The hotel is stunning and quite close to Tokyo station which makes it easy for travel. The food is amazing
hotelName:
8    Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Robin, Lorena and chef David were amazing. They took time to greet us every day and assure we had all of our needs met. What an incredible team you have!! Robin, I know you will be in charge of all the Mandarin hotels world wide some day. If not, it is their loss. Lorena, you will be able to do whatever you want in the service industry. Your smile, your kind words and attention to detail are amazing. And chef, I looked forward to seeing you each morning. You would remember me by name and even sent me on the bullet train with a surprise. Each little thing added up to a marvelous stay. I won't look for any other hotel when I return to Japan. Mark and I agree, this was the best vacation ever. Thanks to all of you!! I wouldn't recommend trying anywhere else to stay. You will probably be disappointed!!
hotelName:
8    Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is rare to find a hotel where you can find NO fault with...this one has it all and puts in the extra effort in everything they do. We were treated like royalty and our every need was met quickly and with a smile! The breakfast, dinner and drinks we enjoyed there were magnificent as well. I would highly recommend staying here. Hands down!
hotelName:
8    Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We just returned home from the MO in Tokyo last night. What an amazing experience!My husband and I stayed a short 6 nights at this property. We actually were meant to stay 4 nights, but decided to extend our stay after experiencing the exceptional service provided by everyone at this hotel (particularly Mr Robin Colleau - Restaurant Guest Relations Manager - and Chef Davide Di Dio - Chef de Cuisine at K'shiki Restaurant). The rooms are spectacular (and huge!), the food exceptional, the Spa magnificent. But what sets it apart is the outstanding service. The quality of their customer service is beyond anything we've ever experienced at ANY hotel, and we've travelled a bit. This was our first stay at a Mandarin Oriental. But it certainly won't be the last. It is expensive, but so worth it. Don't take my word for it, go and experience it for yourself. You can thank me later!
hotelName:
8    Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were on a family trip to Tokyo and found the MO to be a very comfortable hotel in a great central location. We had breakfast included with our room and we looked forward to it every day. The room service supervisor Mr Terui went above and beyond in taking care of us. Concierge did a great job getting us into the Ninja restaurant last minute. The only downside of this hotel was the smell of smoke in the lobby. most spectacular gym i’ve encountered in my travels.
hotelName:
8    Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our stay of 2 nights at the MO Tokyo was just exquisite. The staff was very helpful in many ways. Plus we were upgraded in a suite... and many attentions for my birthday make that stay memorable. The view is incredible from the bar, restaurant and the rooms.
hotelName:
8    Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had an exceptional experience at this property. The bell staff, front desk, concierge and housekeeping were excellent -- impeccable service. Their efforts helped to make our stay comfortable and memorable.We had a pristine room with an amazing view of the Skytree Tower. The room amenities were all top-notch. Turndown was wonderful. The Nespresso machine and selection of teas were welcome. We had breakfast at K'shiki, which was an excellent buffet -- highly recommend it. All of the restaurants were gorgeous. The location was ok, but we ended up taking a cab from Tokyo station because of our luggage. It would have been a long walk with our bags. Overall, we look forward to staying again.
hotelName:
8    Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had the best week stay at the Mandarin Hotel in Tokyo! Everything was perfect from a-z. I loved the room overlooking the city skyline. The service for a large hotel was impeccable. The staff are Uber professional and will do absolutely everything to please their guests! Well done. It was a fabulous stay!
hotelName:
8    Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband & I were fortunate enough to have experienced the wonderful hospitality, beautiful rooms, efficient staff, delicious breakfast and pizza restaurant experience during our recent visit. We were so pleased with the efficient & pleasant service we received from the staff including our request to have the hotel transfer our large suitcases to our destination in Kyoto. Everything was efficiently handled and our bags were waiting for us at our Kyoto destination. The breakfasts were delicious with a large variety of cuisines both Western & Eastern. Many of the tables had wonderful views and the service was superb. We would definitely choose this hotel or other Mandarin Chain hotels for our future travel plans.
hotelName:
8    Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Tokyo Hotel is at the top of its game. The hotel room amenities are up to date and worked perfectly,i,e, Wi-Fi television, HVAC etc. . Our room was luxuriously furnished and very comfortable. One evening we dined at the the delightful Signature restaurant . Ask for a table with a view of the city. The evening view is extraordinary. The fitness center is large and well kitted out. It too offers dazzling city views out the windows, even for this jaded New Yorker.
hotelName:
8    Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: For the third time in less than 3 years, we have enjoyed nights at the Mandarin Oriental. Every aspect of the hotel is of the highest standard, from the personal service offered by each and every member of staff, to the excellent breakfast, both buffet and table-service, and the room service, which we most appreciated, as we had an early flight to Europe and the Mandarin brought a sumptuous breakfast to our room at 5.20am at no extra cost. If only all luxury hotels could maintain this level of quality!
hotelName:
8    Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed a week in the Mandarin Oriental in Tokyo, the room was pretty spacious, the staff service was amazing, the concierge really help me to get reservations at the sushi places that i was looking. The staff at the bar the best!
hotelName:
8    Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The perfect location to visit Tokio, with the convenient Mitsukoshi Mae metro line in the basement. 5 minutes away from the station, and amazing views. From my room I could see Mount Fuji. During my stay in Japan I visited many luxury hotels, and this one is the best by far.
hotelName:
8    Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Mandarin Oriental in Tokyo was a great choice for our trip. All the staff is always ready to help and to give more than one expects. The restaurants, the Spa. If you have the chance, experience all. Even the room service. The best headquarter to get to explore Tokyo.
hotelName:
8    Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Visit the bar on the 37th floor.View was amazing the restaurant and bar was beautiful.Loved the design.We had eaten there also and the food was just so good.The waiter (french waiter) recommend all the cocktails we drank and everyone was very nice. He made the visit even better.Would definitely visit again when in japan again in the near future.
hotelName:
8    Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely staff , convenient for the metro to get into town , fantastic shops nearby too . Sense, their Chinese restaurant, is brilliant as is the lovely little Pizza bar . We had a great view from our room of the city scape and found room service and turn down really excellent . Why only 4 stars then ? Well we don't like the smell of smoke and they allow smoking at the 37th floor bar area ,. This drifts up the open staircase to the lobby and reception on 38th floor too . If you are European, and used to smoke free living, this is nasty . One day we were driven out of the bar by cigar smokers which we could still smell the next morning !
hotelName:
8    Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We greatly enjoyed our stay at the Mandarin oriental. The service is absolutely outstanding. There is care in every detail, and the staff genuinely cares for their guests. When I was ill, they made sure I would get better and went above and beyond to ensure that.The concierge staff is professional, and has picked excellent restaurants for us to dine in during our stay.The in room dining team really deserves a commendation. Thank you for being our home away from home.Thank you for ensuring we had a memorable stay.
hotelName:
8    Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed two nights in this wonderful hotel. The staff is so kind and the room very comfortable. All is made to make your stay unforgettable. I also had breakfast seated in front of an amazing view on the city and Mount Fuji in the background. The buffet is very generous and quality of food is excellent.
hotelName:
8    Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was a new hotel for us in Tokyo. We stayed for four nights in late March, early April during the time to see cherry blossoms. The service was exquisite. The facility and the view are outstanding. Great food. It couldn't have been any better.
hotelName:
8    Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is very classy hotel. Conveniently located for Tokyo Station and the Underground Rail and within easy access of lots of stuff that's wort visiting.The room was immaculate, well appointed and had a distant view of Mount Fuji. All staff were engaging and in particular, I must mention the lobby ambassador, Chiharu Hashimoto, who provided us with a very warm greeting, and was of much assistance during our 5 night stay. She is a credit to the MO organisation. In fact, all staff that we dealt with were excellent, including housekeeping who we never saw in person but clearly did great work.The cocktail bar is well worth a visit. Great drinks, very well managed by the engaging Fu-Fu (hope I got her name correct) and a superb night view over Tokyo from the non-smoking section (yep, Japan still allows smokers to puff away indoors - so 1980's!). The rest of the hotel looks to be non-smoking.If you want to eat at the hotel's Michelin Starr 'Tapas Molecular Bar' get your reservation made before you turn up. We tried to book when we checked in only to find it was fully reserved for the whole of our 5 night stay. Luckily there was a cancellation a few days later and we managed to get in on our last day. It's pricey but it's more than just a meal - it's entertainment too - and be sure to get the wine paring.In my opinion, the Mandarin Oriental Tokyo is so much nicer than the Shangri-La just down the road.
hotelName:
8    Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our 3rd stay here. The staff (they don't like to be singled out but they are exceptional team: Front Desk Jenny Miu, Nao, Niko, Osamu, Maria; in restaurant, Eita, Yuka, Yu, Luca) keep bringing us back, even when our trip doesn't include Tokyo, we make a point of staying here! Jenny and Niko even helped us with MO Bangkok and Hong Kong stays. Excellent Japanese service, but warm and friendly, too; so generous with their hospitality, have earned our loyalty. Feels like coming home. Rooms amazing; breakfast buffets and Italian dinners; spa baths and sauna with a view of the city. Luxurious--worth every penny!
hotelName:
8    Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff was attentive and welcoming. Room was quiet, clean and had incredible views. (Stayed across from elevator and didn't even hear it.) Good meals inside and just outside of the hotel. Will definitely return again for next trip to Tokyo.
hotelName:
8    Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We traveled here as part of our honeymoon. Having been to many 5 star hotels around the world my wife and I both agreed this is the best service we have ever received. A definite recommendation of visiting Tokyo
hotelName:
8    Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I read some of the lower rated reviews to see what the possible issues were and I think most have been addressed - the service is great, most staff speak good English and the rooms are spacious and comfortable. The only remaining one is that smoking is allowed in the bar on 37 which floats up to reception. I think it’s time that the MO Tokyo got with the rest of the 21st century and banned smoking in the public areas. Why should one or two people spoil the space for everyone else??
hotelName:
8    Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Second time to Tokyo and the first time to MOTYO. After the visit, for sure you will return to this FANtastic hotel.  Spacious room and I am really impressed that as usually the hotel rooms in Japan are quite small. I am so surprised for the amazing view from the room which seems like just a short distance to the Skytree Tower. Stunning View no matter in the morning, evening or night time!!!!  Bathroom amenities are luxurious by using BV and all amenities are available. The bath salt with great scent and always great to use it for the relaxation after the long shopping day at daytime.  Convenient location, connected to the Metro, shopping mall, convenient store with 2 mins walk. Only 10 to 15 mins to Ginza by Metro. For arrival and departure to or from airport, you may also take the Airport Limousine Bus (additional charge) and just around 1.5 hour to be arrived.  The staff are helpful. Especially I got the assistance of transfers arrangement from Bell and restaurant recommendations from Concierge. They won't suggest the over-fancy one and always give me the one that suitable my needs and budget!!  For Front Desk, they are all friendly and efficient for the room allocation as I have arrived to the hotel in the early morning which they try very best to accommodate the available room for me as soon as they can!!! Highly appericated!!!!!!  For Housekeeping Team, SUPERB!!!! The amazing thing is they even tidy up my chewing gum and put it in order!!! And I also love the Turn Down service by placing the Essential Oil on the small plate with origami.  For GR team, as I have stayed on 3 March and when I back to the hotel, I found a special gift for Hinamatsuri!!! SURPRISED!!!!  Nice experience and a MUST-TRY hotel if you travel to Tokyo!!!!!!!!!!!!! :)
hotelName:
8    Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good service, staffs are polite and have good quality of service!Foods are excellent! Especially the foods in the "Signature". Those are wonderful at all.The room (especially the bathroom) is a little bit old-fashioned.
hotelName:
8    Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I generally do not write reviews on trip advisor but felt it was necessary as I think the level of service at mandarin in Tokyo was exceptional. I made a visit on my birthday and was provided with a lovely cake in my room which was very thoughtful.I would like to thank yogi who is the breakfast manager for being so attentive and diligent. I would also like to thank masahiro at concierge who was extremely helpful, thoughtful and patient. I would definately stay at mandarin next time I visit Tokyo as the views alone are worth the trip! Only downside is there is no pool..
hotelName:
8    Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First off, I was a Amex Platinum traveler for 20+ years - they completely screwed up my trip. Booking us 2 twins(which are more like full beds) which would have placed my teen daughters on opposite sides of the hotel floor. Book directly, email them. I was very nervous because after spending 2+ hours and 2 days with AMEX they couldn’t figure it out. Unknown to me Platinum cards travel is just Expedia! Join the MO Fan and get same benefits. And the hotel emailed me to let me know that this would have happened. So here’s where Nao stepped in and despite fully booked because of holiday in Japan, we were able to get adjoining rooms after 3 days. She spoke flawless English and gave me many tips especially to the mochi place in Ginza that is part of turndown. She’s an asset to the hotel. I just felt service that was behind the scenes flawless execution and really trying hard even if things aren’t perfect. Comparable to my other fav hotel Waldorf Astoria in Beverly Hills. My daughter loved the spa and fitness areas there were killer views.The attention to details as you can see are amazing from a pillow bar, mochi to the aromatherapy oil. The views are KILLER! The warm Toto seats and towel bars are super nice touches.Breakfast buffet was too good, going home with a few extra pounds. The eggs are a bright orange and the pancake is not like an American pancake but more like a chiffon cake. Lots of dim sum and Japanese dishes too. The breakfast curry was to die for. The chefs are real serious about serving great food. Omelets and eggs dish lean more toward Eastern style and taste.A week in Japan we were really craving home food and they did accommodate us with pizza room service which was darn good NYC like pizza. I think it was expensive but very tasty.Concierge could be more helpful with dining choices but I found Yelp super helpful. It’s not about what you spend but how good the food is or if like us we want quick meals.Hubby had a $25 orange from their market, he said it was the best orange he tasted. Food looked so perfect it looked fake.Lastly, I’m super happy to stay in this part of town. The other areas are overcrowded with people and being from California and living in hills I felt like Disneyland level of people in a lot of Japan. I really like a quiet hotel where I’m not hearing a lot of guests or staff. I love being way up high too. The BED! Only other bed this comfortable is my own at home. I have major insomnia and this was the only hotel I’ve ever stayed in that I’ve gotten great sleep! I’ve stayed at Four Seasons and other 5 stars all over the world - none in Japan but this was a slice of luxury comfort. I got the aromatherapy pillow and my girls the booster.I recommend wearing layers because the heat is pumped in all over. I had a short sleeve T-shirt with a thin down jacket - was most comfortable. Overheated in cashmere.
hotelName:
8    Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed two nights at the Mandarin Oriental Tokyo for Chinese New Year again this year. The service quality is absolutely top notch. Rooms are high-tech with good views and are sparkling clean. We will definitely visit again.
hotelName:
8    Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: One of the best hotels I have ever stayed in and I like high end travel. Stunning food, service, ambience and views of Mr Fuji. Great location to wander around the high end stores and local Japanese boutiques. Walking distance to Imperial Palace. All round a spoiling and glamorous experience. I highly recommend but be prepared to pay for the privilege but its worth it!
hotelName:
8    Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and stayed here for 5 night & lived every moment. From the views of Fuji to the food it was perfect. Staff were accommodating and friendly at all times. The young French waiter was excellent. Breakfast with a view over the city each morning and the night cap drink listening to the jazz session a highlight. Large comfortable rooms made the 5 days in this busy city an absolute pleasure. I highly recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
8    Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was our first hotel for our trip across Japan and we didn’t want to leave.Staff are impeccable. They are all so incredibly polite and helpful and the reception/lobby area is stunning.We arrived slightly early for our room and so we visited the bar just below the lobby. The food and drinks were delicious (photos).We were shown to our room and it was perfect. With a large seating area and big bathroom area. The bedroom was also a nice large size which offered a nice view.The bathroom and bedroom in particular made the stay fantastic.The bathroom felt incredibly clean and modern, offering a bathtub with a view.The bedroom was also very clean and comfortable. The bed was so comfortable and the bedding was soft, felt like new!Electronic blinds were a nice touch too.We didn’t use the facilities for dinner but breakfast was very good. A nice selection of food to choose from with very good waiter service.I would absolutely recommend staying here.If you get a chance to visit the Gourmet shop, please do. Lots of delicious food to choose from. I tried their seasonable cloud cake and it was fantastic.
hotelName:
8    Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: writing this from Sumba isle and have had earthquakes and tropitcal storms the last couple of days so much apologies for typos etc!On the Tokyo portion of our all-Asia honeymoon, my wife and I were greeted with a warmth and genuineness that was truly memorable. Igor Apratz, the hotel manager himself, was there to greet us in person with Nao Kobayashi, their Guest Relations Officer who was awesome! I really recommending signing up for the free Fans of M.O. program, which gets you complimentary upgrades a free breakfast!Nao, who left us several surprises and touches thoughout our honeymoon stay, whisked us to our upgraded deluxe room (huge and gorgeous btw), prepared this beautiful fresh red rose petal heart display accompanied by these pairs of amazing white swans kissing each other made out of bath towels (I've attached a picture). Now if that wasn't already enough, Nao also greeted us with maybe the most amazing strawberry shortcake that i have ever more. Now Japanese people are known for their mastery of elevating something to an even higher level (more on this later). This strawberry shortcake baked in house and made to say, perfection, would be an understatement. A lot of hotels have restaurants that usually are..eh. But Mandarin Hotel Tokyo has 4 restaurants, 2 of which are Michelin star restaurants and one that should be (more on this later too) and an in house Bakery that is to typical of that Japanese way of perfecting things, perfect artisanal croissants (had lots of those in the morning), perfect strawberry shortcakes with just the right balance of strawberries, and cream and just the right amount of sugar and a swirl of crushed nuts on the outside. I'm still salivating about that. It's not easy to get a cake right in this modern day of mass production but the flaky crust was well, perfection.When we told Nao that my wife was pregnant that we'd prefer to exchange the complimentary bottle of champagne in our honeymoon suite for a bottle of Pellegrino, you know what she did? She got us a bottle So Jennie, a premium non-alcoholic champagne bottled IN FRANCE. I am so grateful for this because the only non-alcoholic champagne or wine I've had is basically glorified grape juice. This was anything but. It tasted like the best grape extracts without any added sugars and by the way it wrapped my palate in ectasy, it must be made the traditional Champagne method or something very similar. Nao taught me something my wife and I will remember the rest of our lives that this is what we will drink every time all of our friends have champagne and we want to join to fun but just sans the alcohol. Breakfast was a delightful joy every morning. The freshest fruits, vegetables, pastries, eggs, dear god, everything was the highest quality. I guess that's what you get for staying a a hotel with 2 Michelin Star restaurants and their own artisanal bakery. Every morning, my wife and I were attended by someone that we found out later was one of their management trainees, Flora Hye Soo Shin who had a musicality and gracefulness in your attentive and warm hospitality and, I really must say, Flora was, I guess in retrospect that every single staff member at the hotel, always looked perfect. Every hair in place, every thread of her uniform perfect. She always remembered that we loved San Pellegrino in the mornings and made sure our glasses were filled always. We always saw Flora at 6:30AM every morning so I was astonished when one evening, on the advice of the executive chef Daniele Cason, we hard core NYers opted to have pizza of all things Pizza Bar 38, we saw Flora in the evening hour, again perfectly coifed, perfectly fresh and perky attending to us at the Pizza bar. OK, two things. What?! Apparently, all the staff at Mandarin Oriental wear multiple hats, have multiples skill sets and tireless dedication to their jobs. When we asked her if she was tired after having served us at 6:30am in the morning and now into the evening, she, without even the slightest hint of fatigue that she was well rested and relished the opportunity to serve us again. Wow. Apparently this must be the culture of hospitality so deeply ingrained in their staff from top to bottom, because honestly the hotel manager Igor, who greeted us late at night when we arrived for our honeymoon, I saw early in the morning as well, fully in command and just like all of the entire staff, crisp, organized but relaxed and running every facet with precision.I need to say one thing about the corporate culture at Mandarin Oriental Tokyo. Their management empowers their staff to go above and beyond, to write us a little personal notes, to take time to really let us know the wonders of what makes them so special.Remember when i mentioned Flora worked the night shift same day after serving us on the breakfast shift at 6:30am. Couple of things i wish to say about that night.1) We ordered and savored our bottle of San Pelligrino sparkling water and declined to order. Flora sensed we would've loved more and she sent a few bottles to our room along with such such a lovely personal note. Kudoes Mandarin Oriental and the hotel Manager Igor. They empower their team members to take initiative and coddle their loyal guests. Bravo. It's the mark of a consumnate hospitality manager to entrust and empower. Says a lot about the top level managers and perhaps even more of their faith and belief in the team all the way down the line. Impressive. This is on top of all the premium fruit plates with HAPPY HONEYMOON written in chocolate from Flora at breakfast! Quick shout out to to the awesome manager Yoji Osada who greets us at the door as we come for our table! What wonderful smiles and Japanese bows all around!2) I want to speak about the Pizza alla Palla Pizzaolo, which is Italian for Pizza Maker. First let’s start with Executive Chef Daniele Cason’s pizza. We are from NYC and for me to talk about Pizza somewhere, well, it is something. Pizza Bar 38 at MO Tokyo is made in the style of Pizza made in Rome for centuries, what they call Pizza alla Palla. Is is truly out of this world and it is NOT easy to make. In my opinion, the best pizza int he world comes from NYC BUT let me qualify. The best Pizza in the world that is made quickly and from mass produced ingredients. Having said that, NYC city, yes, the city that never sleeps, does NOT have the best PIZZA. THE WORLD’S BEST PIZZA, must be made of the WORLD’S BEST INGREDIENTS, the best tomatoes, the best Bufalo Mozzarela and the BEST FLOUR. PiZZA BAR 38 HAS ALL THAT AND THE FLOUR THAT THEY USE IS SLOW MILLED BY MULES TURNING A STONE GRINDER (YES, THE SAME METHOD DONE IN ITALY FOR HUNDREDS IF NOT A THOUSAND OR MORE YEARS. They import it from Italy: Marino Flour, Mulino a Petra Naturale Della Langa. It is wow. Something about using only slow ground flour maintains the heartiness the vitamins the soul of the pizza dough. Modern bleached machine milled flour is just, well, nothingness. No flavor, no body, no soul, much less nutrients. The heat of the machine quick grinding of wheat destroys all that. Pizza Bar 38 at Manarin Oriential makes it exactly like the Romans have done for a millennia. Daniele Cason has shaped and trained Yuichi Ito, his Japanese Pizzaolo in Japan into a Master that leavens the bread for 48 hours until it is a cloud, yes, a cloud of dough, soft as the clouds in the sky if you could actually reach them. The result is the world’s highest finest Pizza crust. No one is better. No one. I actually thought Yuichi was Italian. With his Italian Pizza hat and warm bubbly Italian friendliness, somehow I blocked out in my mind and honestly though he was Italian. He had taken his training so well and sooo soo oud and into his craft that he breathed and lived as master Italian Pizzaolo from Rome. What Hotel in the world, really, has 2 Michelin Star restaurants and better get a 3rd for Pizza 38 or that would truly be a crime against the culinary world. You know sometimes when you see an Academy Award Winning performer and what makes his so good is that he is not acting. He is being. Yuicihi Ito is truly a master Pizzaolo in the centuries old tradition of Roma Italia. Bravissimo to the hotel Manager Igor Apraiz and his team. There are world class hotels and there are world class resorts. Somehow Mandarin Oriental Tokyo has both in one location. mastered I daresay. Truly remarkable. Bravissimo once again.
hotelName:
8    Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in MO Tokyo for the second time to celebrate birthday, and the stay was absolutely excellent. What remain the same as our last stay in the hotel are the top quality services and smooth flow of the staff, and this time we really appreciated the hotel for giving us a great room with Mt. Fuji view. The staff were very hospitable and prepared many surprises as birthday gifts to us. The gifts really presents the hotel's creativity and ingenuity in catering to the needs of its guests. And after you stay here for once, you'll definitely grow loyalty to MO Tokyo due to their finest service and hospitality.Besides services, at floors from the 30th to the 38th, the rooms, the fitness center, restaurants, and SPA center of MO Tokyo all offer spectacular view of Tokyo City. The view itself already an eye feast.Overall, M.O. Tokyo is a luxury hotel that's absolutely worth its price and deserves a second (or even more) visit.
hotelName:
8    Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed for a week in the Mandarin Oriental Tokyo ... amaizing rooms with asowme views and the services is next level... I stayed on the 31st floor with a stragiht view to the Mt Fuji. The Concierge is very helpful with reservations , they work with my concierge at America Express to get me a reservation at Jiro. Im regular at Mandarin Oriental but Tokyo property is above the other properties.
hotelName:
8    Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I love Tokyo and I love the Mandarin so the combination is perfect. The rooms are wonderful and most have great views. the check in lobby has a break taking view of the city. sushi sora is one of my favorite sushi places in the world (I am sure there are several in Tokyo that are comparable if not better but can't beat the convenience especially when traveling on business). the spa is also excellent and I highly recommend getting a massage. One drawback is that the hotel does not have a lap pool and the gym is small but functional. The breakfast buffet is excellent. All the bars and restaurants are also exceptional.
hotelName:
8    Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I just returned from 4 fabulous nights spent at the Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo. The hotel is in an excellent location, with plenty of food and shopping options nearby. The Narita Airport Limousine Bus picks up and drops off at the hotel, for easy access to and from the airport (90 mins.). The metro line (Ginza Line) is conveniently located underneath the hotel, and the entire metro system is extremely user friendly. The hotel is located on the upper floors of a modern building, in Tokyo’s financial district. Our room was on the 31st floor, with crystal clear views of Mt. Fuji. The hotel room (3105) was excellent: modern, large, well appointed, and comfortable. Housekeeping did a great job, and were practically invisible, including the nightly turn-down service. The front desk and Concierge were extremely helpful, courteous, and knowledgeable, and provided great suggestions for places to go and outside dining options. The lobby Ambassador, Chihan Hashimoto, was extremely helpful, and made herself available every time we saw her. She even escorted us out of the hotel during our departure. The daily breakfast buffet is among the best I have ever experienced. We also had dinner in Signature, the hotel’s French restaurant, and our dinner was easily one of the best we have ever experienced (and we have tried the Chef’s tasting menus in many M-O locations). Our server, Nozomi, was delightful, and had great wine and Sake suggestions. We both used the spa facilities, and the men’s area had immaculate water and heat options, with a magnificent view of the city. My wife had a facial, and said the practitioner was a true artiste.We like the Mandarin Oriental brand very much, and have tried many around the world. The Tokyo Mandarin Oriental is a true gem, with high quality staff and personnel, excellent dining and bar options, with modern, beautifully appointed, quiet rooms, in a great location. It is without question in the top tier of Mandarin Oriental properties, and an opportunity to try this hotel should not be missed. It is exceptional in every way.
hotelName:
8    Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My boyfriend and I finished our 2 week trip to Japan by staying at the Mandarin Oriental. It was absolutely fantastic. The staff was friendly and attentive. Our room had a beautiful view of the city, and the room service staff took care of us (such as providing a glass cloth for my reading glasses and a chord manager for my boyfriends phone charger). We enjoyed the small touches that made our stay magical: morning juices and power bars in the gym room, the sweets left by our bed every night, costumer care in and out of the elevators, and concierges assistance in making dinner reservations during our stay in Tokyo. If you get the chance, make sure to get reservations at Tapas and Signature ; these dining experiences were highlights of our trip!
hotelName:
8    Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We just back from M.O Tokyo and miss our stay already. MO Tokyo is a truly best hotel in Japan, and among the MO franchises. every moments we experienced were unforgettable. We will definitely back again soon. Thank you again for your fantastic hospitality.일본 최고의 호텔이라고 생각합니다. 세밀 하지만 품격있는 서비스를 계속 받았습니다. 항상 경청하고 도와주려는 마음이 느껴지는 곳이였습니다. 깊은 환대에 감사합니다.Hyun Kyu Nam
hotelName:
8    Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: One of our new favourite hotels in the world. We absolutely loved our brief 3 night stay and were made to feel very special by all staff. Amazing views, amazing service and amazing food. We had booked Sushi Sora for our first meal but this closed down just before our stay and instead we ate in the Italian - we were a smidge disappointed for our first night in Japan however K’shiki provided one of our best meals of the holiday. We had a table by the window and our Italian waiter looked after us throughout the meal. We also ate at Tapas Molecular which was amazing and a highlight of our holiday - very expensive (especially with wine pairings) but worth it.Rooms were very comfortable as you would expect and we received lots of nice touches and gifts from the staff - as I say we were made to feel very special. We are very anti smoking and were a little concerned about the bar but this was fine with separate allocated areas plus the lounge is fully non smoking - not sure why the hotel doesn’t go fully non smoking but anyway. Amazing stay and will be returning (soon, hopefully). Highly recommend
hotelName:
8    Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed in king premier room. Nicely appointed, wonderful attentive staff, amazing views of Tokyo. Literally right on top of Tokyo subway stop with easy access to the JR Lines.
