Next to large department store, multiple stores and restaurants. Would highly recommend and would stay here again. Fantastic breakfast buffet, excellent room service (highly recommend the Katsu-Don). Thank you for a great visit.
hotelName:
8    Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I returned after 1 year in this wonderful fabulous hotel and i could still appreciate the wonderful environments and the excellent service. I thank all the staff, and in particular way the very kind and courteous girls of the beautiful fantastic Mandarin Bar, as well as the breakfast staff, and Pizza bar. Certainly i'll return in future to enjoy again all the beauties and wonders of the superb Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo which is now one of my favorite hotels in the world... Have a happy new year and very good work...
hotelName:
8    Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Mandarin Oriental Tokyo seems to have done everything just right - the room is clean, spacious, tastefully decorated, comfortable for business as well as leisure traveller, and boasts a fantastic city view; staff are exceedingly courteous, efficient and helpful; restaurants are numerous and inviting; location couldn't be more convenient: it's steps away from JR's Shin Nihombashi Station, within walking distance to the famed Tokyo Station, and has direct access to the Airport Limousine (which gets you to the Narita Airport in 75 minutes). The hotel thoughtfully leaves a personal touch here and there to make me feel at home - a handwritten welcome card, a small Japanese delicacy on the bed side table every night, and so forth. Thanks everyone at M.O. Tokyo - you should feel proud of creating an excellent first impression.
hotelName:
8    Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything about this hotel is excellent. In a city full of luxury hotels, the MO strands out for the following reasons:Direct access to subway station from the basementSpacious, luxurious and well equipped rooms Warm and friendly service staff who go out of their way to make you feel at home Resourceful concierge team
hotelName:
8    Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The stay was perfect and the service is the best anywhere we have travelled to so far. From the moment we entered until departure, the attention to detail and the care everybody is giving makes me want to come back as much as possible. Special to mention the breakfast team who makes you want to stay until lunch. They make everything look very calm and especially Miura san is doing an outstanding job. Rooms are very nice and super clean and in contrast to many other hotels don't smell. Whenever something was convenient to happen it happen due to the attention of everybody. During our departure the lady saw me from far away sitting with a finished Banana and she realized and came to collect it - this is really great to know that everybody cares even though a small thing. Must stay when in Tokyo
hotelName:
8    Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very convenient. Close to shops. Love the breakfast buffet. Mandarin oriental las Vegas has a larger room and looks newer but I still love the Tokyo branch. There is a shopping center a few blocks away which sell exotic good food at the basement. Hotel has a store that sells extremely expensive fruits like $30 for a cantaloupe. I bought one to see if they taste different but no.
hotelName:
8    Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent 4 wonderful nights away with my wife. Beautiful and spacious rooms. Great location and outstanding dining options but what sets this hotel apart was the phenomal service we received. Staff went above and beyond at every turn including booking and delivering our train tickets which was a great convenience. Daily breakfast buffet and afternoon tea were amazing!
hotelName:
8    Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: MO Tokyo is our favorite hotel in the city, and in our family’s opinion, one of the very best hotels in the world. My husband and I travel very regularly for work, and take the same holiday each year with our kids: June and December. We have been staying with MO Tokyo each time, for years, due to its impeccable and unparalleled attention to detail, quality to its service, and warmth of its staff. We would like to particularly mention Jenny Miu who looks after us and our kids particularly well. Quite simply the best hotel in Tokyo, bar none.
hotelName:
8    Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fantastic rooms and service the staff are all fantastic the 2 restaurants the french and chinese both wonderful. If there is one criticism the Hotel decorative wise could do with a little updating scratches on the cupboard doors in the room and at the end of the bed. .
hotelName:
8    Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As city hotels go we found this one average. It did all the basics well, cannot complain about the room other than the lighting in the bathroom which was underpowered particlaury around the basin, that too was undersized and awkward to use, should have been two basins with a decent amount of worktop to place your washbag on. Even the Bottega shampoo & conditioner seemed to have been stuck solid in the bottle.We found the buffet breakfast acceptable but get there too late and it feels like a rush,wolfing down your food before it all gets taken away. The signature eggs benedicte is nice but they must do something about the congealed hollandaise sauce. Surely this is not acceptable?The communal areas we found lacking, whilst running the gauntlet through the smoke filled bar between the two restaurants, this could have been better thought out. The bar was small but provided very good cocktails and drinks but as a non-smoker found it stuffy and the hotel jazz band would grind on you night after night - a little more variety would have been better received. This hotel lacked outdoor space, not surprising being on the 38th floor, maybe then maybe not. We have stayed in city hotels in NY, Bangkok and Seoul that are all high rise blocks and all had outside terraces and rooftop bars that gave you a hit of fresh air and openness. We used the spa once but were uninspired by it. Personally, there was no wow factor in this hotel and we found it sterile and lacking atmosphere, if you are looking for a stay that is well organised and good service then it is fine. Looking for more bang for your buck then this is too vanilla.
hotelName:
8    Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice hotel with some lovely views from the rooms. Typical Mandarin quality and service.Not that keen that you need to take an elevator from ground floor up to level 38 reception and then cross the floor and take a different elevator back down to the floors where the room are.
hotelName:
8    Mandarin Oriental, Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Ritz in Osaka, Hotel Gracery and Cross Hotel. They were all great properties but they didn’t measure up to this hotel. It started the moment yo7 walked in, the attention to detail, high level of respect from everyone. We were escorted to our rooms and had the staff following with our luggage. The rooms were magnificent, roomy for Japan and very elegant. Shower and tub were perfect, AC was perfect, as cold as you wanted it. If you encountered any staff in the hall, they immediately stepped aside and waited for you to pass, speaking and bowing. It was just amazing the level of respect from every single person. Beds were comfortable (for Japan), large pillows and large towels. This is a great place to stay in Tokyo.
hotelName:
9    The Tokyo Station Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed in Tokyo Station Hotel for 7 nights on a recent business trip. I enjoyed the stay tremendously. In a city of modern buildings and architecture, hotel stands out for its traditional looks and old school charm. My room was comfortable and well appointed. Hotel breakfast was fantastic, and really a great way to start the day. Location is top notch, and particularly so for a business trip.Hotel service was above all expectations. On site bars and restaurants were plentiful and beautiful, and food choices excellent. In short, highly recommended.
hotelName:
9    The Tokyo Station Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Tokyo station hotel is an excellent hotel in many senses. The location is right at the top of the Tokyo train station. However Tokyo train station is a huge station so make sure your find the M1 exit and the hotel is in front of you. The hotel has a long tradition and the building is very pretty so many tourists come to the outside of the hotel to take pictures. The breakfast is very tasty, has many choices and surprises. The room is modern and pretty though a bit small but you are in the centre of Tokyo so what can you expect? All staff are very polite, their services are excellent and they can speak good English. A little surprise is the ball pen in the hotel. When you use it, you will like it and it is so good that I have to buy one from its gift shop. Lots of shopping areas and restaurants nearby and make sure you have a deep pocket as they are expensive.
hotelName:
9    The Tokyo Station Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything perfect. They take attention to every detail. Always smiling staff .;Location of the rooms ; best location away from the railway station.Staff, food, location and rooms, all amazing. We love this hotel!
hotelName:
9    The Tokyo Station Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here just one night after arriving from the US, before our train ride to Kyoto. The staff was friendly and the hotel sparkling clean. Despite its historic roots, our rooms were quite large with lots of glass and comfortable beds. The staff even showed me the hallway for direct access to the train station without going outside!The breakfast buffet (included in the room price for us) was excellent. It had a broad variety of mostly Japanese-style breakfast foods, including blowfish dumplings (tastes like shrimp)! They also had very high-quality pastries, like pain au chocolat and apricot Danish. I liked their coffee. It’s hard to go wrong here if you need to catch a train the next morning.
hotelName:
9    The Tokyo Station Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: On arrival, I was dropped at the concourse entry. I had to take my bags in myself as there was no porter/doorman outside. I arrived early at 12.30pm and I was recommended to catch the train and go to Harajuku. Unfortunately I spent 3 hours battling crowds and long queues. There was no ability to actually see anything meaningful. Once back at the hotel my room turned out to have only internal views- when it said it was in the dome with concourse views, I expected the external concourse views not inside the train station. I ordered room service and what a disappointment it was. Pate turned out to be terrine- big difference. After a hot nights sleep I had breakfast in the atrium. Also a mistake. I arrived in the last hour of service. The room was incredibly hot. I had to find my own table and then had to chase staff for orange juice which was empty and coffee which they didn't ask me abut when I sat down, I was then trying to quickly eat as they appeared to be packing up. The eggs Benedict that were sitting on the hot buffet were rubbery and semi warm. On check out- I paid the very expensive price and then asked about leaving my bags for a few hours. That was facilitated promptly and with no problem. When I returned to get my bags they were provided to me and I asked about a taxi to the airport and was directed to a taxi stand outside the train station. So, I lugged my bags myself to the taxi stand. Very poor service, particularly when I was travelling alone.
hotelName:
9    The Tokyo Station Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The family stayed at The Tokyo Station Hotel and we loved it. The room itself was not big, but it had everything we needed. And the bathroom was very good. The staff was exceptionally helpful and friendly.
hotelName:
9    The Tokyo Station Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a delightful stay at the Tokyo Station Hotel. All was perfect (situation, staff, breakfast, room, wifi). Amazing to be in the station without any noise. A really unique place we will remember in a great neighborhood. A big special thank you to the concierge who booked excellent tables and was so kind (vive les clés d'or)! She really made a difference.
hotelName:
9    The Tokyo Station Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent our last night in Japan at the hotel above Tokyo Station. So very happy we did! Staff were amazing and accommodating- even walked us right to the train platform to ensure we found our way to the Narita Express for our flight home. Slightly higher cost but so so SO worth it!
hotelName:
9    The Tokyo Station Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Tokyo Station Hotel is simply the best. The standard by which I measure all other luxury hotels. And the location is ideal. The bathroom was to die for. Just a perfect hotel. I am an old woman, it might be too tranquil for some one younger.
hotelName:
9    The Tokyo Station Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have travelled east and west, But nothing matches this place. You have to experience this to know. Its places like this that raise the bar of the word service. I travelled with 2 children in strollers and 2 women older than 70. They were there with us all through our 3 days stay. At this hotel, you don't have to ask. They understand your needs and requirements and help you with a heartfelt smile. The breakfast counters are awesome and they are extremely helpful. But they did charge for my kids who are 5 and 6 years old as the room plus breakfast gives breakfast only for 2 adults. The Grannie Kyoto did not charge the kids the kids !!!!!!!Three big cheers to Ms Marie and Ms Yuki of the Concierge.These ladies are so helpful. They accompanied me to take a suica card, for a card refund , arranged to take me and my family to the platform and answered my million million doubts with a great smile on there face. These women are an asset to this institution and an great introduction to this fabulous place
hotelName:
9    The Tokyo Station Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: LocationUndisputably the most centrally-located hotel in all of Tokyo. Other hotels can claim to being near a metro station or a major interchange, and that is all good. But this majestic hotel sits directly at the most iconic train station in the country, and a stone's throw from the Imperial Palace. As a result of the convenience, you'll be fast-tracked to all major parts of Tokyo and even areas outside of Tokyo (e.g. Yokohama, Hakone) within 30 mins. The Tokyo Station is also a gold mine for food and shopping. Big malls, shops, and restaurants surround the station, including beneath it. Grab a map of the place and tap on the concierge for advice, otherwise getting lost is definitely a real probability. While the constant hive of activity within the train station can be a heady experience, an air of calm and tranquility greets you the moment you enter the hotel lobby. The crowds and noise give way to gentle instrumental music and polite guests/patrons. It is an amazing transition.Rooms In a word, beautiful. The rooms vary widely in size but are generally spacious across the room categories. Everything about the rooms (and corridors and common areas for that matter) exude class, elegance, refinement. They are tastefully furnished with lovely blend of natural lighting, light marble, wood, and teal carpets, and supplemented with quality luxury fittings.  A harmony of modernity and old world grandeur. These are rooms you will want to spend time in, so don't just use the hotel merely as a convenient base to travel.ServiceFriendly, attentive, and efficient, with good command of English to boot. Japanese hospitality and service excellence go hand in hand, and this is on full display by the staff - from the bell desk, front office, restaurants, and housekeeping. Everything is well-oiled and delivered with pride. The team of staff are clearly very happy to be part of the hotel, and have every reason to be.Food The breakfast at the Level 4 Atrium is not to be missed, not just for the wonderful array of Western and Japanese buffet spread but also for the wonderful restaurant ambience replete with high ceilings and natural light. It is a sight to behold. Be sure to have breakfast included in your room rate, or you'll be missing out on something memorable.Overall value-for-moneyThere are several compelling reasons why the Tokyo Station hotel merits your consideration. The most obvious would be the hotel's incomparable location and its classy service and quality. But it is so much more than that. This is also a hotel with a story - an iconic heritage that has evolved with the development of the country's capital. This is truly an experience beyond luxury. Factor in the competitive room rates, and you will very quickly appreciate all the rave reviews and accolades the hotel has received over the years and why it continues to rank so highly on TripAdvisor. Just to add, the hotel is part of the Small Luxury Hotels collection and is perhaps the crown jewel of the SLH collection. The hotel is proud of its association as displayed by the SLH badges on their uniforms and the collaterals around the hotel. This means that SLH members can look forward to enjoying additional perks like early check-ins/late checkouts, breakfast and possibly even room upgrades. Do therefore consider enrolling for the membership if planning a major stay here.
hotelName:
9    The Tokyo Station Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I want to say that Miyuki Saito, the concierge, was amazingly helpful. Way before I even arrived, I e-mailed many questions and needed lots of help figuring out the train from airport to hotel. Not only did they purchase tickets for us, The staff hand held us from our platform through the maze of the station, from arrival to departure, two times and we stayed there in the beginning and end of our trip. I commend the staff also, as they probably did not know what hit them as we seven Americans barged in.
hotelName:
9    The Tokyo Station Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very hard to find fault with this hotel. Professional and welcoming staff from the moment we arrived to the final check out.Spacious, clean, luxurious and comfortable room. We chose a dome view so looked into the station which was actually quite interesting yet also quiet. The bathroom was large and well equipped.We loved our stay at the Tokyo Station Hotel.
hotelName:
9    The Tokyo Station Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Summary: I don't know that we can speak highly enough of the courteous, thoughtful staff at The Tokyo Station Hotel! We decided to try the station-view rooms, and we do kind of wish we had a room with an exterior view. If we had to do it over again, we would prefer that (especially to help us get used to the time change after traveling). Pros:*The staff goes above and beyond to make their guests have every comfort imaginable.*We took advantage of the train pick-up service at Tokyo Station, and we were *so* grateful we did. We got lost many times in that station, so it was helpful after 15+ hours of travel to have someone greet us right at the door of our arriving train (N'EX), take our bags, and lead us to check in.*Location. If you're doing a bit of walking, this is fairly central to things we were hoping to see, but also convenient (obviously) to the train station. We walked easily to Imperial Palace, Tsukiji Fish Market, and a few other places.*Bed was pretty comfortable (hard to say for sure because we were fairly jet-lagged!). The curtains were definitely black-out curtains :)*The bathroom had every amenity you could need (hair dryer, toothbrushes, razors, etc). and was nicely updated as well.Con:*Again, probably the room selection we made wasn't our favorite. It wasn't awful either, but I think we would prefer an exterior facing room in the future for some sunlight!
hotelName:
9    The Tokyo Station Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is very conveniently situated. The staff and the facilities are first class, attention to detail is second to none.The hallways are something to experience, either take a snack, or ask for a segway
hotelName:
9    The Tokyo Station Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was excellent in every respect. The staff without exception were outstanding. They could not enough for us. Our room was spacious and very comfortable. The location was perfect. Breakfast very good.
hotelName:
9    The Tokyo Station Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Where to begin? From the moment you arrive you are treated so well, from being escorted to your room by the bell hop (please remember no tipping in Japan) who helps you navigate the hotel and also points out the various features of your room.The room has an old world charm with a really big bathroom with separate shower and bath and separate toilet (which was so good I really would love to get a full featured one at home).The location is at what I reckon has to be one of the busiest train stations in the world and yet you hear nothing, it is so well insulated and there is a general sense of quiet and elegance about the place. You are within a short walking distance of the Imperial Palace and its many gardens. Being at the Station you can go to all points within Japan from this station by Shinkansen and most hub lines go through it so its ideal to get around Tokyo as well.We didn’t eat here as it was the pricey side (and there are lots of cheaper options just as good nearby).The one bonus we both enjoyed is that there is an in-house onsen style baths which were clean and marvellous with varying temperature pools (hot and cold) and dry sauna (which was the hottest I had ever been in) with a wide variety of complimentary toiletries so you can turn up with nothing and its a complete service.ProsLocation to the main train station of Tokyo (if not Japan), a true sense of elegance, the fantastic room and service. Great hot bath area.ConsLook this is a truly luxury hotel and certainly will not be for everyone at the price point as its not cheap, but truly worth at least a stay if you want to stay somewhere truly special.Highly recommend if you can do it
hotelName:
9    The Tokyo Station Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was luxurious while being perfectly comfortable. The bathroom was perfectly designed and the beds were very comfortable. The view of the boulevard to the Imperial Palace was wonderful and the location couldn’t have been more convenient.
hotelName:
9    The Tokyo Station Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I were absolutely delighted with our stay at The Station Hotel on 28th and 29th April 2019. The hospitality, helpfulness, friendliness of the staff and comfort of the hotel were exemplary. I must make special mention of the breakfast which was by far and beyond the best we have enjoyed anywhere on our travels. On a final note, the bellgirl who helped us with our luggage on departure and stayed outside the hotel to wave us farewell deserves recognition and our appreciation. A small gesture but most welcome and memorable.
hotelName:
9    The Tokyo Station Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I recently came back from my 9 day Japan trip. I used the Tokyo Station Hotel for my final night for several reasons. + The hotel is centrally located especially if you will be relying on trains. The hotel sits right above the train station and this makes it super convenient for getting around or for a final day to get to the airport with fewer transfers. + The staff is amazing- polite, friendly and willing to help out. The hospitality in Japan is top notch and this hotel definitely delivered. We arrived early before 3 PM check in- they held all our bags for us, and had our bags ready for us in the room. The bellboy walked us to our room, give us a brief history of this 100-year-old hotel (recent renovations- this place is gorgeous) and made us feel welcomed. + Gorgeous hotel, the room was huge with high ceilings and a huge bathroom this was great for our final night to get some rest. The only negative I would say will be to get to the hotel after you get off the train was difficult to find. We ended walking around for a while before we actually found the exit that left us nearest to our hotel. Wish they had more signs underground that lead to the hotel.
hotelName:
9    The Tokyo Station Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 3 nights upon arrival in Tokyo and for 1 night when we departed two weeks later. Our first room was a Dome Room that was in excellent shape although it was a little on the small side. But the bathroom was large with a separate tub and large shower area. The Toto Washout toilets are an experience in themselves. The second time we stayed here we had a Palace Side Superior room booked but upgraded to a larger room for 8000 yen more. The room was huge with lots of storage space and beautiful bathroom area and separate powder room. The beds in both rooms were the best that we slept on in the 16 day trip. The breakfast buffet is not to be missed but is on the expensive side at $81.00 for two people. We enjoyed the hotel bars and the service from the hotel staff.Tokyo Station is a maze of thousands of people coming and going on the trains and is a sight to witness itself. We used a pocket WIFI we rented from Japan Wireless on this trip and it guided us around everywhere. The cost was $96 for 17 days and was worth it. We would stay here again if we ever return to Tokyo.
hotelName:
9    The Tokyo Station Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: this was my first time in Tokyo. I decided to stay in a location that provided transportation. The Tokyo station is a hub for many trains . Tokyo, after reading a lot in guidebooks still seems daunting to me. I decided to stay in the Tokyo station hotel for convenience and luxury. arriving late in the evening I caught one of the last next trains into Tokyo station. Apparently JR Office closes at 9:30 so I was a bit worried on how I was going to get into town. Everything worked out. I was able to get out of immigration quickly. I was given a room that was very far away from checkin.The The room was very comfortable but small. We had to rearrange suitcases to make room for walking. We had a view of buildings that were facing the hotel. The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom and shower were wonderful. I love having a window in my bathroom. The concierge helped us get tickets for the Nazomi train. She also made reservations for the return trip to the airport. She also helped us with restaurants. Plenty of help from the concierge make sure you take advantage. We Had breakfast For the four days that we were there. It was wonderful! much better than the food we encountered in the city! The only negative was that Tokyo station is a huge train and subway hub. I was having siatica problems. The huge station combined with the extra long walk to the room was painful. Not their fault. maybe if I had spoken up I could’ve changed my room. Yes I would stay there again that extra bit of luxury in a hectic city proved to make my memory of Tokyo a good one. Service excellent!
hotelName:
9    The Tokyo Station Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It might be Tokyo station that almost travelers from out of Japan firstly drop in. The station has many ticket gates, the gate that the guests staying this hotel should pass through is the Marunouchi South ticket gate. Thereby they will be able to directly access to the hotel. This hotel’s beautiful building is designated the Important cultural property by Japan Government. The whole building was reconstructed from 2006 to 2012 in order to get anti-earthquake reinforcement and restore its original appearance before World War II. For this reason, guests will be able to feel not only just contemporary but also historical atmosphere from the exterior and interior.This hotel has several restaurants, every restaurant is quite wonderful. Especially 'Atrium' provides traditional Japanese breakfast in buffet style, you can enjoy it to your heart's content.＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊
hotelName:
9    The Tokyo Station Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had just a one night stay before leaving Tokyo the next day, but wish we could have just moved in and stayed for a month. We were upgraded (thank you!) to a very large, elegant, and altogether amazing room that was the size of apartment with large seating area, walk-in closet, bar area, and magnificent bathroom. The bed was supremely comfortable. It was very quiet. The view from the room to the front of the hotel overlooking the large courtyard in front of the station was grand. We did not opt for the breakfast buffet so cannot comment on that. The staff was uniformly welcoming and helpful. The location is superb. Overall our one-night stay was one of the best hotel experiences we have ever had.
hotelName:
9    The Tokyo Station Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Every stay at historic The Tokyo Station Hotel has been perfect, memorable. At the Hotel, I have stayed in different rooms of different sizes, with different views, but each has been exceedingly comfortable and unique. Furnishings are plush but very functional and logical: lighting is excellent, electrical outlets abound, the bathroom/showers luxurious. Service is always exemplary, the Concierge giving wonderful counsel on everything from viewing azaleas at Nezu Shrine to buying baseball tickets for our next visit. The Tokyo Station Hotel remains a unique gem. Location is excellent, actually in Tokyo Station, steps away from Narita Express arrival, as well as the train from Haneda. The surrounding financial and shopping area, already lively, gets more vibrant with each visit, yet the serenity of the Imperial Palace and its gardens is just a few blocks away.
hotelName:
9    The Tokyo Station Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A hotel at the Tokyo station since 1915 with over 104 years old is our first choice of this trip to Japan as we arrived late and need to take a rest before next morning’s Shinkansen trip to Aomori from Tokyo Station. Due to its prime location and heritage and its excellent and professional staff, the hotel rooms are not cheap. It’s like comparing to the peninsula hotel in Hong Kong except that I would prefer them to make bigger and nicer rooms with better amenities as we hardly can put in our 4 suitcases in the room. Our room is the Dome Side Room and it’s facing the inside of the Tokyo station though the windows can’t be opened.Breakfast choice and quality were excellent and service was exceptional too. So if you are looking for a very short stay with the convenience of the location like we did, this is a good choice.
hotelName:
9    The Tokyo Station Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had selected this hotel for our final night in Tokyo given its history and location to the Imperial Palace. I have no complaints whatsoever. Everything is historic and beautiful and its right on top of Tokyo Station. Please note that there is no way to go directly from the station to the hotel; you have to walk outside and take a separate entrance. The staff is supremely polite, accommodating, and helpful; I was able to make several Michelin star restaurant reservations through the Concierge. Highly recommended.
hotelName:
9    The Tokyo Station Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From the minute we checked into this hotel until we checked out we were treated as special guests. Our room was very spacious, bigger than others we had stayed in in Hiroshima and Kyoto. The bathroom and it's facilities were luxurious. All the staff were exceptionally friendly and more than happy to help in any way. The location is very convenient to the station as you would expect. The breakfast was especially amazing with so many varieties of food. I loved the half avocado with smoked salmon, poached egg and hollandaise sauce. Delicious!I would definitely recommend this hotel if you want a bit of luxury.
hotelName:
9    The Tokyo Station Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My group had an amazing stay at the Tokyo Station Hotel. The concierge was extremely helpful in booking restaurant reservations and our bullet train tickets. The rooms are well appointed, and we especially loved the large shower and tub. The breakfast buffet was nice, with both western and Japanese options. And the location of the hotel can’t be beat if you plan on using the subway system. Overall, it was an amazing experience and we would definitely recommend this to anyone visiting Tokyo.
hotelName:
9    The Tokyo Station Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Love, love, loved our stay at this hotel. 100% worth the price you pay. The staff and rooms are exceptional. Location is great.Every time you enter the lobby you receive a friendly greeting and a smile. I am so sad I didn't get the name of the staff member who showed us to our room on the 2/4 (hopefully if the hotel read this you can figure who I am talking about). She was such an exceptional lady. So friendly and started our stay off great! We mentioned it was our Honeymoon she made sure to let the front desk know and we got a picture taken by the hotel outside the beautiful Tokyo Station building which was then printed and placed in a lovely card for us. This was such a lovely touch that we appreciated.This was definitely one of the nicest hotels we have ever stayed in world wide. The shower was the best shower I've ever had lol!!! The room was so clean and we had a great view over the courtyard area at the front of the station. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay in the Tokyo Station area. It's obviously super convenient to the station!
hotelName:
9    The Tokyo Station Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is the second stay in this hotel. It is expensive USD650 to 700 per night for a premium twin room during cherry blossom peak bloom weekend. We paid for the convenient location on Tokyo JR Station and 10min walk from Ginza; and the comfortable room with large bathroom. We came back to this hotel for the excellent service of the concierge team. The team of Ms. Mori, Ms. Saito and Mr. Otsuka helped me with booking of dinners; and I changed restaurants, changed number of guests. They patiently helped me to book and changed. I shall come back to this hotel again.
hotelName:
9    The Tokyo Station Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My friend injured her knee on the trip to Nagano. We arrived at Tokyo Station with the request to have a staff coming to the platform to meet and help us getting to the hotel. They sent 2 staff members to help us out. What a relieve it was because going from the train platform to the hotel was not an easy trip, especially in a wheelchair. Throughout our entire stay, the staff was extremely helpful in every way--making reservations for meal and acupuncture, wheeled us to the hotel restaurant, guided us to see the sakura. Thank you Tomo-san, Miyuki-san, Chisachi-san. We couldn't have done it without your support!! We will definitely come back.
hotelName:
9    The Tokyo Station Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After our first stay a couple of years ago, we decided to return each time we’re in Tokyo. Location is great as it’s at Tokyo Station itself which made it easy for us to move around. We tried different types of room and it was always interesting. The staff especially the concierge team were lovely and assisted us even before we arrived as we had made some requests. We look forward to our next visit to Tokyo and stay at Tokyo Station Hotel.
hotelName:
9    The Tokyo Station Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Service was outstanding. The concierge knew our names and greeted us in an unimposing manner. They recommended great wagu restaurants nearby and sushi at the fish market. They even took our luggage to the train. Will definitely will stay at the Tokyo Station again. It is a small luxury hotel but worth every yen we paid. Awesome hotel highlighted by great staff...highly recommend to anybody going to Tokyo.
hotelName:
9    The Tokyo Station Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent one night here on a layover between flights. Access to Haneda Airport is quick and easy via monorail and Yamanote Line. The breakfast is sumptuous and well worth booking as part of the room rate. This hotel is a beautiful landmark.
hotelName:
9    The Tokyo Station Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed in this hotel for 2 times as we really love the Maisonette room. So beautiful and luxurious. The only thing I wish they could add to the amenities is bath salts, when there's such a nice big bath tub there. Location is excellent, right next to Tokyo station. Won't stay elsewhere when I'm in Tokyo.
hotelName:
9    The Tokyo Station Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Exceeded expectations. Beautiful hotel, you feel pampered as soon as you step through the door. Room was tasteful but as with all hotels in Japan a little cramped but this did not detract from the experience. Great location for exploring. Would stay again.
hotelName:
9    The Tokyo Station Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was my second trip to the Tokyo Station Hotel, and I was again very happy to stay here and would recommend it to a friend. The location is inside Tokyo Station (take the South Marunouchi exit), so it is ideal for getting around Tokyo, and the immediate vicinity includes the Imperial Gardens and Marunouchi neighborhood.Everything is clean and functional; the hotel is higher end than the name might initially suggest.Three things to note:1. The corridors run the entire length of Tokyo Station beneath; if you have a room in the 00-20 range, it is a very very, very long walk from the lobby. Try for a room in the 40-50 numbered range.2. Windows in the guest rooms do not open, so you cannot get fresh air.3. The hotel lacks a casual dining restaurant for a quick easy lunch or light dinner.
hotelName:
9    The Tokyo Station Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I primarily chose to stay at the Tokyo Station Hotel due to it's close proximity to the Tokyo Marathon finish line (about a block away). But a major bonus is it is literally in the Tokyo Station City complex (6 levels?!). As such, the Narita Express and many of the other Tokyo Metro and JR trains stop there. Also, massive shopping and restaurant options are available. As a single traveler I booked the Palace Side Queen and it was much more than I could have expected: beautifully decorated, the ceilings must have been 12' or higher, a chandelier, foot lighting (new to me!), in room safe, a massive shower head that was a delight and even a heated toilet seat (very new to me but that was great...LOL). This was the first hotel that I have ever stayed where I could not hear any of the adjoining guests. Very quiet with little to no outside street noise either. But, aside from the stunning room, ornate lobby and well-appointed property, the staff are what makes this hotel a 5 Star. Every encounter I had with either the reception or concierge staff was very professional, friendly and genuinely interested in making sure that both my questions were answered and my needs were met. For example, as mentioned above, the Tokyo Station complex is massive spanning at least 6 levels and is a city in itself. As such, it can be a bit overwhelming trying to learn the layout and operation. The hotel staff offer to meet you when the NEX Narita Express train enters the station and guide you through the maze to the reception area (they will cheerfully provide the same service in reverse when you leave). One member of this amazing team I have to give a special nod of appreciation to is Ms. Miyuki Saito. She was a real joy to interact with and always had a very warming smile for me when I saw her. In addition, as I entered the hotel after the marathon, she insisted on taking a picture of us together (see attached). When I checked-out the next morning I was presented with a very professional greeting card with the picture included...which was very touching to say the least. So in summary, do yourself a favor and book your travel at this beautiful hotel with amazing staff...you will not regret it.
hotelName:
9    The Tokyo Station Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a fabulous treat. We decided on a one night stay on our travels back from Hakuba before we flew back to Australia.It is pure luxury and a beautifully renovated hotel with keeping its tasteful art deco style blended with all the mod cons. We were super lucky to have our room upgraded which put us in the Ambassadors suite, which was just so gorgeous. The bed was super comfortable, the amenities a real treat and the whole experience brilliant. The aircon was really quiet which meant a solid nights sleep for me. We used the gym, it has an excellent selection of technogym equipment to have a great session.The staff were all fabulous and very attentive, a must stay if you are looking for a wonderful treat or easy access hotel.
hotelName:
9    The Tokyo Station Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 3 nights, choosing this hotel because of location above Tokyo Central Station as we were travelling on from there.It was also central to viewing Tokyo City. Well appointed, comfortable rooms. Great amenities, including very nice Spa facilities and a small/medium gym( though extra to use) . Bars and restaurants as you would expect at this level were excellent. It was expensive, but worth it. Staff were very efficient and helpful, all spoke English. Local area very modern & close to Imperial Palace.
hotelName:
9    The Tokyo Station Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Can’t recommend this hotel enough. This historic hotel is completely modernized inside and has an excellent location, obviously, being at the main train station in Tokyo. Everything is beautiful and clean. I recommend splurging for the breakfast, the spread is huge and the atrium is extremely pleasant.
hotelName:
9    The Tokyo Station Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: On a recent tour of Japan we used the Tokyo Station Hotel to a launch the start and finish of a three week journey. We had arranged airport pickup and local guides through Chief Concierge Marie Antoinette Mori Prior to us getting to Japan bad weather forced us to substantially change all our arrangements and Marie and her team went out their way to ensure everything was rebooked. It was extremely stressful time the the hotel could not have been more accommodating in making everything as we needed it to be. When we arrived we were delighted with an outstanding warm greeting and check into this iconic hotel. The next morning we met Marie and she greeted us as old friends and with recognition and warmth. We cannot say enough about the service we received our entire stay including being escorted to train platform on our first train trip a gesture we really appreciated. We had two rooms both comfortable and different. The one with view of Imperial Palace grounds was fabulous. The location is excellent and we were extremely pleased with our decision to use this hotel as both starting end point. Major thank you to Chief Concierge Marie and here entire team who treated us so well
hotelName:
9    The Tokyo Station Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed there twice, each time was a great experience: the rooms are so nice and classy (the ones with view to the palace, though far from the palace, are great, so are the ones with street views) hotel staff are super friendly and helpful (their English is excellent!); be sure to ask for help to book restaurants, the staff are so helpful and thorough! also be sure not to skip the breakfast buffet - it's very high quality and pleasant; location is the best: there is an entrance to the subway/JR station, as well as to the shops (if you have been in Tokyo you know how important it is for trains and subways! ); numerous shops and restaurant all in walking distance, and also you can walk (or run) to the palace (attention runners: there is a very established running route around the palace). great place! will stay there again!
hotelName:
9    The Tokyo Station Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: fantastic old style Hotel, a real treat and perfection - if you can afford it then do it, its going back to an age when people cared about service and style. lovely location and wonderful staff - Japan at its best
hotelName:
9    The Tokyo Station Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It wasn't cheap, but what nice hotel in Tokyo is? It's location, connected to Tokyo Station, makes departing and arriving from Narita super convenient. You can also catch pretty much any train line from there to other parts of the city, too. The rooms are small (it's Tokyo), but they were nice. The bathroom was the best! But if you want to know the best part of the hotel, it's hands down the Toraya Café. We spent two mornings there having matcha green tea and wagashi treats.
hotelName:
9    The Tokyo Station Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located directly above the main Tokyo train station, the hotel could not be more ideally situated. But what makes it really special is the luxurious but homely feel and the wonderful staff. From the moment we arrived staff were helpful and accommodating and eager to assist with any requirement. Our room was spacious and extremely well-appointed with a deep bath and rain shower. The upstairs restaurant was cozy and welcoming and the food exceptional. While not unusual to have an egg station, the creations (particularly the eggs benedict) were superb. There was a wide range of breakfast foods including both Japanese and European offerings. Entry to the hotel can be made from multiple locations in the station which ensured we did not have to wander around trying to find the correct exit. The concierge staff were brilliant, offering activities that suited both the adults and teenagers, and when we queried how to find the correct platform for a train to Osaka, walked us through the station to the correct point. All of the meals that we ate in the hotel, including room service, were delicious. There are many shops in the surrounding buildings and a small supermarket in the basement of a neighbouring building. Within a short walk are local eateries and Ginza is only a short walk away.This hotel was so lovely, that I would not hesitate to stay there again!
hotelName:
9    The Tokyo Station Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As an Art Historian, I particularly looked forward to the final hotel on our already fabulous first trip to Japan. The Tokyo Station Hotel most certainly 'checked all the boxes' on our hotel wish-list for excellence.---So much so that our Kyoto-born, Japanese-American friends, (who return to Japan at least once a year), vowed to stay at the TSH, based solely on the experience my husband and I shared. It is not just the history of the renowned Tokyo Train Station and its unique Hotel, (archivally preserved in tastefully framed photographs which adorn the spotlessly maintained, long hallways on the Palace Side of the luxury Hotel) that delights visitors from around the world. It's the people, the staff, the hotel management who graciously extend themselves in every way possible to ensure that each traveler enjoys a memorable visit to The Tokyo Station Hotel.Starting from the moment we entered the lovely lobby, there were no fewer than five staff people (bell persons, concierges, managers), offering assistance, expertly and efficiently checking us in, seeing to our luggage, etc. And that number and level of staff availability and assistance remained consistent throughout out stay: From the very tall, distinguished-looking bell-captain who navigated us through those l-o-o-n-g Palace-Side hallways to our 'Elegant and Refined European-Themed Superior King Room withBreathtaking View of Tokyo Financial District', to the attentive, petite young female bell-persons who could 'wrangle' heavy departure suitcases and parcels with equal aplomb.Our room was exactly what we had asked for: Quiet; Serene European decor; Highceilings; Tall windows; Soft lighting, including chandelier; Large bathroom with make-up lighted vanity, Toto multi-featured, heated-seat toilet, and spacious glass-walled walk-in shower.Sumptuous Daily Breakfasts in the sun-lit Atrium. Quiet Cocktails in the Lounge. Lunchavailable in the elegant British--style Lobby-Level Tea-Room. And always available to help, with a friendly smile, concierges and management persons such as Duty Manager, Yoshiki Kamata and, at the Front Desk, Ms Yuko Hosoi were very much appreciated.Thank You, one and all for making our stay at the one of a kind Tokyo Station Hoteltruly memorable!-BJLaB
hotelName:
9    The Tokyo Station Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I can't really fault anything - service was good, room and public spaces beautiful, location amazing - just that it's very expensive!I would certainly stay here again, incredibly convenient to metro, JR and shinkansen, and not noisy at all.
hotelName:
9    The Tokyo Station Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was our second time to stay in this hotel, as I made a promised to myself, that I definitely coming back. And that’s still my best decision. Actually, I’d like to spend my Christmas there, but unfortunately I just made myself clear by January instead. So we stayed for 2 nights on Jan 15 – 17, 2019 and choose Palace Side Superior Twin room as this is our last room type and suited our need best, we got room no. 3092 this time, and the view now, we got to see KITTE Mall and Post Office building next to the left side of our window. Detail things are pretty much the same as we got previously. All the cleanliness, beautiful room, amenities, comfy-ness, I can go on and on. But this time we got Handy in our room, the android phone like mobile device that you could carry around when you strolling the city. This is very helpful as the map is slightly better than google map, you can browsing for what’s trending or found any recommendation to dine or shopping or anything, make a local or international call, and the most important thing that you can save your phone battery for something else. There’s slightly rain when we arrived at the hotel, and one of the staff running out of the hotel toward us to help carry our heavy luggage and that’s not the end, as she (yes, you read it right) them, the other staff hand her a towel to dry out our luggage. We never ever have this kind of service experience before at any other hotel at the same situation. And more of this was when we’re checked out and very early in the morning, we ask one of the staff at reception desk for a taxi, and she was checking the taxi arrival for every couple of minutes to make sure it, while we just sat comfortably in the lobby instead of standing in a freezing cold morning. For all the staffs we can't thank you enough for your hard works and excellent dedicated performance. All I can say now, I'm coming back definitely and soon hopefully.
hotelName:
9    The Tokyo Station Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My family and I stayed recently at The Tokyo Station hotel for our Christmas-New Year's trip and very pleased with our stay. The hotel was centrally located and walking distance to our favorite places to go to in Ginza and Marunouchi. Kitte, Daimaru are nearby and very easy to get to. The rooms were well appointed with all the amenties you would need while traveling. The laundry service was great, I could not ask for better service. It was also easy to take the Shinkansen for a short trip to Nagoya being right at the station. Our restaurant and transportation requests were handled prompty by the awesome Concierge team - thank you Saito-san, Otsuka-san and Mori-san. As we were checking out, we were already planning our return trip and hopefully we get to stay at the hotel again. Thank you for making our stay a great family experience and looking forward to coming back again.
hotelName:
9    The Tokyo Station Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you like hotels that arent Western copies of each other, this is a spectacular choice. The rooms are beautiful, restful and quiet. The staff is excellent in every way. (A shout out to Marie Antoinette, head concierge. She and her staff will make everything you want come true.) The hotel is located right in the train station, (rooms with a view of the big beautiful train dome of amazing.) If you love classic hotels with history, that have kept up with modern Toyko, choose this.
hotelName:
9    The Tokyo Station Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The people who work here make this hotel simply one of the best to stay in Tokyo. And talk about centrally located with train lines all over the city -- and country -- just steps away. I emailed 48 hours ahead of arrival requesting their NEX arrival service and was met immediately outside of our NEX car by a hotel attendant who helped us with luggage and a quick walk to the hotel. The rooms are on the small side like most hotels (we stayed Palace side on our first several days before taking off for Gora, and then a Dome side room for our last day) plus they have a sumptuous bathroom set up and I certainly took advantage of an evening bath every day in addition to a morning shower. If you don't know about Taq-u-Bin luggage transfer hotel to hotel, google and use it if you are traveling from hotel to hotel, city to city. Also, be sure to book with the breakfast included because, for us, it was a morning ritual and delightful way to start the day with selections of global goodies with great coffee and tea. In leaving to return to the airport, we were also taken by an attendant back to the NEX platform. Absolutely perfect.
hotelName:
9    The Tokyo Station Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: To start, the staff member at check in was efficient and friendly, I was checked in within moments of arriving, and I was advised then of the 10am check out time. The lobby/reception area for check in is located one floor up from street level with access by stairs and a lift. Only two lifts however they are fast and your key card automatically selects the floor for you when you swipe it on the reader. Like most hotels rooms in Japan, the rooms are smaller than those you will find in say a North American or Australian hotel. However anyone returning to Japan will realise that this is standard and in all honesty the room is certainly more spacious than many I have stayed in. The room is well laid out and designed and with a little bit of Tetris like ingenuity I managed to find a way to keep both suitcases I was travelling with out of the way without compromising my movement within the room. The bed was located in the corner and certainly comfortable enough; next to the bed is a small bench that runs between the desk and bed. On this are power points and USB ports (along with a power point above the bed which has a ledge perfect for phones), and a fridge is located under this bench as well. The desk has more power points and plenty of space to work from if required, however be aware that the sink is located next to the desk. There is an open closet with nightwear provided and slippers (also provided are combs, toothbrush and paste etc). The shower is a Japanese style wet room with a bath. The bath is the usual short but deep Japanese bath and the shower has a removable shower head with great pressure and controls to select both pressure and temperature (individual for both shower and bath). For those who have never used a Japanese wet room, you will find a stool and a bowl provided (good for washing your hair and you use these items to wash prior to bathing) and the whole room is designed to get wet which makes it extremely spacious and not cramped. The toilet is the typical Japanese shower toilet however most of the controls are in Japanese except for the major functions. The toilet door also acts as the door between the entry door, corridor and shower/toilet area. Nearby there is a plethora of convenience stores including one attached to the hotel. The hotel store is a 7 Eleven, there is a Lawson Station across the road and a Family Mart just up on the street to the right. There are plenty of restaurants and shops in this area and the hotel is located only a few (Japanese sized) blocks down from the major shopping street of Ginza. The variety store Don Quixote is also found at the end of the street and features a massive range of various items, so if you forget to pack something they should have it there. To get to the hotel I used the Keisei Skyliner from Narita Airport which dropped me at Ueno Station, and then caught the Hibiya Subway Line to Higashi Ginza. From there it is a short walk using exit A1, down the street on the right hand side where the Mini Stop is. You can also use the Ginza Line from Ueno which places you at Ginza Subway Station (both Ginza and Higasi-Ginza are adjacent to each other). The other option is to take the JR N'EX service and alight at Tokyo Station, then catch the local Yamanote or Keihin-Tohoku service to Shimbashi and walk from there. Both take about the same amount of time to walk to the hotel from each station, maybe slightly longer from Shimbashi as there are a number of signalised crossings that you have to contend with.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Musse Ginza Meitetsu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: So delighted to choose this hotel because the room is spacious (compare to typical hotel rooms in Japan), clean and only few minutes walk to Ginza and stations. Also if you love to find street food, this hotel is only few minutes walk to the famous Tsukiji Market.Very convenient because we just need to go downstairs and can easily find convenience stores (7-eleven and Lawson). Staffs were also nice and very helpful. Hassle-free since we are allowed to keep our luggages while we’re away (we stayed there for first 2 days and off 2 nights to ski resort before coming back and stay for the rest of our trip).By the time of our visit the hotel is considered brand new and newly operated, so the price is quite reasonable.I would recommend this hotel for you because of the room size and its easy access
hotelName:
10    Hotel Musse Ginza Meitetsu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We thoroughly enjoyed our 3 night stay at this hotel! The room was very clean and felt very new. The bed was queen size and very comfortable. We were able to fit two large suitcases that still left plenty of space in the room. The toilet was seperate to the shower/bath. There is a 7/11 on ground floor, Lawson across the road, Family Mart just around the corner and Don Quijote just a few minutes walk down the road. We loved our stay here and will definitely book this hotel again in the future :)
hotelName:
10    Hotel Musse Ginza Meitetsu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: staying here for 5 nights. we are 6adults and 4kids, booked 4rooms. one of the room was MUSSE ROOM at 13 floor and its the biggest room and very nice. the other 3 rooms is just standard size but still comfortable and they prepare everything we need. love this hotel! we also took breakfast and taste good but the menu is almost the same for 5days.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Musse Ginza Meitetsu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 2 weeks as a base for exploring Tokyo, The hotel is well situated close to metro, Shimbashi JR and Tokyo station for going further afield. The surrounding area of Ginza is mostly luxury shops with lots of nice bakeries and restaurants for breakfast. There is a direct door to the 7-Eleven and lots of Family Marts etc in close range.We went for a larger double room which was considerably bigger than other Tokyo business hotels, with a small sofa. The room was clean and new-feeling with lots of the usual amenities - coffee/tea, kettle, safe, humidifier, hairdryer. You can also request an iron for free which stayed with us the whole time. The room felt slightly higher-end than what we paid, overall very pleased. Nb. the shower/bath is in a Japanese style, with the shower outside the bath. The reception was polite but fairly light-touch in terms of hospitality. A slight annoyance is that the lift always stops on the second floor for a few seconds of staring awkwardly at the reception staff before you can leave for the day.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Musse Ginza Meitetsu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location of this hotel is great with tons of restaurants all around and plenty of subway stops within.5 miles of walking distance. The rooms are functional but definitely not what a Hyatt Place person who be looking for. Great bed and showers well
hotelName:
10    Hotel Musse Ginza Meitetsu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We only stayed one night but I loved the design of the Twin room. Even though it was small (most rooms in hotel are), it was well laid out. Plus at 10,000 yen per person, you can’t ask for much more!They provide everything you need like an in-room universal phone charger and amenity kit of Shiseido products for ladies. Shower/bath and toilet are in different rooms! So rare for a budget hotel and the shower room is a wet room so good for older people who can’t step into a bath (my relatives).Check-in staff were friendly and efficient. The hotel is a short taxi ride to Tokyo station so super convenient and great if you want to explore Ginza.Didn’t get the room rate with breakfast but it looked nice.Would definitely stay again.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Musse Ginza Meitetsu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at the biggest room of the floor facing the lift but with separate single beds. Asked to change to a double bed but in vain. Minus 1 rating.Appreciate that the bathroom & toilet are at the normal floor level in the room as with other hotels in other countries. Lots of charging ports for all your electronic devices plus a defuser that I only found out at the last day of checking out as I thought it is a vase.Noted that every hotel room in Japan comes with an air cleaner ( ceiling), thus making the room very clean. Of course, high tech toilet seats to warm & wash your bottom. The Japanese design always separate the toilet and the bathroom, probably of the locals obsess of avoiding the bad smell of using the toilet in both smell & sound. The high tech toilet can eliminate smell too.Water pressure in the traditional Japanese sit down bathroom is strong and there is a bath tub. I kinda of like bathing sitting down, like going to onsen.Adult Japanese video is available by buying the code from a TV machine next to the lift. Or else there are nothing to watch on the TV which is meant for the locals.A lot of Japanese text are in Chinese, thus I could read the Chinese texts & operate the devices & switches in the room.Washer & ice machine are at the 2nd floor, hotel check-in lobby. There is also an automated money exchange machine & restaurant at the same floor.There is a sign saying free storage of luggages for 1 day only at the check-in counter. ( but they used the word “cloak” that I do not understand )There is no swimming pool & gym in this hotel. There are a few Chinese restaurants near the hotel including one with a giant shark fin display which act as a land mark returning back to the hotel.At the ground floor, there is a direct 1-way access to the 7-11 store but have to come out from the cashier entrance when returning back to the hotel.Opposite this 7-11 is the larger Lawson, the local 24hrs convenient store.Overall it’s one of the biggest room that I have stayed in Japan.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Musse Ginza Meitetsu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very convenient location with lots of shops and convenient stores nearby. Very close to Ginza for shopping and close to subway stations as well.Staff was very friendly that we arrived the hotel at around 11:00 pm and just learnt that there was no parking facilities at the hotel. The staff advised us the nearest carpark and kept our luggage at front desk so that we didnt have to carry the luggage back and forth.A funny point is that the washing basin is right next to the desk.New, clean and reasonable price. Recommended!
hotelName:
10    Hotel Musse Ginza Meitetsu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed in this hotel from 14 to 18 AprilNew hotel in great location with attached 7 eleven and several Family Marts in very close proximity Resteraunts abound on the same street and 600 metres to Metro Subway at end of streetVery modern facilities with phone charging station and plenty of power pointsRoom size on the small size but typical of Japanese roomHas coffee facilities bar fridge and all toiletriesOnly negative comments is that the hotel seems catered for the Japanese tourist with no English speaking tv channels,Instructions for controlling the A/ C in Japanese also Don’t pay for breakfast Priced at 24AUD per person.Breakfast very basic for priceCheaper breakfasts out on the street which open at 7amWould stay again just for the location
hotelName:
10    Hotel Musse Ginza Meitetsu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The use of the space was well-designed. It's amazing to find shower and sink and toilet were all separate, not commonly found even in much larger spaces - this made everything very convenient for us.The "ledge" with pop-up outlets along the beds was very useful to place odds and ends and to charge your electronics.The hotel is close to subway stops and Ginza is considered a very safe (and affluent) neighborhood.A great value and altogether a great place to stay in Tokyo!
hotelName:
10    Hotel Musse Ginza Meitetsu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fantastic, fantastic hotel. It felt as if the room we were in was brand new, it was absolutely spotless. For the price you are paying, this room is incredible if you want to stay in Ginza. As this is Tokyo the room is obviously pretty small however the way they have laid it out it doesn't "feel" as small as it is. Everything is absolutely spotless. In terms of location this is as good as it gets in Ginza - within 2 minutes walk you are by Gucci, LV, Prada, etc.....you are in the heart of the most high-end luxury area of Tokyo.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Musse Ginza Meitetsu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Relatively new hotel with new amenities etc. Room is clean and well maintained. Small room with poor soundproof and small bathroom, will be a challenge if you are travelling with more than 2 luggage, basically you can't open up more than 1 luggage in the room at the same time. Bathroom basin is in the bedroom itself, not ensuite in bathroom - I don't like such room layout. Bed was abit hard for my comfort. Housekeeping will make it a point to leave clean towels and mineral water outside the door for you daily even when you have the DND sign on, a very nice touch. 5-6mins walk from subway, 2-3 mins walk from Ginza - great location. There is a family mart beside & 7-11 within the hotel compound. F&B outlet doesn't allow guests to dine during breakfast in bedroom slippers, its a chore and hassle. I can understand the dress code required during lunch, but I don't comprehend the requirement at breakfast.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Musse Ginza Meitetsu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We really like the location of the hotel. We took the bus in from Narita with Narita Express. We walked a few blocks and boom...you’re there. The hotel room is small but clean and cozy. Our bags was delayed from our flight and the front desk received our late bags and held it for us. We loved the 7/11 down on the first floor which make everything so convenient. The subway wasn’t far either. We didn’t have breakfast there cause we walked over down the street to Tully (Japanese Starbucks). We love walking up and down Ginza. We didn’t stay in the hotel long just mostly to sleep and shower. We were on the go.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Musse Ginza Meitetsu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A family of 2 adults and 1 Child, travelling to Tokyo every year and having stay in different area in Tokyo. Here is our thoughts.+ Great location for Metro and JR. + Good Cleanliness+ Comfy Bed and Good Shower and Bath Area.- Did not have proper Closet for Clothes, just one hanging rail with hangers.- Small room like any other hotel in Tokyo, difficult for suitcases. But Overall is good, just have to bring small suit cases. :)
hotelName:
10    Hotel Musse Ginza Meitetsu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have booked this hotel for family vacation for 3 nights, the hotel is quite new and clean, the location a bit far from the station, but it really close to Don-Quijote, a tax free shopping center.They also have laundry machine, but unfortunately because they only have 1 machine, so every time i go there, the machine always being used.But overall, its an nice and clean hotel
hotelName:
10    Hotel Musse Ginza Meitetsu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in January 2019. This hotel had everything we could ask for! It was new, very clean, and modern. The room was very spacious for Japanese hotel standards - the shower room was big and did not feel cramped at all! We had enough space to put our 3 large luggages (+1 smaller carry on) pretty comfortably in the room. Amenities provided by the hotel was great, and the washer/dryer in the lobby was very convenient to do our laundry in (the hotel TV even has a tracker to tell you if it's already in use!). Note - the dryer takes forever to dry your clothes, it took us about 3 hours total to do laundry. We got free breakfast in the hotel every morning and the food was pretty decent, despite the limited choices. There was at least enough food to get you started for the day. There are lots of restaurants around the area should you choose not to eat at breakfast at the hotel. Getting to this hotel was very easy, we took a bus from Haneda airport to Tokyo station, then took a taxi to the hotel. The taxi ride took about 10 minutes and cost around 800 yen, not bad at all! To get to Narita airport when we left, we took the Airport Limosine Bus from the Ginza Courtyard Marriott, which was about a 3 minute walk down the street. Around the hotel there are a TON of shops and restaurants, Ginza is a wonderful area to stay in! There was a 24 hour Don Quijote and grocery store about 1 block away from the hotel. Also there are 7-11 and Lawson convenience stores right below the hotel. Additionally, there are also 3 train stations within a 10 minute walk from this hotel (Shimbashi Station, Ginza Station and Higashi Ginza station). Overall, I would definitely recommend staying here, it is very easy to get around Tokyo and this hotel provides all the comforts you could need while vacationing in Japan. Staff were very helpful and friendly during our stay as well. I would stay here again!
hotelName:
10    Hotel Musse Ginza Meitetsu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location, pleasant service, but the compulsory "Chuck-out" at 10am was annoying! The room service impressed me with their daily change of Pyjamas :) I wonder who is the architect that fit all the amenities within this tiny space?
hotelName:
10    Hotel Musse Ginza Meitetsu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: New hotel, we saw it built two years back, so we had to try. We usually stay at another Ginza hotel, but this one has a 7-11 right under and Ginza Six is right around the corner. It is cheap and clean, we already have a bigger room with two twin beds, but it is not large. So if you want LOTS of shopping... you will not fit more than 2 luggages in here. But beyond that, all is good.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Musse Ginza Meitetsu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is in the quiet street with three 24-hour convenience stores, the streets around made us discovering funny things of Tokyo, and also accessible to main shopping area and many good restaurants of Ginza.Facilities was new, the room was quite small, but the bed and shower room were ideal, soundproofing was fine.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Musse Ginza Meitetsu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: rooms very small and poorly soundproofed, so that in the morning you hear the cleaning maids, especially if you stay in the rooms near the elevator where they have a compartment. The staff are a litle rude. The check-out is at 10am and they dont give a chance for a "litle" late check-out. But if you pay.....they can!!! Is it worth???? No!!!
hotelName:
10    Hotel Musse Ginza Meitetsu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I only seen the rooms and Hotel facilities here, but it is a great Hotel in such a spurb location! Staff where friendly spoken good English, and the Hotel located just a few mins from the Ginza's main street. 10 mins walk from Shimbashi Sta and Higashi-Ginza Metro Sta, close to the Kabuki Theatre also. Direct access to a convenience store on the ground floor which would make the breakfast easy and cheap. 両親の付き添いでホテル内を見させてもらいました。さすが銀座、お値段は少し多めですが、すごくきれいなホテルで、銀座中央通りから２本離れたところだし駅からも近いので良しとします。スタッフの英語対応も大丈夫でした。車いすの方も過ごしやすそうなホテルでした。カードキーがあってセキュリティもしっかりしています。７イレブンもホテルから直接いけるので楽。
hotelName:
10    Hotel Musse Ginza Meitetsu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: No adaptors and was told to buy our own.Check out at 10am (we stayed all over japan and they were 11am).Small queen bed where as we other hotels were much larger.Nuff said. Clean modern hotel in a great location in Ginza.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Musse Ginza Meitetsu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: we loved this place. close to everything in a great area. walking distance to the main shopping street with lots of label shops and an eye opener. the train station was only a quick walk away. the rooms were large, fresh, clean, tidy. comfy bed and great sized bathroom. the staff were friendly and spoke english
hotelName:
10    Hotel Musse Ginza Meitetsu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Came with my friend who had a bad cold and desperately needed a bed 2 hours before checkin . The hotel requested a 2k charge for early checkin even though the room was available and they saw my friend wasn’t well. Very inconsiderate and cold attitude which spoiled our stay. We won’t be visiting again for sure .
hotelName:
10    Hotel Musse Ginza Meitetsu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel has wonderful amenities and very comfortable bedding. You're provided pajamas, slippers, razors, etc -- everything you could need. The rooms are not huge, but they are very well laid out and the shower is very nice (it has an overhead waterfall and side jets). Our room even had a small balcony, though I don't think that's true for most rooms.The hotel is around the block from the main street in Ginza and is a short walk to a number of rail stations. We were able to take a short, inexpensive train (with no transfers required!) From Haneda airport. There's a 7-11 near the lobby for quick snacks (7-11s have a very good food selection in Japan!).
hotelName:
10    Hotel Musse Ginza Meitetsu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It’s a brand new hotel just open this year with affordable rates around the area. I’ve checked into their Musse Double Premium room and it’s very comfortable and sizable enough for me (it’s considered big comparing to some of the other hotel sizes around the same area). It a brand new hotel so everything was great. They have coin operated washing machines at level 2 if you need one.It is walking distance to central Ginza with the Don Quijote just around the corner (less than 150m) for 24hrs shopping. There’s also a limousine airport bus to and from Narita that stops at a hotel which is about 100m away, so its absolutely very convenient!
hotelName:
10    Hotel Musse Ginza Meitetsu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: we liked the room as the good space and functional and very clean.The bed and pillows r very good, staff were helpful. also, i love how u have basin in the room and seperate bathroom and toilet. BTW, the thing i think the hotel might need to provide more is washing machine and lift. i would go back if last time our room not in front of the elevator. so i think i should explore other one.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Musse Ginza Meitetsu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Its clean, its comfortable. The wifi is also good too. Toilet is clean and they have a bathtub. The staff is polite and helpful, even if they don't speak English. Because the hotel is directly above a 7-11 store, its pretty convenient for meals and snacks. it is also very near a lawson, family mart and donki store, that makes it easier to get buy souvenirs.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Musse Ginza Meitetsu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is of great value, we paid about SGD352 a night for 2 pax.. it's right in the middle of Ginza, the room was spacious for 2 person with one medium sized luggage each, the toiletries provided (facial wash, towels, shampoo, conditioner, shower gel, etc) was of good quality. The cleaning crew was very meticulous and very friendly as well. Right below the hotel was a 7-eleven, across the street was Lawson and close by was a Don Quihote and a family mart... it's also about 10 minutes walk to Tsukiji market.. but if you're looking for a more central location (connected to the major MRT lines), Asakusa might be better... but we had a really good stay here, would highly recommend this hotel :)
hotelName:
10    Hotel Musse Ginza Meitetsu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is located very near to Ginza or Shimbashi station along Ginza Line metro. Travelers can take a direct metro from Narita airport to any 1 of this station & walk about 600-800 m to reach the hotel. 1.) below the hotel is a 24 hrs 711 store. Where u can get anything there. 2.) I was greeted with extremely polite front desk staff, where they can speak very minimum English3.) the room......was compact. Built for the size of a Japanese. Comes along with a bath tub, with a chair & a scope for traditional Japanese shower if anyone could like to try. The toilet seat is located in the opposite.
