With a descent clothes hanging cabinet, with all the shoes shine accessories. There is also a low table to put ur luggage. 4.) the hand washing sink is located outside the toilet. With all toiletries provided. 5.) there is a safe & hair dryer located at the low table. With a mini fridge sit beside it. 6.) the walkway is about 1m wide, which make it very small to move around if there is 2 people.7.) the bed is located in between the 2 walls, like I said earlier, the room is really compact in this manner. But the bed is very comfortable with a small LCD tv mounted on the wall. 8.) as for the tv channels, they r all 100% in Japanese. Hahaha. Sorry for those non Japanese speaking tourists.9.) there r many nice restaurants around the hotel at a reasonable price. Well, it’s a very comfortable & descent hotel except for it small built room. Located Juz 100m away from the main Ginza shopping area. I would strongly recommend Hotel Musse to anyone who r looking a hotel in Ginza area.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Musse Ginza Meitetsu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I went to Tokyo July 2018 with my mom.I arrive at Higashi-Ginza Station and took A1 exit which is the closest exit to the hotel. From that point we only need to walk straight for 5-10 mins depend on how fast you walk. I also tried the route from Shimbanshi station but I think I took the wrong exit and walk a long way to the hotel with 2 luggage :(. So accessibility is depend on the exit you take.The location is the best. It's near the convenience store, don quijote, station, also you can go to Ginza station and to Ginza (ginza six, and other malls) by short walk through underground tunnel from higashi-ginza station. I went at summer so yeah, underground tunnel are so much better than scorching heat outside.The receptionists are all very helpful, some speak English well some don't. A suggestion, I think it's best to divide the reception for foreigner (for the one that speak English well) and local so it will be easier to communicate between the staffs and foreign guests, just like in some store in Japan that made 2 cashier one for foreigner (English speaker staff) and one for local.We stay in Standard Semi Double Non-Smoking room. The room is small but surprisingly comfortable. It is clean and well organized. Point plus I like the water pressure for the shower. There also 2 pajamas for use. The laundry facilities also one of my favorite. It is easy to use (price depends on how much your clothes are), suggestion please do check the capacity beforehand also if other guest is using the machine. I suggest do your laundry when you're planning to stay a long hour at the hotel or at night before you go to bed, bec it took 2 hours for me to finish the laundry.Overall I love my stay and will comeback here if going to Tokyo. Even though the hotel is small but I feel very comfortable, something rare I experience if staying at small room hotel.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Musse Ginza Meitetsu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 10 minutes walking distance from the Ginza metro station A2 exit. There are three (7-11, Family Mart, Lawson) convenience stories next to the hotel.Hotel located in heart of Ginza with many shops and restaurant close by. Double room have enough spaces for 2 person. Will consider this hotel again in the future.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Musse Ginza Meitetsu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel located a few blocks freom main Ginza area. Hidden 5 minutes away. The 2 Rooms that we booked are clean, but too small for 2 person with a 28” size suitecaseBe carefull of you shop and add another big suitcase, you gonna want to open it one at a time. We love the cleaning team, very meticuolous and friendly. Since this hotel is not in the Aiport Limousine bus stop (marriot hotel), you can go to and from the airport to this hotel using train. Go to the Kabukicho Theathre, at entrace no 3. You can find a direct train to the aiport. This will be easier and its a 1 train direct to airport, no need to change train. Kabukicho Theatre is a about 5-7 minutes walk. You can ask the front desk for the direction. We didnt know this route, until we asked the train station manager (even the hotel front desk doesnt know at that time). There are 3 train station nearby within 5-10 minutes walks.Other stations, you have to change 2-3 times until you reach the aiport. Other things that you can use is the washing machine. However, theres only 1 available and you have to take turns. I hope the hotel will add more machines in the near future. Below the hotel is a nice restaurant for dinner. We had a wonderful Italian meal, quality and taste worth the price. Below the restaurant is Seven Eleven shop, quite convenient to get things that you need. Overall, I would still recomend the hotel for business purpose or family with small children. For Family with teens, please book several rooms. We will definitely return to this hotel for the next visit.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Musse Ginza Meitetsu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: ROOM : 9/10-The room is not that large but it still great. (Room size is okay for this price and this location)-They'd cleaned the room daily. [I'd spent 6 nights here]-Seperation of shower room and toilet.-They'd prepared all toiletries for you so don't worried, Just don't forget to bring your clothes. [Toiletries : Towel, Toothbrush&Toothpaste, Shower Gel, Shampoo, Conditioner, Hair dryer etc.]SERVICE : 9.5/10-All of their staffs can speak English well and their action is like try to help me for everything I need.-Baggage deposit available for both check-in and check-out days. [Reservation code is required]RESTAURANT : Breakfast 8.5/10-Not that many choices of food but I think it's enough for breakfast.-Taste is not the best but okay.LOCATION : 9/10-You can walk to 3 stations which less than 10 minutes.-Seven Eleven, Lawson, Family mart are about 1 minutes walk.-A lot of restaurants around the hotel.-Tsukiji Fish Market is about 15 minutes walk.-This hotel locates in Ginza so you can shopping all the day.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Musse Ginza Meitetsu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It’s the hotel you need in Tokyo, the price is value for money. It’s small though but spotless clean. The staff is friendly and helpful. It’s a five minute walk from Ginza and Higashi-Ginza Station away which is fine. The location is in a rather upscale neighborhood. So the walk isn’t too bad. You got a few convenience stores around. I’ll be back on my next trip to Tokyo.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Musse Ginza Meitetsu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very well managed small hotel in great location. Room is small but very very well organised. The cleanest room I have seen in my life. Amenities are top quality. Lots of restaurants around at walking distance. Will definitely go back.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Musse Ginza Meitetsu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location. Conveniently located. A stone throw from the main street of Ginza . The hotel is rather new and beautifully done. Separate bath & toilet & a small basin outside. Good for business trip and nice fit for a couple. A little too small for a family, even a small one. There’s 7-11 on the ground floor that opens 24-7. Book early and the rate will be reasonable. Highly recommended.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Musse Ginza Meitetsu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was relatively new and modern. I stayed there with my girlfriend during May 2018 for 3 nights. The room was very clean and spacious. We had no trouble sleeping as the bed was very comfy and the area was quiet during the night. There are also several convenience stores located nearby which was a big plus for us as we like to go down for a late night snack. The hotel staff were also friendly and always willing to cater to our requests. A special thanks for their effort in helping us to secure a booking at an omakase restaurant 1 day in advance. That meal made our trip to Tokyo even more memorable! Overall, it was a truly pleasant experience and I would recommend this hotel to my family and friends if they are staying in Tokyo.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Musse Ginza Meitetsu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My kids and I enjoyed our stay here. It’s no frills but super clean and well located. We found the staff very efficient and kind. The location is great for exploring Ginza. We walked everywhere. Close to designer label shopping as well as the world’s largest Uniqlo store. Lots of restaurants around. The room was very, very small but quite clean and each inch was used efficiently. There’s a 7-11 on the ground floor which was perfect. For an overnight or short stay it was great and suited our needs. The breakfast was not special tho - better to grab something from 7-11 if it’s not included.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Musse Ginza Meitetsu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Normally I stay closer to the old neighborhood but for business reasons had to stay in Ginza this time.This is another top tier "business hotel" but considering the location it is a great value. I paid about $115 USD per night including breakfast. The room layout is more like a Japanese 1K than a hotel and the sink in the main room is a bit odd... That being said the full size ofuro and seperate toilet was nice. The interior sliding door to further block any noise was a nice little feature. Location is great with quick access to Ginza, Higashi Ginza, Shiodome, & Shimbashi stations.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Musse Ginza Meitetsu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is nice and modern. Safe with key access elevators. The staff, mostly, were friendly, Room is small but has the necessary facilities. The location is quiet and convenient. However, the check out at 10 am is way too early. charges 2000 yen to extend one hour. they offer breakfast but with all the places near by, we passed.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Musse Ginza Meitetsu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is only 3 star but feels like a 4 star hotel. First the hotel is brand new and you can almost smell the paint on the wall. They have all the complementery stuff like a 4star hotell water, coffee, tea etc. The room is a bit small especially since we are two persons with alot of luggage. But the room has small but smart solutions for example the shower room and toilet is seperated and you can use the hall as a part of the bathroom making the bathroom feel bigger. The toilet door can be used to seperate the bedroom from the hall. Also the room is modern in wood with tablet and new technology toilet. One of the other good thing with this hotel is the area. Really central at Ginza with all the most exclusive brands like Prada, Tiffany & co, Valentino, Dior etc around. Also subway few minutes walking. I would deffinetly stay here again.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Musse Ginza Meitetsu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We took a chance making a reservation at this hotel b/c it's brand new, and when we paid for our reservations no one had reviewed it yet -- so we were going in blind. We also got a fantastic price online because the hotel hadn't opened yet. WHAT A GREAT DECISION! This hotel is new, clean, modern, and our room was sheer perfection in terms of large size, comfortable queen bed, and nice furnishings (we even had a couch). The location was also very quick/easy to access from the airport (on the same side of Tokyo), and we had easy access to Tokyo Station (only one stop away on the JR line) when we were ready to depart to other parts of Japan. The hotel is also a close walk to Tsukiji Market, many great restaurants/shopping in Ginza, and the Shinbashi Train Station (about 10 mins), which is on the JR Yamanote line - a real cost saver if you have a JR rail pass!!!The check-in was very easy, they provided free umbrellas for the rain, and the hotel is also directly connected to a 7-11 if you want drinks or snacks in your room. So convenient! I can't recommend this hotel more. It's also very quiet. The street is a little "dead" at night, but you're just a 2-3 minute walk away from busier areas.This hotel offers very high value for the price paid. RECOMMEND.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Musse Ginza Meitetsu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect location if you want to explore Ginza. It’s walking distance to A LOT of dining choices, 7eleven, family mart, lawson. A few meters away, you will find the strip of designer boutiques - LV, PRADA, etc. Alongside flagship stores for shiseido and uniqlo. There’s also a lindt cafe nearby and don.ki if you are up for bargain shopping. The room is clean and provides all the essentials including a frah set of PJs everyday.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Musse Ginza Meitetsu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed two nights at this hotel in different rooms. Overall, a good hotel with some interesting interior designs.Location: located within 5-8 mins walk to three metro stations (Ginza, Higashi Ginza and Shimbashi), 8 mins walk to the fish market and 3 mins to Donki 24 hour store and a local supermarket. You can get to the hotel (Higashi Ginza) directly from either Haneda or Narita Airport via Keisei Sky Access without interchange.Room: stayed in both semi-double (14 sqm) and standard hollywood twin (17sqm).Definitely go for standard double or twin because it is about jpy 1000 more expensive compared to semi double. The semi double room which i stayed in was on 3rd floor (reception on 2nd floor) was facing the wall of next building (the distance from the window is probably less than 1 meter), which offers no sunlight and was really depressing. I guess i was assigned this "room" because my booking via agoda was at deep discount. It appears that most single and semi double rooms (up to 6th or 7th floor) have the view of building wall, whereas standard rooms are facing the inner street with minimum traffic.I guess most rooms (except for those on the top floor) have separate toilet room, bathroom and wash basin. Some pros and cons for this type of design. However the door which shares between toilet room and the bedroom for semi double room or the sliding door can provide some privacy if two persons are staying together.There is free bottled water (evian) provided. No cotton pad was provided during my stay (they probably think that male guests do not need cotton pad...)Most importantly, very comfy bed and quiet aircon.Services: some staff speaks English well. The hotel also helps me to keep my luggage a few days prior to check in so that i had less belongings while travelling in countryside. But they did not offer me early check in even i was staying in the hotels for 2 consecutive nights (different rooms though) even there was room available.Would recommend!
hotelName:
10    Hotel Musse Ginza Meitetsu
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: One of the best place i know !! Everything is perfect! We are in love with the staff!! The staff is really polite respectful and amazing ! The place is si beautiful ! The best thing is to have a onsen
hotelName:
11    Ryokan&Hostel Wasabi Nippori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Super cute hostel with great atmosphere and original Japanese hot bath insid. Beds have some privacy being modeled after capsule style, staff speaks English even tough not very fluent (I preferred to ask in japanese after all).
hotelName:
11    Ryokan&Hostel Wasabi Nippori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wasabi offers a very clean room. Not just the room, but the whole guesthouse. My husband loveeee the rooftop. He went there almost every night for a smoke break. The room and bathroom however is very small (but so do any others in japan, i heard). We dont hv ample space to put our luggages and stuff, but still manageable. The train station is superrrr near to Wasabi. Just 2mins walk. 7Eleven is also nearby, next to the train station. All in all, Wasabi is very convenient for us !!
hotelName:
11    Ryokan&Hostel Wasabi Nippori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A group of 3 friends stayed in a share room with private bathroom. The room was tiny, just enough room for the futons. But it was clean, modern with air conditioning. There was also a shared spa area which we used. We each paid about A$55 for 2 nights (yep that's $27.50 each per night). So if you just want a clean bed to sleep in, a communal area with free green tea and water then this is a great choice. The station is across the road making it easy to get around.
hotelName:
11    Ryokan&Hostel Wasabi Nippori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at Wasabi Nippori for three nights and I genuinely enjoyed the comfort and experience here.It's affordable, the staff is friendly & I even made new friends. In addition, it's a short walk from the train station, the convenience store and Sukiya.Keep up the awesomeness!!
hotelName:
11    Ryokan&Hostel Wasabi Nippori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wasabi is located in Nippori area which has local feeling so you can enjoy walking around. The bath, rooftop, breakfast and beer deals, privacy, restrooms, comfy bed and friendly staff really made my stay great! I look forward to my next stay!
hotelName:
11    Ryokan&Hostel Wasabi Nippori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely staffs that help you as much as they can, easy to chat with them.I stayed in the underground room and it was worth it! There's a public bath waiting for you after your cold/tiring day!My room was pretty clean, I didnt got any problems with the bed, the private shower room was clean... Everything was OK ! Just beware of late night People XD! The rooms are not sound proofed so may hear footsteps and people chatting ! Not really close to the center but the guesthouse is close enough to the train station mikawashima that is nottoo far from ueno or nippori station. You can change other there for Jr line or ginza line easily !
hotelName:
11    Ryokan&Hostel Wasabi Nippori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed 4 nights in tatami room. It was tiny. Like I know the japanese rooms are smaller but this was super small and dirty. A lot of hair from other guests in the sheets. Spent as little time as possible there. There was a drink machine with free drinks for guests but I was not informed untill I asked a staffmember ifI could buy some water. Drinks were good. The laundry machine was ok. Didn,t use the hottub. We booked a double room with no bathroom but got two bunk beds in mixed dormatory. Got to pay extra to upgrade to a private room with bathroom since the room I originally booked was unavailable. Not sure if Wasabi is to blame or booking.com or how it could happen. Not very central but there is a train station closeby if you are willing to change trains and ride for 30-40 min to the central parts of Tokyo.
hotelName:
11    Ryokan&Hostel Wasabi Nippori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed in wasabi for 2 days. I stayed in their Japanese room style.I like their location, It just 1 minute from mikawashima sta. you can find convenient store near the hostel. but the location it not too crowded like in wasabi-Osaka. the only thing I'd like to suggest is about the pillow and futton. the pillow is really hard, and the futton is really thin, so I feel hurt with my back when I want to sleep.
hotelName:
11    Ryokan&Hostel Wasabi Nippori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hostel is really nice and while its close to a JR station it is in a really quite and nice area of nippori.What charmed me from the beginning is its hot tubservice offered no restrictions (tattoos piercings, etc OK!) and once in the hostel it was amazing to see that they have elevator (not many have it) to the upper floors including to the terrace.My mother and I stayed in the female dormitory. 20 beds in a capsule style. It was really nice and the space in your own bed is huge. Downside of this is that you really hear a lot of noise if the person on the top moves a lot but is not really that bad. The door to the makeup room closes airtight so even if a hair dryer is being used inside your will not hear a thing outside. Showers are traditional style where you sit down and take a shower like that and they also have one standing shower in each floor shower room or a private shower on the 1st level.If you are staying here i really recommend you to order the Bfast with them as it´s cheap and while it might not have 100 choices, it´s a really great way to save some money on bfast and spend it on lunch outside or at attractions ;)
hotelName:
11    Ryokan&Hostel Wasabi Nippori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nearest Mikawashima station (5 min from Ueno vis Joban line)Relaxing with hot tub service (separated male and female room)All staffs can support with EnglishIt is suitable for backpacker who looking for simply hotel and value
hotelName:
11    Ryokan&Hostel Wasabi Nippori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 4 nights and it was a very pleasant stay. The guesthouse is located right next to the train station (Mikawashima), and offers a convenient route via Narita to Narita airport. The guesthouse itself is also super clean and pleasant. The capsules are spacious (some have windows) and the rooms are clean. Only downside is that there isn’t a real luggage storage area, so you kinda just find some free space at the back of the room to put your luggage. The public bath is cool, you get to have a warm ‘onsen’ bath every day after a long cold day. Otherwise, there is also a private shower on the first floor. There is a common area at the reception/lounge where you can chill, have a drink or eat. There is also a fridge if you have foodstuff needing to be kept or refrigerated.Overall, only good things to say about this place. Highly recommended if you are solo, on a budget and looking for a comfortable place to stay.
hotelName:
11    Ryokan&Hostel Wasabi Nippori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I've stayed here in the dorms before and had a good experience so decided to stay again. This time my sister and I shared a double tatami room. The futons are very comfortable but when they are rolled out there isn't much space in the room. The best part of this hostel is the public bath in the ladies' dorm which is clean and relaxing, a great way to wind down the day. Will definitely stay again.
hotelName:
11    Ryokan&Hostel Wasabi Nippori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We didn’t like much the place. It’s close from the train station, but far from the Tokyo metro station (20 minutes). The 1st floor room seems ok, but we had the basement one that was horrible. Very smelly and humid. However, staff is nice and breakfast was ok. We appreciated the free tea!
hotelName:
11    Ryokan&Hostel Wasabi Nippori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 1. clean, worth the price.2. 300 yen daily rental for a bicycle is so attractive!3. 300 yen breakfast is a good option, which could be further improved if items could be refilled for late-comers.4. no public kitchen, but no big deal in Japan which offers so many choices of food.
hotelName:
11    Ryokan&Hostel Wasabi Nippori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I've stayed here a few times now, and here are the benefits to consider:-sento-style bath - it's shared, but rarely busy-easy connections around Tokyo-awesome rooftop terrace people don't often use so it's super-chill-capsule style dormitory beds with curtains, so it's cosy and private-dormitories don't have a thousand million beds like a lot of places-staff are awesome-regular cheap deals for dormsThe only cons would be your potential neighbours - not always the finest clientele ;o)I've stayed in many hostels around Tokyo, and I say just do it!
hotelName:
11    Ryokan&Hostel Wasabi Nippori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: it is a long overdue review but I don't expect anything to have changed.I booked a private room for three nights end of December 2015. As mentioned by other reviewers most of the staff was less than welcoming. Actually quite rude by Japanese standards (and even European ones). The first room we were given was facing the station which happen to be extremely busy even very late at night with a train every 2 or 3 minutes. The private rooms are on top of the small building and those facing the train station are incredibly loud. The room was tiny even supposed to be for 3 people (Japanese style, futons). No space for luggage pretty much with a tiny old bathroom that cannot even compare to the tiny but sophisticated bathrooms you find in regular hotels. Even 2 stars ones.We ended up getting a room on the side, hence not directly facing the station but suffering from the same lack of noise insulation and decent space. I cancelled the reservation for the other two nights but the hostel insisting on us paying 50% of the 2 days we would not be in. Not nice and probably not to the letter of the cancellation policy In any case not customer friendly and definitely not Japanese at all except for the name...In summary the worst stay at a hotel (hostel in this case) ever. Far away from any Japanese standard which by the way I find absolutely amazing and above anything I have seen elsewhere on this little planet. I cannot speak of the shared space and the real hostel experience with dorms etc... but I can only strongly advise anyone tempted to book a private room to look elsewhere. At ￥12,600 a night it was a very expensive (for what we got) and unpleasant experience. We ended up booking two rooms in a real hotel in the center of Tokyo for less that the price of the incredibly low quality room that we were offered at the Wasabi Nippori hostel. No kidding. In a standard hotel chain (APA). There we enjoyed the real usual fantastic Japanese hospitality (and yes very very limited English but adorable). So clearly if you are a family and want to enjoy Tokyo and real Japanese hospitality as well as a quiet and comfortable stay avoid Wasabi Nippori at all cost.
hotelName:
11    Ryokan&Hostel Wasabi Nippori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: So, my friend and i went to Japan for 13 days and the last 3 days we spent it in Tokyo. We chose this hostel randomly, but, i really love this place. I stayed in a different places before, and this is the best. The staffs were very kind and very helpful, and they speak english really good. I was really happy to stay there, even in a mix dorm. It's all good. The dorm, the public bath, the private shower, and the lounge, all are very clean. And the JR Station is in front of your eyes, just take a walk for 2-3 minutes. Really, if i get a chance to go back to Japan, definitely will stay there.
hotelName:
11    Ryokan&Hostel Wasabi Nippori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This might be a bias review because the moment I entered the dorm room and saw One Piece themed room I was SOLD!!! I kept inner screaming like a kid in wonderland. Even the bathroom is One Piece themed I swear I could have spent hours inside LOL.Too bad we didn't get a chance to try the Ryokan inside. But overall we had a great sleep!
hotelName:
11    Ryokan&Hostel Wasabi Nippori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here alone for a couple nights while visiting Tokyo before heading North to ski and it was an absolutely lovely place to stay. Quiet safe neighbourhood with very cute alleyways that I was really happy to be able to wander around - a Japanese supermarket/shop as well as a 7/11 just around the corner and the Mikawashima station couldn't have been closer as you can see from my photo from the train platform.I stayed in the female dorm and loved the room. The little curtain gives more privacy than other hostels I've ended up in on my travels and although the capsule type beds might seem small there was plenty of space in there for me and all my luggage. 3 bathrooms in the room/on the floor as well as a female public bath which was nice and always very quiet for those who might be shy about getting naked in front of strangers - I think this would be a nice intro for travellers. There is also a private shower downstairs if you prefer.Staff were always super friendly and happy to help.The reason I chose and loved this place was because it was so convenient to the train station as well as being in a quiet area rather than in the middle of the neon signs and everything you might immediately associate with Tokyo. I did have issues getting back a night or two when I headed to Shibuya to party with some friends as public transport ends fairly early and taxis are expensive - but that's not the fault of the hostel, more my bad planning! And as I said, I did appreciate the fact it was a little further out rather with very good transport links rather than being only in the centre.Would recommend to anyone!
hotelName:
11    Ryokan&Hostel Wasabi Nippori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rooms are decent, capsule / bed is big enough and comfortable. Temperature is good. Staff is not the nicest people I have met, but they do their job. English level of some staff is really low or inexistent. Japanese bathroom with hot tub is great, but only available from 21.15 to 23.00. Only one shower available 24 hours. There many hours where staff is not there. I had an emergency with the door locked at my room, and there was no one to help. So I almost slept on the floor because I was not able to get in my room. I rang the bell several times, nobody came to help. The hotel is very very clean. The provide all toiletries and security box. Common room is very poor and uncomfortable. It is not very central but transportation for JR users is very close. Be ready for 30/40 minutes trips to go out to the central places. If you want to go out a weekend night, there is not subway or train the hostel after 12.00 am until 4.30 am, only option is taxi. A decent hostel with very impressive things, but with many basic conditions to improve too.
hotelName:
11    Ryokan&Hostel Wasabi Nippori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in this guest house 4 nights. We had a double room with toilette , anyway it was very expensive and they never clean it, not even change towels for 4 days !! If you pay for the "breakfast" the day before, you will be charge 300 instead of 500. Yes and the morning after if you want coffee you need to pay 100 more. So what's the point. I recommend you to do not pay for breakfast but go to the 7 -11 next door (cheaper and better) it was too far out as well. The main train station, nippori , was 20 mins walking. I'm not coming back here for sure.
hotelName:
11    Ryokan&Hostel Wasabi Nippori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We really enjoyed our stay at Guest House Wasabi and thought it was great value for money in a city like Tokyo where accommodation is really expensive.The location is great - it is literally right next to a JR station, which has good links with the rest of the city and the airport. We stayed in a mixed dorm and were really happy with our cubicles, which were spacious and gave a good degree of privacy.We didn't get a chance to use the public bath, but it is a nice added extra, and the private shower is powerful with plenty of hot water.Breakfast cost an additional 300 Yen each, but was pretty good.All in all a great stay!
hotelName:
11    Ryokan&Hostel Wasabi Nippori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is great, right next to a train station. Facilities are great, I love the public bath with the hot tub.However the best part is the hospitality! The staff are so nice! And the common room is quaint so I made many friends while staying thereI've stayed here for about 3 weeks in total over the past two years
hotelName:
11    Ryokan&Hostel Wasabi Nippori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent 7 nights at this property. LOCATION:Situated a corner away from Mikawashima Station, it’s just one stop from Nippori on the Yamanote Line, which is all the typical tourist will need to get to almost all of Tokyo’s sights. This makes it very accessible not only from Narita or Haneda Airport (via Keisei Line or Shinagawa/ Hamamatsucho for the latter) but also for travel to/from Northern Honshu due to the proximity of Ueno Station.The neighbourhood (Arakawa) around the hostel is a working class district that lacks the “bling” of more posh areas like Shinjuku, but is quiet and safe, and allows more reasonable rates due to the lower property values. There are plenty of places to eat and buy supplies (a pharmacy and convenience store are close by) and because of the hostel, store clerks are more or less used to dealing with tourists who don’t speak the language. CLEANLINESS/FACILITIES:A stickler for cleanliness, I could not find much fault in this place at all. Any mess made by guests would be cleaned in a reasonable time. As for facilities, locals say that this establishment used to be a public bath (sento). Ergo, there are 2 segregated baths- men in the basement, and the women on the 2nd floor. Those uncomfortable with these arrangements can use the private shower at the ground floor, which always seemed unoccupied every time I was there. The green shower gel supplied at the baths smells awful though, so you might want to bring your own, but I used it every time for a whole week and it worked fine.SECURITY:Access to the dorm areas are protected by a code lock. However, this is the type of hostel where luggage is kept at an open rack in each dorm. Only 13in x 16in x 22in (like small 300 yen coin lockers) and mailbox size security lockers are available near the reception for a Y500 deposit, so this might be a problem if you need to secure a lot of high value items or do a lot of shopping. The fire exit at the basement dorm is also a potential security risk. There (may) be a possibility someone gaining access and walking off with luggage unnoticed (not sure if there’s a camera monitoring the area). Same thing goes for shoes which left at shelves near the entrance. Not surprisingly, disposable slippers kept on fish “hooks” at my sleeping pod (free, from a business hotel previously stayed in) disappeared on the third day, but I didn’t bother to report it, due to the negligible value. As with all shared accommodations though, it’s important to always be vigilant with your own belongings, and signs posted by management constantly remind guests to do so. CONCLUSION:Definitely a pleasure to stay at, with friendly, multilingual staff who ran the place like family. They might even show you around town, or share a beer with you (if they’re free). Hostels are supposed to be sociable accommodations, but this place is a cut above the rest. The whole experience was more like staying at a friend’s house rather than as a paying guest.No qualms about staying here again; I even booked their sister property for my next trip.===Note: This report's intentionally written 3 months after the fact to maintain an impartial/fair review.
hotelName:
11    Ryokan&Hostel Wasabi Nippori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I totally recommand Wasabi guesthouse ! Staff is amazing, beds confortable and in a japanese style. It is very clean and the location is really good for JR line, and 15 minutes walk for a subway line. Thank you so much for everything !
hotelName:
11    Ryokan&Hostel Wasabi Nippori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed in Guest House Wasabi twice during my trip in Tokyo. The hostel is in a good location with just a minute walk from JR Mikawashima station. Convenient stores, drug stores and restaurants are a few steps away. The room was tidy and clean, bed was comfortable, Though it's a small room, there are enough space to open the luggage. Wifi was sometimes unstable but overall it's acceptable and not a problem to me. Staff was very nice, friendly, helpful, and can communicate well in English. The hostel is valued for money.
hotelName:
11    Ryokan&Hostel Wasabi Nippori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: i stayed 7 days in Jan, 2016. Reasonable price and comfortable room.room was pretty clean and staffs were all kind and friendly.i stayed in semi - double room, so it was great to enjoy my own time and rest.
hotelName:
11    Ryokan&Hostel Wasabi Nippori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had a great stay in Guest House Wasabi and managed to make new friends. Just 2 mins walk from JR Mikawashima station, so it's very convenient if you have a JR pass. Otherwise, a 15-20mins walk to the nearest metro station would do. Staffs were friendly, helpful and approachable. Most importantly, they can converse in English. Lots of convenient store nearby. Besides, they provide free miso and beverages. If I ever come back to Tokyo again, I'll choose to come back and stay in GHW!
hotelName:
11    Ryokan&Hostel Wasabi Nippori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very friendly staff that spoke excellent English which helped us a lot! Onsen bath was lovely after long days of walking. They had a lot of fun activities as well and a delicious breakfast for only 300yen. Free WiFi and snacks/drinks was great! We had a private room Japanese style and it was perfect for us. Thank you Guest house Wasabi!
hotelName:
11    Ryokan&Hostel Wasabi Nippori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The place is Nice, clean , well located, Nice beds, a lot of restrooms always clean , good and cheap breakfast, free tea an coffie. But the staff are great! Kind and helpfull. My backpack was Lost on the fly and the staff help to contact the airline and airport to help me to bring my backpack!
hotelName:
11    Ryokan&Hostel Wasabi Nippori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place is a gem! 10 out of 10! I stayed at 3 hostels in Tokyo and this place is by far the best. yuki, yuri, mio, Okazaki (the staff) go above and beyond in creating an unforgettable hostel experience. If you're looking for a social environment this is your place, but the wasabi also has unmatched emphasis on personal space.
hotelName:
11    Ryokan&Hostel Wasabi Nippori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Next to mikawashima station. From Tokyo please choose line with direction to mikawashima not nippori. Right when train JR stop you will see the view of wasabi. Clean and staff are helpful and friendly no matter what your nationality.
hotelName:
11    Ryokan&Hostel Wasabi Nippori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in Japan for 4 weeks and our first hotel was Guest House Wasabi. The dorm we stayed in was really clean and organized. The matras was good and you didn't feel like sleeping on a wooden floor at al (compared to hostels we stayed later during our trip). The general area was inviting and it gives a good opportunity to meet other travelers. For the men there is a bathhouse in the basement of the hostel which is just awesome and very clean as well!The staff is really really nice and more then willing to help you discover everything that Tokyo has to offer. They even arranged for us to be able to go to the sumo-wrestling tournament. It was only after we left Tokyo that we found out how special it was that we were able to see the tournament.So be sure to ask the staff about all the things you can do because they are more then willing to help you.
hotelName:
11    Ryokan&Hostel Wasabi Nippori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was the perfect place to get my bearings in Japan. The staff are more than willing to help and become like your family, the space makes it ideal to meet other travellers and the traditional style beds and onsen made my Japan stay incredibly authentic! I will definitely be back.
hotelName:
11    Ryokan&Hostel Wasabi Nippori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place exceeded my expectations. Pristinely clean and well organized, attractive, warm interior. Comfortable bed (I was lucky and got a dorm all to myself). Reasonable price with breakfast included. Nice staff. But most of all I couldn't get over how nice the inside of the hostel is. So attractive and comfortable! Also there are curtains surrounding the beds for privacy. Awesome wifi.
hotelName:
11    Ryokan&Hostel Wasabi Nippori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Super Clean. Family room and the dorm are very comfortable and cozyVery convenient. 200 mtr to train station. Among Malaysian tourists favorite spot. Simple but nice breakfast.No second thought for choosing Wasabi Guest House again.
hotelName:
11    Ryokan&Hostel Wasabi Nippori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for 16 days in total. The capsules are very spacious, clean and comfortable and really great vibe around the place. Everyone is happy and willing to chat and have fun. The staff are fantastic and helpful. They can recommend/arrange absolutely anything you need. They always organise events and cultural parties which are great fun. I cannot recommend this place enough! It's in a great location. Very well communicated with Jr line which goes to all major tourist attractions, but also quite enough to be able to chill and avoid the chaos when wanted. 10 out of 10! Thank u wasabi!!
hotelName:
11    Ryokan&Hostel Wasabi Nippori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very happy with my stay here. The capsules are relatively roomy and at 186cm tall I did not feel cramped at all. Bathroom and shower facilities are top notch and the staff are friendly and attentive. Good location as well, right next to a JR line station and only a 10 minute walk to Nippori station where you can get trains on the Yamanote line.Would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
11    Ryokan&Hostel Wasabi Nippori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here Friday night through Sunday morning, and we couldn't have asked for a better place for a short stay. There are men's and women's areas that are separate which was nice, and the "capsule" was pretty spacious and clean. It is really important for me that the places I stay in are clean, and this place was very clean - from the shared space to the capsule to the shared bathroom. I didn't try the public bath, but I'm sure that was nice too :) They also have a "secret room" in the women's area that has hair dryers, straighteners, toothbrushes, q-tips, etc, and you can borrow towels, etc for pretty cheap! And there is a subway stop literally right outside the hotel, which happens to be very close to the line that goes to all the main spots! Really a great place for a short stay!
hotelName:
11    Ryokan&Hostel Wasabi Nippori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Firstly, I was travelling on my own and had no idea what to expect when I got here. I was welcomed by staff who were fluent in English (Some can't really speak English, but this is Japan). It's a guest house with clean capsules (Private rooms for those who wish for more privacy and also a female-only dormitory) and meticulous staff who clean them every time a guest checks out. The large public bath/hot bath are downstairs and is a great way to wash your woes and relax. There's also a private bath for those on the main floor for those who need that little bit of privacy. Right after a bath, you can sit in the lounge and get to know the staff like I did (They're really friendly. Just strike up a conversation and before you know it, you'll be talking the night away). A lot of the other guests relax in the lounge as well and tend to be friendly - friendly enough to talk to other guests. It's an experience that doesn't occur often, but it does here. If I had a chance, I'll definitely be booking with them again! All the friends I've met here, both guests and the staff are people I won't be forgetting anytime soon~
hotelName:
11    Ryokan&Hostel Wasabi Nippori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed there three nights. Staff is friendly and the hostel is very clean. Had a bed in the female dormitory. They have "japanese style" mattress, so it is a little hard if you are not used to it, but hey! it is part of the experience ;) but you can ask for a mattress for free to put under the matt, it helps. So many nice details (free coffee and tea the whole day, free cosmetics, clothes iron, hair dryer, adaptor free of charge to borrow, etc) was pretty cool.Thanks Wasabi staff for a great stay! :)
hotelName:
11    Ryokan&Hostel Wasabi Nippori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was there for 5 nites & I have enjoy every single day/nites while I were there. The staffs were helpful & cheerful. Complimentary coffee, teas & miso soup were the value added features at this pleasant hostel. Very convenient to near by action packed areas of Tokyo plus the quiet / real Japanese lifestyle surrounding this hostel are the valuable benefits. I'll come back to stay there again before leaving Japan on this 2016 trip and also in the future.
hotelName:
11    Ryokan&Hostel Wasabi Nippori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hostel is a real cool one to stay at. At first, I was kinda intrigued, because of the location, but when I arrived it was good to see the JR Mikawashima station as a 5-minute walk away. Well, the staff was really nice and lovely, especially good was when they went out with us for karaoke. They had everything there and the interior looked really great and cosy, it was even ok that there was only one real private shower and I showered every day for the 7 days I was there. And they have free, unlimited miso-soup, tea, coffee!! Totally recommend the hostel, its one of the best for this cheap price.
hotelName:
11    Ryokan&Hostel Wasabi Nippori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location is really good, juts 2 minutes from MIkawashima station on JR line. Very close to Ueno for Ueno Park, Ueno Zoo or shopping at Ameyoko, as well as Nippori for textile shopping. These two are also main interchange railway stations either for Tokyo or Narita, Due to proximity to the train station, some noises from rail are expected. It didn't bother us but may bother others who are sensitive to noise or lightsleeper.We stayed for one day in a western style double private bedroom with ensuite. The room is good size, considering its in Japan, clean and has all basic amenities. In our opinion, our experience may be better if there are more hook or place to hang our clothes, wet towel etc. Another thing is, the carpet could be deodorized since sometimes it smells of rotten socks. The check in and check out process were good and efficient. Free green tea and miso soup are available in their kitchen, as well as being allowed to use their kitchen amenities such as microwaves etc. We didn't try other facilities such as spa etc.We had good and relaxing time, and recommend this place if you are looking for not too expensive place close to a JR station.
hotelName:
11    Ryokan&Hostel Wasabi Nippori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Strategic location is for JR Pass holder, the hostel is close to the Mikawashima station (2 station from Ueno st.). The room was clean with some bathroom amenities (such as lotion, cotton buds, etc.) and hairdyer.You can get free hot tea/coffee anytime, especially after strolling down in the city on the low temperature.And, I love the breakfast; consists of bread/toast, egg, fruits, and onigiri.
hotelName:
11    Ryokan&Hostel Wasabi Nippori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff was always kind and friendly. The facilities themselves were clean and fully functional. Sleeping quarters in the mixed dormitories were large enough to kneel and freely move around without feeling too cramped. Depending on the other guests the noise level was pretty low with the powder room door being soundproof (I was assigned the capsule right next to it). In the mix dorm there is a small space outside of the capsules in a shared area where you can stow luggage, that being said the capsules themselves have no trouble accommodating an average sized person + luggage if you feel insecure. In the common area on the ground floor there was a miso soup dispenser that my friends and I made us of to warm ourselves up in the mornings, and if you weren't feeling particularly savory then there was also a hot/cold tea/coffee/water dispenser directly next to it along with a micro wave. There are towels provided for a fee of 200yen if you do not wish to bring your own. If you don't think a shared bath house is something you'd enjoy then there is a private shower stall you can use, but it is rather modest in size. Free wifi on every floor that I had no trouble connecting to and was pretty stable for streaming purposes (didn't try any gaming). There is a 711 literally around the corner as well as being located <1minutes walk from Mikawashiwa station. Over all my friends and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would gladly come back again if we ever end up in Tokyo.
hotelName:
11    Ryokan&Hostel Wasabi Nippori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is my second time staying at the Wasabi with a group (total 20 people). It's a great place to stay, easy to find from the JR station, clean, quiet, great staff, and very comfortable. Very quiet part of Tokyo with a genuine Japanese feel to the neighborhood. I'll bring my next group to the Wasabi Guesthouse to stay. Many restaurants in the area within easy walking distance.
hotelName:
11    Ryokan&Hostel Wasabi Nippori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is my fifth times to stay here. The guest house is really good, very close to JR (1 mins walk required only). It is pleased that the the room in the ground floor has been designed for a sitting room instead of mix dormitory. It will be good if you could open the bathroom in the early morning.
hotelName:
11    Ryokan&Hostel Wasabi Nippori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed with my famiy(3p.) in japanese private room. The guesthouse is very close JR Station & easy to find something for meal. Staff very nice,the room is great but toilet just a little small.If I travel in tokyo, will absolutly stayed this place again.
hotelName:
11    Ryokan&Hostel Wasabi Nippori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here over 2 years.First time, I was visiting Japan for 1 month, and stayed here 2 weeks. It was really great first time.2nd time, I got a working holiday visa for Japan. I lived in this hostel for 2 months!I visited 46 countries, but, definitely, this is a special hostel! I will never forget it.Now, they are starting to have parties, so, I can still visit every 2 weeks (I have my own apartment now).Anyway, it is really cheap (for Japan I mean), clean, staff are great etc. They are really friendly, so, you can meet them, hang out with them etc.Capsules etc are really nice (it is a pretty new hostel, it was a hotel, and got new owners and became a hostel, 2 years ago). They have normal couple rooms upstairs too.Location is good. 1 minute from Mikawashima station. Mikawashima station is like 2 minutes from Nippori. Nippori also has the best restaurant in Japan (Zakuro).This hostel has Japanese style stuff, and western style stuff. Lot`s of Japanese stuff for sale or just to play with for free.They got computers too, and some kind of drink machine with free soup and tea etc. Oh, and they have a huge TV.
hotelName:
11    Ryokan&Hostel Wasabi Nippori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Super clean, comfortable and convenient. The guesthouse is extremely close to mikawashima station and the staff are incredible. All the amenities and facilities you could need. The common room wasn't often used in the short time I stayed there.
hotelName:
11    Ryokan&Hostel Wasabi Nippori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Guest House Wasabi is located just 100m or so from the nearest station. It has comfortable rooms for a short stay. Stayed in the western style couple room and it turned out to just enough for the night sleep. Stayed here for 2 nights.Seven11 is 50m away. Wifi is available.
hotelName:
11    Ryokan&Hostel Wasabi Nippori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything was clean, private rooms are small but they have all the necessary things, location is perfect , only 1 min from train station and is not expensive m, I stayed in dorm capsule style and those are okay, cheap and clean, only for woman
hotelName:
11    Ryokan&Hostel Wasabi Nippori
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed four nights. Only negative for us is the small size of the room. We had to take turns opening suitcases and dressing. Otherwise, the room was spotlessly clean, the amenities were generous, there is a refrigerator, it is quiet, and the air conditioning works well and is easily adjustable. There is a coin laundry and microwave on the second floor. The laundry is not expensive. The staff is very helpful and they speak English very well. The breakfast is amazing. The western choices are limited but good. The Japanese breakfast could just as easily be lunch or dinner with all the different foods they offer. It is about 3 or 4 minutes walk from the Asakusa station. Next time in Japan, I would stay here, just pack less junk.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Hokke Club Asakusa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed for 4 nights during Golden Week period, and I was very comfortable with my stay here.The Hotel is within walking distance to Asakusa station, which is passed by Keisei Access Express.If you are bringing your luggages, you can use the elevator exit A2-b, then crossing the street to reach hotel.I booked a Single Room and the room size seems to be standard of a 3-star hotel, however the room is very clean and comfortable.The amenities are good enough for me, and there is also air humidifier provides in the room.I tried the breakfast on second day and varieties of food are okay, mixed of Wester and Japanese cuisine. Taste is also good, though not the best. You can purchase the breakfast coupon from the reception desk.The hotel staffs are polite and very helpful during my stay.Laundry and dry cleaning are located on 2nd floor, as well as microwave and ice machine.Overall, it was very good experience for me as a first timer in Japan, and staying in Asakusa area is convenient and enjoyable!
hotelName:
12    Hotel Hokke Club Asakusa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I like the hotel for some reasons first of them that finally i found good billow to sleep in japan and the breakfast was good The English problem seems to be general at Japan as most of people can not help you But at the end the hotel was so clean and staff are polite
hotelName:
12    Hotel Hokke Club Asakusa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for three nights last week. This is certainly going to be top of my list, they have spacious rooms , breakfast had many options , walking distance from Asakusa template and underground station. Smokers need to walk 10 mins for nearest smoking zone. Hotel staffs were courteous and always happy to help.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Hokke Club Asakusa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location is really good. Near Senso-ji temple. By metro (10 minutes walk) you can easily connect to Ueno Park, Ginza and Shibuya. From Ueno (1 metro stop) you can take Shinkansen (Nikko, Kyoto, Kanazawa, Narita by Skyliner).Hotel is very clean and quiet. Staff is very friendly and helpful (but sometimes English is a barrier).Very good rate quality-cost.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Hokke Club Asakusa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is not the most ideal. It is very far away from the main tourist spots like Shinjuku and shinbuya - about 45 mins using the efficient subway. It’s about 350 meters to the kuramae and Asakusa stations. The Ginza line Asakusa station is about 850 meters away. There are not many eateries within the vicinity. A convenient store is located only a few hundred meters away. It is however quite convenient to get to Narita Airport from the hotel (Asakusa Line : use exit A2b if you have luggage, otherwise use exit A3a) pl note that this train WILL not run if there is snow! I was unfortunate that the train did not run when I needed it. So I had to use the Skyliner to Ueno station and walked a few hundred meters to transfer to the Ginza line. From the Asakusa Station, it’s another 850 m to the hotel. The room is quite clean but the cleaning lady always left dirty cleaning cloth in my room. It happened on 2 days out of 8. I have stayed in very small rooms before in Tokyo but Hotel Hokke Club takes the cake. You can’t swing a cat in the room. I had no interaction with the staff except during checkin and checkout. The staff very quite friendly except for one bespectacled male staff who was on duty on 10 Feb at about 6.15 am - he was very rude. His rude behavior was downright obtrusive. I think that at this price point, there are definitely better options in Tokyo. After my 8 nights stay, I was bemused by the positive TA reviews. I’d have rated this hotel much higher if it was my 1st time in Tokyo but having stayed in several other hotels before, Hotel Hokke Club does offer a good price to value ratio.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Hokke Club Asakusa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed in this hotel for a week during my Tokyo trip. Their service is execellent. While the room may be small, it is good enough to meet my requirement. I enjoyed the breakfast very much. Every morning, I look forward to have breakfast for a good start of the day. The food is tasty and has good variety of selection.I will stay here again.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Hokke Club Asakusa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: So there is no pool, or spa, or restaurant, so this hotel will never officially be five stars. But in every other way, it really is impeccable. The staff are friendly and helpful. My room was smallish, but I've had smaller even in France. Here there was a queen bed, good size bathroom, and space at the foot of my bed to open my very large suitcase. The breakfast is incredible, both for the quality and the variety - in two weeks I never ate exactly the same thing twice. Finally the ease of access by direct train from Narita aorport with lifts/elevators from track to street. After that, the hotel is less than five minutes from two stations, Asakusa and Kuramae so anywhere in the city is never more than half an hour away. Highly recommended, would definitely return.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Hokke Club Asakusa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed in the Twin Room which is 30sqm and what a steal knowing room sizes in Japan like this is hard to come by in this price category. Clean, comfortable and walking distance to 7/11, Lawson and Family Mart which is plus point. Also close to Asakusa and Kuramae station. Getting here was simple with direct access from Narita and then taking the elevator at subway exit across the road. Staff always friendly and helpful. It’s in the little touches: We got fresh towels even when we had “no housekeeping” sign up. Definitely coming back for our next trip!
hotelName:
12    Hotel Hokke Club Asakusa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was the perfect hotel for my wife and I last year. The staff was incredibly friendly and everything was nice and clean. The location of this hotel was good too, close to metro stations and even Bandai-Namco buildings which had really cool things on display!The rooms are small so if you're looking for western style spacious rooms, you might not be thrilled. Our room had a twin sized bed, and the room was about twice as big. But, it has its own bathroom which was our biggest concern, so it was fine. There is even a vending machine with beer on the main floor!There is a laundry facility on site, however there are only a couple machines so it was tough getting time in to our laundry. Still, for the price, not a big deal at all.We would love to stay here again!
hotelName:
12    Hotel Hokke Club Asakusa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Some people may baulk at the small rooms but they are well designed and perfecty adequate. Breakfast is terrific, location (close to Asakusa Station) is excellent and staff are polite, attentive and efficient. Just fine for tourists. Highly recommended.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Hokke Club Asakusa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed in three different hotels in Japan and the room at Hotel Hokke was the smallest. It was fine since I was simply looking for a comfortable place with an advantageous location. I don’t know how comfortable it would’ve been for a couple staying in the small room. The location was fine as it was close to a couple of subway stations. I like that it was a tiny bit away from the tourist locations as it was quieter, but some people might be uncomfortable coming back super late at night.I don’t think that the breakfast is worth the cost. It’s probably because I’m not a big breakfast eater in the first place, but I thought that it was fairly expensive, even for a buffet. Every lunch and dinner meals I are cost less than the breakfast.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Hokke Club Asakusa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had reserved a huge room, and indeed, it was huge. Great spot, near the metro and asakusa is a great neigbourhood. Go shop behind the temple, and have a curry nextdoor.At night the temples are well iluminated and save to visit
hotelName:
12    Hotel Hokke Club Asakusa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is located not very far from Senso-ji temple, Asakusa and Ginza subway line and also very near to Bandai Building. It is very accessible to many other attractions. The staffs are very friendly and accommodating. The service is excellent! The rooms are very clean and comfortable. The house keeping is excellent as they keep the room clean with fresh towels every day!! (I stayed there for 5days!!) Breakfast was awesome as they have Japanese and western varieties. The plus point is that they do provide extra amenities such as facial masks, bathing salts, moisturising lotion and bath towel!!!
hotelName:
12    Hotel Hokke Club Asakusa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is my second time staying here..Pros :+ Location near than Asakusa subway station and Kuramae station+ Cleanliness room and well maintenance Cons :- Hotel surrounding a bit quite, where it can be advantage for some people
hotelName:
12    Hotel Hokke Club Asakusa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for five nights on a solo trip. The room was small, but perfect and very comfortable for one person. Everything was very new, very clean, and the bed was very cozy. The hotel accommodated my request to be on a higher floor and the hotel staff were very welcoming and kind. The coin operated washing machines and dryers were much appreciated, although I had to run the dryer quite a few times to get everything dry. While this hotel is not in the trendiest area of Tokyo, it is close to several major tourist attractions, such as Senso-ji Temple and the Sky Tree. The area seems to consist primarily of office buildings without much of a nightlife, however, the area just west of Senso-ji Temple was bit more lively, and only about a 10 to 15 minutes walk away. There were several 24 hour restaurants and 24 hour Don Quijote that came in very handy for some last minute midnight shopping. It was also nice to walk along the Sumida river which was just a couple of blocks away. I also appreciated that it was very easy to catch the train to Nikko from Asakusa station, which is a short walk away from the hotel. Additionally, Shibuya and Shinjuku, were still easily accessible via metro in about 35 minutes.Getting to and from this hotel from Haneda Airport was also very straightforward as you’re able to ride the Keikyu-Kuko Line, which turns into the Asakusa Line, all the way to the hotel without any transfers.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Hokke Club Asakusa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed with my sister for 6 nights in Hotel Hokke. The room was comfortable and comes with kettle, TV and fridge. Aside from towels, they also provide traditional sleeping garb which they replace every night or whenever they clean the room. Staff are helpful, accommodating and can speak English. This hotel is a 5-minute walk from the Asakusa station, which will connect you to almost all metro trains in Tokyo and airports, both for Haneda and Narita. Walking distance from Hotel Hokke is the Sensoji Temple and the Tobu Asakusa Station - which is a plus if you're planning to visit Nikko for a day.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Hokke Club Asakusa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for 6 nights with my partner. We were in a small double room. It was very comfortable, with kettle, fridge, TV, and air purifier. The bathroom was great, with a shower with fantastic water pressure. It was very quiet, I don't think I ever heard another person save for a cleaner in the hall once or twice. There is coin operated washer and drier that helped a lot. The curtains were black out, and the room was very dark and quiet at night. My only problems was that the room got very warm, especially for October/November, and the air got a bit too dry. There was also no safe in the room. The room was quite cramped, but we did ask for a small room, so that was to be expected. It was also great value. The staff were very helpful, spoke English, and we were able to check out 2 hours late for 2000¥. Highly recommended!
hotelName:
12    Hotel Hokke Club Asakusa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We chose this hotel for one night because of its location as we wanted to be within walking distance of a station from Narita airport (5 minutes) and the Sumo arena (20 minute walk). The staff were friendly and spoke good English. The room was very small but clean and reasonably priced for the area (did not include breakfast). The bed was a large twin and quite hard, which was ok for one night for us a couple but not comfortable enough for a longer stay. We consider the room would be ok for a single traveller but too small for a couple, you would be tripping over your bags, we had to put them in front of the closed door of the room.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Hokke Club Asakusa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Definitely would stay in this hotel again and recommend to others. Subway is only a 5-10min walk away from hotel and Sumida river, a must-go Asakusa market and restaurants are close by. Breakfast is fantastic and is ideal for anyone who wants to experience Japanese food culture. Our room was cosy double room and the only negative thing about our stay was that there wasn't any good storage in our room.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Hokke Club Asakusa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked through Expedia good deal for single room & breakfast. Chose location as good access to Narita airport from nearby Asakusa subway on Keisei express.Location is a business area about 10 mins walk from touristy area near Senso-ji temple and Sumida river. Also close to Toei Asakusa mainline station and 2 subway lines so easy to get around.Hotel is so clean and quiet and usual Japanese efficiency.Small single room but immaculate and comfy bed with good bathroom. Very good wifi in room. TV only had local channels and CNN in Japanese only.Best part of staying here was the incredible Japanese buffet breakfast, easily the best I had in 3 weeks of travelling around Honshu island. So much variety and delicious.Also whole hotel is non-smoking which is excellent.Plus free toiletries for women to restock if you like.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Hokke Club Asakusa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Highly recommend Hotel Hokke Club Asakusa. Location: 10 mins walked from all type of Asakusa station/Asakusa temple. Breakfast: Many choices and great setting for business people/family or solo tripStaff: English/Chinese speaking staff. All of them are so helpful and friendly. I kept my luggage the day before and felt so welcomed. Room Size: Twin Room are suitable for me, my husband and my daughter. The child policy is under 6-year-old is free charge for the room+breakfast. Room Setting: Wonderful room design. I have counted there are 13 plugs to use wherever you sit or need. Housekeeping: Clean and comfortable. Tip: If you stay for 2 or above nights, you can book one night without breakfast to explore outside local breakfast.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Hokke Club Asakusa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I highly recommend Hotel hokke club asakusa. From the moment I checked in the hotel made a wonderful impression. The staff were friendly and welcoming.Near 7-11,near metro station. Free face masks, cleansers, moisturiser, bubble bath and muscle herbal patches.Breakfast is nice ... Room clean. High recommend.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Hokke Club Asakusa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I highly recommend Hotel hokke club asakusa. From the moment I checked in the hotel made a wonderful impression. The staff were friendly and welcoming and the hotel was beautiful maintained. The room was small, but perfect for me as I was travelling on my own. It was immaculately clean and well appointed.The perfect touch was coming back to a table of complimentary beauty products at the end of the day -Face masks, cleansers, moisturiser, bubble bath and muscle herbal patches. After a day exploring the streets of Tokyo - this was certainly a relaxing way to recharge for the next day!
hotelName:
12    Hotel Hokke Club Asakusa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great Location. Good breakfast. Rooms are tiny which is to be expected. The bed was very comfortable and the amenities in the room were great. Staff are very friendly and try their best to help. Located next to a 7 Eleven which is very helpful. Will definitely be back
hotelName:
12    Hotel Hokke Club Asakusa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Hokke Club Asakusa is a fantastic place to stay in this part of Japan.Located only about 7 minutes easy walk from the famous Sensoji Temple and large markets, and restaurants, this modern (April 2017) Hotel has very friendly and helpful staff and really can't be faulted, except for the fact that the rooms are small. This is typical in Japan, but ideal for a short stay. Trains are nearby and will take you anywhere you want to go. Downtown Tokyo, Shinjuku, Akihabara are all just a short train trip away, even the train station to Narita Airport is only about 200m from the hotel.The journey to Narita takes about 50mins at a cost of about $15 to $17 Australian. The train to the airport runs about every 50mins.NB. The room we chose was very small, but I believe they do have larger rooms at an extra cost also.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Hokke Club Asakusa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at Hokke Club Asakusa total 9 nights (On 08 - 17 Apr 16). I really appreciated :).Staff very nice, The room quite small but very clean and convenience.There is closed to subway (Asakusa Line exit A1 and Ginza Line exit A5)Everything very perfect!
hotelName:
12    Hotel Hokke Club Asakusa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room is really small but surprisingly sufficient. There's a ginormous air filter that you will think that it's a side table. I prefer taking the Kuramae station than Asakusa station as there is a big 7 11 store along the way. I won't recommend the breakfast though.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Hokke Club Asakusa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is in the asakusa district at few steps from the Metro Asakusa and the beautiful Senso-Ji temple.Very gentle and friendly staff but unfortunately none of them was fluent in English, therefore it's been hard to communicate.In terms of cleanliness I can't complain but the bathroom without window had a very bad smell.The bathroom itself was very small but with a bathtub.The room was minimalist, more or less 9square meters, probably even less.This means that with two suitcases it's been hard to move.Breakfast probably was ok for Japanese guests, but the international one was quite basic.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Hokke Club Asakusa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very satisfied with this hotel which was located near Asakusa station (walking distance around 10 minutes). Convenience store (FamilyMart) was located around 5 minutes walking distance from hotel. Quiet surrounding, walking distance to the famous Sensoji temples and Asakusa happening area.The room was small but comfortable enough for 2 of us. Good selections of breakfast buffet, offered Japanese regional cuisine and western cuisine. The bed was comfy, we have good sleep in this hotel.Definitely will come again.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Hokke Club Asakusa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I loved staying at this non-smoking hotel. Spotless, new rooms and a very nice staff helped make my solo trip to Japan unforgettable. They even gave me an ice pack after I sprained my foot walking around Tsukiji. Another time, after I set out to start my day, they chased me down the street with an umbrella because they saw that I didn't have one! Very sweet people! Also, a 5-10 minute walk to two train stations, Senso-Ji Temple, and Nakamise shopping street. Asakusa is nice and quiet at night, which I liked. I would stay there again in a heartbeat (and I probably will if it's available the next time I book a trip to Tokyo). If I could give them 10 stars, I would.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Hokke Club Asakusa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I love this hotel I was more than 30 day on japan and 15 days at Tokyo, I was on this nice hotel on march 1 to march 8 2016, I really recomend this hotel It's very nice located on Asakusa you can go wherever you want on Tokyo you have at least 300 or 500m the main station Asakusa you can take a train to go Nara, Nikko, Narita... The service provided by the staff is wonderful, they are very attentive, cordial and speak very good English, they are always ready to support you for what you need.I try to get more days on this hotel on my last 5 days on Tokyo but was full, I recommend 1000% you will not regret.Definitely on my next trip to Tokyo and with this chain of Hokke I will stay again.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Hokke Club Asakusa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was in a good location (close to major subway lines), and I could walk to lots of interesting places. There weren't many great restaurants around, but that's not the fault of the hotel. The room was just for me, so it was a very small single - but it was clean and comfortable. It was a bit annoying that I arrived about 30 minutes before check-in time and they made me wait, but I found that was common in Japan.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Hokke Club Asakusa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked a double room and it was amazingly BIG especially for a hotel room in Tokyo. No fuss, modern and very clean room with all basic necessities such as hairdryer, kettle, fridge, air purifier etc. Besides, the hotel was also generous about providing facial products such as cleanser, lotion, moisturizer and even facial masks, and the hotel staff encouraged you to take as many sachets as you please, I felt so welcome! Last but not least, the design of the bathroom and bathtub is really neat and efficient, and the view from the room is thumbs up!
hotelName:
12    Hotel Hokke Club Asakusa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 6 days with a kid. While room was typically small, it has all the amenities one would need. They give out free facial wash and relaxing sheet, good for sore feet and back after a day of touring and endless walking. Budget-friendly and the staff were accommodating, they speak good english. You may leave baggage without extra cost. Very near the Asakusa Station with direct access to and from the Narita Airport. 7-11 and Family Mart are just a 5-min walk. Tip: From the Asakusa Station, use exit A2, there's an elevator there so you wont need to carry heavy luggage going up and down the stairs at exit A1. You just have to cross the street to get to the side of the Hotel. Since the room is small, big luggages may not fit if you open them at the same time.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Hokke Club Asakusa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is near toei line from airport .Room is quite tiny but cleanliness. The staff is very friendly ,we can deposit bags before check in time. It'ok for stay alone or couple with small size room.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Hokke Club Asakusa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very helpful and professional staff. Courteous and accommodating. Rooms are clean, modern with electrical outlets along the bed, desk. room is a kettle for tea, but they do not have coffee - no matter, as there are two convenience stores with minutes (7 Eleven and Family Mart). Did not try the breakfast, but it appears very good with a nice restaurant setting. The hotel is modern and clean and the rooms are nicely appointed. The bathroom is a Japanese style - toilet separate, sink separate and a lovely Japanese shower and soaking tub. There is a washing machine and dryer on the second floor. This is a Japanese hotel - not a foreign chain. Great hotel and great service.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Hokke Club Asakusa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I've stayed with my husband and it was exactly what we were expecting.Keep in mind this is a Japanese style hotel: small bedroom, even smaller bed ( my feet hang out of the edge of the bed) and almost no place to leave anything.If you are going to spend most of the stay out of the hotel, as we did, this is the place to be.Really close to the Ginza and Asakusa line, and easy to move around.No noises, comfy bed although small, and really helpful and kind staff that solved all of our doubts and questions, all speak english very well, which is something to take in notice too.They provided us of extra plugs, pillows, and hangers when needed.If I have to pin point something bad, is that there is really no place to store anything in the room and no safe, and for two men who stayed for ten days in a room, we were only given the smallest closet with four hangers, which was ridiculous as none of our suitcases nor clothes fitted there.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Hokke Club Asakusa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We chose Hokke due to the: (a) real estate; location; good choice of Japanese breakfast; option for late check-in. On these counts and more (great bath-room and living area), it didn't disappoint. Typically small bedroom, but having a living area compensates for this when you are staying for more than one night/have more than one person. Good linen, nice service, and 'ladies amenities' (code for 'bath salts and face masques' - guys, just ask for them).Oh, and a great Japanese breakfast.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Hokke Club Asakusa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for four nights, and would definitely stay again. The hotel has been renovated fairly recently, and everything is fresh and modern. The single room was compact, as is typical in Japanese business hotels, but it was comfortable and had everything I needed.
