There is also a very useful coin laundry in the hotel, costing 200 yen for a load.The location is fantastic, close to Asakusa and Kuramae stations, thus providing easy access to many areas of Tokyo, and both Narita and Haneda airports. It's also convenient for wandering around the sights of Asakusa.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Hokke Club Asakusa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was well priced. The double bed is smaller than most people would be use to but it was not a concern for us. The room was clean and comfortable. The hotel was quiet, the staff were helpful and looked after our bags on the last day so we could go sight seeing before our flight. The location was good - 10 minutes to shops, restaurants and sight seeing, and 5-10 minutes to the subway (depending on which line you want). Asakusa is a very good location for travellers regardless of where you stay. We enjoyed our stay here. We did not use the restaurant during our stay.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Hokke Club Asakusa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Despite the size of a room, Hokke club is a very nice hotel. They have good facility and professional staffs. Also it is the only hotel that ever give us a onsen powder, I found that very cool. Location is convenient, but if you have JR pass, this is not a hotel for you since there is no JR line passing this area, you need to take subway to Ueno every time you wanna go somewhere. But overall, it is a high quality hotel with reasonable price in Tokyo.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Hokke Club Asakusa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Near Asakusa Station, Clean,Perfect StaffI like the location cause it so near to sensoji temple,Tokyo Skytree, and it near to Asakusa Station. It was a perfect place for travellers whom want to enjoy the night view around Sumida River I need cameback agian.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Hokke Club Asakusa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Myself and two friends stayed in the Hokke Club Asakusa from the 2nd-6th April 2016. I established through some research that Hokke Club seems to be a national Japanese chain, and based on the price we paid I assumed the chain was a Japanese equivalent to Premier Inn or Ibis, so I was expecting something basic, but I was pleasantly surprised by the features of the hotel.Arrived late in the evening after 18 hours of flights and train hopping from Narita to Asakusa. Got lost at first but once you get your bearings you will find the hotel is ideally situated to reach Asakusa metro station (to the north) or Kuramae metro station (to the South). The complimentary wifi in the hotel is fast and easy to connect to.Staff were courteous and spoke very good English and check-in was quick and efficient. My friends and I were scattered over different floors, so I can only comment on my room which was in on the 8th floor. The rooms are compact, though I have heard this is the norm in Tokyo. In my case the bathroom was immediately to my left on entering the room and the single bed was just beyond the bathroom on the left, slotted neatly between the back wall of the bathroom and the window. In the "corridor" leading to the bed there was a rail with some hangers for clothes (no space for wardrobes!) as well as some traditional sandals slotted into a rest near the floor. You also have a traditional robe provided.On the right wall of the sleeping area was a small but functional wall mounted TV and below it a decent sized desk with a built in multi-functional charger (better equipped than most economy hotels in the UK/Europe!).The bathroom was also compact but functional. The toilets come with the infamous "control panels" which if you're unfamilar with, I will leave you to discover yourself! The bathroom provides a wide variety of complimentary toiletries including large dispenser bottles of shampoo, hand wash and shower gel and a hair dryer is also provided. The one thing I can't comment on is the food as my friends and I tended to eat out every day. There is a 7/11 store 5 minutes walk away which is ideal for grabbing a quick snack in the morning. And there is a variety of good restaurants in and around Senso-ji temple about 10 minutes walk North. Overall I had a great stay in the Hokke Club Asakusa and would certainly stay there again.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Hokke Club Asakusa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms are very small, but still there is all u need. They even provide you with a japanese style pijama. Staff is very friendly and helpfull. And breakfast is very good if you like to explore some jp stuff. Of course there is bread and coffee as well.Location is top for shopping in the streets as well as sightseeing temple and skytree.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Hokke Club Asakusa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is tough to give this location a numerical rating. For my needs this trip it was a 5 star. 2 blocks from subway, great "locals neighborhood" Very clean, modern room and building; however it was very small. My single room was 12' x 12'. The other rooms have to be bigger. The only amenities in the hotel were a laundry and a breakfast buffet. The buffet was about $11 USD and was very good (Japanese breakfast). I would stay here again even with my girlfriend. The price/value was very good. The kesai train from NRT stopped at subway 2 blocks from hotel
hotelName:
12    Hotel Hokke Club Asakusa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel has a very good location in Asakusa close to two subway lines. We took the train from Narita airport and it stopped at Asakusa station about 55 minutes later and then it took us five minutes to walk to the hotel. There are several convenient stores close to the hotel. Asakusa is a nice part of Tokyo and there are several restaurants in the temple area.We stayed in room number 1111 on the top floor. It had a small separate sleeping area with TV and a small living area with a sofa for two, a table, a fridge and a TV. The room was very clean. The breakfast was good with many Japanese specialities. There was also a limited choice of western food. The staff was very kind and polite and had a good knowledge of English.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Hokke Club Asakusa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: For such a high priced room, I expected at least a decent one but was very disappinted. The room didn't even have enough space to lie down my one luggage so it was hell trying to take stuff out of it on a vertical position. The expensive, high class look that this hotel has on it's outside is totally deceiving. Never going back there again.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Hokke Club Asakusa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It's close to Asakusa temple and sumida river. Family mart isn't far from the hotel so you can walk about 1 min. Althought,the room isn't big but it's too clean. You can should that you wanna clean your room or not .If i go tokyo , i will book here again.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Hokke Club Asakusa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is very close to the Asakusa subway station, about a 5 minute walk, or from the Kuramae station which is also served by both the Asakusa Line and Oedo Line, again about a 5 minute walk. Check-in was fast and the staff very friendly and helpful. The hotel lobby is well appointed and reflects the simple Japanese flavor. There are 11 floors to the hotel, mine was on the 11th and had a nice view. Rooms are sound proof and I heard no noise from the hallway or from outside. The room is small, clean, comfortable and has all the amenities one needs. Flat screen TV, free Wifi, small fridge, well appointed bath room. The bed was extremely comfortable. Breakfast was included in the room rate and had a huge variety of foods, many Japanese specialties as well as western food. There are also washing and drying machines located in the hotel. You absolutely can't go wrong staying at this hotel. Forget the American chains which you find in every big city and immerse yourself in a traditional Japanese hotel. Simple, peaceful, enjoyable with all the modern amenities.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Hokke Club Asakusa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had previously stayed at this hotel twice when it fell under the Chisun Hotel Group. It was a good hotel then if only for it's location and comfortable beds.Now, however, the hotel belongs to the Hokke Group and it is an absolutely great hotel for the above reasons and the fact that it feels like a much more expensive hotel than it is. The refurbishment is amazing! The decor is modern and very clean.The rooms are small, as to be expected for a Japanese business hotel, but they are spotlessly clean have everything you could possibly need. There's nothing better than getting back to the hotel after a long day of sight-seeing and having a long soak in the deep bath.Staff are friendly, speak a good level of English and will do whatever they can to help you.I can't rate this hotel highly enough! I have stayed in 6 different hotels during various trips to Japan and this is by far the best one.The great thing about this hotel is that, if you fly into Haneda Airport, the hotel is accessible via the Asakusa Line. It takes about 40 minutes and once you reach Asakusa station you go up to ground level and the hotel is across the road and a 3 minute walk away.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Hokke Club Asakusa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is very new. I had a single room which was small but perfectly functional. Perfect soundproofing, slightly hard beds, but all other amenities good. Located near two subway lines and on direct jr line to Haneda so access all around Tokyo is good and fast. Note that this is in a quiet area out of the main parts of Tokyo. There are few restaurants or night life in the immediate area (which was fine for me), would need to walk up to the middle of Asakusa about 10 minutes away. Didn't try the hotel breakfast so can't comment on that. Hotel staff very pleasant.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Hokke Club Asakusa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A great hotel, located in Asakusa, near Kamonarimon gate (just 5 minutes by feet). Perfect connection to the Ginza lina and to the Asakusa line. Quiet and so friendly. The staff was very very kind and helpful. My single room was quite small, but perfect just for myself. I had also got the breakfast, very complete with also some sweet food (as westerns prefere). Clean, quiet and brand new. Fully working wifi in room and restaurant.An excellet solution for live in Tokyo.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Hokke Club Asakusa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a five night stay in late December here. Everything is a-ok at this hotel. Staff is attentive and friendly and there is always someone on hand who speaks good enough English for those in need. Booked the biggest room, the twin, and it was perfect for 3 guests. We never felt cramped and the layout of the room, while different, was sufficient. The breakfast is wonderful here, highly recommend it. Vast choices of both local as well as western cuisine. The staff was more than accommodating when we asked to leave our bags at the front desk area when we checked out on our last day as our flight was not until later that night (we were wondering where they out all that stuff as we were not the only one's doing so!). In sum, I'd give this place 6 stars if I could! Asakusa is a terrific area. The location of the hotel is in a quiet part of town with the main area of shopping and the temple being a 6-8 minute walk down the street. There is a 7-11 and Family Mart close by to purchase water and other goodies (tip: 7-11 has a spectacular selection of food to-go and they will even warm it up for you - this ain't your local 7-11 with old hot dogs turning on that warming machine) and an ATM that will work with a US ATM card (Plus symbol).
hotelName:
12    Hotel Hokke Club Asakusa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is modern, very small rooms.It's literally based in the centre of the redlight district.I had my father a pensioner with me and my son who is six.We went for a morning stroll to witness drunks and people sitting on the floor eating food.I felt so bad about it, because of the Olympics they are building up loads of new hotels in the small spaces they have.If you are into walking around be careful, you'll see things you don't want to see.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Gracery Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in the Godzilla Room for one night while we were in Tokyo as a request of my boyfriend and we loved it. It surpassed our expectations, beginning with the gifts we got at the front desk (each of us got a goodie bag) to the spacious size of the room and to the fun surprises littered in the room that both fans and non-fans would appreciate. It's a cool, kitchy thing to do and any Godzilla fan or film buff would enjoy. The area it's located in Shinjuku is also very close to various fun activities - Robot Cafe, Cat Cafe, shopping, train station.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Gracery Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a hotel in a great location. I read the reviews and people need to do their research on Japan. Rooms are small. Beds are small. This isn’t USA. So the size of the room shouldn’t be a reason for a bad review. The rooms are clean and service is good. For me, beds were a little hard, which is not what we experienced in Kyoto. The location is excellent for access to the train station, restaurants are open late and it s close to subways. For what we paid, totally worth it. Not a 5 star hotel, but not a Motel 6 either.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Gracery Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: VERY SMALL BEDS AND ROOMS, FAMILIES TAKE A NOTEWe had booked Double Room for 2 adults and a 11 y. child for one week via Ebookers that said the room could be occupied up to 3 persons. When we arrived we just laughed and thought there has been a mistake, room had 140cm wide bed with no extra bed. Room was so small that an extra bed would have not even fit in the space that was left. And after the normal amount of luggage, all the floor space was taken. Website states that the room is about 16m2 but the bedroom itself was about 4-5m2 as large part of the space was consumed by relatively large bathroom and a long corridor. When we stated the issue at the reception, they informed that HOTEL DOES NOT HAVE EXTRA BEDS at all. Even us 2 adults had trouble sharing the 140cm bed together, let alone with an extra child. We asked why they make reservations for 3 persons when the room has no space to commodate 3rd person, we were told very blatantly that this is a business hotel, not a family hotel. There was not even extra towels etc for a third person. We asked to be moved to a larger room, that could be done for extra price that we then of course had no change but to pay. The bed was 160cm wide but still no extra bed/ convertible sofa etc. as hotel has none. WE HAD TO GO AND BUY A MATTRESS OURSELF and one of us slept on the floor. This should not be something that happens in 4 star hotel. We also had to go and ask for third set of sheets for the mattress EVERY DAY seperately after cleaning. I don’t know if it’s a cultural thing but I was quite taken back by the fact that when trying to solve this matter, there was no trace of empathy or apologies by staff dealing in this matter. In fact, I felt like our problem was a nuisance and not theirs to solve. We were told that we were not promised an extra bed, this is a business hotel, that we should go and solve this matter through our travel agency. We did not ask for refund or discount, nor a free upgrade. We just wanted a room fit for 3 people to sleep and stay. We were of course disappointed and unhappy with the situation, but not at any point rude or inappropriate towards the staff. I would like to add that we had friendly help with the case of lost luggage at the airport from the hotel staff. I felt service was generally happy and helpful in regular matters.Our new room was located in 20th floor. Still you could hear trains, ambulance sirens and traffic suprisingly well to the room through the night.Location is superb, everything is just outside of the hotel, and Shinjuku station is within a short walking distance. Breakfast was very good and well organised even at rush hours.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Gracery Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel rooms very small. check in and out efficient, food in restaurants passable, very good breakfast buffet, no complaints here, Ok bar for a drink, staff very helpful, pillow menu, pretty good value for money
hotelName:
13    Hotel Gracery Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I'm not much of a complainer, but this experience was not great. We arrived an hour before check in and were looking to shower after an overnight flight and were told to come back later to check in. The building is literally a skyscraper there are really no additional rooms ready? ok, whatever..returned later and asked if they could call ahead to a restaurant in Osaka that speaks no english and make a reservation for us, as we were headed to Osaka next, but the consierge gave us some crap about them not being able to make a reservation on our behalf..hmm..isnt that the job of the consierge? just do it man. called our Osaka hotel and they did it for us no problem.The rooms were the smallest rooms ive ever stayed at in my life, and i frequently go on cruises. I thought oh maybe this is just how japanese rooms are, but the next 4 places we stayed at were all substantially bigger.Lastly, our room was located right next to the godzilla so if we tried to take a daytime nap (with our jet lag) we would be awoken on the hour to hear the fake godzilla let out its roars.Great location in shinjuku but man they could polish a lot of stuff up. i'd stay at a less touristy hotel and something with better service in Shinjuku if i could do it all over again..
hotelName:
13    Hotel Gracery Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean tidy hotel with a reasonable bar. Didn’t try any of their food offerings. Check-in/out was very efficient and we could buy our metro 24 hour pass from reception.Rooms are small but no different to the other hotels we stayed at whilst in Japan. Great shower!!This hotel is right in the middle of the very busy Shinjuku area, surrounded by arcades, shops, bars and other less desirable establishments. If you don’t like busy streets, this probably isn’t the hotel for you but then again, good luck finding a quiet street in Shinjuku ;-). Couldn’t hear any noise up in our room.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Gracery Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We reached the hotel on a rainy evening, Front Office staff offered to wiped all our luggage which were soaking wet. Thanks to the staff working on 10/6/19. Our room was small as expected. The view from room was good, managed to see the whole town. Close to all eateries and the hotel has a few washing machines and dryers to wash our clothes. Distance to the trains were not close. Overall, a nice place.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Gracery Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were a bit overwhelmed when arriving in Tokyo! We chose Hotel Gracery based on reviews and location. The hotel us located just a 7_minute from Shinjuku Station. There is also a bus at the hotel that travels around Shinjuku for 100 yen. it will take you to Shinjuku Station where you can catch various trains and buses. Everyone has been so helpful in giving us directions for trains and buses. There are so many stores and restaurants within walking distance. We found it quite funny to see Godzilla on the hotel terrace when we arrived! The lobby is welcoming, and the room is comfy and very clean. We looked forward to coming "home" each night after our busy, adventurous day! Be sure to walk to the Metropolitan building for a free, fantastic 360-degree view if Tokyo!! Hotel Gracery was a good choice for us!
hotelName:
13    Hotel Gracery Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Pretty good hotel. Great location, lobby is on the 8th floor. You got KrispyKreme or 7-Eleven downstairs... cinema on the same building.... they even got ladies only floor for ladies traveller... (feel safer I guess)... basically a hotel located in an area that never sleeps. Shinjuku station is like 700-800m away walking distance. Gets you so many places. The breakfast buffet was great but prefer grab something from convenient store like Lawson or Family Mart. They have laundry room so for extended stY, no need to bring lots of clothes... (300¥ for washer, 100¥for dryer... soaps are automated dispensed). Pretty good 4 stars Hotel
hotelName:
13    Hotel Gracery Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Putting the "No clean up today" notice outside the door resulted in a bag of fresh towels being left hanging on the doorhandle outside the room but no making up of the bed, etc - exactly the opposite of what we wanted. To be eco-friendly, don't change the linen and towels unless requested, but DO clean up!
hotelName:
13    Hotel Gracery Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Truly great hotel! Excellent location, small rooms that have all the comfort and anything you might need while traveling. The service is very good. Have to mention two people who went way beyond their duties to provide superb customer service and helped with several issues. Itaru Yoshida Yoshi and Pritiz Dangol both in concierge service. Thank you guys for making my stay so much more pleasant and easy.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Gracery Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: rooms are good they provide you with everything but the beat part is the Godzilla if your lost just search for the Godzilla on the hotel and LOCATION IS AMAZING CLOSE TO EVERYTHING AND STATIONS very happy with this choice staff are great and you will not regret your choice
hotelName:
13    Hotel Gracery Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nicknamed Godzilla hotel standing in the middle of the Kabukicho, the oldest entertainment area of Tokyo turned the busiest tourist area. You would have difficulty to choose a restaurant as there’s just hundreds within your proximity! The hotel was hugh so you could expect heavy traffic at the lobby on the 8th floor, but they are very efficient so check-in check-out are very smooth. But you can feel the hotel staff always seems to be in a hurry, and answer your questions sometimes without really listen to what you ask! Shinjuku area is really big so there’s a “WeBus” running around the area, which is really nice for foreign visitors.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Gracery Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at Hotel Gracery with my 2 kids and it was awesome. My elder daughter loved the HUGE GODZILLA out in the balcony esp when it roars with water misty shooting from its nose and mouth. Loved the friendly staff. They were very helpful to us esp with tips and guides. The room was neat and tidy. We had ordered a baby cot and noticed it wasn't there. On enquiring was told that it was landed to someone and we'll get it the next day. We didn't make any fuss and said all good and went back to our room, then nek minute they sourced a baby cot for us and were very apologetic. They approach kids and babies is very different. Also smiling and talking to kids and telling the kids stories about the Godzilla. The housekeeping were just AMAZING!!! We also came back to a very neat and tidy room. The hotel is located close to many shops and malls. Felt safe and enjoyed our stay at Hotel Gracery.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Gracery Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was very centrally located, very close to the station and restaurants. The location is definitely the best bit. There was a cheap Japanese fast food place across the road that was perfect for breakfast.It was very clean. Nice to have a bath. The rooms are tiny. I think best for one person. Two was a squeeze.Recommend for location but if you want space this isn’t the hotel.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Gracery Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in Hotel Gracery for 8 nights, on the top floor (30th storey) in a double room with 2 big sized beds. The 2 beds were bigger than a super single, but smaller than a queen. But they were just great for my family of 2 adults and 2 kids, and the room is spacious compared to a typical Tokyo hotel room. Love the bathroom which comes with a bathtub, and serves as a full wet room. Separate toilet room, and wash basin is outside the bathroom.Inner partition seperator for the bed/tv area vs the bathroom/ toilet area.Location of the hotel is fantastic. Minutes walk from JR Yamanote line and Metro, and there are underground linkway with shopping and restaurants. There were 2 convenience stores downstairs (7-11 and Lawson station). Lots of restaurants that open way into the night, and the area feels very safe even at midnight. Oh and of course the huge Godzilla head that makes navigating back to the hotel from the street super easy. Just look up and search for the godzilla head. Great breakfast options - 2 choices everyday, either at the lobby lounge on 8th floor for sandwich buffet, or at level 1 for the full buffet option. Both are fanatstic.Will stay here again!
hotelName:
13    Hotel Gracery Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good things - clean, safe, lots of restaurants around for food options, very centrally located. Staff spoke English reasonably. Things that made it not a 5 star review - rigidity, and bathrooms. Rigidity because it led to not keeping a guests needs in focus. Example, running late to an event, had a small bag (size of a notepad from shopping, check in and concierge/bell desk is on 8th floor, however they do have a desk on the ground floor where entrance is. Asked staff if they could either keep it there until I returned or have it sent up to room. Answer was a resounding “no, we do not have this service”. Asked another way (as I thought maybe language was a barrier and she misunderstood), no “we cannot do that, you will have to ask at 8th floor”. Then went to 8th floor and asked 1 of the 3 bell staff standing around and they were very Accommodating. Would it have been so hard to fulfill a customers request? This was one of a few instances. The concierges were a little inept, u able to give guidance to restaurants or attractions (saw this with myself and others while I was waiting in line to speak to them.). They are helpful to execute booking something if you know what you want. Secondly, I was sharing a room with my teenage son. Being a woman, and his mother, obvious privacy issues with showers etc. Delays twin room was spacious for a room In Tokyo, however, unless I wanted to get dressed in the wet shower room (you will come to understand this if you stay in Japan), where there aren’t even hooks to hang a towel, I was forced to come out into the larger room (full view) wrapped in a towel to try to get dressed in front of my son. (Don’t even really care about the optics, just physically uncomfortable trying to not drop the towel while putting gitch on). Can’t imagine if I was on a work trip with colleagues or friends and sharing a room. Oh, and no private space, business center. Only lobby where if you need to have a private conversation you will be sharing it with everyone else around you. Overall good hotel, I would stay here again, just very clear now on what to expect and who to bring.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Gracery Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent hotel - great location and very decent standards a true 4 star. Right in the heart of Shinjuku’s Kabukicho Area that I choose to explore for its shopping, food and neon-lit night life. The area never seems to sleep and the hotel is a good sanctuary when you do want to rest within walking distance of all of Shinjuku’s highlights.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Gracery Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Happy to say that our double room did have enough room to swing a cat (in a humane and safe way). Comfortably furnished and surprisingly quiet given the hotel was full, we enjoyed our stay in the throbbing fun centre of Shinjuku. Yes, the bed is pushed against the wall making egress for the second sleeper a challenge but again it's fairly standard in Japanese hotels. The room had the normal multifunction toilet and a shower head positioned over the bath. I did appreciate the complementary bottled water. Dining and (adult) entertainment options abound nearby. The Godzilla theme is a good laugh but also a great and easily seen landmark. Public transport very close.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Gracery Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: really enjoyed this hotel. it offered little things like a free hotspot/smart phone that I'm using now to write this review. also has a washing machine room on site so it saving you alot on luggage. the walk is a short 10-15min on relatively flat surface to the hotel from shinjuku station.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Gracery Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Hotel is well located near to railway station Shinjuku and rooms are in comparison to others larger. Restaurant is not recommendable. Breakfast is good and have many variations of food. Service is excellent.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Gracery Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is in a great location in the heart of Shinjuku.It has a Godzilla on the side of the building that roars and blows steam on the hour which is quite cool. The rooms are very clean and a bit small ,but it is Japan.Bed was a bit hard for our liking but okay for a couple of nights.Rooms have a safe for your valuables, mini fridge and air con works well.The hotel is within walking distance to Shinjuku subway station but also has a shuttle bus that runs often.to Shinjuku station.If you have suitcases this is a must.cost is 100 yen each.The hotel is very close to Robot Restaurant,Golden Gai and other attractions.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Gracery Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is situated in the heart of Shinjuku. An ideal base to explore the area.The room as usual was clean and comfortable with air con. It has five power sockets and one USB socket, a kettle, trouser press, mini fridge and a safe. It has a free mobile phone in the room for guests to use. It was also nice to see the toilet rolls are two ply!! Japanese staff as always are friendly, helpful. Most of the staff speak English!If you like Godzilla, this hotel has a Godzilla head at the Reception level. It roars and spews out steam every two hours! Great fun and photo opportunity!
hotelName:
13    Hotel Gracery Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is in great location in the middle of the Shinjuku area. Surrounded by the crazy nightlife and many, many thousands of people. Its a few minutes walk away from the Shinjuku railway station so there is easy access to all of Tokyo and further afield.The staff are wonderfully helpful and the rooms perfectly clean.Our only criticism is that the room was very small (but I guess you get what you pay for) and both my wife and myself found the mattress and pillow to be incredibly uncomfortable
hotelName:
13    Hotel Gracery Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel and very clean in the heart of Shinjuku! If you want a western style hotel in one of the busiest areas of Tokyo, go ahead and book this hotel. It’s very new so it is very clean however, be prepared for the small room size. I thought I was prepared but it was still shocking! You’ll be in the midst of a crazy nightlife with easy access to the train station. Plenty to see and do here!
hotelName:
13    Hotel Gracery Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location in Shinjuku. Staff are friendly, great service. Rooms well looked after, everyone goes out of their way to hep you. Short walk to all the action in Shinjuku. Entertainment, rail, eating, its all there just outside the front door.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Gracery Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect location, close to Shinjuku station and area with lots of day and night activities and restaurants. The hotel is actually the hotel attached by Godzila - the famous Godzila head is on the 8th floor where is the reception.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Gracery Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very friendly and helpful staff. Double room is just that. A double bed in a v small room. 1 drawer. 1 narrow short seat and a small shelf. Nowhere to put luggage. Wi-Fi OK. Non smoking room very clean. Included breakfast is worth it.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Gracery Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We really enjoyed our stay at Hotel Gracery. The service from check-in tp check-out was excellent, from the front desk staff to the concierge. They were always willing to assist. Our room was on the 26th floor with an amazing view of Tokyo. We had a deluxe twin room which had plenty of space for our family. For those of you wondering if "twin" means North American "twin", the answer is "not quite". We found Japanese twin beds to be a bit bigger so that they can accommodate families better. The separate bathroom with soaker tub was also a nice feature!There are a number of restaurants at the base of the hotel, including an excellent Italian restaurant. Show your hotel key and you get access to a special pricing menu. The food was very good and we went a couple of times. There are too many other restaurants to count in the surrounding area, everything from traditional Japanese food to a McDonalds.One of the best features of the hotel is the location. it is a 6 min walk from the train station that gets you all around Tokyo. There is a nice Samurai Museum right behind the hotel. The area has a very active night life and while it is considered by some to be a "red light" district, we didn't find it to be seedy. There are plenty of locals and tourists around, no one bugs you (especially if you are with your significant other or as a family) and it felt VERY safe. I would definitely stay here again. And yes, kids love the Godzilla at the top of the hotel!
hotelName:
13    Hotel Gracery Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Recently traveled to Tokyo with friends, and we decided to stay at the Hotel Gracery in Shinjuku. My room on the Ladies Floor was small but comfortable and perfect in every way! The bed was spacious and the room layout was functional. I was glad that there was a pillow menu and I asked for 2 extra soft pillows, which were eagerly provided.Being on the ladies floor meant that we had a steady supply of mini presents like facial & hair products and a foot massager, among other amenities. I enjoyed the bathroom! There was a separate room for the tub and shower area. Customer service was great! Staff were so polite and tried to address all concerns, no matter how minor. There was a vendo machine for drinks and an ice dispenser on the floor, which was convenient. A very nice touch was providing a smartphone with wifi in each room, which we could use when we ventured out.We enjoyed meeting up at the hotel lobby, with a balcony where we saw Godzilla every day. When we venture onto the streets, Hotel Gracery is right in the middle of Shinjuku, very near Ichiran Ramen, Coco Curry, and Don Quixote, among others. It is also a comfortable walk away from the JR Station. Can't wait to be back!! Thank you, Hotel Gracery!
hotelName:
13    Hotel Gracery Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our 1st time in Japan and was excided to stay here after all the recommendations & it didn't disappoint!The room was small but we were expecting that . However it was designed to make best use of all the space available. Godzilla was great & I love my little snow globe I bought there as a souvenir. The food served really nice food and it is a great location. Would DEFINTETELY stay there again.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Gracery Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel could not have been in a better location. It's within a short walking distance from Shinjuku Station and close to the bars, restaurants, and nightlife. The Robot Restaurant is only about a block away too. The room was pretty small, but clean and comfy with a great sized bathroom. I'm a solo female traveler and I felt completely safe here. I would definitely choose this hotel again!
hotelName:
13    Hotel Gracery Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel was in a great location amongst all the hype of Shinjuku.There were amazing restaurants/cafes literally right underneath the hotel building and in the surrounding areas. The station was a short walk away, which is ideal in Tokyo, as we used the train a number of times a day.Only downside are the rooms, as they are quite small, however I am hearing this is pretty typical for Tokyo.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Gracery Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 4 nights , the hotel is located in the middle of all the mayhem of Shinjuku , however it remains aloof of it and is actually very classy inside . We stayed in one of the superior comfort rooms (2501)The room size was very reasonable considering this is Japan. The view out of the windows is interesting to say the least and makes a good photograph on its ownNoise insulation I found to be absolutely excellent from outside your room and from the floor above , we heard nothing. There is low level street noise which is to be expected in this area but trust me of very low level and no concern .The only weakness to the whole package was the bed which were on the firmer side, the pillows were also firm and the quilt was not sumptuous. Had it not been for this I would've given the hotel 5 Stars.The hotel service is absolutely excellent, the massive reception area has an air of class. The concierge service is very helpful. There is an in house laundry room which is well stocked out with modern machines , it's an excellent idea and we used this facility and I strongly recommend you do the same, you enter a PIN number on machine so no one can take your clothes in your absence .You will always be able to get a taxi from the hotel , we did on several occasions, make sure you have a hotel card to show a driver for your return journey as the taxi people do not speak good English .You are a walking distance with your luggage from Shinjuku station (10minutes approx) , make sure you exit from the central East at stationShinjuku (the area) is like staying in a cross between Soho / Piccadilly Circus in London, or Times Square New York . However unlike either of those it's completely safe to walk the streets at any time of day or night. Would I stay again, I wouldn't even look elsewhere, this is a truly excellent hotel with just the one weakness which I hope they rectify
hotelName:
13    Hotel Gracery Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is convenient to Shinjuku station, shopping and restaurants and was fairly easy to find. The double room is very small but the bathroom was spacious with a separate shower and tub. The services offered were stellar. They give you a handy phone to use during your stay. They let us borrow umbrellas and let us store our bags for a few hours after checkout. The coin laundry on the 8th floor was easy to use and convenient. We grabbed breakfast from the 7-11 located right below it every morning. Even though the hotel is located in the Kabukicho (red light) district, we never felt unsafe. The Godzilla show runs for a couple minutes every hour from noon-8 pm each day and we could hear it in our room on the 13th floor. It wasn't too distracting though.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Gracery Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was clean, well-managed, and helpful staff. The hotel is located in a neighborhood with many good bars and restaurants. The rooms are very small. However, it is in the heart of the red-light district, because of this I probably would not choose to stay in this hotel again.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Gracery Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect location, close to subway and many restaurants around. The rooms are small but that’s common in Japan, everything was super clean, great staff. There’s is a movie theater in the same building, we went to see a 4D movie and was great.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Gracery Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My family of three was in the smallest room I had seen in Japan. We had to keep our suitcase in front of the door. The bathroom was very nice with an onsen. However it seemed like a strange use of space since it was huge compared to the sleeping area. The wi-fi was very weak. I was not always able to connect which was frustrating. The location was in the middle of it all. I wanted my child to see the action in Tokyo, but definitely prefer other areas in Tokyo. She loved that it was the Godzilla hotel.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Gracery Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a little trouble finding the hotel as the sat  nav was playing games but actually it is very close to Shinjuku station East exit.Very nice hotel. Good amenities within the hotel and also in good proximity to dozens of good eateries on the streets.The public areas are light and spacious and the staff are all incredibly welcoming and friendly. The room was very small and not much clothes storage however this is the norm in  Tokyo and we managed perfectly fine.Space had been prioritised to include a very nice in room onsen with deep bath and wet room floor.  We really appreciated this after a few days hard sightseeing and it really helps to relax the muscles. Bed was comfy and we both slept very well.There is  novelty value in the large sculpture of Godzilla on the roof at the 8th floor. He roars and breathes smoke and fire on the hour from 9.00am to 8.00pm each day which is available to all guests.  You can see him from the street if you look from the right side!A great base for exploring the Shinjuken Gyoen National Gardens and close to the trains to get to Ueno park in Tokyo and further afield.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Gracery Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here last February for 4 nights before heading to Kyoto. The hotel is situated right in the heart of the city and I loved the landscape window they have in the room. Room is quite small for us a family of 3 but manageable. I loved that house keeping would leave a bag of fresh towels and amenities when we forgot to remove the ‘dnd’ card at the door. There are a lot of places to eat at right below us and a supermarket as well. Their staff were polite as well who assisted us at check-in, stored our bags as we went out for food because we arrived early. — Would highly recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Gracery Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Unremarkable hotel in the center of Shinjuku, centrally located, however, I would prefer to stay elsewhere next time. Good breakfast selection for those who has it included, we did not and had to pay out of pocket. Decor is tired, bathroom not updated, rooms have narrow windows, no special touch. Concierge desk is busy, we had to wait 40 minutes to ask a simple question. Not good value for the money. Some streets near the hotel are very dirty and have homeless people - the only place we saw them in Japan.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Gracery Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Getting a hotel in Tokyo around cherry blossom season can be very challenging. I wanted a hotel close to a JR train station and isn't hard to find. I have stayed in Shinjuku before and have seen Hotel Gracery so I wanted to give them a try.The hotel is in a decent location. It is a short 5 to 10 minute walk from JR Shinjuku Station East entrance. The biggest problem you will have is that it is a very busy foot traffic area on the way to the hotel so you will find yourself having to dodge other pedestrians while dragging your luggage. The good news is that it is all downhill from the station so it isn't too difficult. You will find the hotel quite easily thanks to the Godzilla on the 8th floor of the building.The hotel is definitely right in the heart of all the happenings in Shinjuku. Restaurants, entertainment, and even parks are all within walking distance. Being right next to Shinjuku Station makes it easy to visit the rest of Tokyo as there are so many different trains and subways you can take. It does get busy and noisy but some people enjoy it!The staff of the hotel is great and very courteous. The check-in was a little cold but you do hear the warm greetings and the smiles as you walk through the hotel. There is definitely an efficiency in the staff as check-in and check out was very efficient. Check out was using a machine and that was very nice. The daily cleaning staff was also very polite and warm.The room is small but not unusual for the area. If you want to live in an area like Shinjuku, Tokyo Station, Ginza, etc, the rooms tend to be small. If you want hotels with larger rooms, stay in areas like Shinagawa. My main criticism of the room is that it did not even have a desk so I found myself working on my laptop in bed or at an awkward angel. The size of the room will probably also require you to do some luggage tetris as you try to leave yourself with enough room to walk around, pack, etc. The lack of a closet does mean that you should plan on living out of your luggage. I definitely didn't think the size was an issue as the room itself was functional.I got 2 free bottles of water every day which is a very nice touch. The hotel itself is quite new and everything except the internet worked well.The main reason why I gave the hotel a 3 star (instead of a 4) is the internet was really bad during my stay. It kept fading in and out. At first I thought it was just a weak wifi signal around the little table but over the 3 days, I realized that it didn't matter where I was. When the internet works, it wasn't particularly fast either. It might be the time I was there and the hotel was quite full. With that said, I do expect a hotel of this category to have functional internet which it does not.I think Hotel Gracery is a good hotel that is right in the heart of Shinjuku. If you like to stay in an area with easy access to lots of restaurants and a lot of activities, Hotel Gracery is a good choice. For me, I would not recommend it as a business hotel as it does get a bit noisy and the bad internet made it a bad option.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Gracery Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a large hotel on an imposing site on the Shinjuku district. Reception is on the eighth floor which Is unusual, and the rooms go up to the 30th floor. Our room was quite compact for a twin room but the view was excellent from the 26th floor. The are 2 restaurants on site, one of which opened out on to a shopping arcade.Wifi is provided and was good
hotelName:
13    Hotel Gracery Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed for a week . I stayed on the 14th floor means the ladies floor where men are not allowed on that floor . I stayed in a small room but yet I felt that it is equipped with all the necessities ! Although the room is small but the bathroom is in a very good size with a nice bathtub and also with a shower area ! The room is quiet even it is in a noisy area. The only complain is it has not many English channels . They should have at least a HBO movie channels for international travelers ! Overall because of its location I will return again !
hotelName:
13    Hotel Gracery Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location of this hotel is excellent.That said,anyone booking a double room would be disappointed had they not read previous reviews.The actual bedroom is approx. 9 sq metres at best ,no facilities to store or put your luggage.Too small to be comfortable in even if you are there for only a couple of nights..Recommend you book a twin room to give you that extra space.Would not stay here in a bog standard double room
hotelName:
13    Hotel Gracery Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room is extremely small so if you are claustrophobic stay away from this place, the room is clean and they offer in the room the basic amenities. The customer service is basic as well and their English not that great, the bed was the most uncomfortable bed we ever had it was just a double bed pillows were like sheets so I had neck pain all week the breakfast the offer 2 locations, one they offer sandwich breakfast and it is VERY basic and small so not much there and the second one they offer a mix of japanese and western brekkie again small and not many options.Would I stay here again? NO but the location is good and it is next to shops supermarket, close to robot restaurant so if you don’t mind having a bad bed and not be able to sleep is ok.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Gracery Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in a double room for 2 nights. There is a long narrow walkway into the bed area only fit for standing luggage. The bathroom is bigger than usual, but I would prefer it to be smaller so that the bed area is bigger. There is no space to open my luggage except on the bed. Although close to Shinjuku station, it is a crowded 400m away from the entrance. For the price, I can find a bigger room in a hotel nearer to the station (if not for me booking late). You might think that yeah the rooms in Japan hotels are small etc, but I have been to Tokyo numerous times, and the design of the rooms in this hotel can really be improved - bathrooms smaller to make the bed area bigger.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Gracery Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very good hotel in the heart of Shinjuku...close to Robot Restaurant. Room is on smallish side but bathroom is quite large with bathtub and separate shower. They were out of non smoking rooms, but price was very reasonable so took a chance. They advised by Email that they gave the room extra cleaning to eliminate the smoke smell...they did a good job cleaning. This was first time staying at Gracery...I’d stay again. 10 minute walk to Shinjuku airport bus station and rail station.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Gracery Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very good placesNight life is very good. Stay in heart of tokyo Very good experience joyful stayGood people japan very humble very cooperative soft Japan many more places to visit and must be visit all of those come in japan as tourist
hotelName:
13    Hotel Gracery Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is in the heart of the Shinjuku gaming hub but even though we are not into gaming, we still enjoyed the convenient location — close to the train station and numerous restaurants.Rooms are not huge but manageable and designed to save space in typical Japanese fashion. Very clean and amenities are all there. The beds are comfy too!Big thumbs up to the concierge staff who truly went out of their way to help us outI would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Gracery Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel has a central position and is surrounded by restaurants, shops and arcades. The rooms are very small but the view is beautiful. The breakfast is excellent for japanese standards and the service is very efficient and professional.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Gracery Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My hotel room at The Gracery was small as I was expecting but the size was manageable. I had a single room on the ladies only floor. The bed was larger than a twin. I enjoyed the extra features in the room such as the facial steamer and the leg massager. But I loved the daily replenishment of the DHC skincare products. The skin care package included cleansing oil, foaming cleanser, a moisturizing mask, toner, and moisturizer. My skin felt amazing all week. Bubble bath, pajamas and other special extras were also provided daily. The room was very clean. I loved the location in the heart of Shinjuku. Anytime I got lost, I could look up and find Godzilla on the roof of the building and know how to find my way home. The staff were very helpful especially when I wanted restaurant options at 4 am. Not extremely expensive for Tokyo. Excellent location a short walk to Shinjuku Station.Attached to a 7-11 and a Lawson is across the street. Lots of restaurants and entertainment in the area.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Gracery Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just spent 3 nights at Hotel Gracery at first we were not impressed that our rooms were not what we booked. However management stepped up and had it corrected the next day. The location is right in the middle of everything in Shinjuku and with teenage boys we felt safe at all times. The double rooms are very small and if you can go for the twin rooms a lot more space and better lay out. On many occasions we were looking for our hotel and once we saw Godzilla on the roof area we were back. Overall a great first time Tokyo experience and we would stay here again.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Gracery Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at this hotel for two nights during my first trip to Tokyo in May. It was an amazing location, about a five minute walk from Shinjuku station and all of the wonders of Shinjuku easily accessible without it being really noisy. The rooms were spacious and comfortable and the staff were friendly and helpful. I also really enjoyed the view from the hotel. I’m only giving it 4 stars as it was pricey and for the price I paid there was nothing that really wowed me, but I’d certainly consider staying again.
hotelName:
14    Hotel Century Southern Tower
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at this hotel for 6 days. We booked it because of its perfect location. The reception is located on the 20th floor, and from that on up to the 35th floor are hotel rooms. We stayed on the highest level. Although the room is facing the station, view is magnificent. We didn’t book a room with free breakfast as we were not sure if we would want to eat there every morning. Fortunately, the staff at the front desk gave us 20% coupons (approximately ¥2000/per) for breakfast buffet there. The quality of the food and the setting of the buffet line were very good, and we ended up going there every morning. There are two restaurants on the 19th floor. We tried the Chinese restaurant and had dim sum there (surprisingly delicious). We spend around ¥2400 for four dishes of dim sum. We you take the elevator to the second floor, you walk out of the hotel and within a 3-min walk, you arrive at the south exit of the Shinjuku station. It is super convenient for people who want to go to different places for shopping and sightseeing. Then on the same level at the hotel entrance, on your right is shake shack burger and on the left, there are Tim Ho Wan dim sum house, a restaurant (I forgot the name) and Starbucks. There is a overpass connecting Takashimaya Time Square and Tokyo Hands. Moreover, this hotel is one of the stops for the limousine bus to and from the narita airport. The room is spacious. It’s not a new hotel, but the cleanliness of the room is above standard. Free bottled waters are provided as well. We had a pleasant stay at Odakyu Hotel Century Southern Tower.
hotelName:
14    Hotel Century Southern Tower
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: So surprised at how large our room is - has a lot of lying down and walking room inside (we had a king size bed), with great views of Shinjuku, clock tower, the city. There is a Starbucks and food nearby. The hotel room was clean, and great little toiletries provided. They lose one point because of having a hard bed.
hotelName:
14    Hotel Century Southern Tower
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It's a busy hotel but the location is excellent. It's situated right opposite of Takashimaya Times Square and Tokyu Hands, and it's just so convenient for us esp we had a little one so we can always go back to our hotel when he needed a nap or just tired from shopping. The hotel is not new but the room layout just worked for us, like the room's layout is just functional. Love the view from the room, my son couldn't get enough of the view. Reception is efficient, though they did mix up some details of the room booking. They first gave us a smoking room where we requested a non-smoking room. The staff apologized a few times and changed us to another room immediately. Not a big deal. Breakfast is ok. Would definitely come back to stay here if we are going to stay at Shinjuku area again.
hotelName:
14    Hotel Century Southern Tower
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Only stayed 2 nights, but this hotel is very nice and modern. Room size is typical of Asia, but we were very comfortable. Close to the train and mall. Good choice for those seeking a nice place to rest/sleep while being able to connect with the rest of the city.
hotelName:
14    Hotel Century Southern Tower
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: During my vacations to Japan I usually stay here up to three times (as I go to other cities and return to Tokyo). The location on the west side of Tokyo is perfect - a few steps away from the train station. The views are exceptional. The rooms are big and well appointed and are always clean and comfortable. The style might not be 5 star, but there is nothing to complain about at all. The one downside is that the lobby store is closing after many years of convenience. That is the on thing I'll miss.
hotelName:
14    Hotel Century Southern Tower
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived early. Had to wait a long time for access to the room. We were treated with some indifference. Some reception staff are quite good others less so. The room was quite adequate and the location very good. Access to the train was excellent. The surrounds are a mix of modern restaurants and stores but easy access to more traditional areas. It was ok without being wonderful
hotelName:
14    Hotel Century Southern Tower
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Been Staying at Hotel Century Southern Tower, whenever we are in Tokyo due to its convinient locations to the train stations, bus interchanges and Shopping Districts of Shinjuku.The hotel also boast a great panoramic view of Shinjuku skycapers and impressive night lights.
hotelName:
14    Hotel Century Southern Tower
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff at Hotel Century Southern Tower are absolutely phenomenal and the view is outstanding. In a perfect location next to the metro and the main city of shinjuku. We had a lovely time and I highly recommend to anyone traveling for the first time to tokyo to book it at Hotel century!!
hotelName:
14    Hotel Century Southern Tower
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was a lovely, comfortable, clean and modern hotel. The location is in the Shinjuku area- where there are lovely restaurants, easy access to the rail lines and fund department stores across the bridge. Staff were really really accommodating and helpful. The buffet breakfast is a nice way to start the day with great cappuccino!
hotelName:
14    Hotel Century Southern Tower
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Hotel Century is just a short walk down a pedestrian path from the south entrance to the Shinjuku station, which is served by express trains from Narita Airport. I had one of the more spacious single rooms (3063), 10 floors up from the lobby. The room made very good use of the space and was a pleasure to return to after a busy day. The included breakfast spread was excellent, as was the ambiance of the breakfast room; I also enjoyed dinner with my business colleagues in the Chinese restaurant on the 19th floor.
hotelName:
14    Hotel Century Southern Tower
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My scenic king room is very spacious with awesome view. Bed is comfy but pillow is too soft. Location is unbeatable, only 2 mins walk to NEX station near the new south exit. Many good restaurants and shops around.
hotelName:
14    Hotel Century Southern Tower
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was a great stay as always. This is probably my 7th time staying at this hotel, I noticed that they updated the shower head, which is great, the water stream is more powerful now. No complain, always a pleasant to stay at this hotel!Wish there is a membership program, so I can collect points for every time I stay. Thank you for the wonderful hospitality!
hotelName:
14    Hotel Century Southern Tower
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After in depth researching the best place for my holiday in Tokyo, I decided on Century and couldn’t be happier. The location is super convenient to everything you could want to buy, eat or do & across the road from a train station that links to everywhere. The hotel looks & feels brand new, no musty stale smells, the room was comfortable, well equipped, lovely toiletries topped up daily and the pillows were heavenly. I meant to grab the details from the label but forgot, will email the hotel to ask where I can purchase some. Had a walk around and a look at the two other hotels I was considering and so relieved I chose Century. Hotel staff very helpful and attentive. I hope to return for cherry blossom season in the coming year or two.
hotelName:
14    Hotel Century Southern Tower
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stand in the hotel in may, after one night we discovered and we showed at reception desk a photo (attached) showing crackers and food left under the couch. Despite this, rooms cleaning have not been done the next morning. As we were upset we moved out the couch to clearly show the mess and to have it cleaned, at last cleaning personnel hoovered it!This happened in both rooms we booked and on top of this, supplies refill (coffee, tea, sugar) was not done every day in one of the room. The hotel is not at the level we could expect of such a price and supposed quality.
hotelName:
14    Hotel Century Southern Tower
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Superb location - centrally located in Shinjuku, right opposite Takashimaya and a 5 min leisurely walk from Shinjuku JR station. Room is big with all the amenities. No frills and with great views of the Tokyo landscape
hotelName:
14    Hotel Century Southern Tower
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 4 nights. Hotel is next to JR Shinjuku and Takashimaya, however the walkways are not covered. So in summer heat and rain, you really need an umbrella. The furnishing of the hotel and the room are really dated. I was shocked that upon arrival, i have to help myself in getting my 3 large suitcases up to the receptionist hall, and even to get the trolley off the entrance lift to load it myself as there was no porter available at all. The reception area is on a much higher floor - so you are basically on your own until then. The receptionists are not friendly or helpful. The gym is outside across the road in another building and the receptionist were not very friendly in helping out with direction as well. So overall hotel experience is NOT great, except for the location.
hotelName:
14    Hotel Century Southern Tower
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel location close enough to Shinjuku Station Yet not to close to the crowds which is what we like. We were given a room with good view overseeing Tokyo Skytree and Tokyo tower. Room size is good for a japan hotel. Will stay here again
hotelName:
14    Hotel Century Southern Tower
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Described as a business hotel but much more than that.Excellent rooms of a good size. Clean, tidy and very welcoming staff. Choice of food at the buffet breakfast was extensive and of good quality. Great view from higher floors and a couple of minutes walk from the new South exit of the station. Good choice of restaurants nearby as well as the hotels own.Recommended for value and location.
hotelName:
14    Hotel Century Southern Tower
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 3 of us shared a room - tight fit and only worked because we each had overnight/carry on luggage. Anything larger would have been a problem. Comfortable bed and 2 pillows each, plus 2 towels each which was great.Guests have access to gym across the road - excellent set up and the trainers were efficient and happy to help.Directions to hotel from Station suggest taking the South Exit, crossing the road and walking to the hotel (5 minutes max) - or there is a New South Exit which brings you out across the road and near the JR tour office (for exchanging rail pass and making reservations), a 2-3 minute walk to the hotel. We caught the airport limo bus as it dropped us at the door of the hotel - it is possible to use rail pass to catch the N'EX from Narita T3 to Tokyo but you then have to change trains to Shinjuku and find hotel. After 7-1/2 hours on a plane we're happy to go door to door!We used Plasmo cards (same is SUICA) but if catching subway (JR lines free on rail pass) more economical to purchase 2-day ticket (or 1 day) as set amount covers any number of trips on the subway.This is one of the best hotels we've stayed in when visiting Tokyo over the last 3 or 4 years. The buffet breakfast was excellent, dinner in the restaurant was very slow but worth the wait and staff happy to adjust items to ensure gluten free.We ate in one of the Japanese restaurants in the Southern Tower, and again this was an excellent choice. Shake Shack were happy to provide a gluten free burger (ie in lettuce rather than a roll). Starbucks a 1 minute walk away.Walking distance to Shinjuku Park.
hotelName:
14    Hotel Century Southern Tower
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved this hotel. Super location. Literally on top of Shinjuku station. Lovely quiet room with great views. And wonderful staff who moved us to a non smoking room effortlessly. Breakfast buffet was perfect.
hotelName:
14    Hotel Century Southern Tower
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent 5 nights here on arriving in Tokyo, and 2 connecting rooms worked perfectly for our family. The buffet breakfasts were excellent, as were the views from the hotel restaurant. In fact we loved the restaurant so much we also ate dinner there twice! The proximity to Shinjuku station was great, though definitely travel from the nearby Yoyogi Station for a less stressful experience (given that Shinjuku is the busiest station in the world with 3 mill people passing through daily). The noise from the trains wasn’t a problem due to the triple glazing and height of the rooms. We slept like babies—though it was always hard to draw the curtains on the spectacular view! The hotel is also opposite Times Square and Tokyu Hands, which offer brilliant shopping and dining options. We will stay here again when in Tokyo!
hotelName:
14    Hotel Century Southern Tower
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had one night there at the end of our time in Japan and we really enjoyed our stay.The Hotel is centrally situated and very convenient for restaurants and shopping and sightseeing The rooms is great and well equipped and the staff are very helpful Would recommend staying here if in the area of Tokyo
hotelName:
14    Hotel Century Southern Tower
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is perfectly located just blocks away from Shinjuku station. This station is connected to every train and subway line. The rooms are very comfortable and spacious. It has all the amenities you need. The view is spectacular as the hotel is located in the 20th floor. The staff is very helpful and nice. Breakfast is good if it is included in your rate, if not, it is a little expensive and you can find better options.I would definitely recommend and stay again in this hotel.
hotelName:
14    Hotel Century Southern Tower
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Hotel Century Southern Tower during the first six nights of our trip to Japan in March. We had planned to stay two nights at another hotel in Tokyo for the last leg of our trip (after returning from trips around Japan), but after staying here, we cancelled the other hotel, and booked the two final nights here instead. We just loved it so much. There are definitely cheaper options of accommodation in Tokyo, but our time here was worth every penny. First of all, the location is amazing. Just a couple of minutes from Shinjuku Station (South Exit) in a great part of Shinjuku, right next to the beautiful Shinjuku Gyoen National Garden. Across the street from the hotel you'll find a Takashimaya, Tokyu Hands, Uniqlo and much more, and, no matter which side of the hotel your room is, there is the most amazing view over the city. The room itself is wonderful - spacious, clean, comfortable, great facilities, great bed, great tv channel options, and every morning you'll find a newspaper by the door. We also enjoyed breakfast at the hotel every morning, and we couldn't have asked for a better start to our day. Everything at Hotel Century Southern Tower was comfortable and convenient, and the staff was amazing, making us feel like this was our home away from home. We would come back here in a heartbeat, and we will definitely stay here, when we get a chance to return to Japan. Thank you for a wonderful stay!
hotelName:
14    Hotel Century Southern Tower
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: At the heart of Shinjuku , this hotel is situated at the perfect spot between Shinjuku station and to various other restaurants and shopping areas. it’s as central as you can get in Shinjuku. The rooms are very clean, the service is excellent and the staff speak English adequately enough to help if anything arises. There’s really no “con” I can say about this hotel however here’s a few key things to remember.1. The room is small compared to North American standards. That said it’s adequate but adjustments need to be made about exceptions. If you have multiple large suitcases , having the basic room might be a bit small. 2. The staff speak English perfectly well. Yes they may drop a syllable or two here and there but they aren’t reciting Shakespeare (I’m sure they could too!) so it’s more than adequate.3. There is no room service but the shop downstairs has stuff if you need essentials and there’s 7-11, Lawson’s and family mart all around. I would absolutely stay here again. The service is unparalleled and each person genuinely treats you with a smile. It’s a cultural norm, that said it’s still nice to see. If you’re reading this, you should definitely stay here.Cheers.
hotelName:
14    Hotel Century Southern Tower
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I’ve never felt the need to review somewhere before even leaving but this hotel is absolutely sensational. Having lived in japan previously for years, I planned my visit to Tokyo with a view to stay in a hotel with an exceptional view - and this hotel does not disappoint. Rooms are spacious with plenty of amenities and WiFi. Staff have been excellent and the on-site restaurants look great, but we didn’t use them. The location is also brilliant and the hotel is easy to find. Highly recommended.
hotelName:
14    Hotel Century Southern Tower
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at HCST for four nights this March/April. Had excellent views out over Tokyo. I cant say enough about the staff at this hotel; every one we spoke to and had dealings with was excellent. The rooms were clean with great amenities. The hotel is super conveniently located to Shinjuku Station. The only problem I had at all was the couch in our room could have used a little bit of a clean. This was my only issue! I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay in the vicinity of Shinjuku Station.
hotelName:
14    Hotel Century Southern Tower
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights after our 2 weeks tour in Japan with Inside Japan. A top class hotel located next to the rail station close to main shopping and food areas and 2 parks. First class service by all the staff. Will certainly return when we come back to Tokyo. Highly recommended
hotelName:
14    Hotel Century Southern Tower
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was used to be one of the best in Tokyo, but now with all the newer hotels in town, it's having a hard time competing. This hotel no longer gives you best value and the rooms, even their highest grade Panoramic Room is mediocre. I dislike the unit bath where you have to take a bath with the toilet right next to your face. There are many better newer hotels at lower rates in Tokyo these days.
hotelName:
14    Hotel Century Southern Tower
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a great time at the Hotel Century in Shinjuku. Very spacious and comfortable rooms, sensational breakfast from the 20th floor, where our table gave us a view of Mt. Fuji, and friendly and helpful staff.
hotelName:
14    Hotel Century Southern Tower
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful hotel that’s located conveniently. Steps from Shinjuku Station, loads of shopping and tons of food. Check in staff was polite and courteous, as were the rest of the hotel staff. Room was spacious and well appointed with amenities and latest tech stuff.
hotelName:
14    Hotel Century Southern Tower
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I really enjoyed the amenities of this hotel. The bathroom supplies, included tooth brush and tooth paste, razor and shaving cream, various types of moisturizers and cleansers and high quality shampoo, face soap, conditioner and body wash. The hotel provides a mobile device that helps navigate the city and the hotel services.
hotelName:
14    Hotel Century Southern Tower
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff was helpful and accommodating. Spoke English. Clean rooms. Amazing toilet with heated seats! Great location right next to Shinjuku station. Lots of shopping nearby. Hotel is on 20th floor and up so it has amazing views. Location is clean and safe. Very satisfying stay.
hotelName:
14    Hotel Century Southern Tower
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Second time staying at this hotel and would stay again as the location is perfect. When you arrive at Shinjuku station just make sure you follow the signs for New South Gate exit and you'll get to the hotel. Our room was clean, good size, comfortable bed, safety deposit box, tea/coffee making, hairdryer, shower over the bath with excellent pressure, what more do you need when your're out all day. Breakfast is excellent, plenty of choice to please everyone.
hotelName:
14    Hotel Century Southern Tower
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had stayed previously at the Cerulean Tower Hotel and it was a great experience. This hotel is supposed to be a similar 4-5 star accommodation but it was a really bad experience for me. When I checked in my room wasn’t ready despite requesting early check in. When I got into the room, there was some kind of brown streak on the toilet seat. At first I thought it was a crack but I tried to wipe it just in case and sure enough it wiped off. Gross. How did the staff miss that? I had the higher end king luxury room and there’s no coffee maker (only powdered coffee) or food or beverages in the room. No room service menu and they forgot to leave WiFi info. I had to call the front desk several times for things and most of the time no one picked up, it just kept ringing. I had to physically go downstairs. They also refused to give me 2 keys even though we had two guests and I was paying for two. My last hotel gave me 2 keys even though I was solo there. The building is also very strange. The hotel lobby is on the 20th floor but the way it’s set up is you take an elevator to the lobby, walk through the lobby and take a second elevator up to your room. Not a huge problem but it’s weird. The location the hotel is in is extremely convenient to the Shinjuku Station itself but not very convenient to the popular attractions north of the station because you have to go all the way around the station and then cross a busy highway that only has a sky bridge on one side and not many crosswalks. There’s not much of interest to tourists south of the hotel. Honestly, I love Shinjuku but this didn’t feel like a great hotel for tourists. Maybe it’s good for business? Not sure. Out of the 6 hotels I’ve stayed in Japan this was the only one i didn’t like.
hotelName:
14    Hotel Century Southern Tower
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Love the location of hotel while visiting Tokyo. The rooms are a great size and offer good facilities at the hotel. I recommend staying here if you're looking to explore Tokyo properly and have easy access to shops.
hotelName:
14    Hotel Century Southern Tower
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent 5 nights at the Century South and enjoyed every minute of it. The hotel is in a great location, right at Shinjuku Station so easy to get around and the hotel itself is very clean and the rooms are a good size! We also enjoyed using the complimentary cellphone to help us find our way around the city, it was a must!Breakfast included was also great as it had a good variety and gave a good option for starting your day without having to go searching.I would recommend this hotel for your travels to Tokyo!
hotelName:
14    Hotel Century Southern Tower
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When I knew I was returning for a holiday in Tokyo I had trouble finding a hotel that matched Century Southern Tower for location and style. Rooms: good size. Breakfast: wonderful selection. Location: brilliant. They have introduced "Alexa" systems in room for simple requests. Also had a mobile phone for my use if I required one. Bathroom small but okay. Quality toiletries (Shiseido shampoo etc)I was arriving by train to Shinjuku Station and this hotel is so easy to get from the station (very close if you have luggage). I had my luggage sent on from Kyoto to allow me to travel in some rural areas, free from carting a large suitcase (took carry on only with me). As I was checking in at Century Southern, my suitcase that I forwarded was wheeled out and placed next to me without me even asking about it! That's service!!Plenty of shops and restaurants in the area. Lots!!! Lovely Yoyogi Park & Meiju Jingu shrine an easy walk too. Shibuya is neighbouring district and I walked there through the park and along the streets. Tokyo Metropolitan Gov. Building is an easy walk. Free entry. Observation levels with panoramic (including Mt Fuji) views. Don't think I would stay in any other area than Shinjuku, and even though I could have found cheaper accommodation it wouldn't have been up to the same standard.
