Definitely my 'go to' hotel for Tokyo. The limo bus to the airport stops and picks up from the ground level of the hotel. So easy! Bus is a bit longer than the train to the airport, but so much less hassle if travelling with luggage. A few of the walking tours I took met near Tokyo station. This was an easy 10-15 minute train ride from Shinjuku Station. The area around Tokyo Station seemed more business; less tourist/shopping, but it is closer to the Imperial Palace. Still would choose Shinjuku area to stay as there is so much in that district.
hotelName:
14    Hotel Century Southern Tower
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel provide full amenities. Reception have great customer service and helpful.Few minutes walk to Shinjuku main station. Restaurants are only minutes away. Minutes away from Tokyu Hands and Takashimaya.Very convenient location and highly recommended Thank you
hotelName:
14    Hotel Century Southern Tower
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had a wonderful 3 night stay here.Customer service was excellent. The room was small but didn't feel it because the layout is well thought out. Comfortable bed, modern and clean bathroom. The elevators are consistently fast. Definitely opt for the breakfast buffet -- both western and Japanese fare that is fresh and delicious! Lastly there is easy access to Shinjuku Station and the Airport Limousine bus brings you right to the front door.
hotelName:
14    Hotel Century Southern Tower
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Thoroughly enjoyed our recent four night stay. We had a superior twin room which was quite spacious. Really comfy, decent size beds. Very clean with excellent amenities including Shiseido and Pola toiletries. Plenty of towels. Even fabric spray to refresh clothes. Hairdryer a bit weak. Great location so close to Shinjuku station.
hotelName:
14    Hotel Century Southern Tower
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nothing could quite prepare us for arriving late at night to the hotel and opening up the blinds to take in the view across Tokyo. This was my second visit to Tokyo and staying at the Hotel Century Southern Tower made this visit the best. The location is insane - in Japan, it's all about being near a train or metro station and this hotel is only metres from the entrance from Shinjuku station and basically in the hub of this great area. The room was flawless, bed super comfy, room lovely and clean and we simply couldn't fault it. Don't bother looking anywhere else!
hotelName:
14    Hotel Century Southern Tower
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I don't dislike anything about this hotel. Havnig said that, nothing really stands out to me either. Location wise, it is close to Shinjuku station, so in theory it should be easy to get to. But the reality is I got lost a couple of times after leaving Shinjuku station. For dietery options, you can go to the department store across the station, or dine at in-and-out burger downstairs. Nothing is really cheap in this area though (or I didn't find one).The room itself is pretty standard, slightly bigger I assume than other guest rooms in Tokyo. It is also quie. After all the hotel is placed at the higher levels of the buidling so you get to enjoy the view without having to bear the noise.Another thing I like about the hotel is that there is a small shop next to the elevators. If you don't want to go all the way down to the ground floor and leave the hotel in the rain just to find a Family Mart in the vincinity, you can probably get what you need at the shop. I find it very thoughful.
hotelName:
14    Hotel Century Southern Tower
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Breakfast buffet, quite good, price is fair, but for the breakfast, it seems too many clients, too full, food is okay, quite many variety , the view is quite good, as this hotel lobby is on 20th floor, the restaurant is on the same level of hotel lobby , so the restaurant’s view is fantastic if you sit near the window
hotelName:
14    Hotel Century Southern Tower
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My family of four stayed in two separate kings room as all the connecting rooms were taken. The location cannot be beat - so close to transportation, eating and dining - everything you need in Tokyo is just a heartbeat away. That's the best thing about this hotel. The rooms are looking a little dated. The bathrooms even older. One great thing about the bathrooms is the full-sized bottles of Shiseido shampoo, conditioner and body wash. I detest using the small travel bottles at other hotels. And this shampoo actually clean, unlike most other hotel shampoo. We had a room on the 34th floor and the view was fantastic. We could see Tokyo Skytree in the distance the lights of Tokyo at night. The staff is efficient but not very warm or friendly. We tried to get extra room keys but was told that only one key per room was allowed due to security reasons. (we had one adult, one child per room - just wanted a second key per room so that the second adult could access the room.) It's the hotel's policy so nothing we could do, but a little annoyed. There are other hotels in the immediate area, so despite the great location, we will try another hotel should we find ourselves in Tokyo again.
hotelName:
14    Hotel Century Southern Tower
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect location, just next to the new South Gate of Shinjuku station, and also just a 4 minute walk to nearby Yoyogi Station. When taking the Airport express train, get off at Shinjuku station and exit via the NEW South gate (you can exit via the South gate too, but you'd have to cross a big street) and it's only a very short walk to the hotel. The hotel is surrounded by Shopping malls and streets. Just across Tokyu Hands (amazing stationery, etc store), Takashimaya Square, Lumine, Odakyu and a very quick walking distance to a huge Don Quijote, Isetann, BicQlo (Bic Camera and Uniqlo), Muji, etc. The room size is ok per Japanese standards, very clean and it has a full stock of amenities from Shiseido, tea service and a Handy phone that you can take out of the hotel for free internet. Very helpful for using google maps to get to sites via walking or trains. We were booked at the southern terrace side, which was very quiet despite being close to the station. It has a small convenience store on the 20th floor, which is also where the lobby is. It's close to great restaurants. Shake Shack is at the basement of the building. Walking distance to Fuunji and Ichiran (great ramen), Nabezo (eat all you can hot pot), Akasaka Umaya (delicious Kyushu style hot pot), among countless others. The breakfast spread is delicious and the staff is very friendly and helpful. It got really busy during the Christmas and New Year break, that there were times we had a 15-30 minute wait for a table (esp if you get there after 9am), but the staff did their best to accommodate everyone. I would definitely stay here again, when in Tokyo.
hotelName:
14    Hotel Century Southern Tower
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is the main reason we stay at this hotel. Airport bus stops at this hotel. The room is clean, roomy and comfortable. We can adjust the temperature in our room to our needs. We still need AC in November while other hotels have heat only in Auturm. We don't need to open the window for fresh air when the room is too warm for our taste. The train station either JR or subway is very near, providing us great transportation needs.
hotelName:
14    Hotel Century Southern Tower
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Century Southern TowerWe were a family of 2 adults and 2 children and we had booked the Panoramic King Room and here’s our review of this hotel.LocationThis hotel located in the Shinjuku Southern Terrace area and is just 5 minutes away from the Shinjuku New South Exit as well as the Shinjuku Bus Terminal. If you are taking any of the JR lines, it would be optimal if you alight the train and walk all the way to the end with the “New South/Kasho Kaido” exit and you will have a short walk to this hotel. The JR East office is located at the New South Exit as well. Staying here making taking trains and buses a breeze.It is also 5 minutes walk from malls such as Mylord and Newoman whereby there are many cafes and restaurants for breakfast/lunch/dinner. Starbucks is just a stone’s throw away as well.RoomOur room was a panoramic king room with a large King Bed and 2 large windows overlooking the city. Being on the 27th floor, the view was amazing. We were facing southeast and so docomo tower and gyoen garden were in our view. There was also a small coffee table with 2 chairs for us to chill with snacks and drinks while taking in the view. The space was laid out well, enough for luggage and 2 kids playing. The binds can be controlled via a remote and the room was heated well too. The Kind bed was wide enough to fit all of us horizontally.FacilitiesThis hotel has direct luggage transfer service and we received our luggage from Kyoto and it was handed to us during check in. They also have a counter for the Airport Limousine Bus whereby you can buy tickets onsite or make payments in cash for limo bus tickets reserved online. All this was done professionally and the limo bus pick up is at level 1 of the building. We did not eat at the restaurant and ate out at the cafes around the area.In summary, our stay here was short but we enjoyed it. The hotel wins big on location, being very near to malls (Takashimaya), SHinjuku Station New South Area and Shinjuku south and it also wins big on providing a grand view of the city with its high floors and spacious rooms.
hotelName:
14    Hotel Century Southern Tower
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Being our first time in Japan, we were nervous about having a “good” hotel. Well...our worries were relieved upon arriving. Speaking no Japanese, my wife and I were greeted in English. We arrived in our room, which had an amazing view of Shinjuku and, what seemed like, all of Tokyo. The greatest part of the hotel is the location. You are, literally, a three minute walk to Shinjuku Station (reportedly the busiest train station in the world). Also, within a few minutes walk are multiple restaurants and shopping. The “mall” was also a short (2 minute) walk across the bridge. There is also a Shake Shack in the building if you are craving a burger and fries (but I advise you to try the amazing local food all around you!). The room itself was clean and comfortable. The only two downsides were that it smelled slightly of smoke (it was a non-smoking room) and that there are barely any tv stations in English...you’re basically getting CNN. Props to the hotel front desk for helping me navigate the remote and captioning! There is also a convenient lobby store that sells everything you may need. Oh...how I miss those Japanese bathrooms!Everything was super clean. The hotel restaurants were really pricey...a two minute walk yields yummy, cheaper food. Also, there is a family mart about 5 minutes away. Overall...GREAT hotel...great location...would highly recommend!
hotelName:
14    Hotel Century Southern Tower
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I recently stayed at the Hotel Century Southern Tower with family and was pleased to find the hotel has renovated the former Tribeks restaurant to create Southern Tower Dining with an improved breakfast buffet and much updated open seating. The hotel retains its ultra convenient location, a short walk from the New South Exit of Shinjuku station which can be easily reached by the Narita Express from Narita airport. Takashimaya Times Square is just a short walk over a bridge over the train tracks leading into Shinjuku Station. The rooms are small but equipped with everything you need - mini fridge, in room safe, small TV, small table and side chair. I had a full size 30 inch suitcase so it was a bit of a struggle to find a place in the room where I could fully open up the suitcase on the floor to unpack and pack, but then again the modest size of the room was reflected in the modest price per night, about 2/3 of what I would pay for the Hilton in Shinjuku. The new restaurant where the buffet is served has beautiful new clean lines and modern seating with many options including counter seating and family style larger tables in addition to the basic two and four person tables. The buffet offerings have also been enhanced compared to my previous stays. The buffet had always been good in quality and now additional quantity of offerings has been added. There is an eggs made to order omelet station, several cooked offerings including roast pork, sausages, bacon, vegetables and a daily potato offering varying from fries to roast potatoes and a soup offering that varies from day to day instead of being just the common corn soup. There is also a section for Japanese breakfast offerings including usually grilled fish. All in all, a convenient and well priced hotel has now upped it breakfast buffet game making a good choice for a hotel in Shinjuku even better.
hotelName:
14    Hotel Century Southern Tower
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was a little discombobulating to find that the lobby to this hotel is actually on the 20th floor of this complex next to Shinjuku Station. As well, we wondered if being next to the station, the area would be dirty and full of menacing street people, as often big city stations in European cities can be. But lo and behold none of this was true. The area - as with most places in Japan - was immaculately clean and safe and streets full of very polite, well-dressed, helpful people. The hotel had a lovely lobby entrance with bar close by and the rooms were very clean with nice views over the city. The hotel has a first-rate breakfast room/ evening restaurant which offers a very comprehensive, high quality breakfast for all tastes, Asian and Western, and is also popular for evening meals. Service was consistently excellent. But that is not at all unusual in Japan where standards of service are so much higher than in North America or Europe, even for moderately priced places. But probably the best thing about this hotel is its superb location, right next to Shinjuku Station. The area is lovely to walk, especially on the east side where there are lots of small restaurants and shops, but the whole area has a very lively buzz and no menace whatsoever in the streets, which are completely litter free and filled with well-dressed people going about their business. Being close to the station gives you easy access to other key sites, such as Shibuya Crossing, which you can get to with just a short subway ride. Our beds in the hotel were very comfortable and the bathroom fitted with all the best fixtures. Some friends complained that there were not enough hangers in the closet but we were happy with the number we had and the hotel was always willing to send up more. I would have no hesitation staying here again. We did stay before in another, older hotel nearby and we found the room too small and the breakfast rooms too crowded and the location a lot harder to access the best of the area. This hotel was a happy experience.
hotelName:
14    Hotel Century Southern Tower
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel room with superb view. I booked the panoramic king hotel which the room is really spacious. Location is great as well only less than 5 minutes walk to the train station and shopping street
hotelName:
14    Hotel Century Southern Tower
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Saw the good online reviews of the hotel's location, views and rooms and decided to stay here for 5 nights. Could the experience get better? It sure can by staying in one of the hotel's ONLY 2 Executive Rooms located on the 35th floor. Room 3565 has literally 180 degree views East to South to West. On a really clear day (we only had one during our stay) you can see Mt. Fuji in the distance from your living room couch. The room has TWO toilets a shower and tub. See pics of the large glass windows that we spent lots of time day and night gazing out and looking at greater Tokyo. From the room it was interesting to see all the trains coming and going through Shinjuku station. We even had meals in the comfort of our room knowing that you would be hard pressed to find a restaurant with a view like this. This room was very large by Japan hotel standards, but it does come at a price. Save up and splurge for a special vacation. The room doesn't feel that modern and in some places it's starting to look worn, but overall it's still in good shape with a large comfy bed. My opinion is the breakfast buffet in the hotel restaurant was fine, dinners not so much. There are better options around the hotel from awesome Tonkatsu to Shake Shack. Overall, as people have said, the location is convenient and the property was nice. My only small recommendation to management is for a hotel like this it would be a nice touch if the front desk staff would recognize that you are staying in one of their premium rooms. I've stayed in this room a couple of times and while the staff is pleasant enough (almost a little robotic, not that warm), I think it would go a long way if their systems could recognize a frequent guest and welcome them back to build loyalty. I'll still come back, but it sure would make someone feel like they were returning home. If you can stay in one of the Executive Rooms, go for it. I prefer #3565.
hotelName:
14    Hotel Century Southern Tower
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in a room with 3 beds. The room was a bit crowded with 3 beds (3rd bed was an add-on) but still very comfortable. We enjoyed tea in the room and used the nice pajamas provided. The bathroom was quite spacious by Japanese standards. The room was very lovely.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Niwa Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Niwa hotel is on a quiet street at walking distance from the JR Suidobashi line and very close to the Jimbocho Station on Toei Mita line, which can easily take you anywhere. So the hotel is very well located in Tokyo. There are also many nice restaurants and supermarkets within walking distance from the hotel. We had breakfasts in the onsite restaurant, which was very good and with plenty of dishes (both western style and Japanese style buffet available). My only negative comment is related to the size of the restaurant, which is insufficient to accommodate all customers that come down to have breakfast, especially between 8 and 9 am. We always had to wait a few minutes for a table to be released for us, but that didn't impact my extremely positive judgment on the hotel.The hotel itself was fine. We had a triple room, which was quite large compared to the Japanese standard. The three beds were large and comfortable, with enough space to open two large suitcases (although on the floor), with all the the amenities you would expect. The bathroom was large and spotless clean. My favourite amenity was the room cell phone which you could take with you during your entire stay and that we used for free internet and maps/directions. There is also a Workout Room equipped with some fitness machines and a Relaxation Room overlooking a rooftop mini-garden, equipped with full-body massage chairs to loosen tight muscles at the end of a long day in Tokyo. Overall I would definitely recommend this hotel and I'd come back when visiting Tokyo in the future.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Niwa Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Walking distance of Suidobashi station, Tokyo Dome and many restaurants. Enjoyed both the Japanese breakfast and the Western-style/Japanese buffet breakfast. Part of the hotel package included vouchers that could be applied toward dining at the hotel. Was nice being able to access the lounge that had free full-body massage chairs after a full day of walking. Top notch staff that was very helpful and highly accommodating. Sliding shoji screens cover the windows in the room, which are aesthetically pleasing, but do not offer a black-out feature, which didn't matter to me since I was an early riser. Would definitely stay here again!
hotelName:
15    Hotel Niwa Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Niwa is a wonderful destination for those visiting Tokyo. A little way out from Tokyo station it is welcoming and quintessential Japanese. It is in a great location just near the metro and the JR line. It is close to eateries. A great destination to relax at after a busy day in Tokyo!
hotelName:
15    Hotel Niwa Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Overall a good value and an affordable, beautiful hotel by Tokyo standards. Good location...less than a five minute walk from the Suidobashi station.Stylish hotel with excellent service and great breakfast buffet - overall good kitchen/good meals.Rooms are a bit small, but nice bathrooms, coin laundry, and very tiny workout room (only three machines and no free weights) - gym needs serious improvement! Well located hotel overall with lots of restaurants a few blocks away, and close to Jimbocho station as well.Overall a positive experience and a good 4-star option for hotel in Tokyo.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Niwa Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Moderately priced, good English, great service, and a tasteful and serene place. Off busy streets but just a couple blocks from subway transit and a few blocks from local restaurants. Small but very nicely appointed rooms.This was our second stay and we were just as happy as on the first. Will stay again if we get to Tokyo another time.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Niwa Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good-location is near Suidobashi station so,if u r subway savvy, very convenient for everything (though I prefer Ginza area). On quiet street but near lots of decent but modest restaurants. Breakfast buffet very good but pricey at $30. So get it in ur package. Rooms nice and very clean but see caution below. Landscaping very nice. Massage chairs in lounge.Bad-the smaller double is Euro small and only has a double bed. Larger has queen and is quiet nice but pricey. When everything tallied, not a good deal. Laundry but people camp out so seldom available.Ugly-decent Kaisaiki but over priced. Better quality available in numerous places.So, not bad, but can do better.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Niwa Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff was extremely helpful and very pleasant. The hotel is very close to Tokyo Dome City. 5 minute walk. Breakfast was included. They gave us a smart phone (no charge ) to use during our stay. It was very helpful, The rooms are small but quite comfortable. They gave us everything that we needed. I would stay here again visiting Tokyo
hotelName:
15    Hotel Niwa Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We found this hotel ideal as it was located within 5 minutes of the Metro, and it was easy to travel wherever we wanted to get to consequently. Its not far from Ueno Park by metro where there is masses to see and do, museums, the lake, the pagoda etc. The hotel has a very nice ambiance, calm, with a big foyer, with comfortable sofas. We couldn't get into our room unfortunately until official check-in time (they would have let us if there had been a room ready) so we left our luggage with them and sallied forth to do some sightseeing. The staff were very friendly, spoke English. Good european and japan breakfast buffet. A good choice of hotel in the heart of the city. we had a superior twin room. It wasn't that spacious so glad we had the upgrade.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Niwa Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel aesthetic was very nice. The staff were pleasant and room size was reasonable for Tokyo. The location was, in our opinion, fine but not amazing and if we returned we would not stay here again primarily for this reason (quiet area and still a little walk to station whereas our previous cheaper hotel in Akasaka was right next to a station entrance) . Also if you're looking to eat at the hotel... I appreciate it's a nice 4 star but breakfast was the equivalent of £17 and not worth it considering the alternative options available elsewhere.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Niwa Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I wanted to thank Mio Asaka (浅賀　美緒) for the best hotel responses I have ever seen in my life. I wrote a note in the hotel stay asking for a room with a view and she wrote an essay back explaining the height of the building and what it overlooks. I knew this hotel was good at that moment. She did everything she could to make my room accommodating. Thank you Mio. Mio is the same name as my brother's cat.The hotel is small but beautiful. You are greeted by a small Japanese garden then a tall 20ft+ door. The room is small, but feels like modern Japanese. Shoji doors that let the sunlight in.They provide a smartphone. It kept popping up ads, but you can carry this around and talk many minutes to anywhere. If you plan to call all over the world, you might actually come up ahead.The gym only has 3 cardio machines which was a little disappointing. Function room had a few massage chairs, laundry machine and an outside area to hang out.The location is 3-4mins from the Suidobashi train station. Maybe about a 5-10 min walk to Tokyo Dome, Space Museum (wack), and a huge mall next to it which had some Japanese Pop Group singing while men jumped around.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Niwa Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very good Hotel. Good connection to Metro and still close to Union Station. In case of a Return it is my First Spot for a next stay. Very friendly staff.The room was clean and quite although the location is close to the downtown area.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Niwa Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rooms are large by Japanese standards and very comfortable. The breakfast is very good and the staff are extremely helpful. The location is very good for travelling around Tokyo by public transport. Overall, a very pleasant stay.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Niwa Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed 6 nights at Hitel Niwa Tokyo. 5 mins walk from suidobashi railway station so nice n quiet. Comfortable beds & nice western style showers/ bathrooms with good shower pressure. Helpful staff would defnitely stay again.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Niwa Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our initial reaction to our "standard" room was to ask for an upgrade. But the only available upgrade was 6sqM for $$ more. So we cancelled the idea.As we got through our 8-day stay we realised that the room was small and the double bed more like a large single provided in many hotels but we were out of the room most days and we got used to living out of our suitcases and minimising our occupation of the space available the Japanese way.The cupboard was the slimmest I have ever seen, fit only for our coats. Our clothes had to be folded and kept away in/over our suitcases if we wanted a semblance of order.But aside from the tiny room and lack of storage in the room, the bathroom was very well fitted with shelves, a collapsible string for drying smalls, baskets for towels and clothes and a most efficiently draining tub. Loved the aromatic hand/face foaming wash.The amenities outdid the lack of space: the softest most comfortable cotton pajama suit, the self-service laundry, the massage chairs free to use,the vending machine, a microwave and the pleasant out-door smoking area for those in need of it. Tokyo is an expensive place for accommodation and if I could afford the bigger rooms I could come back to Hotel Niwa! Short walk from Suidobashi station (JR) Lots of eateries around and Tokyo Dome for shopping and entertainment.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Niwa Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is located 5 mins from the Suidobashi station in Tokyo, within walking distance of Tokyo Dome. Absolutely beautiful hotel tucked away on a side street - the rooms, compared to other Tokyo hotels, is exceptionally spacious and comfortable, with large private bathroom facilities. The staff is extremely accommodating and pleasant. We enjoyed mochi pounding and sake tasting activities while staying there. Would HIGHLY recommend this hotel!
hotelName:
15    Hotel Niwa Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Checked in here thrice. Will come back again. Very nice hotel. Quiet neighborhood. Minutes away from train station. They had mochi making, sake tasting and traditional music when we went there. Staff were super helpful and nice. Overall, had a nice stay.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Niwa Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have stayed at this hotel many times over the past 5-6 years with multiple trips per year. It is convenient to the tokyo dome area and the sumo venue. The rooms are really small but comfortable. I feel the service and friendliness of the staff has declined over the past two years. I can feel a vast difference in the service. I except the recent popularity of this hotel and tourism boost in Japan has strengthened their business but you can find other hotels with more square feet for the price if you look around those with close proximity to a train station you are probably better off. I have recommended this hotel to several people over the years but am now recommending others which are also convenient
hotelName:
15    Hotel Niwa Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When I book hotels in Asia, including Hong Kong and other fairly dense cities, standard rooms often have some semblance of a view. The hotel should specifically indicate that some rooms may face another building's wall, as opposed to rooms with a view -- if I had known that the standard room may *not* to have any view (though it could be that some rooms have a view -- I don't know), I would have booked one that *did* have a view. Considering that we stayed at the property for 8 days, and that the fees we paid were not negligible, I really feel that we could have been provided a better room than one that faced a wall. Granted, the interior design had a few interesting bits, but that was something we got from every other hotel we stayed in in Japan anyway.The other issue that I had was that wi-fi was abysmally slow. While I stayed at the Niwa on holiday, I still wanted to dial in to a couple of meetings abroad -- impossible with wi-fi where it took a full 5 minutes to upload a 2 MB document.Yet another one is that for a room with two people, the storage space was almost non-existent. This was NOT true for other hotels in Japan that we stayed in, so I'd definitely say it's below standard.Would not stay here again.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Niwa Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had a superior non-smoking room with two twin beds. The staff at the front desk went out of their way to help me with arrangements that I could not make without the aid of a Japanese speaker. The room was quiet, pretty, clean, and big enough for a solo traveler. It included a comfortable desk for working and a nice view of the city that could be screened off for privacy. The massage chairs in the lounge room were a nice perk. Also, the food at the Bar & Grill in-house restaurant was surprisingly good.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Niwa Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have traveled quite extensively through Asia (mostly China and Hong Kong), including 7 around-the-world trips for work in one year. This was on a personal trip to Tokyo and possibly my worst experience at a hotel. My flight got delayed in Vancouver, due to the wild fires in San Francisco. I emailed the hotel but they claimed they never received it. The hotel refused to adjust my stay, or refund me on the night I was not there. When I arrived at the hotel (at nearly 10pm after a full day of travel) they said they didn't have a record of my stay, and proceeded to charge me an additional $400 USD to stay there. Since it was so late, I had no choice. When I asked to speak to a manager, no manager came out to even speak to me or address my complaint.I got upstairs, found the room to be damn and humid. The next day, after they found my reservation, the front desk called 3 times after 11pm and on top of that never refunded the night that I didn't come OR the breakfast I had originally paid for. I have never been treated so badly by a hotel in all my years of travel. I wouldn't want anyone to stay here and be charged through natural disasters, and things out of your control.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Niwa Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent 7 nights here, we liked this hotel the best of our 2 week stay in Japan. Very conveniently located near 2 metro lines and Japan rail station, good choice of restaurants within a 10 minute walk or so. Staff all very charming and helpful when needed. Reasonable room size (twin) with good layout and nice little roof garden on 3rd floor, laundry facilities too.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Niwa Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A very relaxing, small hotel between the Imperial Palace and the Baseball Stadium. Gardens are beautifully designed to provide a lovely stream sound. Room was immaculate, well appointed and good sized for Tokyo. Room complete with mini-fridge and all other expected amenities. Japanese Restaurant on the property is superb. Breakfast includes all Japanese, European & American breakfast options. Staff was very helpful for directions and for helping get our luggage from one hotel to the other. All travelers should use the very reasonable luggage system if you are traveling with anything more than small carryon luggage. Laundry service is superb but they also have an in house coin-operated washer & drier for the business traveler. Great experience!
hotelName:
15    Hotel Niwa Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in two hotels this trip enroute to Nakasendo. This hotel was recommended by our agent. Our friends chose this hotel+ Plus pointsCozy boutique feelEfficient check inFree bottle water everydayJapanese gardenNice walk to Tokyo Dome food courtMore reasonably priced than Sunroute- Not my favouriteNo shopping aroundShinjuku is more convenient with access to shopping, Toei line to Tsukiji, airport limousine, JR stationShinjuku in comparison is more convenient, you save travelling time. Camera, cosmetics, Uniglo, famous shops all have branch. But more expensive by S$50 per night for same sized room. Shinjuku is also claustrophobic crowded.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Niwa Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 3 nights at the end of our Japan tour. Friendly helpful staff, comfy room with all the regular complimentary items. Perfect location being only 5 minute walk to suidobashi station on the jr railway system. Would certainly stay here again if ever in Japan.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Niwa Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had one night at the Hotel Niwa at the end of our holiday while travelling with friends (who stay at more upmarket hotels than I usually choose). The location is good, an easy walk from Suidobashi JR station on the Chuo-Soba line. Staff were friendly and efficient, beds single but comfortable, the room layout efficient. My only complaint is that the lighting wasn’t bright enough in the room - far too dim for my liking. Breakfast was good but expensive at 2,500 yen per person.There are lots of reasonable restaurants nearby.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Niwa Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First time to Tokyo and had a wonderful stay here. Staff is fabulous... Very attentive and helpful with any assistance needed.We stayed in a triple room and found it to be spacious (Per Tokyo related hotel comments). Easy to get anywhere via Subway Trains (We had JR Passes), with plenty of restaurant options nearby.Will stay here again, when travels take us to Tokyo again!
hotelName:
15    Hotel Niwa Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a quiet elegant place to stay. The staff really go out of their way to make their guests comfortable. Clean pajamas on the bed every night was a surprise and a delight. The restaurant was very comfortable with excellent food.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Niwa Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for four days during a recent trip with my fiancée. The checkin process upon arrival was smoothly handled without any issues which was great after a 10+ hour international flight.We stayed in a superior double room which was generously sized. The king bed was very comfortable as were all of the linens.The breakfast buffet was delicious and had a good selection of different types of food. We both ate heartily every morning before heading out for the day.In the evenings the neighborhood is quiet and peaceful which is great after a busy day. That may seem as a downside to some individuals but I have been to Japan many times over the years.I think the value you receive for your money here is much better than if you stay near a major station such as Shinjuku or Shibuya. For a similar size and quality hotel near those areas you will likely expect to pay significantly more per night.The hotel itself is very close to a metro station as well as a JR station which can easily get you to any of the other areas of Tokyo quickly and with minimal effort. A twenty minute or less train ride can get you to almost every major point of interest in central Tokyo. All of the staff were extremely professional and polite and during our stay. I filled out the hotel questionnaire and to my surprise I received a thank you letter with a hand folded origami crane back at my home address in the US. It certainly shows a commitment to provide their guests a pleasant stay.I would definitely recommend it to anyone and will keep it on my short list of hotels for future trips back to Tokyo.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Niwa Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel room and facilities were adequate for the price. The customer service was very good. However, the location could have been better for the subway and location restaurants.The lounge room and laundry facilities was nice to have on site.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Niwa Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: To all:I and my Mother traveled to Japan last week and overall had a Wonderful Time. Our stay in Tokyo was at Hotel Niwa. God's will, I look forward in vacationing to Japan again and when in Tokyo, I'll be residing at Hotel Niwa.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Niwa Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Niwa is located near Tokyo Dome, home of the Giants baseball team as well as a small theme park, shopping centre and conference venue. It is under 10 minutes from both Suidobashi stations (the nearer one having the JR Chuo-Sobu line which accepts JR Passes and connects with other major lines, and the farther having the Mita line) and it is well-signposted.On the first floor (or ground floor) are both the French-inspired Lieu restaurant (where breakfast is served) and the Japanese restaurant (where an alternative Japanese breakfast is served on weekends and public holidays, but you will have to queue from 6.30am for it as only 12 seatings are catered for). Two floors up from there is the relaxation lounge with three amazing massage chairs as well as a smoking terrace, vending machines for drinks and SIM cards, and washing and drying facilities for clothes.The rooms are a good size by Japanese standards although the long double beds are actually quite narrow for two people. Rooms include Niwa-branded pyjamas changed every day which are very soft and comfortable and which you can buy from reception. The bathrooms have the famous Toto Washlet bidet toilets and the usual amenities (razors and shaving cream, toothbrushes and toothpaste, hair brushes, cotton pad sets, shower caps, sponges). Rooms include a large writing desk with phone, a large flat screen TV, and are air-conditioned. There is also a free smartphone for use during your stay which has web browsing, social media, a camera, email, a Tokyo tourism guide, Google Maps and free international calls to certain countries. There is also a foldout storage for suitcases and a small cupboard with hangers.My only issue with the rooms is how dark they are - the headboard is backlit and there are bedside lights, and there is a downlighter over the desk which also has its own lamp, but still the room is very dark due to the fabric-effect wallpaper used and the fact the window blind can only ever be half-opened.Breakfast has an excellent selection despite being expensive (like every hotel). There are some Japanese dishes but also steamed Chinese buns, sausages and eggs and bacon, a large salad selection, good fruit selection and they will freshly cooked eggs however you like.The hotel is near Tokyo Dome for food and shopping and rollercoaster rides, but past Tokyo Dome is Tokyo's oldest garden which has a small entrance fee and is well worth a visit. Also past Tokyo Dome is the Bunkyo Civic centre (government offices). The 25th floor is a free observation floor with a very nice and very popular restaurant (expect queues). From this floor you have a panoramic view of Tokyo and can see Mount Fuji on a clear day. They have leaflets for an app which lets you take virtual tours of the sights you can see from that floor.The local JR station, Suidobashi, connects with the faster Chuo line after one stop which will take you to Tokyo station. The JR station also takes you to Akihabara which is the anime and technology district.The Mita line from the farther Suidobashi station takes you near Tokyo station directly.Getting to/from Narita airport is easy - the Airport Limousine coach runs from the Tokyo Dome hotel which is a 10-15 min walk from Hotel Niwa. Book online in advance, and pay at the travel desk next to reception in Tokyo Dome hotel 15 mins before you board the coach.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Niwa Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was wonderful and I had a great time there’s a nice park not to far away. The room was beautiful and I like the view, I would recommend this place to all of my friends visiting there. The rooms were spacious.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Niwa Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel in Tokyo. Service was superb with excellent in-room amenities, such as daily pajamas, daily slippers, bathroom stuff and the best part a “travel buddy type of iPhone” to use for free! The only downside was it’s in a residential neighborhood, so not much night life but very close to metro.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Niwa Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is so cozy and near to the train station, you can go to akahibara walking in 20 min or so, the staff are welcoming and the hotel have coin washing machine, how ever the room is too small and I think this is a standard in most of tokyo hotels as I been told, but I love the hotel as everything around it as a walking distance.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Niwa Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 2 nights in this very good hotel close to Suidobashi station and a 30 minute walk from Tokyo station. The hotel is modern Japanese in style with good use of wood and comfortable bedrooms with good ensuite facilities.The reception staff were exceptional and spoke English. Ideal hotel for a short break in Tokyo.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Niwa Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent about 5 days here last month and loved it. It's quiet and inexpensive comparatively, but very near public transit and also in walking distance of a lot of local restaurants. The room was small (as expected), but clean and well designed. The bathroom was nice. What makes this hotel so exceptional is that every room has a smartphone that you are free to take out of the hotel for that day. It wipes its memory when you check out. Being American, we knew our smartphones wouldn't work in Japan except with wifi. Having this local smartphone allowed us to use google maps and look things up on the go while traveling around the city, which was extremely helpful.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Niwa Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for three nights and would definitely go back again. The hotel is everything we were looking for: comfortable, quiet, and located close to transit toward the center of the city. It was that, and more. The staff was very helpful, and we were very appreciative of how easy it was to communicate in English (as we speak basically no Japanese). There's a relaxation room in the hotel with a small outdoor patio surrounded by nicely landscaped plantings where we enjoyed a self-catered breakfast. Hotel Niwa is an excellent value for Tokyo!
hotelName:
15    Hotel Niwa Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff was extremely kind, attentive and helpful. Since my previous visit, the English has improved significantly. The regular breakfast was very good, the Japanese one excellent! And the room was quiet. All this made for a very pleasant stay.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Niwa Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Pleasant stay. Plenty of choice for breakfast English or Japanese. Decent sized room with all the bathing/hair requirements.Worth remembering you can’t book into your room until 3pm so if you have an early morning landing into Tokyo book an extra night from the day before.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Niwa Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed 7 nights over a two week period in between travels. Overall the Niwa is a lovely, boutique style hotel. Welcoming and calming entrance. Staff is friendly once you speak with them, otherwise they do keep to themselves. Very helpful as well with directions, ideas and minor issues. Personally had no complaints or problems. I'm sure based on some of the other reviews that it is all about communicating correctly. Google is a good translator when needed though the staff did speak English well which is the best form of communication if you don't speak Japanese.The two different rooms I stayed in were spacious for Japan. The larger of the rooms had a beautiful luxurious bathroom. Quite large with a separate shower and tub with a view. Beds are super comfortable. Slept well which is not always the case for me in hotels.Rooms are very clean as well as the bathrooms. Well stocked from tea/ coffee to bathroom necessities. Depending on the floor and room, there are great city views to be had.Location wise it was just a 4-5 minute walk to Sudobashi station which I used as my main station though used the two other stations as well which were about 10-12 minutes away. Breakfast was wonderful. It's a one price meal, so I would not suggest it if that is not appealing to you.Had dinner as well. Pricey for some people possibly. Will say the food and service was very good.Five star hotel for it's really wonderful...but I like to be fair for it's not a super high end luxury hotel which has over the top service and amenities. But it doesn't need to and thankfully is not. The Niwa perfectly gives you what you need at a very reasonable price. Great as a business hotel. Great for travelers who want a quiet location and not be in the hub of Shinjuku / Ginza or the like. It was wonderful to come back to the Niwa at the end of long days and relax.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Niwa Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice and clean, we stayed for 7 nights. The staff was always very helpful and attentive. Very good location for moving around Tokyo. Excellent breakfast. Amazing traditional Japanese dinner. Very useful massage chair - located on the 3 floor after busy day of exploring Tokyo.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Niwa Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: They gave us a smoking room even though we asked for a nonsmoking room. I can't sleep because the room reeks of cigarettes and it's so hard to breathe. It's so suffocating! Go somewhere else if you actually want to enjoy your stay. It is not worth a sleepless and frustrating night.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Niwa Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Myself and my husband stayed here for two nights at the end of our trip. The hotel was nice and clean and in a convienant location. They only issue is that we got a smoking room which for non smokers wasn't ideal. They unfortunately didn't have any other rooms available, so we had to put up with the room which smelt pretty bad. Unfortunately I think that may have reduced our experience of the hotel. However, breakfast was very nice, plenty of choice. I probably my would stay here again, I'll just make sure I have a non smokers room!
hotelName:
15    Hotel Niwa Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Tucked away down a quiet side-street this hotel provides welcome relief from the hustle and bustle of the city.As per any Tokyo hotel, the rooms are compact and everything is made to just fit. However, the bed was large and comfortable. The hotel was clean and quiet.The air conditioning was good and was able to keep the room at a nice chilly temperature during the night.The "Handy" mobile phone was a really excellent addition to the room. This is a smartphone that you can take out with you to provide free data and international calls during your stay. We just used it as a hotspot and it was invaluable.I would happily stay here again.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Niwa Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel entrance lets you know you have just stepped into a little garden haven. (Niwa meaning garden) Just a few blocks away from the Suidobashi Station, you can access Chuo-Sobu and Yamanote trains, the Tokyo Dome and the beautiful Koishikawa Korakuen Gardens. My room was modern Japanese, spotlessly clean and all the bath conveniences and toiletries, white fluffy towels, slippers and fresh PJs every day. I loved staying here because the staff was so friendly and helpful.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Niwa Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I loved the decor of this hotel. There were touches of traditional Japan in a thoroughly modern setting. The small garden with a creek was lovely; the running water could be heard from the third floor. Off that floor there is a small patio. Overall, the hotel was a peaceful oasis in bustling Tokyo. Prior reviewers got it right: very convenient to public transportation, very nice breakfast buffet (my cousin was talking about the strawberries for days), very clean, laundry & vending machines available, near restaurants and convenience stores. Best of all was the concierge Yuriko who helped me navigate Tokyo. Her help made the difference between a so-so visit and a great travel experience.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Niwa Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: stayed here for 4 nights.- breakfast had decent number of options, croissants were amazing!- cheap laundry machine- found the massage chairs useful after a long day roaming in Tokyo- Suidobashi station is a 5-6 min walk. I visited Roppongi/Ueno/Chiyoda areas from here and they required a change over. Tokyo Station/Shinjuku are one stop though. So 'convenience' is subjective I guess. The nearby area goes dull at night. No big city feel in this neighbourhood. - standard room was pretty small. I see some reviews mentioning that they are larger than other Tokyo rooms but trust me, its not suited for a longer stay if you are used to more space ( I did stay in Ginza for the 2nd leg of my Tokyo stay and the room was better there)overall, this is a nice business hotel and all the basic stuff is well taken care of.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Niwa Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I am so glad we chose to stay here for our time in Tokyo. It is very conveniently located, clean, nicely furnished, and overall just a very pleasant stay.For Japan, the rooms are large and the best part for me is they have quite a generously sized bathtub, perfect for soaking in after a long day of walking around Tokyo. Our bed was comfortable and it was nice that you could open the window. They also provide daily complimentary water which is a real godsend. Their in room pajamas and slippers were great. The staff speak perfect English and were very helpful and professional. We did not try the breakfast. There is a good curry place and cafe nearby as well as a 7/11. The train is a less than 5 min walk away.I would definitely stay here again!
hotelName:
15    Hotel Niwa Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very clean and elegant and nicely decorated. Great room temperature control options and beds were quite comfortable. Enjoyed the pretty Japanese architecture. Staff was wonderful. Located in a quiet neighborhood that is about a 5-10 minute walk to a JR station. Close to Shinjuku. Highly recommend.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Niwa Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Tokyo hotels tend to be small and overpriced, some so small you can’t even open your suitcase. This place has got the price, quality and room size ratio near perfect. I grew up in Tokyo and now live overseas but when I visit Tokyo I always stay here. You will not get better value at any other hotels in the vicinity. Only a Y1,500 cab ride from Tokyo station or 10-15min train ride it is close to many of the major train hubs. Additional recommendations...1. Try the oriental bar Momo-no-mi right next door to the hotel and you will be amazed with the quality of southern Indian style curries. If unsure order the chicken curry and make sure you say “chicken curry set” which will get you all the yummy condiments. 2. Nightcap at the wonderful Bon Vivant wine bar 2 min from the hotel. Go straight for the wines by the glass, the owner behind the bar and senior sommelier Ms Etsuko will bring out some well selected bottles. Try the snacks too you won’t be disappointed, especially the cheese plate.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Niwa Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Well located with various JR and subway stations close by make this a suitable base to explore Tokyo. Friendly service and decent size rooms. We did not have breakfast included as it’s easy to find something close by in the morning. 7/11 that’s open 24h next door is also convenient when needing something small. Stayed 3 nights and were satisfied. Hotel offers a handy phone which can be nice for those wanting to limit the use of their private phone and data.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Niwa Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was very happy with the hotel overall. The room was clean, well stocked with toiletries, coffee, tea, etc and very well-maintained. The staff was courteous and very hospitable.  The hotel is a short walk from Suidobashi train station and Tokyo Dome. This was our 1st hotel stay during our 1st trip to Japan and it was an excellent pick. The high rating it receives on Trip Advisor I think is well deserved.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Niwa Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is the third hotel in our 10 days Japan trip and 2nd one in Tokyo. Compared to the first two, this is a total disappointment. This is the only only hotel I been to in Asia doesn’t provide coffee, the tea bags is so cheap that I found better one at 7-11 around the corner. When I request a tea set to make some tea, the answer I get was, sorry, we don’t have it; even photos of rooms with tea set on their website and poor service just ruined the whole experience. The 1/2 of the massage chairs was broken when we were their. Our experience at Celestine Hotel in Tokyo is much, much better experience. Their staffs go out of their way to make sure we have a great stay.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Niwa Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for six nights as part of the 16 day Japan journey and I am glad we had Tobu as our introduction to Japan. After arriving in Haneda airport from US/Canada, it was a quick trip via the Airport Limousine Bus with a stop right at the front door of the hotel. This convenience can’t be overstated as after a long flight, you don’t want to have to navigate the hectic Tokyo subway transfers on arrival day. Especially if you are coming in during the rainy season like we did, you don’t want to worry about dragging your luggage in the rain. It is much better with the direct bus drop off.As some have complained, the rooms are not large by US/Canadian standards. But that’s expected for a large metropolitan city. We booked a quad room and it was a bit of work to move luggage around during the night/morning to get clothes for next day. Since we were seldom in the room as we spent most of the time exploring the city, the smaller sized room was not a big issue.The additional charge breakfast was a great value considered what you get. Be sure to add that as part of your online reservation with the booking web site. It’s considerably less expensive when breakfast is added as part of the room cost versus having to pay when you are there. For the people that complained in their review that the breakfast is repetitive, the answer is yes and no. There are changes daily but it’s subtle like types of fish changes or type of pastries may change after couple days. But there is enough variety to choose from even for a 6 night stay. You just need to leave the comfort zone of always have to eat the more western style breakfast. I picked between western and eastern style breakfast daily and had plenty to eat.To save money, we didn’t get the sky tree view rooms but you can just walk right outside of the hotel and take a picture down the street. The hotel has sky tree discount tickets that you can buy at the front desk to save few dollars off of the sky tree if you plan to go to the top. We just did a leisurely walk to the Sky tree on next morning after arrival just to get a feel of Tokyo street vibe. It’s a simple 25 minute walk.There are numerous restaurants just across the street as well as by the metro station 3 blocks away. If you buy the 24/48/72 hour Tokyo metro pass (sold at front desk as well as many Tourist offices), you can go to many places in Tokyo with the pass for a set price. The hotel is located on the east side (more historical side) so if you are more interested in Asakusa/Ueno/Tokyo station (for transfer to the Shinkansen), this hotel is in a great spot. Shibuya is 30 minute away on the Hanzomon line with no transfers. Shinjuku is 30 minutes away on the JR’s Chuo line so it’s not like you are hours away from the center but if you insist to stay next to the action places, then this place is not for you. For me, it’s good to stay in the quieter neighborhood after a hectic day of sightseeing and fighting the crowd.Lastly, I appreciate hotels that respond to my inquiries prior to arrival and I emailed Tobu many times prior to arrival and they were always prompt in their reply. They even left a note at the check in that I was interested in purchasing a 72 hour Tokyo pass as I had inquired about it previously in my email so that’s part of good customer service.Overall, this is a good value for your stay, especially if you have family of 4 as not too many Tokyo hotels have 4 beds in a room and with its location/breakfast/value for money, I would highly recommend Tobu for your Tokyo stay.
hotelName:
16    Tobu Hotel Levant Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel was a relief after long flight, as it had direct airport shuttle from Narita airport (about $25 per person but worth it). Check-in easy, room for 4 people was spacious, view of the city amazing, bathroom clean, shower pressure great, very complete bathroom amenities (shampoo, conditioner, bath/shower gel, toothbrush, toothpaste, etc...). Beds and bedding were firm and comfortable, room was well air conditioned for good sleep conditions. Concierge very knowledgeable and staff very helpful and spoke english. Helped with clear instructions to every site, activity, restaurant we wanted to visit. Next to Kinschicho station and super convenient mall next door which you can access by 2nd floor of the hotel. 7Eleven, Family Mart right in front of the hotel. 24hr coin laundry mat 1 block over. Walking distance to the Tokyo Skytree and surrounding neighborhoods are the Sumo wrestling area (Ryoguku), the anime area (Akihabara), old Tokyo (Asakasa). Hotel also has free shuttle service to Disney and Disneysea which was again very helpful. Distance to central Tokyo (Shibuya, Shinjuku areas) is about 30mins but easy with the transit system in Tokyo. Very enjoyable stay!
hotelName:
16    Tobu Hotel Levant Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We flew in overnight after long haul flight with aged parents over 70yrs old and I did request before arrival for early check in for obvious reason. Regardless how many times you explained the situation all they did was asking 50% additional for 2 hours early check in although the room was apparently available.Everywhere you go you don’t see this type of money craving mindset ...would never never recommend.
hotelName:
16    Tobu Hotel Levant Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I guess for a hundred usd in Tokyo, this is what you will get... 500 Mt's from station and metro... Old hotel... Small rooms. Nice breakfast. Average... Just about OK to stay if on a budget. But not recommended... Travel time into City Centre is 30 to 45 mins 1 way.... Spend 150 and stay in the centre... I feel.... Did not take pics.... Enough to look up. Bhagwan.
hotelName:
16    Tobu Hotel Levant Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff were very welcoming and helpful. Good lication, 5 min walk to Kinshichō train station, and 4 conbinis nearby. They also have free bus shuttles to Disneyland and Disneysea and a few airport limousine bus lines a day to and from the hote (about 2000 yen). Room was quite big and pretty, very clean and with a beautiful view of the city. Wonderful!
hotelName:
16    Tobu Hotel Levant Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great Hotel in a good location for train travel and sightseeing Easy walk to the Tokyo Tower. Good service from hotel Staff Plenty of small eating places around the Hotel..Interesting area.Hotel provided free of charge a direction finder which was invaluable for moving around Tokyo
hotelName:
16    Tobu Hotel Levant Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My daughter was sure we were at the wrong hotel since it was on a few minutes walk to the Kinshichō Station (Sobu Line - Rapid). Since it's so close to the station, it's easy to get around to many locations in Tokyo. It's about 20 minutes walk to the Sky Tree. There are a lot of stores, eating establishments, and convenience stores nearby.The rooms are nice with AC and dehumidifiers. The rooms and bathroom were designed with foreign visitors in mind. We got two complimentary bottles of water daily. The buffet breakfast has something for everyone; the food was tasty. The downstairs coffee shop had the best shave ice...the water in imported from Nikko (according to my Japanese friend, Nikko has the best water.). It HUGE and fluffy. You have to eat it relatively quickly before it starts melting.I will definitely keep this hotel on my list for return trips to Tokyo.
hotelName:
16    Tobu Hotel Levant Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Upon arriving at this hotel, the staff greeted us so warmly and check in was so efficient. It was lovely to be able to get to ones room quickly and to be able to freshen up for an evening of exploring. The hotel is situated in Old Town of Tokyo and I was worried that my husband and I were staying in the wrong part of town but we were not disappointed. The train station is an easy 5 minute walk away as well as shops being close by and plenty of food outlets to choose from to eat at. Convenience stores were close by too.The Sky Tree Tower looks closer than what it is - it is a 25 minute leisurely stroll away from the hotel. It too offers plenty of shopping and eating outlets.This hotel is quite large and our room faced onto the railway tracks, proving to be quite noisy especially at night but we got use to them - last train at midnight, first train at 5am. The size of our room was good and the amenities were very good.We were given 2 bottles of complimentary water each day, we had free wi-fi in our room and the bonus of being given a smart phone proved to be very valuable. Not once did we get lost travelling around Tokyo with the hotels smart phone - a big tick by us.The hotel also offered a beautiful buffet breakfast on level one each morning with a good selection of food. One morning it was quite busy due to a tour group but the hotel set up one of their conferences room as an overflow, which proved very helpful.The hotel has a lovely lobby with a special area for group check-ins. In the middle of the ground floor is a lovely cafe that provides music/entertainment at certain times - it was very pleasant having a coffee plus a cake after exploring Tokyo all day, although it wasn't cheap.The hotel provides a complimentary shuttle bus to Disneyland/DisneySea a few times a day (see the schedule) - it must be booked as soon as possible. The ride on the coach there and back was lovely.The hotel will also book any hotel to airport coach transfer on your behalf; we really appreciated this service as we expected to be lugging luggage on the trains to the airport. The cost for this transport was not too bad - we did make two other stops on the way to the airport.The hotel was very clean, modern, great large lifts, good quality towels, etc and extremely efficient staff whom seemed to love their jobs.My husband and I look forward to returning.
hotelName:
16    Tobu Hotel Levant Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed one week in this hotel during our stay in Tokyo. The hotel is conveniently located near Kinshicho station (for both JR Line and metro). It's one of the few hotels in Tokyo we found that accepted children and offered enough space in the room to stay together. The free shuttle bus to Disneyland is a nice bonus. The breakfast buffet offered many options, Japanese and Western. Cleaning was spotless and the staff very helpful. I will definitely stay here again when visiting Tokyo next time.
hotelName:
16    Tobu Hotel Levant Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I researched different Tokyo hotels, finally decided on Tobu Hotel Levant.Very glad Idid, stayed 5 nites with my teenage sons. Location, Cleanliness,, close to Eateries, Train station, Mall, and Laundromat ticked all the boxes.Breakfast good selection with the added Bonus of a DIY freshly squeezed Orange juice machine.Plentiful supply of hot water, very strong pressure,and a bathtub too, which my Son's enjoyed.Very well maintained Hotel, room very spacious.The staff although difficult to communicate in english, put in the effort, all requests met. The helped me with the Airport bus to Haneda Airport,(Pick up from Hotel), and Disney Sea Shuttle Bus, also pick up from Hotel.I intend to visit Tokyo again, next time staying longer and will stay at Tobu Hotel Levant again.This is the first visit for all of us to Tokyo,Our purpose was to go to China first, the airline allowed us to have a stop over in Tokyo. Great visit, Excellent choice of Hotel!
hotelName:
16    Tobu Hotel Levant Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for 3 nights with my husband and teenage sons (17 and 13). Check in was smooth and friendly (we had paid for early check in and that was expensive) and our room was clean and comfortable with great views of the city (20th floor). We had a quadruple room, 4 single beds in a line which was cosy (!) but there was just space enough for our suitcases etc. In other hotels in other cities we visited the “single” beds were larger divan size which on reflection was better and I would look for in Tokyo next time. The shower was very good (over a bath), good selection of free toiletries and good towels! The breakfast buffet was expensive but according to my husband and youngest son was very good. Make sure you collect your breakfast discount tokens when you check in. The restaurant on the top floor had even better views, we had a set menu available only to hotel guests which featured “Wagu” steak and it was delicious, if a bit pricey (6800 yen each, including one nonalcoholic drink).
hotelName:
16    Tobu Hotel Levant Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I don't really understand how this place is rated so highly. I stayed 2 nights and things were really just average. The location is pretty good. Overall I wouldn't say Kinshicho is the most convenient neighborhood in Tokyo to be based in, but the hotel is less than a 10 minute walk to both Kinshicho train and metro stations, which was convenient. Nearby are plenty of convenience stores and restaurants. Like some other reviewers noted, there is some adults only nightlife in the evenings in this neighborhood, but it isn't visible in the immediate vicinity and it doesn't feel unsafe next to the hotel. Checking-in was quick and pleasant. They seem accustomed to English-speakers and other foreign guests. The lobby interior was bright and pleasant. My room had 2 twin beds and it was about average in size for this type of hotel in Japan. Everything seemed clean. The free wifi seemed adequate. The TV was ok, 2 English language channels. The AC/heater was easy to use. I appreciated the 2 free bottles of water a day. The "Handy" brand free smartphone was useful, even though the user interface is quite clunky and sometimes laggy. The free coffee didn't taste very good, and finding a place to plug-in the big water heater was actually a bit difficult. Not a big issue however.The bathroom was somewhat of a good surprise. Although the toilet is slightly too close to the sink, the overall size of the bathroom is slightly above average compared to other Tokyo hotels. And the bathtub is a decent size. I really appreciated that this bathroom actually has some space for your toiletries next to the sink. I just wish that they provided hand lotion. The shampoo and body wash/gel seemed pretty good.Unfortunately, 2 big problems ruined the stay for me. First, the bed was quite hard and my back was actually aching a bit when I woke up everyday. Also, there were 2 types of pillows offered, but I didn't notice much of a difference. They were both too hard and somewhat uncomfortable. The 2nd big problem was the fact that my room faced multiple train tracks, so it was super loud about every 10 minutes as the trains passed by, sometimes multiple ones simultaneously. The first time that I heard it, I actually thought that it was a monsoon storm pouring down torrential rain, which was not the case. This quickly got old and stressful. I called the front desk and complained about the noise. I asked to move to another room, but they claimed that they were all full. Perhaps this was true, but I was very dissatisfied that they could not offer another solution. If you come here, you should definitely bring earplugs, and even then, it may not be enough. At least checking out on the last day was very easy. Overall, the Tobu wasn't that bad, but given the 2 major issues, I would not come back again. If you're a light sleeper or have back problems, you should avoid this place.
hotelName:
16    Tobu Hotel Levant Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wonderful hotel very clean. Located next to train station and mall. Awesome breakfast plus a lot of little extras in the room like bottle water ,toothpaste ,toothbrush ,robes .slippers. The room was a little small but after all this is Tokyo I wasn’t expecting anything as big as we will get in State. Front desk was very helpful but did not speak much English so was very difficult to communicate with most of the employees.
hotelName:
16    Tobu Hotel Levant Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed two separate time at this hotel and we found it to be clean, good room size with the view of the Tokyo Sky Tree and all necessary amenities and comfortable beds. They provide a smart phone free of charge which we found to extremely helpful and we even made call back to the US. The breakfast buffet has a large spread with both western and Japanese food and their diner buffet isn't bad either. We were however, somewhat disappointed at their Sky view restaurant, they don't speak English and consequently not able to answer questions about any menu items and their food should be better for the price that they charged.
hotelName:
16    Tobu Hotel Levant Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed a few nights and had 4 single beds for our family. Was perfect as everyone had their own space. The food st breakfast was wonderful. Fantastic selection. I could have Japanese style and the rest of the family traditional western breakfast with the teen even sneaking the icecream for breakfast!! The hotel was beautiful and location was great. We will definitely be staying again on our next trip.
hotelName:
16    Tobu Hotel Levant Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here, booked 2 rooms - one for my parents and one for myself, my wife and baby.The staff was very warm and friendly , never had any issues at all.Each room includes a handy phone (free data, free local calls and room to room when out and about - incredibly convenient) and a smart tv - you can log into your streaming services .Next time, I'll do my best to rebook here.
hotelName:
16    Tobu Hotel Levant Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My family (me, my wife and 2 boys) stayed 8 nights at the hotel. Upon arrival, we were told that my 7 year old child has to pay the full price equivalent that of 1 single room for the next 8 nights even if he is sleeping with us without an extra bed - no negotiation. This was very upsetting because in Expedia, it clearly showed that the room can accommodate up to the 2 adults and 2 children. We also paid for a twin room with an additional sofa bed (total 3 beds).Fortunately we contacted Expedia through a relative in Singapore and very quickly, Expedia contacted them and we were allowed to be charged for the price of an extra bed instead. We have to accept since it is a "more reasonable" rate. However, our room was not changed and there were no additional bed in the room.Having started on a sour note from an overnight flight, we put that behind us and decided that it should be a great holiday.Tobu Hotel on general is situated in a very good location - one word - CONVENIENT. There were amenities, eateries, a number of supermarkets, and most importantly, connected to JR station and Tokyo subway. This helped planning travels and visiting attractions a lot easier.The Hotel is old but clean. The rooms are big for Japan standard, each bed is bigger than a twin but smaller than queen, good sized toilets with bath tubs and easy to control shower. Provided generous supplies of toiletries, towels, hangers etc. The sofa bed was initially very thin and hard, we got the housekeeping to add a layer of mattress over it and it was fine after first night. Provided a mobile device in each room for guests' navigation, though we did have our own data card. Unfortunately WIFI was not fantastic, weak or no signal when many guests are hooked on. They can't do anything about it. We had missed packing our power adapters and they were able to help us with that.Breakfast had a good spread but as all other comments you read here, served the same every other single day. On a day we could not make it for breakfast, they packed some juice and croissants for us to take on our journey.They had free Disneyland/Sea shuttle buses to take you to/fro. However, very important to reserve your seats and make sure your name is on the list. They were so strict with all these paperwork!In summary, our family enjoyed ourselves tremendously in Tokyo. Well, partly, the location and comfort of the hotel played a part.
hotelName:
16    Tobu Hotel Levant Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located just by the Kinshicho station making travelling around Tokyo easy. The staff were very pleasant and helpful with good English.Handy coffee shops towards the station if not having breakfast in the hotel. One side is next to the railway but with good insulation the train noise was barely audible in the room. Free mobile phone is very handy. It could be said that the room was a little tired but was always immaculately clean and large compared to some Tokyo rooms. This was the first time I had stayed at this hotel and would not hesitate to stay again.
hotelName:
16    Tobu Hotel Levant Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location may not be the greatest, but it's within walkable distance to the subway and JR station. We have walked about 30 minutes to the Tokyo Skytree and I thought it was a very enjoyable walk, you can to experience the Japanese lifestyle without being crowded like in Shibuya or Shijunku. From Haneda airport, there's also an airport shuttle you can take which drop you right in front of the hotel, so you don't have to hassle around the subway / JR with your luggages. Rooms are very decent in size, bigger than lots other Japanese hotel. There are 24 hours restaurants and convenient stores right across the hotel so if you are jet-lag and wake up in the middle of the night, you won't be starved. The hotel also has a shuttle to the Tokyo Disneyland. Staff are so nice and helpful, like alot of other Japanese, they may not be perfectly fluently in English but they sure did try. My mom speaks decent Japanese so we had no issues communicating with the staff and when asking for help. They surly tried to help even when they heard me speaking to my mom in English asking different questions and comments.Also, the hotel breakfast buffet is a MUST to try. It offers whole range of varieties and they even have a self-serve orange juice machine. It's about 30CAD but I found it worth every single penny. Even it's not located centrally in the tourisy area, but I think I will return to the same hotel next time when I visit Tokyo.
hotelName:
16    Tobu Hotel Levant Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We, a family of two adults and 2 teenage children stayed here for 3 nights From check-in assistance with keeping our luggage till the room was ready to guidance with local services and directions we were well looked after. The sky tree view room and breakfast buffet exceeded expectations. What made it special was the personal support given by Guest Service officer Yumi Tazaki in arranging local train tickets, transfers to Disneyland and even working past her shift end to help with filling in the forms to get 3 pieces of luggage sent to our hotel in Osaka. Yumi's pleasant manners and attention to detail made her and the hotel shine. Will definitely come back. Great Job.
hotelName:
16    Tobu Hotel Levant Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is near station, lucky me that our view room was facing Sky Tree. Room was clean we have 4 bed in one room, comfortable.
