Amenity was complete, our kids got " special " slipper and brush teeth. There was Limousine bus from the hotel direct to Airport, convenience if you brings lots suitcase.
hotelName:
16    Tobu Hotel Levant Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Large older hotel in nice area, but staff was not friendly, breakfast was too expensive and room was just average. Room was too hot with sun blaring in throught the window and thermostat did not work. When we asked for another room, they refused and told us all rooms were booked when we knew they were not. Much better hotels such as Dormy Inns.
hotelName:
16    Tobu Hotel Levant Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We visit this hotel twice during our trip to Japan. Really nice hotel with good facilities near Metro and JR station. This is very useful if you have JR pass. You can walk to SkyTree around 10-15 minand after it going to Asakusa Temple, where are you can find big souvenirs market. Rooms is quit big with tea/coffee maker, 2 bottles of water wil be offered each day. Breakfast is perfect, it include western style dishes and asian corner. You can take a soft icecream if you want.
hotelName:
16    Tobu Hotel Levant Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel served us very well during our recent 8-day trip in Tokyo. We liked the fact that there was complimentary good neighbour shuttle bus service to go to Disneyland/sea theme parks from the hotel. It is recommended to book in advance though in case the bus is full. I booked it online before the trip. Very convenient! It is also a stone’s throw away from Kinshichō station which makes public transport easily accessible. We took the train on some days. Beside the train is a shopping mall which you can find almost everything you need in it like a supermarket, drug store, Uniqlo, Daiso, kids departmental store, food etc. McDonald’s and Starbucks are also available there if you crave for some non Japanese food. We also tried some eateries opposite the hotel. You can find ramen, bbq food, Japanese bentos, 7-11 etc there. Burger King and Yoshinoya are along the same street too. Spoilt for food choices. You can also book a limousine bus to/fro airports or choose to take JR line to hotel if your luggage is manageable. The hotel is also very clean. We will definitely stay at this hotel again !
hotelName:
16    Tobu Hotel Levant Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Set up base here and travelled throughout various parts of Tokyo over 7days. Clean & good sized room that can cater to 3pax/room comfortably. 3min walk to JR/Metro Stations. Cross a road to access 7-11 & Lawson. Basic shopping needs are well catered to in the shopping malls around the area. Additional plus point.. you can take a leisure 20min stroll (with luggages!) to Oshiage Station (Sky Tower) to take the KS Narita Skyaccess to Narita Airport. Reasonable convenience given the taxi costs and complexity of navigating the rail system. Recommended !
hotelName:
16    Tobu Hotel Levant Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: clean rooms and good-sized for Tokyo. Near Tokyo sky tree and easy access to Narita airport via direct local train (not Narita express). Less than 5 minute walk from train. Hotel is also on Narita bus line (luxury coach) but service more limited. Staff was very nice and provide good restaurant recommendations.
hotelName:
16    Tobu Hotel Levant Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A great location with subway and it line around the corner. Airport limo bus stop in front of the hotel. Free baby cot provide for infant below 1 year old. Hotel room consider big for Japan standard. Bath tub size is international size compare to mostly Japanese hotel size. SomeFloor come with ice machine (need to check with front desk) 24hour convenience store and eatery is opposite the road. Free shuttle bus for both Disney land and sea. Although this is a “good Disney neighbour hotel” but they don’t have any Disney Channel on tv. WiFi willDisconnect in middle of the night. But overall this is a great hotel.Especially you are travel with kids
hotelName:
16    Tobu Hotel Levant Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here during a week trip with 2 other friends and this hotel was everything we could have asked for. The room was spacious, and we each had a single bed larger than standard. We booked the non-skytree facing room but the view was still great, looking out over onto the rest of Tokyo. Free water bottles and the toiletries, (including toothbrushes and toothpaste!) were replaced every day, even if we left the room late and there was more than enough for the three us. The complimentary phone to use for calls and data was way over our expectations and came in extremely useful for google maps. The hotel restaurant overlooking the SkyTree was under construction and closed when we stayed but this didn't affect us and we heard no noise within the hotel, despite being in a quieter area of Tokyo but still has a lovely atmosphere and night life with lots of places to eat nearby. There's also a shopping centre and a JR station around a 3 minute walk away which was a nice surprise!Would definitely come back, this was the best hotel i've stayed in yet! And affordable!
hotelName:
16    Tobu Hotel Levant Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was our first time in japan and we could not have chosen a nicer hotel to stay with. Our trip was split beteen Tokyo and Osaka. Tobu Lavant Tokyo sports sapacious family room with lovely view of the sky tree tower made it even better. Located just 5 minutes walk away from Kinshicho statione this hotel whilst being well connected to the city is protected from the hustle and bustle of Tokyo. Friendly and helpful staff make the stay here pleasurable. The breakfast on offer is very good and the hotel is ideally located for taking leisurely walks. I will definitely stay here again and would recommend it too....overall really happy with our stay at TOBU LEVANT TOKYO
hotelName:
16    Tobu Hotel Levant Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From check in, we arrived about 2 hours earlier, the staff gave us the first good news—she got us in our room early. The 2nd good news came in as we got to our room—the view. While overall its tiny space is functional. The location was near a metro station and lots of food shops & some quick shopping. The great experience was driven by great staff, very helpful in every interaction. Thanks! We’ll never hesitate to come back.
hotelName:
16    Tobu Hotel Levant Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were happy with everything about this hotel. Stayed 13 nights; close to shopping, and transit. Most gracious people with exceptional customer service. The staff are very helpful in every way. We were pleasantly surprised at how large the room was (2 twin beds and additional couch that turned into another twin). They still used china cups for coffee/tea. towels were supplied everyday as well as toothbrushes/toothpaste and a large abundance of shampoo/conditioner & body wash.The beds were very comfortable and we were able to adjust the heat and air conditioner to suit us at any time. I can't recall exactly how much we paid for each night of stay but knew it was reasonable and would stay there again in a heartbeat! They offer a buffet breakfast ( food was very good) and also offer limousine service to and from the airport (Haneda). Loved staying there!
hotelName:
16    Tobu Hotel Levant Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked a room with the view of the Skytree. Our 12 floor room proved a great view and lit up at night provided a pleasant focal point. Whilst slightly dearer, would recommend paying for this upgrade.The hotel is in a good location to explore the city and the nearest station a five minute walk away. Rooms in the hotel are smaller than most western hotels. However, immaculately clean, comfortable and satisfactory for our needs. A good addition is the smart mobile phone for use by guests to gain access to the internet in the city and indeed phone internationally at no cost.Hotel staff are extremely helpful and very polite. It has to be said this is common to almost all Japanese people who in general go out of their way to be helpful.We have no hesitation in recommending hotel Tobu and would stay there again if we return to Japan
hotelName:
16    Tobu Hotel Levant Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After a 15 hour flight and checking in, was given a room on the 22nd floor.AsI got off the elevator, on my way to my room only to hear a baby cry. The more I approach my room the louder the noise was. Only to find out, next to my room the noise was coming from. The staff was so kind and understanding, that my room was changes and upgrade. The location is great that I barely spent time in my room.I washout early (bus and train station 5 mins away) and in late. Did not get a chance to checkout the amenities offered.
hotelName:
16    Tobu Hotel Levant Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 6 nights in a quadruple room. We had the best view of the Skytree. The room is small compared to hotels in the US but a decent size for Tokyo. Beds were super comfy. The shower was to die for. Wonderful pressure and a huge tub for Asia. The hotel shampoo, conditioner and body wash were all Shesiedo. They smelled heavenly. I really wanted to purchase them but couldn’t find them in the stores. Housekeeping was immaculate in tidying up the room and replenishing toiletries and amenities. The hotel provides free water daily and there’s an ice machine near the elevator. Everyone at the hotel were super polite and helpful.The wifi was a bit tricky but once we asked the front desk we were able to utilize it. The rooms were not completely soundproofed, we could hear our neighbors next door banging around and some stomping, running noises from the floor above. It was not too bothersome since we were out most of the day.The location is great. It is about a 20-30 min walk to Skytree or one metro station away. The metro and Jr are about a 5-10 walk away from the hotel. There are two huge supermarkets near the train station Seiyu and Japan Meat. The mall near the train station has many restaurants on the 10th floor. The restaurants close at 10:30 pm so you can have a late dinner. There are two French bakeries nearby and tons of restaurants around the station. The mall also has Uniqlo, Muji, Gu, and Daiso.The hotel has limousine bus pickup and drop off from both Narita and Haneda airports.We would definitely stay here again. We miss Tokyo already.
hotelName:
16    Tobu Hotel Levant Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is a 4-minute walk from Kinshicho train station and is close to tokyo skytree. They have a really grand entrance so you can't miss it. They offer a free shuttle to disney resort. The service is amazing, they went above and beyond when I asked them for direction. The room was a decent size and it was a full size bed. I only stayed here for one night, but it was a pleasant stay.
hotelName:
16    Tobu Hotel Levant Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We recently stayed at Tobu as a family of 2+3. The staff we encountered were all very friendly especially the receptionist who helped me find a Dr on a Sunday after my daughter put beads in her ears and the gentleman who checked us in. The rooms were all very clean and stocked thank you housekeeping. The fact Tobu has rooms that can accommodate us in one room made things so much easier. The mobile phone available in the room to take out with you was a fantastic and such a great idea. Location wise we found really good easy to get around. There’s a playground five minutes down the road super helpful with kids. Plus there is the free bus to Disney which makes a long day easier. Our only negatives were the coffee prices in the lobby lounge was excessive and the breakfast buffet was a little repetitive after a week. I wouldn’t hesitate to recommend this hotel to family and fiends. We will stay here again when we return to Tokyo.
hotelName:
16    Tobu Hotel Levant Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We selected Tobu Hotel Levant Tokyo because of other great tripadvisor reviews, its location and value. Needless to say, we were not disappointed. This hotel is located 3-5 min walking distance from Kinshicho station which has both subway and JR train (Sobu line direct to Narita, without transfers for 1,350 yen) and it takes about 20 to 40 min to get to other areas of interest inside Tokyo. There is a Limousine bus direct from Narita to the hotel but it's only offered twice a day. This hotel also offers a free shuttle bus to and from Tokyo Disneyland which is great if you have little kids, specially on the way back when they are tired. You can also buy Disney tickets at the front desk and skip the 30 minute ticket line at Disneyland (keep in mind that the hotel does not sell fixed-date Disney tickets, which we did not mind, since the crowd forecast was good mid-week)Our room was spacious for Tokyo standards and contained every known gadget and necessity. The cleaners were excellent and very detailed. There was an ice machine in the hallway. The TV offered mostly Japanese TV with one channel that had occasional English news. We were also offered an android cell phone which had unlimited data and voice and was indispensable for google maps and street directions. You could also download apps from Google Play - we downloaded google translate, Tokyo subway app and TDR Alert for Tokyo Disney wait times. The phone's user interface was a bit clunky and ad-supported, but it was a great free service by the hotel. The mattresses were comfortable. There was just a bit of outside noise from the trains and some minor noise from people passing in the hallway, but no different than most places. The email communication with the hotel prior to our arrival was prompt and all of our many questions have been answered in great detail. Everyone from cleaning staff, managers, concierge and the front-desk staff were very polite, knowledgeable and always very helpful. There are 2 convenience stores (Lawson's and 7 Eleven) right across the street from the main entrance and 2 french bakeries (one in the train station and the other one next to the southern entrance) There are many restaurants on the side streets and an entire floor of family friendly restaurants on the 10th floor of the nearby Arcakit shopping center. In case it rains, you almost don't need an umbrella and can go strait from terminal 2 of the train station to the Arcakit shopping center which has hotel access on the second floor (west gate). If it doesn't rain there is a big park nearby (Kinshi park) that has a playground for kids. Across the street from the Kinshicho station (east side) there is an escalator access to the basement of the Rakutenchi building with a big supermarket that's affordable and has a pastry section and a large take-away food section with a very large inventory of prepared foods and sushi. Rakutenchi building also contains several restaurants and fast food places (including KFC and a Subway) as well as a 24/7 onsen (spa) on the 9th floor. Overall - this was a great choice and gets five stars for location, service, convenience and for solving a lot of issues tourists face in Tokyo.
hotelName:
16    Tobu Hotel Levant Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: we had an amazing view of Skytree. the room for 4 was small but it was nice, comfortable beds, the shower was awesome. Free WiFi. very clean. The free loaned cellphone allowed us to access google maps and other useful information at all times which was very helpful. The staff was very kind too.
hotelName:
16    Tobu Hotel Levant Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: everything was always really clean. I enjoyed my stay immensely! all the amenities were more than I expected. the staff is exceptional. This location is really close to the JR and tokyo metro so we got around cheaply and easily!!
hotelName:
16    Tobu Hotel Levant Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fabulous hotel, spacious rooms, wonderful amenities. Very close to the train station. We were able to take the JR Sobu line from Narita Airport (about 1350 yen) since our JR passes didn't start till the next day. Nice quiet neighborhood with plenty of shops and restaurants around. Our room had a great view of the Tokyo sky tree. My only regret is not purchasing the Breakfast buffet option ahead of time. Even purchasing it at the hotel each morning, I felt like it was worth it...tons, and I mean tons, of options, both Western and traditional Japanese. And with 4 teenagers, the buffet was money well spent. Front desk staff was very nice and concierge was so very helpful. All in all we enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay again.
hotelName:
16    Tobu Hotel Levant Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Truly enjoyed our stay in Japan.. Tobu Hotel is by far the best hotel we stayed in. The staff were helpful and accommodating, The room is nice and you have a wide selection of breakfast buffet. Love to go back to Japan again!.
hotelName:
16    Tobu Hotel Levant Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A good hotel which offers a nice location - close to Kincho station and to Sky tree. The hotel is big and offers free WiFi, I would have liked a gym though. Big breakfast buffet with both Asian and western offerings.
hotelName:
16    Tobu Hotel Levant Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed with family (2 adults 2 children) for a week in mid June. Stay was fantastic. Hotel staff were all friendly and super helpful. Like all of Japan hotel was spotless. Breakfast buffet was also great; though as others have mentioned, the menu did not rotate. I did see two roaches on two separate locations in the breakfast area; however since the breakfast area was pretty much spotless we did not deter us from eating there again.
hotelName:
16    Tobu Hotel Levant Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms were spacious and clean, and had a magnificent view of the Tokyo Skytree. Location was conveniently next door to a mall and a train station. Breakfast buffet was above average. Staff were very friendly and service was great.
hotelName:
16    Tobu Hotel Levant Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful hotel with a great location. Staff were amazing were so helpful with everything. So close to shops,transport,restaurants,7/11,Family Marts and the amazing Sky Tree Tower. Highly recommend would definitely go back 5*
hotelName:
16    Tobu Hotel Levant Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms were spacious and very clean. The Buffett breakfast was the best we had had on our tour. On the 24th floor there was a bar and fabulous view.Staff were very helpful and polite. Close to 2 large shopping centres with lovely quality gifts to take home and the metro station. There are many restaurants near the Metro with yummy food.
hotelName:
16    Tobu Hotel Levant Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Highly recommend - We stayed here after a day at Disney. There is a free shuttle bus from both parks. It's about 30 mins (may be less as we got stuck in traffic). The hotel is clean and easy to navigate, staff are very helpful (although this is typical for Japan). The room was quite cramped but not unusually so for Tokyo. However, we were comfortable (2 adults + 1 child).It is near Sky Tree, which is worth a visit even if you don't plan to go up. There is also a nice gardens/park which you can walk through to get there. You really don't feel like you're in Tokyo, it's so peaceful. The breakfast buffet was superb! There is so much variety and you will want to try everything. You definitely won't need lunch!
hotelName:
16    Tobu Hotel Levant Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spacious hotel rooms located conveniently next door to the Kinshicho Station and a couple of large malls. Relatively easy walk (approx 20 minutes) to the Sky Tree Tower. Nice breakfast buffet offering a combination of Western and Japanese foods. The hotel conveniently has regular Airport Limousine bus service to both major airports. Fantastic restaurant on top floor offers delicious Japanese set menus.
hotelName:
16    Tobu Hotel Levant Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is nice and well functioning. We were there in a period with many guests. The hotel handles this nicely, although it might get crowded at breakfast. Staff is friendly and efficient. Rooms are not very big, but layout is good so you don't really notice it
hotelName:
16    Tobu Hotel Levant Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located right next to Kinshicho station allowing easy access to Tokyo’s rail system. Within walking distance of the Tokyo Sky Tree and the Asakusa shopping precinct. Many good eating places and bars nearby . If you can afford it eat at the restaurant on the hotels 24th floor (Skytree View Restaurant and Bar) and enjoy stunning views of Tokyo by night. If your budget doesn’t stretch that far there is an all you can eat buffet on the 2nd floor.Rooms are large by Japanese standards and come with the usual amenities ( fridge , TV , A/C ,safe etc) and good bathroom.Buffet breakfast is an experience only because of the sheer number of guests. Great selection of Western and Japanese food.The best hotel we found on our tour of Japan.
hotelName:
16    Tobu Hotel Levant Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From all reports, we were expecting a bedroom where there was only room to sleep standing up!What a pleasant surprise to find that the room was very spacious!There was one English channel on TV, but when it came to news time, they dubbed it into Japanese!The breakfast was excellent too.We decided to have dinner in their buffet restaurant and were not disappointed. The range of dishes was fantastic and reasonable priced too.
hotelName:
16    Tobu Hotel Levant Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is located in close proximity to Kinshicho Station of the Sobu Line and the Chuo-Sobu Line. In fact, there are direct JR trains from Narita International Airport (amost 1.5 hours). To tourists staying at the hotel and using JR passes such a convenient location is extremely advantageous. In addition, a large number of shops and restaurants are within walking distance.The front desk staff is courteous and helpful and understands English perfectly.The room itself is fine, althouh the twin-bed type is a bit small for us with two suitcases and a snowboard bag. The bathroom has a shower and a bath and, of course, all the necessary amenities. Free Wi-Fi service is available.On the first floor there is a smoking room, outside of which there are a couple of vending machines.I will definitely consider staying at the hotel again the next time I visit Tokyo.
hotelName:
16    Tobu Hotel Levant Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 3 nights in October on the first leg of a round-Japan trip and it ticked all the boxes. Not far from Kinshicho station from which you can basically access the whole of Tokyo reasonably easily, a 20 minute walk from the Skytree (which we had an amazing view of from our room), and a good-sized breakfast buffet with plenty of choice. Add in a comfy bed and a decent-sized room for Tokyo - can't ask for much more than that at a very reasonable price too. If I'm ever lucky enough to be back in Tokyo, I'd gladly stay there again.
hotelName:
16    Tobu Hotel Levant Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Tobu Hotel is very decent and clean. Hotel is relatively quiet with pretty good. Breakfast has a good spread of varieties and staff are pretty friendly. A great view of the Skytree from their restaurant and bar at level 24. Lots of smaller eateries surrounding the hotel and very closed to the train station.
hotelName:
16    Tobu Hotel Levant Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in this hotel for two nights prior to a cruise. Our room was large enough and very comfortable with all the necessary requirements; a refrigerator, safe, kettle for making tea or coffee and an English TV channel CNN. The bathroom was a good size with an excellent shower and satisfactory bathroom products. Breakfast was free and consisted of cereals, croissants, little hot pizza pieces, fruit juice and tea and coffee. The hotel is situated a few minutes walk from Shibuya Station and the famous Shibuya Crossing. There are many eating places very close to the hotel and so it was easy to find a place for dinner. We ate at Han no Daidokoro Kadochika on both nights. It was a short walk from the hotel
hotelName:
17    SHIBUYA HOTEL EN
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Shibuya En was very nice. We had much more room than in the other two hotels we stayed in during our trip. The bigger beds were wonderful! We were on the second floor, by request, and it was super fun! The staff was great, very helpful. But we did not love the area. A little seedy, frankly. There is a lot of shopping and sights in the Shibuya area. This hotel is close to the station - but do NOT try to lug big (or even small) luggage in this area. But there are a lot of bars surrounding. Our last night, being a Friday night, was ridiculously noisy. Realized as we were leaving for our flight to go home Saturday morning that there was a bar across the street with their windows wide open. That was the source of the noise all night - and they were still going strong. I didn't enjoy the restaurant just across the street but there was another a couple of blocks away that was wonderful and I wish I knew the name - on the receipt, it translated by Google to Chinese Ramen, I believe (it was across the street from an Outback).
hotelName:
17    SHIBUYA HOTEL EN
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was reasonably priced for the location. Includes everything you need (clean, up to date, water included). The staff are friendly and accommodating.The room is very small (which makes sense in Tokyo) and if you are travelling with friends you may find the clear bathroom uncomfortable (as mentioned in other reviews). While there are curtains it may still be a little awkward. As a couple it wasn't issue, however I did find it added a clinical feel to the room which wasn't the best.We found the mattress to be too firm for our tastes and it did give both my partner and me sore backs. If you prefer a firmer mattress this may be great.Being in Shibuya the location is great, and the part of Shibuya it is in is nice. There are loads of food options and it is just the right amount away from the crazy Shibuya crossing. On the downside it is quite a walk (just under ten mins) to the train station. There were no laundry facilities and there is no wash and fold within walking distance. There is a coin laundry nearby.I would stay here again, however would prefer something closer to a station (even if it meant being in a less popular spot i.e. outside of Shibuya).
hotelName:
17    SHIBUYA HOTEL EN
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect location in Shibuya. Friendly and English speaking staff. Room was small but most places are in such an ideal location. Breakfast was included at no charge- coffee, toast, pastries etc. room was cleaned daily. Great ramen spot just across the road that is open until 4am. We really did enjoy the location! Each floor has a quirky decor. Would definitely stay again!
hotelName:
17    SHIBUYA HOTEL EN
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for three nights and its location is brilliant. After spending only 10 days in Tokyo as a tourist, Shibuya is the part to stay in. The hotel was nice, offered a free breakfast but foremost - the staff was brilliant and very service orientated. Booked an Executive room and to my surprise it has a massage Chair.The only downside... it was difficult to find. The entrance is Cool but very anonymous. So we walked by it. GPS does not work very well due to it comes in ”shadow mode” at the narrow alleys. It is a short walking distance from the Metro station, Starbucks, Tully’s and a load of rock clubs! Highly recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
17    SHIBUYA HOTEL EN
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Well remodeled hotel near the center of Shibuya!It almost look like an old apartment complex that was converted into a boutique hotel and they did a lot to make the small space feel modern. Yes, the shower / bathroom are all windows which gives it a modern feel and makes the small space look bigger at the same time. Don't worry there are curtains if you want privacy. The whole room has everything put away to conserve space. Yes, the hallways are decorated differently on each floor.Toto bathroom was top of the line. The bathroom had some motion detection that gets the everything ready for you as soon as you walk near it. Smell? none. Poo? gone. Seat? Warm. I will buy that bathroom one day. Bed was comfortable. They are proud of it that they have paperwork talking about who made it.Finally a hotel that offers decent speed wifi. 50mbps. It's not fast, but most hotels get tourists downloading movies all day killing internet for the rest.The service was superb. Was about to buy an umbrella. Then the worker said don't buy one, and handed one to borrow for free.Location? Literally go outside and you are next to a TON of food choices and even night clubs and stores. It's a very good location if you want to be in the middle of action. The constant load of people does get tiring though.Price is great if you keep an eye out on the room rate. The price fluctuated a lot. I recommend booking a cancellable room. I was able to book for about $150/night. The price kept fluctuating between $150-250.Was able to hear a lot of noise outside. People slamming the doors or just stomping on the floor above. Not sure where it was coming from but people are quiet after 10pmish.The front door when entering was VERY heavy.Like many Japanese hotels, you need to turn in your key before leaving. This feels secure and not secure at the same time. You don't have to worry about someone stealing your keys and going to your room, but at the same time, the workers can just hand your keys to someone random.Overall, this place offers great value for a unique stay.
hotelName:
17    SHIBUYA HOTEL EN
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location - really good location, near to a lot of restaurants and walking distance to Shibuya crossing and Train. What I want to highlight is the Staff! I left my wallet at the Safe and they were so efficient and nice to handle the shipping back to Singapore. I got my wallet and money - all intact - an in just 5 days. thank you for ensuring I get it back. they even included a thoughtful note, special mention to Sawaya from the front desk. Thank you!
hotelName:
17    SHIBUYA HOTEL EN
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms were very clean and had up to date amenities. The room and bathroom were comfortable enough to accommodate me and my girlfriend, along with our three suitcases. There was adequete desk space for us to do some work from our laptops too!The staff was extremely helpful in booking restaurant reservations for us at places that did not speak English. They also helped retrieve my phone that I left in the back of a non-english speaking taxi. They were a life saver.Finally, the location is in a very convenient location close to major shopping, restaurants, night life, Shibuya crossing, and the metro/train station.
hotelName:
17    SHIBUYA HOTEL EN
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect location on Shibuya . No noice so it’s Perfect. The service is good as well The Only problem is the room even if you take the Premium. Very small and no place for you clothes... But the most important is the situation absolutly perfect !!!! Thank you for this amazing Trip
hotelName:
17    SHIBUYA HOTEL EN
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for only a night or two but it was comfortable enough. Clean and small but we only had carry ons so really didn't need much. The location is great for visiting Shibuya crossing and the area around it. When we visited, there was a little continental breakfast included. It wasn't the greatest, but good enough. The bathrooms are odd because they have glass instead of walls. I smashed my head into the door because it was clear and I'm a big moron. So. Be careful of those bathroom doors!
hotelName:
17    SHIBUYA HOTEL EN
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice! There were added value that we were not aware of a simple breakfast was served in the bar which was a nice surprise, since it's so hard to find western breakfast places in Tokyo, and a free drink for guests in the bar when the DJ was playing which was also very nice. There as no wardrobe and almost no space for storing but it was worth it. Can't imagine a better location when staying in Tokyo.
hotelName:
17    SHIBUYA HOTEL EN
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked last minute when an Airbnb booking fell through and I'm so glad we decided to stay at this hotel! The location is incredible - only a short walk away from the amazing shopping, food, and scramble crossing in Shibuya. And less than 10 minutes walk from the JR station. The room was quiet, beds were very comfortable, and the bathroom was big in comparison to many of the other places we stayed in Japan. Staff were very attentive and lovely. I would definitely stay here again!
hotelName:
17    SHIBUYA HOTEL EN
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was our first hotel in Japan and it was the best we experienced along our travels!The location is spot on- walking distance to get to the JR and the subway so your journeys are limitless!We stayed in the superior double which is worth the extra cost with a larger space! The decor was beautiful with lovely curtains that could be draped around the bed- very snuggly!The room, like most places in Japan, was incredibly clean and tidy with a fantastic shower with so many different functions to enjoy and relax to!As mentioned, there are small pastries, coffee, juice available for breakfast which is the perfect early morning snack as breakfast was a challenge for us westerners! Overall, it was the perfect relaxing rest from the busy Tokyo outside- a very quiet, peaceful space.Worth every penny and would definitely return back- across the road was a brilliant 500 yen bar too!
hotelName:
17    SHIBUYA HOTEL EN
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We wanted to stay in Shibuya for the start of our 3 week trip in Japan and chose this hotel because of its location and fair price. We booked a slightly larger room (modern double) because we were afraid the standard rooms were too small and it was a good call. The room was clean, comfortable and the amenities were of good quality. There was a complimentry basic breakfast with coffee, tea, juice and pastries. The staff was very nice and the location is perfect - about a 5 minutes walk from Shibuya crossing and station.
hotelName:
17    SHIBUYA HOTEL EN
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hands down the best hotel in Shibuya. It's central to all great shopping and a short 5 min walk from Shibuya station which will take you anywhere in Tokyo. Staff is very friendly and helpful taking care of every single detail. Rooms are big and spacious which you are going to want for your stay in Tokyo. I've booked AirBnBs and it has just been too tiny. This hotel is super reasonable in pricing and spacious!
hotelName:
17    SHIBUYA HOTEL EN
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here in September for our anniversary and this was a new ce hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful. We forgot our key on the door and they were nice enough to keep it with them until we got back. The room was a good size with a good size bathroom. The only thing wrong is how close the put the toilet to the wall. But other than that the room was clean and nicely presented. It was about a five minute walk to Shibuya Crossing and close to the shops. We even got a drink voucher on check-in at their bar which plays great music.
hotelName:
17    SHIBUYA HOTEL EN
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is conveniently located in Shibuya, about a 5-10 minute walk from the station. Stayed in the double full room which was spacious for Japanese standards. Bathrooms were excellent. Front desk staff is very friendly & warm.However, as it is located by some bars you can hear music throughout the night. Not terribly loud but you can notice it if you wake up in the middle of the night. Also, you must leave your key at the desk when you leave.Overall, I’d stay here again. It’s a great place, great location, great staff. Not for the uber light sleepers.
hotelName:
17    SHIBUYA HOTEL EN
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wow very beautiful stay! Very convinent to every places you want to go. Staff are friendly and help. Book early for cheaper price. Highly recommend this place. Free breakfast available to start your day :)
hotelName:
17    SHIBUYA HOTEL EN
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for my last night on honeymoon. The room was decent and of a good size. We didn’t get drinks vouchers as other guests did and we didn’t eat the breakfast. The hotel was situated in a bit of a dodgy area however really good location and very close to the Shibuyu crossing. The room was also bigger than the 2 other hotels that we stayed in situated in Shinjuku.
hotelName:
17    SHIBUYA HOTEL EN
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Service: The staff was lovely from check in to check out. They still use keys here so you are required to drop off your key at the front desk before you leave the hotel and pick it up upon return. The front desk is open 24/7. Housekeeping did a great job of freshening the rooms daily.Rooms: Space is a premium in most buildings in the city of Tokyo. With that, expect a smaller room but designed well and clean. My studio room with one bed was tight in space but I never had any issues with it being too small. The bathroom was well stocked with essentials in case you forgot to pack something.Location: Location Location is key and Shibuya Hotel En is in a great one. It is walking distance from the Shibuya Scramble crossing and the Shibuya JR station. Most importantly, the Golden Ball Bar is literally across the way and there's all kinds of late night dining options within walking distance. The Mega don Quixote for souvenir shopping and Lawon's are nearby. Miscellaneous: In the morning, they have a free breakfast of pasties, croissants, coffee juice and tea in the bar. Each floor is decorated to a Japanese theme and are great social media moments. I paid $149 a night and would definitely do it again taking everything Shibuya Hotel En has to offer. Enjoy!
hotelName:
17    SHIBUYA HOTEL EN
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I like this hotel for the location and the service. The hotel is in the center of Shibuya. It's close to everything - transportation, restaurant, shopping. I also take a walk from the hotel to Omantesando shopping area and it's quite fun.What I don't like about the hotel is the breakfast. It's totally rubbish to serve the same thing over and over and I stayed here for 6 nights.I'm undecided if I will choose here again for my next Tokyo trip. For the price we paid, I might be able to find a hotel with the same location but better breakfast.Still, stay here if this is your first time exploring Shibuya
hotelName:
17    SHIBUYA HOTEL EN
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great for the traveller experiencing Tokyo for the first time. Located in the Shibuya area it’s walking distance to the train, famous crossing, endless shopping, restaurants and bars. Hotel was very quiet and the beds were really comfortable, so much I had one of my best nights sleep in a long time! Staff were super friendly and answered all my questions and went out their way to help out. I really appreciated the complimentary evening drink at the bar too..Thanks again I look forward to my next stay!
hotelName:
17    SHIBUYA HOTEL EN
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A well located, simple/basic hotel within walking distance to Shibuya station. Small room, but creatively designed. Clean, simple bathroom - no tub, unusual for a Japanese hotel. A simple continental breakfast included. Good English speaking skills at the front desk. A decent option!
hotelName:
17    SHIBUYA HOTEL EN
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I booked this hotel in late May. It was our first time in Japan, so we researched extensively to choose a hotel that was affordable and had a great location. Shibuya Hotel En, was the choice for us for our 4 night vacation.Only a 7 minute walk from Shibuya Station/Shibuya scramble. It was easy to navigate to the hotel with our luggage. Once we arrived, the employees were super nice and was able to communicate in English very well. The room was small, but we expected that staying in Tokyo. My wife and I managed with 2 large luggage comfortably around the room (getting dressed, showering, packing and so on). The size of the room isn’t much different than a boutique hotel in Manhattan. The bed was comfortable. The room was clean and organized. The tv was huge. And the bathroom was superb. We didn’t care so much about the glass windows that surrounded the bathroom. The toilet was super clean and high-tech. And the shower was awesome especially after a 16 hour plane ride and walking around Tokyo all days we spent there. We both felt super clean and refreshed.The location was great. It was quiet, there was a 7-11, family mart, and Lawson’s all in walking distance. Only minutes away from shopping and eating. And only a 7 minute walk to Shibuya Station, which was ideal for us because we used the train to go where we wanted to go.Overall we loved the place and we would gladly stay here again on our future trip back to awesome Tokyo!
hotelName:
17    SHIBUYA HOTEL EN
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked 4 nights at the Shibuya Hotel En to start a 4 week holiday in Japan. I booked on Agoda and thought $1,200 Australian dollars for 4 nights was expensive but maybe that was typical Japan. Well, it wasn't. I had a 21 day rail pass and travelled from Tokyo up to the top, Sapporo on Hokkaido, and down to the very bottom of Japan, Ibusuki on Kyushu. The Hotel En was double anywhere else and I stayed in a couple of 4 star hotels. The room was small (12 square metres), the bed had a wall on each side so I had to crawl up from the bottom which was difficult with a cup of coffee. Breakfast was bread and coffee. It was ridiculously overpriced. On my return to Tokyo I stayed in a different area called Ueno. I booked into the Mitsui Garden Hotel at 12,500 yen versus 24,000 at the Hotel En. Ueno was a much better hotel as it had a proper sized rom, there was a very big park close to the hotel with a zoo, National Art Galley and museum and right next to the subway. Hotel En was about 1 kilometre plus from the subway. We live and learn. If the management add an addendum to this criticism don't believe it. It's a rip off.
hotelName:
17    SHIBUYA HOTEL EN
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our room was spacious enough given what we were expecting in Japan. The glass bathroom didn’t bother us as it helped with the spacious feeling. Small range of items for breakfast as advertised but what was available was fresh and very nice and staff always friendly and helpful. Location amazing - department stores, cafes, restaurants, marts and shibuya station and crossing all close by in walking distance. Reception staff very friendly and helpful.
hotelName:
17    SHIBUYA HOTEL EN
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very clean. Great location in Shibuya--fun area to walk around in. The room was very small with no room for clothes or luggage. The breakfast was minimal. There is a Starbucks just down the street and many great restaurants around the neighborhood. I think it seemed like a poor value because the prices were inflated because of cherry blossom season.
hotelName:
17    SHIBUYA HOTEL EN
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was a good hotel to stay at, excellent location close to Shibuya station. The rooms are adequate, keeping with Japanese size of rooms. The staff offered us a free drink each night which was great. But the service was fantastic. They were quick to provide any help we needed i.e. booking taxis etc and were very polite - all the time. We left our passports in our hotel room and travelled to Kyoto. They made every effort to ensure our passports were sent safely and arrived in good time for our international flight. That was amazing!
hotelName:
17    SHIBUYA HOTEL EN
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We checked in December 2017 at EN Hotel. Room was clean, not very big, just what you need if you only want a place to sleep in after an all day travel. Toilets have spray/bidet features. Corridors are themed per floor. The anime theme was kinda cool.  Choose a higher room so that it would not be too noisy at night as there is a bar at first level below the hotel room.Location is not very near the main Shibuya area so you have to walk a little. Near convenience store, family mart across and a little far away down the street is Lawsons. There are restaurants and coffee shops around the area so that is pretty cool. Staff are friendly, and we are accommodated to leave our luggage after check out since our flight is late in the afternoon. They will provide you with luggage number tag so that you can safely claim your stuff later on. So we had extra time to explore the areas around for eating and shopping a little more before heading to the airport. You can use the train going to the airport with pre-purchased ticket at the train station. The Japan trip was great and we will be back for more soon!
hotelName:
17    SHIBUYA HOTEL EN
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a good stay, clean room, comfortable bed, good hot shower, nice staff, close to the station. Was very quiet in the hotel.Breakfast was complementary, coffee and some danish. Will go back again if I´m in that Tokyo area.
hotelName:
17    SHIBUYA HOTEL EN
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Shibuya station was about 10 minutes walk to the hotel. If taken the main road to the hotel, the pathway was pretty levelled. Otherwise, it will be a up and down hill walk through the small route. We had a large luggage, therefore it took us 15minutes to reach the hotel. When we reached the hotel, we were alittle taken aback as we could not find the entrance at the main road. The main entrance was at the side road with 2 large wooden door that was closed. Initially, we though the hotel was closed down as 2 other guests were as confused as us. We tried pulling open the door, we saw the reception area. I guessed it was hotel effort to make the hotel look chic. However, it may not be chic for guest to pull open a heavy door to enter themselves. After a minor scare, we were attended by a warm staff was spoke good English. We were given coupon for free drink at the bar and was informed of free breakfast. The breakfast was simple with bread, soup and coffee or juices but enough to fill you up if you don’t mind the limited food choice. Having said that, we could not complain as the breakfast was complimentary. We were also told to leave the room key at the counter which I would not done so if I was given a choice (as I forgot my room number and was more of a visual person). The room was decorated with style. However upon reaching the room, I was surprise that the toilet were transparent. As we were not used to being nude, it made accessing the space near toilet inconvenient as the sink was there with double mirror. The room were the typical size that does not allow opening of 2 large suitcase simultaneously. There was no space left to walk after opening 1 large luggage. Noted from other reviews that it defer from room to room. We booked a double room which was near the lift. However, the bed was really comfortable and of good size as compared to other Japan hotel. It comes with double pillows for each person. There were basic toiletries such as shampoo, conditioner, body scrub towel, body foam, toothbrush with toothpaste, hair dryer, towel and hangers. They replace the toiletries daily. The best part of staying in this area is that it is close to all the shopping area. Don Quijote which was opened 24hours was just few minutes away (sell food, clothes, comestic, furniture and much more with immediate tax rebate when u spend a certain amount). The was a large Uniqlo and MUji nearby too. ABC mart which sell shoes was close too. On the last day, we took the train to the airport with 2 luggages each. We bought a ticket for 550yen at JR counter for the Yamanote Line and the Keikyu Line to the airport. Just needed to flash the ticket. At the Yamanote Line, we travelled from Shibuya station to Shinagawa Station using the south entrance as there was no escalator at The Central entrance. The staff was kind enough to tell us to use the south entrance where the escalator was at Shibuya station. Upon reaching Shinagawa, we needed to exit the station to change to Keikyu Line. At the platform, the were 3 different queue. If I did not remember wrongly, the blue Color queue sticker, was to the airport. The entire journey took about 40 minutes (we travelled during non-peak.) May have difficulties getting on the train if on peak period with luggages. Although I could not tolerate the nude toilet and the small room size, the affordability, modern design and most importantly the prime location Beats the cons.
hotelName:
17    SHIBUYA HOTEL EN
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As newcomers in Tokyo we thought we'd be able to find the hotel easy peasy. Boy were we wrong! The hotel is a bit hidden, but once found it is easy to get back to again once you have walked around in the area a bit (it is close to the Shibuya Station which helps).First impressions were great - a friendly staff greeted us with a smile and made the check-in process fairly smooth. The rooms are extremely comfortable and well designed. If you like to sleep, you will not want to leave these beds - it is like Mr. Sandman designed them himself! The hotel was renovated not too long ago and it shows! It is definitely great value for your money. Especially if you are a gang of friends travelling. There are many bars and clubs in the area - especially one across the street called "Oiran". One thing I have to add is that there is no noise from those bars/clubs, at least if you are not high up in the hotel.In the morning there is a small breakfast included. It is funny that (even though they are frozen) these croissants were amazing and combined with the a nice coffee it is an excellent start on your day! I would recommend this to anyone.
hotelName:
17    SHIBUYA HOTEL EN
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location can’t be beat! It was a little tricky to find the first time (it’s on a small side street), but the hotel is minutes away from Shibuya Station, as well as countless shops and restaurants. The free croissants, coffee and juice for breakfast are perfect and the staff is super friendly. We stayed during the weekend and were offered a couple of free drinks at the bar, as well as free candies and celebratory tea in the lobby as a New Year’s gift.The room was small, but functional. Comfy bed, mini fridge and all the amenities we needed. Note: the bathroom is enclosed by glass, but there IS a curtain you can close for some privacy.
hotelName:
17    SHIBUYA HOTEL EN
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I've stayed at the hotel with 3 others. We booked 2 rooms for a total of 5 nights. Checked in twice for our stay as we checked out for a day when we travelled to Hakone.During the first check in we noticed that one of the rooms was slightly smaller than the other. But the difference wasnt great and we understand it's normal for the size of the rooms to be a little different so it didn't bother us. However, on our second check-in we were rather puzzled when we were given significantly smaller rooms. (We had booked the same room type for all 5 nights) From a rather spacious room where we can open two big luggage and still have walking space to a room where we can only open one luggage with not much walking space. When we checked with the reception we realised that the range in room sizes for the same room type was rather big. If one is lucky they would get the bigger room which we got for our first check in. In the end we decided to pay an extra 1000yen/nights to upgrade our rooms. The amount of space we got for tt extra 1000 yen was rather significant. The room was spacious and one could open 4 big luggages and still have a lot of space. The large room was definitely worth it. But we did prefer the rooms we got for our first check-in as the sink was not in the bathroom, this reduces washing up time as one could use the bathroom while the other wash up at the sink. I had made this reservation through booking.com. Not sure if that is why there is such a significant difference in room size for the room we reserved. Perhaps it might be better to book the room through the hotel website where there more details on the different room types. Besides the odd room sizes, we enjoyed our stay at the hotel. The location was good. The rooms we stayed in were clean and tidy. Staff were also polite. The complimentary water, tea and coffee were topped up daily. Would definitely return to this hotel if I ever travel to Tokyo again.
hotelName:
17    SHIBUYA HOTEL EN
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just walked into our room and I have to say it’s very underwhelming. The first thing to noice is the complete lack of privacy from the toilet to the shower to the bed room. The door to the toilet seems to be missing some blinds too.The room doesn’t seem very clean compared to the other hotels we have stayed in during our time in japan. You can see very visible marks on the walls, dust on top of the tv etc and lots of watermarks. The toilet paper dispenser isn’t even straight to that give you a sense of the attention to detail. The shower area also doesn’t smell cleanYou get bottles of weather in the fridge, which is pretty common for hotels in japan and the hotel itself seems to be in a fairly decent spot.You only get one key and it’s an old fashioned KEY which you need to leave behind with reception each time you leave and it seems anyone can access the lift because you don’t need a key / cars access to press a floor number.
hotelName:
17    SHIBUYA HOTEL EN
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a great stay here from 12/25-12/27 during a layover. Check in was very easy after a long travel day (more on that later).Rooms are SMALL as expected for Tokyo but very CLEAN and modern. The bathroom was our favorite part - the toilet and bidet was super cool. Toilet cleaned itself when you open the door and after you leave, seats are heated, automatic flushing. The shower got hot very quickly, was easy to use (no fumbling around to find which direction is hot), and the pressure was great. Most importantly the bathroom was spotless. We ran into the glass door several times because it was so spotless.Bed was very comfortable - one of best we’ve stayed in. We were provided with robes & slippers. Loved the robes so much I bought them when checking out. I thought this hotel was non smoking however several times smelled cigarettes in the hallways. It didn’t bother me enough to complain but just FYI - smell was there. I was on level 4.Major tip: WALK from Shibuya Station to hotel! Literally a little over 5 min walk from Hachiko exit. We didn’t do as much research and thought Shibuya Crossing would be too daunting to walk when getting in from airport with our luggage. Ended up waiting over an hour in the taxi queue. Was a waste with the limited time we had in Tokyo. Taxis weren’t as easy to get in Tokyo as other places I’ve traveled.
hotelName:
17    SHIBUYA HOTEL EN
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I don't normally write hotel reviews because for the most part, they're all the same. But I need to take the time to call out the fantastic customer service we had from the team at Hotel En. They were incredibly helpful in setting up a couple reservations for us-even when our first choices weren't available and we ended up changing our minds. When we wanted to send our luggage ahead to our next location, but couldn't drop it at a hotel since we were staying at an Airbnb, they offered to call the pick up point and arrange the delivery there for us instead. The staff were incredibly attentive and eager to help no matter what we needed.The location was fantastic-you're less than a 10min walk to the station and right next to all the shopping/main attractions of Shibuya. But my favourite part of the location was if you walk North towards Yoyogi park, you'll enter this residential area with lots of fantastic small bars/cafes/restaurants. It's a great respite from the chaos of the rest of Shibuya.One word of warning-the room has a glass bathroom, so probably best suited for couples/solo travellers.
hotelName:
17    SHIBUYA HOTEL EN
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Shibuya-En is a relatively new hotel with modern facilities. The location is excellent - approximately 10 minutes' walk from the Shibuya station but 0 minutes to some fantastic ramen (open late) and shopping. Hotel staff are friendly and we had no trouble with communication with English.We stayed on the 5th floor which had a quaint view of the city surrounds. Our room was accessed by a short beautifully decorated corridor, and the room was a decent size with a glass-walled bathroom (curtains for privacy). The toilet was high-tech (as expected in Japan) with a clean sink and shower which had excellent water pressure. The double bed was firm but comfortable. The room came with green tea and cute decaf coffee sachets which came with their own filters - we hadn't seen that before! Pyjamas and room slippers were provided. Breakfast was offered from 7:30 to 9:30am daily - small pastries, coffee, tea and juice.The thing that really won me over was the excellent shoe horn they had by the door. But that may not be a game-changer for anyone else.
hotelName:
17    SHIBUYA HOTEL EN
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I normally don't write reviews but this hotel deserves a great rating. Clean and comfortable for 2. This location was easy to get to from shibuya station making it a wonderful starting place to explore Tokyo!
hotelName:
17    SHIBUYA HOTEL EN
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel and amazing stuff!! The room are beautiful and there size is great for 2!The stuff was so helpful in every question, everything is so clean, and the complementary breakfast snacks are such a nice surprise.The hotel is located on a cool quiet street, with tons of cool hang out places, just a few mins from shibuya station.A must!
hotelName:
17    SHIBUYA HOTEL EN
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms were spotless and comfortable. The staff were friendly and exceptionally helpful. The hotel is a little hard to find but in a great location and I did not find it noisy (8th floor room). The only disappointment was the breakfast which was basically just french pastries. For coeliacs travelling this is an issue as there are few cafes with gluten free options - so having breakfast in the hotel is important. Even if there were a few pieces of fresh fruit this would have been better.
hotelName:
17    SHIBUYA HOTEL EN
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice and modern renovated rooms. Fresh water bottles every dat. Clean. Excellent location in Shibuya with some nice pubs around the corner (Mikkeller!). Unfortunately very noisey in the weekend caused by the bar at the 1th floor. Even up on the 5th Floor the music was really loud untill 3.30am(!!). Spoiled the stay for us a bit.
hotelName:
17    SHIBUYA HOTEL EN
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Overall the hotel was able to serve my needs for a very short two day stay. Bed was comfortable. My wife and I can fit (we're asian). It's a quick walk from the shibuya station. Check in/out was a breeze and the staff was friendly and helpful. I would say the hotel met my expectation.The design of the room is smart. It maximized the small area. Everything you need is in that tiny room.I do have some concerns. Walls were a bit thin. I could hear the neighbor in the corridor. Location gets pretty wild with drunk kids on the weekend.
hotelName:
17    SHIBUYA HOTEL EN
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The thing I appreciated most about the hotel is the location in Shibuya. The staff is nice although they caused some problems with my credit card and I am still waiting for a reply from them...since the 12th of august and today it is the 28th.ROOM: it is average, not as cramped as many rooms in Tokyo that you can get for the same price. Don't expect too much room anyway, the pictures of the rooms that I see on TA are not remotely like the one I stayed in. Mine was 10-11 square meters. The bathroom has glass walls...which is a bit annoying if you are not alone (see attached pictures). They have blinders of course but the bathroom door didn't have anyThere is a safe in the room and complimentary coffee and teaEach floor as a theme, which I found nice.BREAKFAST: come on!!!! seriously they call that buffet? There were 3 types of small croissants, coffee and orange juice! Plus something that I tried only once, it was something salty with yogurt I think. Get a room with no breakfast and go outside, starbucks is walking distance.
hotelName:
17    SHIBUYA HOTEL EN
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place was great! My husband and I stayed for three nights as the beginning leg of our honeymoon. We arrived to Tokyo at midday and although we could not check in until 3pm (as stated on the website so I knew this already), the staff kindly took our big bags whilst we killed some time. The location is perfect and in the heart of Shibuya. There are loads of eateries everywhere and loads of side streets to explore. Check in was a breeze and our bags had already been taken to our room. As expected, the room is not huge. It is however exceptionally clean and lovely to look at. All basic amenities and more were provided, included some very nice green tea and decaf drip coffee which serves as it's own filter. If you're a guest at the hotel, a basic but really tasty breakfast is included in the price. One thing I would say, is the bathroom is novel in that the walls are all glass. Theoretically, you could see someone on the toilet or showering. There are blinds to pull down though so it's ok. HOWEVER, the glass is very very clean. I walked into it more than once. So be warned! The only other thing is that there is no wardrobe (an overhead one only over the sink) and not a huge amount of floor space. This was fine for us as we were only using backpacks and there for three nights but may be an issue for others with large luggage. The staff are really friendly and seem to enjoy their jobs which is great to see. Finally, all floors are differently themed. I came across this accidentally when I pressed the wrong button to leave the lift. We were on level 7 which was decorated like temple gates - my personal favourite. Others were cherry blossom, anime etc. Really interesting little place! I would definitely book this again should I ever return to Tokyo.
hotelName:
17    SHIBUYA HOTEL EN
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Off one of the main streets in Shibuya, it has a quaint, clean, cozy room-- at least the room we stayed in. Check in was a breeze, handled by friendly, smiling staffs. Our room was just what we expected it to be from the website photos, and the beds are so comfortable we had a good rest during our stay there. will definitely come back again!
hotelName:
17    SHIBUYA HOTEL EN
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was perfect for myself and my mum, 9 night stay and we couldn't be happier. Room is on the smaller side but that's expected in Tokyo. Beautiful little izakaya on the basement floor (35 Steps Bistro) which the lovely staff at the front desk helped us book, along with a few other restaurants. The location was perfect, a short walk from the famed Shibuya Crossing, Hachiko Square and the station. The staff are so friendly, facilities are wonderful and I will definitely be staying here when I return to Tokyo.
hotelName:
17    SHIBUYA HOTEL EN
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Intro:I’ve stayed at this hotel the last 2 trips to Tokyo, and would definitely stay here again! Getting to the hotel:It’s just a short walk from Shibuya station so it’s very easy to get here. I do however recommend taking a taxi to the airport if you have a lot of luggage as the streets of Shibuya around the crossing can be mental! If your are taking the train to the airport I highly recommend sorting out your return ticket for the Narita Express immediately or the day before your going back. The queues can be super long and please allow for plenty of time for the trip to the airport! The Location:Outstanding. You are right in the middle of exciting Tokyo and everything it has to offer. Restaurants, shopping and fashionable people! The Room:The rooms are small! But hey, that’s Tokyo! It seems to be newly renovated so it’s clean fresh and comfortable. The mattress and pillows are FAB! Good to know:Breakfast is included, but it’s only coffee/tea and croissant/pains. Customer Service:The first time I visited this hotel I was really not that happy, the secod time however I was very surprised. The team in the reception and the cleaners were super sweet and customer service oriented! Overall impression:If you want a clean, fresh hotel that has a great location at a reasonable price, this is the one! No doubt!
hotelName:
17    SHIBUYA HOTEL EN
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My boyfriend and I will stay again! Great location and the staff were extremely nice and very helpful. We love Tokyo! ask for a map it was a lifesaver. If you are looking for a great place to stay, I would recommend this hotel!
hotelName:
17    SHIBUYA HOTEL EN
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel was a bit tricky to find at first, but once you get there and get a sense of the area, then it's actually a great find. Pros:1. The location is about 7-10 mins walk from the main Shibuya station. Head toward H&M after the Shibuya crossing. It's not too far from there on your left. Lots of restaurants, cafe and shops all around. We just love the energy in this part of Tokyo (we've been many times).2. The room size is actually decent for Japanese Standards. We've experienced some smaller compact ones, and this hotel is just fine. Rooms are modern and clean. It has all the amenities you need, toiletries, coffee and green tea and a yukata to wear. Great water pressure shower! Don't be alarmed by the room and bathroom size, this is actually pretty good! and Very clean :)3. Free pastries (croissants) + coffee in the lobby from 7:30-9:30am.4. The staff at the reception was very helpful regarding our next destination as far as logistics and really helped us out with the transportation timetable.Cons: The hotel is boutiquey-modern type. So, no gym, no onsen or any of that sort. For the price, it's a great choice compared to other hotels. Really enjoyed our stay here!
hotelName:
17    SHIBUYA HOTEL EN
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Overall a really nice stay, with some odd little quirks.Location: A great location. A little tough to find at first when we got out of Shibuya station, but once you get your bearings it's a great spot. A little under a 10 minute walk to Shibuya station. Lots of restaurants within a couple minutes walk. Can be a little noisy on the weekend, but that didn't bother us.Room: Small, but that's normal for Japan, and it didn't bother us. Bed was fairly comfortable and the room had all the amenities and was always spotless. My one major complaint about the room is the weird glass cubicle for the toilet and shower. There were curtains and blinds around it, but they didn't quite close properly and you could see through the gaps in them. We made it work, but I wouldn't recommend it for anyone who doesn't know each other very well. It's a little awkward. Would probably be a great room for a solo traveller though.Staff were excellent. Friendly and good English skills.
hotelName:
17    SHIBUYA HOTEL EN
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was better in retrospect than we felt at the time. It was our first stop in Japan, and although our room well clean, it was tiny, little room for suitcases, nowhere to sit because we used the chair to store things, and the bathroom/toilet cubicles seemed simply........odd! Turns out they are standard in Japan, shower was great water pressure, everything sparkling clean and we became used to the tiny sizes over time. The staff here are friendly, good housekeeping, our room tidied and cleaned beautifully each day. Breakfast that was included in our booking was simply 'coffee and bread' (a selection of croissants, Danish pastries and a local cake item, with juice/water and machine coffee, but in a pleasant environment. Decor is different on each floor, slightly quirky and interested. In retrospect, we would stay here again as the rates are moderate, room really clean and excellent, convenient location. There are many bars, cafes and restaurants in the surrounding streets. 'Love Hotel' Hill is adjacent and some of the bars get pretty loud during the night but that seems part of the location and atmosphere. One morning I woke up thinking that the crowd was very loud outside, to find sun coming up at 0530!!! Tokyo folk love to party, clearly, and around this hotel is a prime area! If noise bothers. you, perhaps ask for a room that doesn't face forwards to avoid the bars and late night/early morning noise. Good amenities provided and overall excellent value for money.
hotelName:
17    SHIBUYA HOTEL EN
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Was a little apprehensive but Shibuya En exceeded my expectations. The rooms are a bit small but made it work with two large suitcases. The location is perfect, the hotel is clean, daily restocking on toiletries and most importantly the staff was so kind and patient. One of the front desk ladies helped me to book last minute dinner reservations for a Saturday night not only calling various restaurants but mapped them out for me as we needed a specific location. Not only was her patience so sweet I also had fun talking with her and to top it off dinner was delicious! Thank you Shibuya En! I will definitely keep this hotel in mind when I return to Tokyo.
hotelName:
17    SHIBUYA HOTEL EN
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: For me , this is the best hotel to stay in near the Shibuya district. We did not know what to expect since it was our first time to stay there,but to our surprise they went the extra mile for me and my wife. As we came in we were welcomed by Mr. Wang and his staff with all smiles and warm greetings, as my wife went to the powder room, I secretly told the staff that we are celebrating our 5th wedding anniversary. I asked them if they can help me surprise my wife with my gift. As I handed them the gift. They assured me that they will do their best. What surprised me was that they upgraded our room to a suite as a gift As we went in the room my gift is laid neatly on the bed with a very nice hand written note,wishing us well and thanking us for choosing them, What surprised me was that they upgraded our room to a suite as a gift and as my wife was reading the heart felt note, tears of joy rolled down her eyes. This really felt good and I never experienced anything like this before coming from a hotel . They made our anniversary in Tokyo amazing !!! Thank you Shiibuya Hotel En... More power to you and your staff.
hotelName:
17    SHIBUYA HOTEL EN
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: comfort bed, helpfull staff speak english, especially with direction to interest places, near shopping center, near many good restaurant and cafe, recomended for first time travelling to Tokyo. Definitely go back again to this hotel.
hotelName:
18    Mercure Tokyo Ginza
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located a 15 min walk from Tokyo Station we really enjoyed our stay here. Ginza itself is full of places to eat & there are plenty of transport options too.We were 3 adults in a room & found it comfortable in size. The room was very clean & maintained that way throughout our stay. We had plenty of towels & amenities in the bathroom for all of us all of a good standard product. The staff are beautiful, exceptionally friendly & helpful. We needed to borrow umbrellas during our stay & the reception girl was so upset one of them was a bit broken. We didn't mind at all but her reaction was very sweet. This was our first time in Japan & it was all very daunting, with Mercure Ginza as our base we felt very safe & well taken care of.
hotelName:
18    Mercure Tokyo Ginza
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing little hotel... for which the room is bigger than usual 3 Star Hotel in Tokyo... the lack of pool or gym probably that bumps this hotel from 4 to 3 Stars Hotel. But the service from check in to check out to helping get a taxi during rush hour... superb!!!! The Subway on the basement of hotel don’t really get you familiar places... not sure where the route goes!! But the Ginza Sanchome Station is like 400m away. There’s Natural Lawson (healthier convenient store) and McD like 3 minutes walk away. Overall pleasant stay at a superb hotel. Recommended!!!
hotelName:
18    Mercure Tokyo Ginza
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean and comfortable. Friendly staff, right on a metro and close to good shops. Breakfast was a good selection albeit in a small dining room. Fast internet, if that’s important to you. Very good price for the heart of Tokyo. Overall, a pleasant hotel to stay.
hotelName:
18    Mercure Tokyo Ginza
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Visiting Tokyo, we choosed to stay at Mercure Ginza and we really recommend it.Ginza is a very convenient area to use as base for visiting Tokyo. It's well connected, close to Tokyo main station, and with plenty of nice places to eat.We really enjoyed Mercure Hotel. Rooms are not big (but that's very common in Tokyo) but very comfortable. Our room was always perfectly clean, and very quiet. Bed was comfy too.Hotel staff was extremely kind and helped us anytime we needed.Good breakfast, with many choices either for Asian or western food.If we are be back in Tokyo we'll staying at this hotel.
hotelName:
18    Mercure Tokyo Ginza
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great Location, near Ginza station and shopping district. Comfortable room, even the space is a little bit small, but still nice. I like how they put artistic touch in the interior detail. Recommended to stay .
hotelName:
18    Mercure Tokyo Ginza
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This a quaint, boutique-style hotel, a short walk from the famous Ginza strip and Mitsukoshi Department store. The rooms were tiny but very clean and comfortable, that is, if you don’t plan on bringing large suitcases. We upgraded to the “larger” Privilege Room with two single beds, and this was a better fit for us. The breakfast buffet was adequate, but could do with some daily changes, as they served us, the same exact fare every day. What made this hotel shine was the fantastic service of the hotel’s staff, most especially the ladies behind the front desk. They made sure we were comfortable and met our needs, even calling for certain places we had to go to, without complaint and always with a smile. One of the best hotels that I’ve been to, that made us feel welcome and at home. I would highly recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
18    Mercure Tokyo Ginza
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Mercure allowed an early check in at about 1pm which got things off to a nice start. The room size slightly larger than Tokyo standards, meant we could settle in comfortably. It proved the perfect base to shoot off to both Shibuya and Asakusa on the metro. The breakfast spread was adequate, nothing more, and the bartender who took my free drink voucher on the first night of my stay, made me feel like it was coming out of his pocket, but aside from this we loved our stay and would come back again.
hotelName:
18    Mercure Tokyo Ginza
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is superb and everything is within a stone throw away. Direct train from Haneda airport and just 2 mins walk from the Higashi Ginza station. Room is quite spacious, bigger than the average hotels in the city. Friendly and helpful staff. Will stay again for my next visit.
hotelName:
18    Mercure Tokyo Ginza
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great stay in frenetic Ginza. Rooms were quiet, staff friendly and professional - what more could you ask for? Would highly recommend for those wanting to experience Tokyo for the first time. Looking forward to coming back.
hotelName:
18    Mercure Tokyo Ginza
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wow, what a nice and fancy Hotel! We arrived after a japan cruise in that Ginza hotel. This is located in the heart of Tokio, called Ginza, where you have nice shopping street "Ginza" and all luxury shops literally around the corner. it is easy to get to Ginza hotel which is subway station Ginza and has got underground metro access. when we arrived at the reception desk we could feel the entire friendliness of Japan. You feel like a prince, they treat you super nicely and politely. We got an upgrade into a bigger room which has got all amenities for free. the room was very nice, modern colours and it felt like you are in your own living room. the bed had feather/goose blanket and cousins and we slept like babies. very quite room indeed. from that location you reach all attractions by metro. the train, metrosystem works perfectly well and you are cheaper and faster by metro than by taxi!Exec summary:- top service- top location- top roomsA place you must book.Best regardsPeter S. Philipp
hotelName:
18    Mercure Tokyo Ginza
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was close to the city center, with a train station located below it for easy access. It was clean and the staff were friendly and helpful. The only slightly off putting thing was the French bar tender who was not very talkative and a bit gruff, but there was a small bar just down the street which was handy.
hotelName:
18    Mercure Tokyo Ginza
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Comfortable stay with spacious ensuite bathroom. Nice interior design after renovation. Helpful staff, english and multilingual speaking.
