review_body: It is more like a double decker bed in a capsule like space. It is much more spacious compare to the usual capsule room. The toilet and common area is very clean. They have a small little bar at the common area and some vending machines for drinks.
hotelName:
22    Samurai Hostel Asakusa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect location in the middle of Asakusa. Convenient access from the airport via Asakusa Train Station. Quaint neighborhood. Comfy capsule bunks for a reasonable price. Friendly staff. Kitchen and laundry facilities available. Nice view from the rooftop. Check in time though is late at 3:00 pm and check out time is too early at 10:00 am.
hotelName:
22    Samurai Hostel Asakusa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: ENAKA Asakusa Central Hostel have a good location near Senjoji Temple, Tokyo Tower and have a lot of Restaurant. Bed and Toilet are clean wifi so good. I can drop my baggage before check in time all staff is very helpful and them can speak in English very well so you can asking anything if you have a question.
hotelName:
22    Samurai Hostel Asakusa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very comfort place that i've found in Japan, staff very helpful, near with station 100m only, i stay here for 5 days, low budget and nice place, completed with kitchen, washing machine and front of hostel you can buy halal ramen "Samurai Ramen"
hotelName:
22    Samurai Hostel Asakusa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is super well located in quiet Asakusa (not in the middle of Shibuya or Shinjuku, so if you're looking to be in the middle of the "action", don't go there). There are still some nice bars and restaurants in the area but it tends to be quiet at night (which was what I was looking for anyway, and it's easy to access more lively areas with subway).Easy access from Narita airport too, from Asakusa train station.The staff is super helpful and friendly, the rooms and bathrooms are super clean, the common area is nice and you can meet other travellers there if you're traveling solo. The staff is always happy to help and give some restaurants or bars recommendations. Good sushi around the corner, as well as good ramen joints around. The beds are very very comfortable and allow you to have lots of privacy thanks to the curtain. Power socket is provided there, very convenient. The dormitories are generally quiet. Great, great, great value for money, I recommend this place 100% and would go again on my next trip to Tokyo. Thank you to the whole team at Enaka for making my stay great and comfortable!
hotelName:
22    Samurai Hostel Asakusa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed in female dorm which is located in the third floor for woman only. it also have their own toilet and bath room inside the room.the hostel is very clean, tidy and quiet.it close to asakusa temple and near to the Asakusa station.
hotelName:
22    Samurai Hostel Asakusa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: clean and good location, staff are very polite and helpful. next to asakusa station you can easily go anywhere you want it should be better if they have better communal space. but overall , it does the job if you want a good night sleep!
hotelName:
22    Samurai Hostel Asakusa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It's relatively close to the train station and food outlets are plentiful nearby. The capsules are clean and comfortable and all facilities are working well. The staffs are friendly and the policy is good enough to allow us to drop our baggage there for no charge ahead of our check-in time. It's perfect for individual or couple travelers, but as expected of a hostel, privacy could be a problem for some.
hotelName:
22    Samurai Hostel Asakusa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As i planned my trip to be a budget one, ENAKA Hostel was right up the alley. Its relatively cheap and ideal for solo travellers. I stayed for 2 nights and arrived at about past 9PM.The host at the front was prompt yet polite with the rules and whatnot, which is great. Her english is great as well, with barely a hint of an accent so thats an added bonus to non-japanese speaking travellers. You can find the hostel easily; its the 3rd 'hall' when you walk through from the Kaminarimon on the left.The security is also something I like. They have a key for everything and the doors to the female floor requires a special pass. The toilets and bathroom were clean and almost soundproof. The guests were respectable although the smell of alcohol was prominent from some of the women.The wifi signal is strong as well even from the 4th floor. Furthermore, they have a common room where you can chill with other guests and plan your trip for the next day. I am currently sleeping in my capsule and hope this positive review remains as it is until I check out
hotelName:
22    Samurai Hostel Asakusa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good hostel conveniently located in Asakusa, I stayed on the 6th floor with a bit more space. The common area was comfy and well equipped with vending machines and a small kitchenette. The washrooms and showers on my floor were clean and tidy. Would go back to this hostel when I am in Tokyo, recommended!
hotelName:
22    Samurai Hostel Asakusa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed 5 nights in this hostel, staff speak very little english.Not advisable if you need advise from the staff.The bed is spacious with lockers is a plus here.There is no locker for luggage, only a lock to tie on the handle of your luggage which dont think it works at all. People still able to access your luggage easily. Not much space for packing, poor layout except for the bed.There is a rule not to use bathroom after 1am but I don't think it helps or even relevant. There is a wet and dry shower, no shelving to put your clothings. This is design flaws, only the last 2 days basket pop up in the dry area. So either managment made some improvements or other guest had took it for their own use.Clean hostel, but not sufficient bathrooms. I need to Q for 2 days.Only 2 bathrooms for 20+ beds.Toilet always has a foul smell due to non ventilation of the premises.Other room mates just throw their things on the floor, everyday I need to skip over it. The management or cleaner seems dont care about it at all.Their green tea latte is pretty good, from their dispenser on ground floor.Washer cum dryer 500yen.Location: There are a few eateries open till late night/ 24hrs.Many good food in the vincinity, 24hr Don Quijote just 5mins away.Good with metro (ginza line) but not convenient to airport with luggageAlthough it is direct line to Narita airport, the entrance of the asakusa line does not have any elevator at all. 6-7 long flights of stairs is crazy with luggage! They do have another entrance to the staton which is much further away.Overall, Clean hostel except the toilet foul smell.Ok location but hate the stairs to station (airport).But for the price, i will consider twice.
hotelName:
22    Samurai Hostel Asakusa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for several days, The Pros; Central&Clean Hostel offering single-beds. This provides relative privacy and hygienic protection that is missing in bunker-bed-use.Also a nice seating area is provided for B-fast & Friendly ambiance.The Cons; Charge me +$10.00 additional to the reservation contract-price for usingthe credit card in lieu of Yen-cash-pmt. Also jumping a foot&half in/out the high-bed was not easy with-no support-to-grab & No-towel-hangers in the wash-rooms.The air-condition heating was excessive.
hotelName:
22    Samurai Hostel Asakusa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: it was the best hostel during my trip to Japan. the bed was so comfort, the shower room was soo clean. there was a shoe box and elevator so you dont have to have a hard time going up to your room. the shower room is on every floor so it is really convenient. It was a great time. I would definitely come back if I have a chance.
hotelName:
22    Samurai Hostel Asakusa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at Enaka in May this year when it was still quite a new place. It was such a lovely hostel I wanted to move in. The staff couldn't have been friendlier, the WIFI couldn't have been faster, the rooms couldn't have been cleaner. What can I say? This was such a lovely place to hang out, I just didn't want to even go out and explore (although I did...). The pod capsule beds were unique and fun, each with its own small locker, shelf, a reading lamp, wall outlet and privacy curtain. What more could one want? The toilet room was separate from the shower room and both were plenty spacious with enough toilets and showers for the guests of that room.Each room used key card access, and there was only an elevator to get up to the top floors. The common room downstairs was centered around a large table, with plenty of outlets so people could plug in and be connected to rest of the world. This hostel has a no shoe policy. Please leave them at the door, on the provided rack.The kitchen wasn't very spacious (it is located right next to the large common room table) but enough if you just want to keep food in the fridge or boil some water. There are vending machines for both snacks as well as coffees located on the ground floor in the common space.The location is perfect and right in the heart of the Asakusa area of Tokyo. Supermarkets, the metro lines and some places of interest are only a few minutes walking away.Enjoy your stay -- I certainly did!
hotelName:
22    Samurai Hostel Asakusa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice hostel, friendly staff and new and clean interior. Its located in the heart of asakusa historical area. Beautiful parks and shrines just around the corner. Walk from the metro (asakusa station) is not far - max 7 minutes
hotelName:
22    Samurai Hostel Asakusa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The facilities are all great including coin laundry and bathrooms with everything you could need and more. The staff were all super friendly. Everything was so clean despite it essentially being a hostel. They do free drinks at tea time and free breakfast pastries in the AM which are great added extras. I stayed in the art floor and my pod was super cute and comfortable. And of course the location is great, a 5 minute walk to the train station and all the sights of Shibuya. I feel almost unfair not giving it 4/5 but here is why: 1. It was summer and 32 degrees and the floors have no light and little ventilation. My little pod got INSANELY even with the ‘fan’ which felt more like someone blowing near you. 2. I travelled with a big backpack which needs unpacked an repacked every 2 days and it was very difficult to do this as the floors are all dark and there is no space to spread your stuff 3. Unfortunately for me, a guy on my floor got up at 3am and spewed right in front of my pod, which I had to endure for the rest of the night including leaping over it to get up in the morning. This is of course not the hotels fault and I guess just happens in hostels but I can’t help but feeling the heat on the floor couldn’t have helped the poor guy. It’s basically an upscale hostel and if you’re looking for budget with comfort, good location and a friendly place to meet people then definitely stay here!
hotelName:
23    The Millennials Shibuya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When I was checking the capsule hotel online, I was worried the cleanliness of the toilet and bathroom, because of shared bathroom and toilet. With this capsule hotel, no problem with the cleanliness at all. I was staying on the female floor for 4 nights, everything’s good, nice bed. Just the locker underneath the bed, it’s very very small, I couldn’t keep my laptop in the tiny locker.I also needed to work during the trip. 3rd floor is “working space”, it’s perfect for me.24hours Free coffeeFree beer from 5:30pm to 6:30pmFree Breakfast Good location
hotelName:
23    The Millennials Shibuya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our stay at the millennials was great, the capsules are quite large and comfortable. You are equipped with an iPod instead of a keycard that allows you to control the lights , the fan, and the bed. In the wall you have 2 usb sockets,which is super convenient, and you store your luggage under the bed, so no need to mess around with lockers or to sleep with your bag. Everything was really clean and the staff is super friendly. The common area is cozy and has a nice view. Everyday they have happy hour where you can tap your own beer. As the ‘door’ to your pod is a sheet it is definitely not noise proof, but the floors are carpeted and there is a fan, so I really didn’t hear anyone. We stayed here only 1 night and stayed at the 9hours the night after, a decision I regret. If I ever come back to Japan, I’d stay at the millennials again.
hotelName:
23    The Millennials Shibuya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a spotlessly clean hotel with comfy beds. The room floors are nice, quiet and dark so you could sleep day or night if necessary. The hotel is in a great location only a few mins walk from Shibuya crossing and the train station. Free beer every evening too which is great way to meet new people and socialise.
hotelName:
23    The Millennials Shibuya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice hotel. In one of the best regions in Tokyo, it is conveniently located close to Shibuya Station. They provide tou an ipod that is your key to the building and elevator. It also controls lights and fan on your room. And the alarm is a thing itself (no spoilers).But there is one thing i want to emphasize. Everyday at 5h30pm up to 6h30pm there's beer for the guests.Of course i love free beer but the best thing is that they serve it athe lounge in 4th floor and there's a lounge where you can chill and meet other guests, awesome!They transformed capsule hotel concept to something way beyond and above.Get it in your next trip to Tokyo and you will not regret.
hotelName:
23    The Millennials Shibuya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Positive’s--Super cool concept overall! -The proximity to Shibuya Crossing is great - only three short blocks away -Bathrooms (common use) were always available and very clean. The toilets were electronically controlled and have self-rising lids and seats which were also heated-Showers (common use) were always available and very clean and well stocked with liquid soap and shampoo. Water pressure was very good and hot water plentiful. The showers also feature a small private dressing room which adjoins the shower-Beds and sheets were very comfortable-Fast WiFi -Blackout curtains shielded the actual capsule/sleeping area 24/7-Very spacious common area which also had comfortable chairs and sofas-Friendly staff-I love that each capsule had individual names and have some Tokyo relevanceNegatives--Breakfast was a major disappointment! It’s advertised as ‘breakfast to go”, whatever that means. The reality is that it’s just coffee/tea (which is available 24/7 anyway) and a variety of six sweetbreads. There are no eggs, sausages, juices, fruits, yogurts, butter/jellies, or the like. Major disappointment!-There is no temperature control in your capsule (was a little warm). Your individual capsule has a fan, however-When you recline the bed to the bed position (as oppose to the sofa position), the mattress tends to slide down on the garage door that lowers and gives you privacy. When you try and raise that garage door from within the capsule in the morning, it’s quite difficult because the mattress has slid down and hampers the garage door from easily rising -The clothes dryer took over an hour to dry my clothes, and they still weren’t that dry at that point. Was tired of putting in coins-Very minimal signage from the street - nothing other than “The Millennials” Not a Positive or Negative---You watch a few minute video upon check-in on how everything works -Earlier reviews mention there were noise issues. I was on a mixed (sex) floor and there were no noise issues at all-Mostly younger Westerners stay here-They are very strict on the 10a check-out time - they wanted to charge 1,000 yen ($9 USD) for staying a little extra time
hotelName:
23    The Millennials Shibuya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A really well done hotel! Staff are super friendly and flexible, happy to hold my luggage before check in and let me pay for a later checkout. The “capsules” are spacious and I really liked the clever use of storage. It was so nice to have a bed bigger than a single!
hotelName:
23    The Millennials Shibuya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked for one night (with my wife) because we wanted to experience a capsule like stay and it was awesome! They have a video play during check in to explain the tech aspects of the hoste along with the amenities and dos and don'ts. All of th expectations regarding check out time and returning the iPhone and bag were clear. We slept very well and everything worked to the expectations set by the hostel. Right after check in I got to enjoy free beers during their happy hour time. I would definitely return and recommend you stay here.
hotelName:
23    The Millennials Shibuya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Highly recommend. Has a modern feel and it’s very clean and the capsules were larger than expected. Recommend getting the dimensions of big luggage’s to ensure it fits under the storage under the bed.
hotelName:
23    The Millennials Shibuya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Let me say first that I really enjoyed my stay here; beds are comfy, super modern feel to the place, and nice having free beer for happy hour. The downsides are not terrible, but with a mention; there's only one elevator that can sometimes take forever, and you get an iPhone on arrival that you need to carry around with you to get to your floor. Also, the place could use a beer vending machine (just a heads up).  Still highly recommend this place though!
hotelName:
23    The Millennials Shibuya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I only knocked it down 1 star because the safe is far too small to keep a laptop in - had a been a little bigger the peace of mind would have too. Location: awesome - a few blocks from Shibuya I Station/Crossing! As well as Harajuku and Yoyogi Park Free Breakfast: coffee and pastries are enough to hold you over before looking for something in the cityStaff: lovely - very helpful with great restaurant recommendations too! “Room”: very clean and I was pleasantly surprised with the room under the bed I could have allll my stuff down there without a worry. I also loved the alarm system -having the bed sit up and light slowly come on was a treat, if only I could wake up like that at home!10/10 would recommend and stay here again!
hotelName:
23    The Millennials Shibuya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I wanted to stay in the ‘thick of it’ and the location of this place doesn’t disappoint. It’s a really short walk to Shibuya Crossing so there are thousands of shops and restaurants nearby as well as the metro station for getting around Tokyo. The rooms are as they look online, the size of a double bed, which are electric so fold up so you can sit up in your ‘room’. The communal spaces are really clean and modern and the whole place feels very new. The free beer between 17:30 and 18:30 is a really nice touch and the breakfast is very welcome too. I’d happily stay again when visiting Tokyo even though you don’t get too much space to yourself, the location easily makes up for it. I even got the Shinkansen to Gala-Yuzawa for a days snowboarding which was awesome. I walked around 70 miles while touring Tokyo and want to see more of Japan so will probably use the other Millenials Hotel down in Kyoto.
hotelName:
23    The Millennials Shibuya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hostel was in a great location, really close to the train station which was why we chose it as we were flying the following day and wanted to be somewhere convenient.We arrived a couple of hours before check in and unfortunately could not check in straight away so left our luggage at reception and turned up later. I was surprised by how quiet it was when I got there, everyone was really mindful. My partner and I had neighbouring pods. I was expecting there to be more floor space and thought the bed would go back more for it to be fully seated - but in fact you only get about a metre.We did have one slight issue where our suitcase was slightly too big to fit underneath the bed, however we managed to get round this by having it fully open. We were only ok with this as I was sleeping on top of the bed and it was just for the one night. Our only other option was to fully lock the suitcase and have it in the corner of the room, or take it down to reception for them to look after which would have been really annoying if we were staying there any longer.Breakfast was ok - some bread/pastries and weak coffee. It is annoying there's only one lift to serve the whole building, I understand that it's beyond the hostel's control but it does mean you can be left waiting for the lift for quite a while if it's going in the wrong direction!On the whole - The hostel and facilities were spotless, and the bed was comfortable.
hotelName:
23    The Millennials Shibuya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A very very unpleasant to stay! First is very very noisy and you will surprise the amount of noise make from party cut !!!!! And this is not a cap sule hote you thought about the Japanese will go stay overnight and very quiet l!!!! Is simply a low key hostel !!!! Very will not recommend !!!!!
hotelName:
23    The Millennials Shibuya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It totally exceeded my expectations. Great design, staff is very friendly. The beds are comfortable and capsules do not seem small. There is free coffee and nice simple breakfast available. It is also very close to the metro station, so all the attraction spots are easy to reach.
hotelName:
23    The Millennials Shibuya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a pleasant surprise! Was our first time experiencing the whole Capsule Hotel trend and The Millennials Shibuya was definitely the perfect first choice. The staff were great and helpful, facilities were clean and provided everything that you need, the capsule room itself was spacious. You get free breakfast - who doesn't like free food??? Smack bang, in the middle of Shibuya - what a convenient location. Recommend everyone to at least try it once :)A suggestion? Maybe have more elevators? Only because this building is shared with other businesses. Also, more space is needed around the reception area, especially during check out time. Aside from that, it was an amazing first time experience.
hotelName:
23    The Millennials Shibuya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The design concept is the big thing about this place. Pods with electric bed and lighting controlled by an iPod. It’s fun! Until you try to get out of bed in the middle of the night and can’t get the privacy screen up because the flat bed is right up against it. So you have to raise the bed enough to get the screen up, hoping the noise of the bed moving doesn’t wake your neighbours. I saw so many people struggling to work out how to raise those screens, whether from inside or outside the pod. Definitely an issue. I found I was cold in the middle of the night and the shower area was cold too. Probably great in the summer. One night I had a projector pod. Definitely gimmicky. Didn’t work very well. More trouble than it was worth. Breakfast provided. Good kitchen, nice seating area. Good hot shower.
hotelName:
23    The Millennials Shibuya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I finally got around to visiting Tokyo and the 3 of us decided to stop at Millennials Shibuya. It was a great decision as the hostel was close to Shibuya Stn and very accommodating. Beds were clean and comfy. Even though they look small at first, they recline and become bigger! Other amenities were great. Free beer during “happy hour” every night was an added bonus!
hotelName:
23    The Millennials Shibuya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just like a capsule hotel only spacious! Immaculately clean, a fun overnight stay at the absolute heart of Shibuya - a 4 minute walk to the famous crossing. I was also able to easily walk to Harijuku’s main street. Perfect for a short term trip to Japan’s hotspots! The bed was extremely comfortable, great fun controlling everything with an iPhone.
hotelName:
23    The Millennials Shibuya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Super hospitable staff, with cozy and hip atmosphere. The public lounging areas have beautiful views of the streets below, and the location itself is close to great restaurants, a train station, and Shibuya life. Amenities are amazing: free coffee 24/7, unlimited beer tap for an hour in the evening, and occasional activities, like DJ nights! Just make sure to be really quiet on your floor; no doors to the capsule rooms means that it’s easy to hear movement, so talk in whispers and be courteous to those who might be sleeping or relaxing in their little pod. You won’t regret your stay here, and you definitely won’t want to leave.
hotelName:
23    The Millennials Shibuya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: At first, I was skeptical of the concept of a capsule hotel, but The Millenials blew my expectations away. The beds are large and very comfortable with an iPod touch that controls its position and the lights on your capsule. The bathrooms and showers are clean, and give you ample privacy. Also, the location is fantastic. Such amazing shopping and eating in this area of Tokyo. I would not recommend this type of hotel for an extended stay, but a night or two stay is great!
hotelName:
23    The Millennials Shibuya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Easily the best capsule hotel. The staff is super friendly and helpful. Rooms are small because it is a capsule hotel, but unlike other capsule hotels, the Millennials have regular room size height and fun style (alas art room) Location is great and very close to one of the biggest subway stations in the city. Definitely will stay here again.
hotelName:
23    The Millennials Shibuya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We only stayed for one night but i would have loved to stay for another.The pods where awesome! controlled by an ipod (which also functions as the key), the beds where comfortable and pretty big with ample storage underneath (however only a tiny little safe). We had a projector in our pods which was pretty fun to use. AS you should expect, there is very little privacy and sound travels quite easily although we had a pretty quite night throughout our stay. The showers and toilets where fantastic and the shared breakfast facilities where great. The staff all spoke fluent english and where very helpful. Overall it was pretty expensive for a capsule hotel but worth the money just for the experience and connivence, i would stay here again
hotelName:
23    The Millennials Shibuya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was my first experience with a capsule hostel and I must admit it was really good. This place is brand new and very modern. Especially the common areas are very nicely designed and comfortable. My capsule was cozy and all the areas are exceptionally clean, which is something you definitely want when you stay in a hostel. Their staff is also nice and tries to help with everything. You can borrow anything you need if you are same lazy and forgetful as I am: chargers, electrical adapters, umbrellas, etc. Big plus is also the fact you can make a coffee, tea or hot chocolate free of charge whenever you want to. And as I was travelling because of work I found that very convenient. They use iPods instead of cards or keys, so you can use it for the entrance, for setting up your air-con, light, etc. Location is absolutely perfect, only 3 mins walk from "the famous" Shibuya crossing. The only downside was that I arrived in the early morning, so I had to wait for other 8 hours to check-in. The check-in time could be a bit earlier, not from 3pm. All in all I would stay here definitely again.
hotelName:
23    The Millennials Shibuya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is just a few min walk from Shibuya Station & Shibuya Crossing and close to a lot of shopping places. The lounge area and kitchen is wonderful. It’s spacious and complete with necessary supplies, a great place to meet new friends, and yay for free beer (17:30-18:30) and coffee. The bed is comfy and spacious as compared to usual capsule hotel
hotelName:
23    The Millennials Shibuya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff:The staff was amazing. They allowed us to store bags both before and after our check-in/check-out. They were extremely friendly and spoke excellent English!Common Facilities: The hotel is extremely modern and clean. There's a common space with free hot drinks and fast WiFi. The toilet lids and seats raise with a button (!)My Accommodations:I stayed in an art capsule on the 5th floor where the walls are adorned with a unique painting. The pod was comfortable and clean. I slept well, but I'm also a heavy sleeper.Considerations:In order to fully enjoy your stay, you'll need to be aware of some realities of the capsule hotel design.1. There is no ability to lock your belongings in the pod beyond a small lock box.2. The only barrier between your pod and the outer walkway is a drop-down screen which does not lock.3. When reclined, your bed will fill up the entire pod space.If you're sensitive to noise, bring ear plugs!My luggage was too thick to fit in the pull-out space under but I could still tuck it under the bed at the front. Just lower the bed slowly to confirm you aren't damaging anything.
hotelName:
23    The Millennials Shibuya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Central location close to transport hub, awesome vibe and relaxed atmosphere, and well designed smart pod with everything at the finger tips. Great staff. Recommend for any solo traveler looking to spend a couple of days in Tokyo.
hotelName:
23    The Millennials Shibuya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights and it was great! I was nervous and because people complain about the iphone and that the room is hot and that the breakfast was not good. But all of that was an exaggeration to me! The iphone is tiny it didn't bother me to hold it and you can leave it at reception if you wanted to, too. The room has an option that you can turn on fan, the night was nice and cool. And the breakfast fun were delicious! Man people be picky. This hotel is easy to walk to after a long day full of adventure and it's in Shibuya! I would definitely recommend and stay here again. Staff is great!! <3
hotelName:
23    The Millennials Shibuya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have travelled quite a bit in the US and stayed in all types of hotels. The stay at Millennials topped it all. The beds were super comfortable, amenities were amazing and the best part is that the floors were super silent always.The location is awesome (few minutes from Shibuya crossing, Shibuya Station) and there are tons of eating places nearby. For this price, there is free breakfast in morning.I would love to stay here as many times as possible.
hotelName:
23    The Millennials Shibuya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here last night and would highly recommend staying here. I loved the pods and they were incredibly comfy. You get your own iPod which controls the temperature, lighting and position of the bed. On checking in you are given an amenities bag which includes a towel and amenities kit but you can also buy other amenities if needed. The showers were fantastic and had shampoo, conditioner and body wash in them and the wash are had hairdryers as well. The place was spotless. 24/7 access to a coffee/ hot chocolate machine. Free beer from 1730-1830 and breakfast was help yourself to pastries. I was worried it would be really noisy with people coming and going through the night but it was not.
hotelName:
23    The Millennials Shibuya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The beds were bigger and more comfortable than I’d imagined. I’m 1.77cm and could fit without a problem. There’s a storage area under the bed. M/L suitcases can fit. The room offers cold airflow, charging plugs and clothing hooks. You’re given an iPod that’ll function as the room key and you need to use this to switch off the lights and set the alarm. It’s sounds pretty cool but it was a burden. You’d have to carry this with you at all time. So that’s a big responsibility which I didn’t liked at all!Furthermore, the rooms are clean as well as the communal area. There’s laundry but the dryer doesn’t work unless you pay extra. Free drinks throughout the day. The other guest are generally quiet so you get your sleep.I’d come back!
hotelName:
23    The Millennials Shibuya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Millennials is a great place to stay. The local is great in Shibuya. Short walk to the train station is an added bonus. As for the pod there is storage under the bed. A shelf above the bed to items on. You get given an iPod which controls the light and converts the bed from a sofa/sitting position to a bed. The bed is super comfortable. In addition you are provided an amenity kit. The shower and bathroom facilities are fantastic too.
hotelName:
23    The Millennials Shibuya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at the Millennials Shibuya for 5 nights, and had a great stay. This is completely different to other capsule hotels - the bed is somewhere between a single and double, and very comfortable. You are given an iphone to control the lighting and air conditioning in your pod, and to control the angle of your bed (it can fold up to be couch-style or laid flat to sleep). I stayed in a pod with a built in projector, which allowed me to chromecast shows onto the screen at the end of my bed. There is a shelf above the bed, USB and power points on the wall, and a pull out drawer under the bed for your luggage.The bathrooms are shared, but are extremely modern and clean. Toiletries were provided, and showers were nicer than any shared bathroom I've experienced before. You're provided with a towel at the beginning of your stay but can grab a new one each day as required.I didn't take advantage of the free breakfast or happy hour beer, but there is a shared kitchen and plenty of seating downstairs for anyone who wants to use it.The best thing about The Millennials is its location - it's incredible! Only a 5-7 minute walk down to Shibuya Crossing and Shibuya Station. There are hundreds of places to eat in the surrounding area, and lots of great shopping. Shibuya Center-gai is just around the corner.This isn't somewhere where everyone hangs out on the room and chats like they might do in a dorm, but it's a really modern, well set up place, and I would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for reasonably priced accommodation in a fantastic location.
hotelName:
23    The Millennials Shibuya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Free beer every day from 17.30-18.30 what more could you want ;-)The Millennials is very well located, very close to Shibuya station. The capsules are very large, modern and the beds comfortable. The light and the beds can be controlled by I-Pod. The showers and toilets are clean and spacious. The staff is young, friendly and has good English knowledge. The only thing that disturbed was the screens rolling up and down all night long.The price is rather high compared to other capsule hotels in Shibuya. But I would recommend the hotel because of the atmosphere and the futuristic experience.Keep going.
hotelName:
23    The Millennials Shibuya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The beds are comfortable.The capsules don’t feel claustrophobic at all.The amenities are modern and neatly appointed.The staff are very friendly and speak English well so they can help you navigate.The best park is the convenience of the location - really centrally located in Shibuya!
hotelName:
23    The Millennials Shibuya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I came from Spain. Great experience in the heart of Shibuya. Very comfortable, clean, funny, a very kind staff and... free beer!! I wish I could back again. Highly recomended, you wont regret. See you soon!
hotelName:
23    The Millennials Shibuya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for a night. The hotel is very trendy, each “pod” is cutely decorated, the bed is big and comfy for one person. Everyone around us was very considered of making no noise. The kitchen, shower and conmon areas was kept really clean as well. The lobby is always lively at night and a good place to meet at night.
hotelName:
23    The Millennials Shibuya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms are super comfortable and the hostel gets the balance of a place to chill and a place to socialise just right! I stayed in the girls only dorm and everyone was quite and respectful at night and the common spaces were ideal to hang out. They offer free beer in the evenings which is perfect if you're travelling by yourself as everyone comes down and its a great way to meet people.The staff were also amazing at helping me get back some lost items! They contacted local police and bus companies for me as I don't speak Japanese and were just incredibly helpful and friendly!!!!
hotelName:
23    The Millennials Shibuya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: [Positive aspects] Bed is good for better sleep and adequate in space. Lounge is OK since they have tasteful furniture and essential kitchen equipments such as refrigerator, kettle, microwave oven, knives etc. Very close to the central area of Shibuya but also safe and quiet.[Negative aspects] What was the most disappointing thing to me is the price setting. I had to convince myself why I had to pay 8k yen for the last day of my stay for about a week for a tiny personal space without TV. For free breakfast, it means simply bread and coffee/tea but you have to wash and dry your dish and get it back to the shelf. Plus, free beer is available only between 1730 to 1830, too narrow slot. Shower booths are not close to restrooms like they have their doors each separately, which I felt totally inconvenient. Only one elevator is available, so you have to wait for 3 or 5 min at average. To the way to this place from Shibuya sta., you have to climb steep slopes in any way. [Total] All in all, it’s not exceptional enough to pay 8k (for an ordinary weekday, not Friday or weekend) even with some comfortable experience at lounge or bed. I can think of many more points I didn’t like than I wrote here. It’s better to consider if you really think this location is the best for your schedule and if you can compromise with the presented price for your schedule.
hotelName:
23    The Millennials Shibuya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It's my first time to stay at a capsule hotel, and I'm absolutely loving it! I originally booked for 2 nights as a quick stopover hotel in Shibuya/Tokyo before venturing to other parts of the country -- but liked it so much that I extended for 2 more nights, and I'm now booking another 3 nights in Kyoto. The box/bedroom is technically not capsule-shaped, but has the same concept and is actually roomier. There’s a pull down drape for privacy when sleeping, a top shelf for your stuff, a safe, and a pull-out storage space for your luggage. The room comes with an iPod which serves as your digital key and controls the lights, A/C, and converts the bed from a sofa to a lie-down bed. Such a comfy bed too! For us digital nomads, there’s a big coworking area in the lobby and on another open floor, plus a well-equipped kitchen for guest use. They offer complimentary sweet breads for breakfast and free beers on tap during daily happy hour (5:30p-6:30p)I highly recommend it for *solo* travelers visiting Tokyo for 1-3 days -- and just need a cozy, clean, and safe place to sleep. (I‘m staying in the women-only floor.) The shared baths are sparkling clean. My only constructive feedback is stronger wifi (but don’t we always want this!), and to host and facilitate more community events where guests can socialize with each other. I do understand most folks only stay 1 night, and it’s a very transient group.It's an incredible deal in the hot Shibuya district, especially if you book in advance. Go go go! ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
hotelName:
23    The Millennials Shibuya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I love this modern capsule hotel so much. It only takes 5-7 mins by walking to Shibuya subway station. There are nice coffee shops and stores nearby. And the most amazing part is how the bed functions. It could be a seat and a bed. And, it is really soft. They also offer free iPhone for you to adjust the bed and light easily.Restroom and shower room are super clean and well organized. The big shower room designed for customers to change clothes comfortably. And the restroom has an automatic open lid toilet which amazed me so much.The lounge area and meeting room area are super stylish. It made me feel like I was in a modern trendy Scandinavian hotel.The two things I hope the hotel could improve is the door has no lock and the elevator speed. They use a very thick curtain to cover the room. But I was worried if someone opened my room by accident, there will be nothing to protect myself. Regarding the slow elevator, I truly think the hotel should improve it as soon as possible because there was another customer complained about it too.
hotelName:
23    The Millennials Shibuya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: All the employees speak english well. They are helpful, professional and thorough. The one downside is that there is no noice isolation between the mini-rooms. Even with the strict set of rules to limit noice on the sleeping floors you may still need to use earplugs.
hotelName:
23    The Millennials Shibuya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is wonderful, the staff very helpful and polite. The bed is very comfortable, the place is very clean and sure i recomend it and i definitely will come back! The breakfest is very good but if you're used to eat fruits, you're gonna miss it.
hotelName:
23    The Millennials Shibuya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Unlike most pod hotels, you get a decent sized space and your room extends up to the ceiling. so you could look at it as a mini-room that's the size of a bed. beds are between a twin and full size bed. great perks like free beer everyday from 530-630pm. free breakfast which consisted of various breads. coffee machine is available for use 24 hours. very helpful and friendly staff. very clean. bathrooms are clean and stocked with shampoo/conditioner/body wash. the hostel is located around a 7 minute walk from the Shibuya train station. I'm very happy with my stay here and would definitely recommend it to other travelers!
hotelName:
23    The Millennials Shibuya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The best Hostel ever!!! A bar like hostel with free beer with matching led lights, led light table screens and music.Aside from that is the free breakfast. Most importantly, the bed,reclininable bed with an ipod as your remote control. To sum it up woth the amenities are the very polite/accomodating/respectful and the never gets tired desks officers. Value for money its worth the price.Lavatory, Shower and toilet is so modernized. Its really worth my stay aside from that made my special day/natal day/stay in Tokyo-Shibuya more enjoyable/memorable/worth keeping. Fully/Highly recomended and in a scale of 1-5 and 5 as the highest.RA
hotelName:
23    The Millennials Shibuya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is the nicest hostel I’ve every stayed in! The whole place was clean, the staff were really friendly, and the beds were really big. The give you an iPod as the key and it controls the beds. The bed was super comfy and it’s cool being able to sit it up and then put the bed down flat when you’re going to sleep. Each little booth has aircon/fan as well. You can also set the bed alarm so that it turns of the light and sits up the bed slowly. It’s only a pull down curtain like thing but everyone was so quite that that really wasn’t a problem at all. There’s plenty of storage space under the bed to put your suitcase on and each bed has a small locker. The bathroom facilities are really nice and were always clean! They have free hot drinks and ice in the communal area for during the day and at breakfast. The breakfast is really only a couple different bread choices. They also have free beers for an hour every evening in the communal area. The location of this place is also one of its standouts. It’s a short 5 minute walk from the Shibuya Crossing, and all the shops around there. There’s plenty of food places and convenience stores around as well. It’s also about a 15 minute walk from Harajuku and all the big shops around there. If I was going back to Tokyo, I would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
23    The Millennials Shibuya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beer happy hour each day, free beer on tap.And now for the serious part of the review. A captial hotel with plenty of room in a modern bed setting, the bed is a justable by iPod control, and the spice in the captial was much wider and roomier than I imagined. Any of the photos you see are no exaggeration of the space.Facilities are new, modern and clean. Overall, great and affordable stay in Tokyo.
hotelName:
23    The Millennials Shibuya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel,3 minutes from shibuya crossing. Very reasonably priced. Clean, free wi-fi, very nice staff.Very good for single travelers.Exit 13 from shibuya station i think is the closest. Use google maps to get herefor the first time and you're set to go.
hotelName:
23    The Millennials Shibuya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed in the hotel for a long layover and loved it! My first time to try a capsule hotel and was a little nervous initially and turned out to be a super experience. The capsule area is very quiet the whole time when I was here. My only worry was that I might have snored during sleep. The hotel is within walking distance from Shibuya station, close to shopping and restaurants area. It has happy hour with free beer and simple breakfast /coffee in the morning. Hotel staff was very friendly. The capsule does not have a lock, but it should not be a concern at all. Will certainly stay again.
hotelName:
23    The Millennials Shibuya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at the Millenials in both Kyoto and at their Tokyo Shibuya location. It caters to international tourists, but I’ve seen one Japanese salaryman at breakfast. I preferred Kyoto as you could lock your pod with a key and the common area was much bigger. At Shibuya you can leave your valuables in a locker at another floor. Otherwise they provide the same services. All amenities you may need and a nice lounge area to socialise with other travelers.
hotelName:
23    The Millennials Shibuya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: You get the luxury of being just a quick walk away from anything you could possibly need. Very clean, and friendly staff. As far as capsule hotels are concerned this one stands above the rest in the area.
hotelName:
23    The Millennials Shibuya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Definitely it is the best hostel in shibuya, just 2 blocks away from the Jr station. Very beautiful accommodation, the capsule is fair enough to sleep, it’s perfect for a lonely traveler like me. I’d come back again
hotelName:
23    The Millennials Shibuya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As mentioned in title, rooms are so beautiful. And each room has different style. That's so cool! Additionally, there are 2 public floors for meeting friends, cooking self, internet place, and etc. Last but not least, there is a happy hours, free beer!
hotelName:
23    The Millennials Shibuya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was our first experience with a capsule hostel. The capsules themselves were spacious and comfortable; it was cool being able to control the bed incline, light brightness, etc. with the push of a button. You could also open or close a screen for privacy as necessary. Showers and bathroom were immaculately clean, and the communal areas were comfortable. Free wifi was fast and consistent. The location of the hostel was also excellent; very close to Shibuya station (about a 5-7 minute walk), as well as to some great eating spots. We would definitely come back for another stay!
hotelName:
23    The Millennials Shibuya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It’s my favourite hostel in Tokyo. i would definitely recommend it and would likely stay again here. LOCATION: Easily accessible from the airport - you can reach it with just 2 trains from Narita. The hostel is just a short walk from Nishairai Station. There is a big supermarket & department Store (AEON) in front of the hostel. There are plenty to of local restaurants and fast food options (McDonads, KFC, Mo’s Burger). There is a family mart & Don Quijote just a short walk from it for your 24 hr needs. It’s easy to take the train to explore Tokyo. Note though that the station closest to it is not part of the JR Pass or Metro day passes. You can use your IC (SUICA) card for it. There is a mall nearby (about a 10 min walk) with a lot of stores including GU, MUJI, Uniqlo, and ABC Mart. ROOMS: if you’re a big group - I would suggest getting the room for 8 with the ensuite bathroom. The dorm rooms are good too. There is enough space in the bed with a small ledge on the side, reading light and outlets. There are lockers inside the rooms big enough for a large backpack. This is helpful so you can unpack some of your stuff so you won’t need to keep opening your bags. BREAKFAST : they serve good simple breakfast - bread, eggs & sausage mostly. You have the option of milk, orange juice or coffee. They also serve unlimited soup. :) STAFF: They have really friendly and helpful staff. It’s one of the friendliest hostel I’ve stayed at. A lot of the staff speak English well so you won’t have any problems. I liked how many activities they had in the week. They usually offer tours or activities during the day and have fun events at night you can join in to interact with the other guests. There is also a good temple close you should stop by if you can - Nishiarai Daishi Temple.
hotelName:
24    Emblem Hostel Nishiarai
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I felt like I was getting the 5 star hotel treatment within the affordable price of a hostel. Super friendly people and super friendly staff!! Also located In a unique area of Tokyo where you get to experience the chill every day life of the locals.
hotelName:
24    Emblem Hostel Nishiarai
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing place and staff :), Thank you so much for everything :), The rooms are so clean, staffs are so nice, I will stay there again for my next trips. It's very close to main areas and there are a lot of restaurants and malls around there.
hotelName:
24    Emblem Hostel Nishiarai
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The place itself is great. It is super clean, have nice friendly staff and with great amenities but it's just so far away from the city. Took us more than an hour by train to Shinjuku / Shibuya so we had to change hotel by the second day, unfortunately.
hotelName:
24    Emblem Hostel Nishiarai
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Emblem Hostel was our family's first stay at a hostel and we had a great experience with Emblem. It was very close to the train station, so even though it's a bit far from "town," getting out and doing things in Tokyo was a breeze. The cafe served great food at very reasonable prices -- the burgers at dinner are some of the best burgers we've ever had! It may seem like a little thing, but we learned later at our Kyoto hostel how much we loved it and that was having a vending machine in the hostel lounge. With our time being all out of whack, having that vending machine in the hostel with great coffee options at 3-4AM really made a difference! Staff were all super friendly and helpful and all that we dealt with spoke very good English. We had a "private" room that was essentially two sets of bunk beds, although they were more like a capsule hotel. Nice curtains to give you privacy and darkness. Shared bathrooms, but separate for women and men (again, not something we had in Kyoto). Aeon grocery right across the street was also super convenient! Had many meals from there, as well that made this area even more affordable.
hotelName:
24    Emblem Hostel Nishiarai
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great staff.Great place, with 300yen breakfast.I stayed here in my 1st week, returning in my third.Then I have to write more stuff and hit 200 characters before this review can be submitted...that should do it.
hotelName:
24    Emblem Hostel Nishiarai
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We visit our daughter here in Tokyo and stayed at Emblem. It is a nice and clean hostel and all the personal are very kind and helpful. They arrange very good events. We can only recommend this place.
hotelName:
24    Emblem Hostel Nishiarai
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Pretty social hostel. Lots of cool activities and events to bring people together. Rooms are decent. Location is really far, you need to budget at least 2 hours a day going back and forth if you want to go into the city. Bad value for money in my opinion.
hotelName:
24    Emblem Hostel Nishiarai
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was here for four nights while exploring Tokyo. Easily one of the best hostels I have stayed at. A little out of the way but worth it. Everything was exceptional and the staff are great. Cannot go wrong staying with Emblem!
hotelName:
24    Emblem Hostel Nishiarai
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean everything, very nice facility, friendly staffs and interesting events everyday. It is the place where I can embrace Tokyo without being right in the middle of craziness. Nice breakfast being served in minimum cost, big supermarket next to property, so longer stayers are beneficiaries.
hotelName:
24    Emblem Hostel Nishiarai
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Incredible staff, service, facilities, activities, options, location.. the list is endless! Premium style hostel without the inflated prices; all facilities are extremely clean and tidy! Staying in dormitories is similar to staying in a capsule hotel, however, beds are spacious and comfy.. great sleep! Shared bathrooms and showers are clean and easy to use. Staff were the highlight of my stay; all speak several languages and are extremely helpful! No matter what hour it is there is someone around at the front desk! Super fun, caring and kind! A range of daily activities to participate in with other hostel-mates such as karaoke night, fish markets, temple seeing etc. Plus, there are bikes to rent and a gym to use! Everything reasonably priced including breakfast and other household items like laundry detergent etc. Emblem Hostel Nishiarai has been an incredible stay with lots of things to do! I will be back!
hotelName:
24    Emblem Hostel Nishiarai
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Went with a friend, left with many. Super chill vibe with friendly people and even friendlier staff with good knowledge of the area and general advice for Tokyo. Very affordable, clean and very good food and drink. The distance from the city may be an issue for some people but I found I got used to it very quickly, plus theres still plenty to do locally anyway.
hotelName:
24    Emblem Hostel Nishiarai
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a great place for anyone wanting to stay in a premium style hostel that is well priced! Although it is a little bit out of town, the people there make it well worth it!From the first moments I walked in, I was able to receive early check in and was invited to join in the walking tour to the local Temple and got an insight into the customaries when visiting Japan!This was a great social hostel for anyone willing to join in conversation in the lounge was always more than welcoming! I made lifelong friends there in such a short time! The cleanliness was exceptional and amenities were cleaned daily.
hotelName:
24    Emblem Hostel Nishiarai
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I don't know where to even start with this place. By far my favorite place I stayed at in Japan. Great area, just hated the metro system. Easy to meet people and hangout. Loved being able to use the gym there, but the gym did have some strange rules. Mark is a great guy to chat with (Btw, was able to pick up the Godzilla shirt at the airport, but not the same sake. Should of just bought it from you). The women are beautiful and friendly. I hope they put together a pub crawl for the hostel before too long.
hotelName:
24    Emblem Hostel Nishiarai
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I’ve had the pleasure of staying at Emblem hostel and I can say with full confindence it it’s the best housing I’ve stayed at in japan - and I have stay in many hostels all over the country of Japan. The location is excellent, the nice quite area of Nishiarai outside of the busy city center - perfect for travelers who prefer to lodge away from the crowded streets of Tokyo. The facilities are top notch - lounge, cafe, bar, laundry and even gym passes. The hostel also sells food, the chicken nuggets and burgers are really good. The staff are incredible. All of the reception staff have traveled to different countries, some have even studied abroad, so they have an excellent understanding of foreign cultures and how many of the guests think and can communicate effectively. Also, they’re are sometimes foreign staff from various countries working in the hostel as well. Ive seen staff from Denmark, Korea, New Zealand, France and Singapore. This hostel is basically an international culture hub. I’ve meet people from all over the world and a good portion of them have come to this hostel multiple times. The hostel doesn’t feel like a hostel - it feels like a community. I recommended my friends to go stay at Emblem and every single one of them have enjoyed it as much as I have. In summary, If you come to Tokyo. Go to Emblem.
hotelName:
24    Emblem Hostel Nishiarai
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I only stayed at Emblem for a night, but it really is a great deal for the accomodations and amenities. Super close to the train station (maybe a 3 minute walk, at most), very clean, and great staff!!
hotelName:
24    Emblem Hostel Nishiarai
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here 2 times and both times were great, met a lot of new people and did a lot of fun stuff. The hostel is a bit further into town but that is actually nice about it. Being close to a big supermarket and the trainstation is also really nice!
hotelName:
24    Emblem Hostel Nishiarai
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Emblem Hostel Nishiarai were perfect! We enjoyed the service, the beds, the activities (regular hostel meet ups, traditional Japanese excursions and much more) and the location was good too. A bit far from the main areas but it’s no problem to get around as Nishiarai station is right there. I will definitely be back!
hotelName:
24    Emblem Hostel Nishiarai
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: To my regret, I was at the end of my travels in Japan and was exhausted and this one night stop was to get organised for my next destination. This place has lots to offer in terms of their cafe, food, bar, social meetings and the actual accommodation was excellent. I think it brought together the best of hotels and hostels together in one package. Getting there was easy by train. The check in/out process was easy, fast and painless. The staff were very friendly and spoke very good English. Beds were very comfortable, not too hard not to soft. Ablutions were very clean and of a high quality. The only problems I had were what you may encounter at any hostel but my night was particularly bad with some very rude people talking loudly about 3 am and alarm clocks not being turned off. Perhaps some rules can be made clearer to all guests about Hostel by staff as part of the check in process. However, overall this place is excellent and typical of Japanese attention to detail, cleanliness and high respect of their guests. I will most certainly have an extended stay here next time if I return to Tokyo.
hotelName:
24    Emblem Hostel Nishiarai
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very professional staff, very clean rooms and very nice atmosphere. There are tours in the morning and parties at night for traveller to mingle with the locals and learn more about the culture of Japan. Overall a very good stay!
hotelName:
24    Emblem Hostel Nishiarai
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: OMG I had the best visit ever the best place to stay while in Japan excellent customer service , the room , bathroom the food and the new friends I meet were awesome. I am willing to visit again and I had travel alone and over the age of 62 years old. Just great its worth more than a 10 a secret Hotel near the metro.
hotelName:
24    Emblem Hostel Nishiarai
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is my first time traveling as a backpacker, this hostel is very nice, nice staff and nice people there, nice atmosphere, I’ve learnt a lot about traveling there. There are lots of events there, such as karaoke and meetup.
hotelName:
24    Emblem Hostel Nishiarai
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We enjoyed our stay at Emblem hostel - overall a great, modern hostel. Friendly staff! The room was spotless with plenty of storage and very comfy beds. They offer a good breakfast at a reasonable price. The only downside I would say is the distance from some of the main areas you'd want to visit in Tokyo. Although it is right next to a subway station and travel is relatively cheap. I wouldn't let that put you off but worth keeping in mind.
hotelName:
24    Emblem Hostel Nishiarai
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: So this has been my first experience in a hostel: at the beginning, I was skeptical and did not expect much, having chosen the lowest-price accomodation available in Tokyo. Me and one of my friends just needed one bed for the last night in Japan the day before the flight from Narita Airport, so we found and booked here two randoms beds.The position is not the best, but allows you to easily catch a train from Nishiarai Station (if I well remember) which is just 200 meters away. If you consider buying the daily Tokyo underground pass, you'll have to pay a fee of 170yen for the first ride in order to get into the pass included station. Speaking about location, the hostel is close to the best supplied supermarket I've found in Japan, with tons of take-away delicacy and an internal bakery.The hostel itself is super clean, with cosy rooms, handy washrooms and cushy common places. The capsule where we spent the night were not claustrophobic, there was enough space for a big guy like my friend. They will provide you a key for your private cabinet (backpack sized, not for a suitcase) and one to access the room. The washrooms have a lot of space, which allows you to easily bring your clean clothes with you avoiding to run through the hallway wearing the bathrobe.The check-in was fast and easy, having reserved via booking.com we just needed to provide our passports, pay and we were ready to get some rest. One appreciable thing: all the different guys and girls we met at the reception were extraordinarily kind, we really appreciated it.Definitively I'll check beds availability here next time I'll go to Tokyo, probably for more than one night!
hotelName:
24    Emblem Hostel Nishiarai
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hostel was well maintained at all times, very clean, beds were comfortable and had curtains, felt like I had my privacy in a mixed 8 bed dorm! staff was super helpful and so friendly, gave us tips on how to get around Tokyo as well as around the hostel. Staff provides daily activities and events that are fun and educate you about Japanese culture. They provide bike rentals as well so you could bike around the hostel area which is so worth it. About a 30min metro ride to Ueno station with Tokyo metro line, can get you to Shibuya in 50min. Overall, had a great stay at this hostel and would definitely stay here again when I return to Tokyo.
hotelName:
24    Emblem Hostel Nishiarai
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hostel was clean and comfortable with a really nice cafe, and they organize events where you get the opportunity to learn more about Tokyo/Japan and meet other travelers. Staff were extremely friendly and helpful! Would definitely want to stay here again if I'm coming back to Tokyo!
hotelName:
24    Emblem Hostel Nishiarai
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: There is nothing bad to say! Beds are big and comfortable. Shelves and chargers by your bed are really useful.Big lockers for all your stuff also great. Luxurious clean bathrooms here and lovely showers. Communal areas have great atmosphere. We even saw some live music one night which was really nice.Kitchen great for heating up food. And fridge. Supermarket literally across the street so so handy for dinners and lunches and way cheaper than eating out.Staff all lovely and friendly. English was great.cant fault it one bit.
hotelName:
24    Emblem Hostel Nishiarai
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved everything about Emblem. Yes, the place is a bit far from central Tokyo ( about 30-40 mins from everything) but it was okay since the train station is nearby. Loved the Nishiarai neighbourhood! The few but good restaurants and bars nearby we're good places for night caps. The staff we're really nice and helpful! Even days before my arrival, they were already very nice to answer my questions. The common area on the 3rd floor is a great place for drinks, meet other travellers, or prepare some meals or drinks. Wished we had more time to join their group activities!
hotelName:
24    Emblem Hostel Nishiarai
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have stayed at Emblem Hostel before and liked it a lot, but my second stay has been even better. The staff really do their best to make you feel welcome and comfortable as soon as you get there to check in, and they are so friendly as well. Emblem Hostel is always well kept, and clean. They hold events almost every other day to get you involved in the culture or explore Tokyo and local Nishiarai. They also have created a perfect atmosphere to meet other travelers and locals. Every day I explored/partied with a group and we all became great friends at the end of the day. Their location in Tokyo is perfect. The train station, supermarket, several local restaurants, and even a gym are all next to, or right across the street from the hostel, which is super convienent. They are a little far from downtown Tokyo, but the train station has an express train that goes straight to Shibuya so you don’t have to worry about transferring at all. I miss the staff so much. I can’t wait to be back in Tokyo so I can hang out with them more!
hotelName:
24    Emblem Hostel Nishiarai
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First time ever in Tokyo and we stayed at this hostel. Very nice staff and the rooms are small but good for the money given. Out of the way and it takes approx. one hour and a half from Narita Airport. However lovely hostel and we would return again!
hotelName:
24    Emblem Hostel Nishiarai
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hostel is really a lovely place to stay! We are a retired couple and normally stay in hotels but our daughter persuaded us that Emblem was an experience not to be missed and she was correct!The staff are wonderfully helpful and always welcoming. We had a double en suite room which was equal to hotel rooms we have stayed in Japan (all have been quite small). Beautifully clean and very well equipped. No kettle in the room but this wasn't a problem as there is a great kitchen/ sitting area on the second floor where you can chat whilst preparing food from the very cheap Aeon supermarket across the road. Great laundry on that floor as well.Great bar and restaurant - not much for us awkward vegans though. I am sure a vegan version of a burger or burrito would be a great addition to the menu.Had a great time being dressed as a Geisha - many thanks to the very lovely Suzuki Sensei for that. All in all great value for money and would return!
hotelName:
24    Emblem Hostel Nishiarai
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked for a dorm for 8 people (with 2 young teens). Room was spot on - from clean, white beddings; soft, fluffy towels; ample room for luggages. The shared bath and toilet were as clean as too and smelt so good. The staff were very friendly and nice and very welcoming. The meet-up night at their lobby was a surprise that fam had a chance to get dressed up in kimono's for free! This is a worth to stay in place, very close to shops and train station. Highly recommended. Fam had good memories of it.If anything it's only the shower room that's not to my liking as there's only a curtain that separates access between men and women. Would have been great if it's in separate rooms just like the toilets.
hotelName:
24    Emblem Hostel Nishiarai
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My stay in emblem hostel was great, the staff were friendly and helpful, the beds were really comfortable, the facilities were good and clean (though lacking complete cooking facilities). Excellent information about the local area was provided and the hostel organises meet ups very often and organise activities such as anime voice over workshops and origami workshops. Highly recommend!
hotelName:
24    Emblem Hostel Nishiarai
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Was at the Emblem with my family for the last week in August and the staff there made us feel really welcomed and comfortable during our first time in Tokyo! All their amenities are great, the cheap laundry was very helpful. The space itself is spacious and bright, something that I felt was a competitive advantage over the other hostels I was considering. Their dining space doubles as a cafe where locals frequent, and they also involve locals in their social events which is great for cultural immersion. The beds were comfortable and clean, I didn't wake up with half my body frozen which is the usual expectation of a hostel. This was definitely at a hostel price with a hotel vibe. They also let us leave our bags there while we went out into the city since we had a late flight which made everything much more convenient. Also a plus that there's an awesome thrift store right across the street (called Mode Off). Overall great experience!! Shout-out to Haruna, Yuki, and Mark for creating an excellent atmosphere!
hotelName:
24    Emblem Hostel Nishiarai
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hostel is very lively for it tries to host making events to get its guest engaged. It has an awesome staff that is very friendly and has multiple personnel that can speak multiple languages. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. Some will say that the location is not the best because it is in a non tourist location. However, I did not see it as a problem because of all the positives that the hostel has going for it. I can't wait to plan my next trip to Japan and my next stay at Emblem.PS. Thanks Sunny for an awesome first day. You sing very lovely and hope you make your dream come true. Chicago guy.
hotelName:
24    Emblem Hostel Nishiarai
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms were clean, Beds similar to capsule hotel, friendly staff, very quiet and I had amazing sleep experience. The only con for me was the location, You need to change twice the train to get to the city center. Else, everything is great.
hotelName:
24    Emblem Hostel Nishiarai
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I went to Japan in my first trip alone and far from my country, I thought that it was going to be difficult to make friends and visit all the places I wanted to go, but it was really nice. I made a really good friends there, all the staff was really kind and lovely. They do a lot of activities to makes you get involve with everyone. They do tours, English conversation meetings, karaoke, movies and more. All the place is really clean. I recommend it at all.
hotelName:
24    Emblem Hostel Nishiarai
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I live in many hostels around the world. Some were good, some mediocre and some bad. The Emblem Hostel is one of the best I stayed in. The staff is very friendly. Everything is very clean. The beds are comfortable, the rooms have good air conditioning and clean fresh air. Nothing is dusty or bad for the lungs. Each guest has a cupboard. In the 3rd floor is a large room with a kitchen for the guests. In the 1 floor is a bar with restaurant. There are often ivends such as karaoke, live music, japanese cooking, tea ceremony, etc. All in all, very good. If I go back to Tokyo, I will live in this hostel.
hotelName:
24    Emblem Hostel Nishiarai
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I loved our stay at Emblem Hostel. The staff was so gracious: they even called to book my wife's surprise birthday dinner while I was still in the States, since my Japanese wasn't good enough. They seem to love their jobs and enjoy getting guests involved in meet-ups, takoyaki parties, karaoke, and more. Oh, and the facility is lovely as well.The only drawback is that it is far away from many of the things we wanted to see: Shinjuku, Shibuya, etc. However, it's situated next to public transportation in a lovely little neighborhood that gives a sense of quaintness in contrast to Tokyo's bright neons and general craziness. I'd definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
24    Emblem Hostel Nishiarai
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything I do is quite impulsive, and so was booking this hostel. When I saw the location, Nishiarai, I was sort of afraid I would be to far away from everything. But the local-tourist culture the hostel offers turned out to be so much fun, that this area worked offered way more than the average Tokyo place. A fantastic Korean lady gave all of us an authentic local tour, a real eye-opener! Also the live music created a super chill vibe! Most of all, I should really thank Ryoko! I fired question after question and she ended up helping me plan my entire trip in Hokkaido. Thanks guys, keep on rolling!
hotelName:
24    Emblem Hostel Nishiarai
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have stayed in many hostels across Tokyo and this was definitely one of the best.It has a great environment, attracts good customers and the staff are super friendly and helpful.I had only booked one night but ended up staying for over a month as I enjoyed the hostel and location so much.The staff really take care of you truly making your stay as enjoyable as possible.
hotelName:
24    Emblem Hostel Nishiarai
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Is nice and full of cool people and staff but is outside of tokyo and you will spend lots of time at the trains and the money you save on the hostel you spend it in moving around tokyo so that wasn't great
hotelName:
24    Emblem Hostel Nishiarai
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was blown away by the kindness of all the staff at Emblem Nishiarai! It may be a bit far from the sights but it more than makes up for with clean facilities, nightly activities and a common room that all ages can enjoy.Never have I been to a hostel that people have so quickly tried to stay at again , and the people I met during my week long stay were as varied and as interesting as I could hope for.Shout out to Mark and the team for all their hard work and kindness (and Sunny for her amazing singing)I can't wait to come back!
hotelName:
24    Emblem Hostel Nishiarai
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It’s a really clean open hostel with nice soft beds and a really nice Terrance for socializing- the concept is to bring local people together with the international community - so everyone can learn from each other- recommend
hotelName:
24    Emblem Hostel Nishiarai
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hostel is incredible! The facilities are so impressive and the food is amazing! I would not opt for the budget breakfast as their normal food is much much better!!People are really helpful and informative. Thank you Emblem!
hotelName:
24    Emblem Hostel Nishiarai
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Such a great Hostel!!! Great energy and great bunch of travellers. The awesome common area genuinely helps with mingling with fellow travellers. Great spaces and great beds. It is on the outskirts of Tokyo but once you get the hang of the train lines it's super convenient that it's right next to the station!!! The staff was amazing!! So friendly!!!! Suupperrr chill but also really professional. They have everything sorted with a hug map on the wall that tells you everything locally and have no problem telling you what to do around Tokyo! One of the workers gave us an awesome hint to an amazing ramen place!!!
hotelName:
24    Emblem Hostel Nishiarai
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was my fourth time staying at Emblem Hostel. I have come back time and time again because it is one of the best in Tokyo. The staff are so friendly and speak English extremely well. They have many events on at the hostel as well as in the surrounding Nishiarai area. The beds are so comfortable and clean, the overall hostel extremely clean itself. The vibe at this Hostel is one of the best when it comes to meeting new people and it is always busy. I will be staying again the next time I come to Japan.
hotelName:
24    Emblem Hostel Nishiarai
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was a walk in and was lucky enough to be accommodated since they’re usually fully booked. Clean rooms, towels, toilets and showers. They even have a bath tub or 2 available per floor!It’s located like 30 paces from the train station. Convenience stores and mall/s in every direction plus food places, whatever budget you have you won’t go hungry here.Super fast internet, super friendly staff too. They gave me a discount for extending my stay.
