The accommodation was clean and spacious and each room had an air con unit which was needed during a particularly hot Japanese summer. The people who run the Inn couldn't have been more helpful with advice and information when we were planning our trips out each day. They were friendly and accessible for the whole of our our stay.There is a small area to have breakfast (coffee, toast and jam) and it's great to meet and socialise with the other guests. There is also facility for storing food and microwave if you need it as well as laundry facilities which is is very useful.I'd recommend this place for location, the comfort it offers and value, as well as its proximity to Ikebukero. From there it's really easy to get train and bus services all around Tokyo and the areas outside of Tokyo.
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff was really nice and helpful and their English was verry good what is not common in Japan.The room was a nice litte traditional room with tatami as floor.The bath was modern and clean.The next time I come to Japan I will most likely stay there again.
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The employees here were super nice. From the moment we arrived, they treated us like visiting family members. we got great advice on what to see and how to get there. Also recommendations on local restaurants and shopping. A few times, the front desk clerks mother (who lives onsite) would bring us out different Japanese snacks that she had cooked for us to try. They had a simple, but tasty breakfast everyday and we got to chat with other guests over breakfast. The rooms were traditional (as much as I can guess) Japanese, futons on the tatami mats. we had private bathroom and shower, but they also offered on the top floor a traditional Japanese ryokan bath which you could make an appointment for and you had it all to yourself (no charge). Washing machine was available with soap included and they had a frig which we were welcome to use near the front desk. On our last day, one of the staff members even escorted us to the train station and made sure we got on the right train back to Narita. I highly recommend this place.
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Alright, I made an account just to write this review (as well as a few others from this trip). My wife and I just had our honeymoon in Tokyo for the past two weeks. We weren't originally planning to stay here. We had plans to travel to Osaka, but cancelled them because of the earthquake and chose to stay in Tokyo instead. We had checked out of our hotel in Shinjuku and had to find a new place. As luck would have it, the first place we found was Family Inn Saiko. It had great reviews, so we decided to stay.I have to say that this is a much different experience from a traditional hotel. If you are booking here expecting to stay at a place the Park Hyatt, you will probably be surprised. The rooms are clean, Japanese-style rooms and you sleep on a futon. While your room has a toilet and shower, there is also a Japanese-style bath on the top floor that can be reserved on a per-room basis (I recommend trying it). All of the inn staff are family or friends of family. They are all very nice and welcoming people, and we greatly enjoyed our time here and interacting with them. They were very welcoming and accommodating even on the short notice with which we booked (less than 24 hours in advance). The inn itself is located in a nice, quiet neighborhood about 25 minute walking time from Ikebukuro (or 10 minutes from two nearby train lines, the Fukatoshin subway line and the Seibu-Ikebukuro line. Note that your JR rail pass won't work on either line as they are not owned by JR, but it's also totally reasonable to walk to Ikebukuro and catch the Yamanote line (or another JR line) there. Walking through the neighborhood and exploring the various tiny shops and restaurants was probably one of our favorite moments of the trip. We really felt like we got to experience everyday life in Japan as opposed to being caught in the tourist bubble. I will say that it helps to know a small bit of Japanese when interacting with the locals, but I imagine with the inn in the neighborhood, most people around here are at least used to the occasional tourist popping by. Finally, just another note about the inn staff. The Saiko family is wonderful and really made us feel like we were guests in their home rather than guests at an inn. We have already decided that whenever we come to Tokyo, this is the place we will stay. The value, location, and experience can't be topped. The Saiko family is what makes this place truly special, and I encourage you to stay here and give it a try.
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our small family stayed three nights at the end of May. The inn was easy to find if you followed the directions in the video on the inn's website. We had an enjoyable walk from the train station to the inn. There is actually very little traffic on the small streets, most residents were either walking or biking. The facilities are nice, and the basic breakfast of toast with jams, and coffee or tea was good. They have a collection of small gifts for purchase which was fun, as well as foods suitable for eating in your room if you desire (ramen noodles and the like). But the real reason to stay are the people. Uki and Hiroshi are very friendly, and to say they are helpful is a huge understatement. I lost my wallet on our first day in Tokyo, a city of almost 40 million! I had heard wallets can be returned in Tokyo, so I wasn't in a big hurry to call in my lost credit cards. We went to the local koban (police station) and filled out a report with the help of a couple of friendly officers. The next day we came back from our sightseeing and Uki had called around to the subway stations (of which there are a lot) and found my wallet! Everything was accounted for, even the cash. I can't say enough good things about the folks at Family Inn Saiko, other than they helped make our trip to Japan an incredible experience.
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We felt like locals lodging in this quaint family-run inn for 4 nights! Being on a Budget, we walked every day from the train stations (to and from Shiinamachi with luggage, and to and from Kanamecho for the rest) - it was arduous for our two elementary school aged kids, especially when it was drizzly and windy on some occasions, but I guess it taught them to persevere through minor hardships! For adults, the walk is doable and it is really a very pleasant upper-middle class neighbourhood to stroll through.The hospitality is unbeatable, as many have attested to. They have helpful maps to popular destinations (e.g. Tsukiji market) and whoever is manning the front desk always goes the extra mile to help you with any queries. We had a really charming experience being decked out in real kimonos by the Grandma of the family who owns the inn. It was complimentary, and in many ways, a priceless experience and we got to take lovely photos which will make for great memories of our time in Japan.The rooms are small and cosy but has everything that you would need. The rooms do not have blackout curtains and the sun rises around 5am, so do bring eye-shades if the morning light would affect your sleep. Tea and toast provided complimentarily in the mornings are simple but a warm touch that would give you the needed boost to start your day / trek to the train station or first itinerary stop.It is great value for the price and we warmly recommend it.
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First of all I'd just like to thank the lovely people at the Family Inn Saiko who made our 5 days in Tokyo absolutely delightful. Our stay couldn't have been better. I chose this place because of the reviews and I'm so glad I did. Do not be fooled by the 10-12 min walk from Shiinamachi or Kanamecho station. It really is quiet easy if you follow the directions. The Family Inn is quite charming. My friend and I slept in traditional Japanese styled beds which were very comfortable especially during the summer. During our stay the host gave us recommendations, advice and tips on how to get to around. The kitchen and laundry were great as we needed to wash some of our clothes. Big bonus for us! We felt really welcomed and one of the hosts we bumped into at Shiinamachi station even helped us around and recommended a great place to get some Kit Kats as a souvenir. It was sad to say goodbye but I will never forget their friendly hospitality. They even gave us a little parting gift. Thank you for everything. We would love to come back and visit you guys.
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have stayed at this hotel for the past five nights and am really happy I did. I would agree with most of the others reviews: clean, comfortable, kind staff, nice neighborhood, a good long walk from the subways. I really liked the price and exchanged that for a long walk to the subway which can be really crowded during rush hour. I bought a SIM at the airport for 4,000 YEN. I would have had a hard time finding the hotel without my phone through the narrow/nameless streets. Also, my maps app was helpful when using the subway system.I took the airport bus to/from the airport for 3,100 YEN.
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It's a great place to be on a number of occasions, and it's a great place to be introduced to your friends. Among them, it was the lowest level of kindness, cleanliness, and neighborhood tone. I personally think there is no better place than this although I stayed in the hotel twice this month in April. I will also make a reservation and visit this August or September. Thank you, anyway.
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you want a place to stay which gives you a real Japanese feel, as opposed to the tourist hotels of the cbd, then the Family Inn Saiko is the place for you. It is not in the city but is a short walk to 1 or 2 train station - one being Ikebukuro station. The staff are incredibly helpful. A short walk towards Shiinamachi station also takes you to lots of small cafes and restaurants. Definitely a great experience and more enriching than a standard hotel.
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you are looking for the Tokyo city experience this is not the place to go. The place is a good walking distance from a local train station and when you are towing roller bags at 9 pm it seems to be a long ways away. No local restaurants were around since you are in a residential area. Once we got train passes and station locations worked out it was a quiet relief from the active city sights. On our way back through Tokyo we stayed very close to the Tokyo train statino and that was a little better for us.
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Easy walking distance fromShiinamachi train station You will be able to connect to Ikebukuro by one stop Ikebukuro is a large station which connects to many lines and will be your main departure point to other areas We found the Inn with some guidance from a kind local who walked us the 10 minutes from ShiinamachiOnce you arrive the reception staff will give you a map of the area and show you the facilities This Inn is very low key and relatively informal compared to other Japanese accommodations As an Australian I found this matched our cultural style perfectly and the “ easy going “ nature of the staff allow you to relax straight away This is its greatest charm You feel like you can be yourself and there’s always someone interesting arriving or sitting in the main area having a chat Best Points For Teenagers- free WiFi For everyone - there is a lift !Parents and family - there is free laundry facilities so you don’t have to go toThe coin laundry !!Free use of kitchen - Zip style hot water and microwave and fridge A communal eating space is delightful as you can watch the streets outside (One morning a group of three year olds from the local kindergarten strolled passed  kawaii ! )The rooms at large by Japanese standards and have tatami and futon to sleep onWhile this does take a little getting used to I was so tired fromWalking all day I slept very soundly on the futonWe had our own toilet and shower in our topHowever, go up to the 4th floor as you can book the onsen ( hot tub) for a hours use freeOn a cold evening this is heaven Overall a very relaxing a quiet place to stay Like home.  Photos taken of local neighborhood March 2018
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Family of three taking a 5-night trip to Japan. We stayed with the Family Inn Saiko on our first two nights in Tokyo. Not taking a 5-rating lightly, the unbeatable staff made it well deserved. Booking and web site were full of great information, especially for a first-time visitor to Japan. Location was quaint and although a bit of a walk to the nearest two stations (both not JR), a taxi was only 1000 yen tops from the IKEBUKURO station. The facilities themselves are very simple but clean and comfortable. What makes the Family Inn shine are the staff. Extremely warm greeting by english-speaking staff, they understand that many wary travelers are visiting for the first time and suffering not only from exhaustion but a healthy dose of culture shock. Check-in and explanation of the facilities were prompt and clear. When requesting a place for a "quick bite to eat", we were not only given a terrific recommendation but he actually walked us to the little restaurant. A quaint little spot named Kamameshi Ran, we had an terrific meal in an intimate setting with full translation provided by our host before he returned to the hotel. It put us at ease in a daunting cultural shift and will be one of our most lasting memories of the visit to Japan. For the next two days, all our questions were expertly answered, and many great recommendations provided. Breakfast is a very simple toast with tea and coffee but a great start to the day. Comfortable accommodations, good location, stellar value, and most notably remarkable staff make this hotel and great place to stay. We will be back!
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Cozy family-run inn using traditional Japanese bedding. Quiet neighborhood location with 15-minute walk to dual-line metro station. Friendly hosts who can help you with tour and travel ideas. Hot tub access was refreshing!
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The title is the best definition of my great experience staying here and i will choose this place again for sure if i visit Tokyo next time - Friendly staffs and willing to support you everything, just one station from the main subway station (Ikebukuro).
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely little boutique hotel, no frills but very clean and neat with helpful staff and owner who can’t do enough for you. Highly recommend as a base to explore Tokyo from, not the centre of Tokyo tourism which is a distinct advantage as the neighbourhood is very very unspoiled by us tourists.
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a wonderful six-nights stay. This was our first trip to Tokyo and Family Inn Saiko was a very good choice for us. The staff and owner were friendly and were always ready to make sightseeing suggestions. We were able to relax and had a good night sleep after our busy day of sight seeing. The Inn is about 10 minutes walk from the nearest train station so it was fun to walk through the neighborhood to get to the train station. I will highly recommend this place.
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Although inn is far away from station, it - Reasonable Price, Fantastic room quality!!! and very kind host!!I absolutely recommend this Inn. I will assured stay this hotel when i next visit in Tokyo.
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for 6 nights in mid January 2018. The staff is really helpful and pleasant. The room had the facilities I needed, good sound isolation and clean. The area is calm and in walking distance to most places. If you like walking a bit instead of the trains. Otherwise the nearest train station - Kanamecho (F8/Y8) is 1 km. from here and is run by Tokyo Metrostation. Only 1.5 km to Ikebukuro Station from Kanamecho Station. Easily recommendable to others who want to in a "local" area.
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a great time here. This is actually a nice place to experience the japanese culture. Far better than staying in posh hotel rooms where all the beds look the same. Here you are able to live like a real japanese house and experience their culture. A lot of jap food is available outside. Definitely coming back
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is in a quiet suburban neighborhood. I requires a 10-15 minute walk to get to one of two nearby metro/subway stations (Kamacheo or Shiinamachi). Both stations are one stop away from Ikebukuro Station which is a major metro/subway/JR station with multiple connecting lines and a large shopping center and district. Shiinamachi Station is nearby a number of local restaurants, shops and grocery stores. The train to/from Narita will get you to Ikebukuro Station either directly or with one train change. Ikebukuro's JR Station also connects directly to most other local/regional destinations. If you take the train to Ikebukuro and have a lot of luggage, take a taxi (about $9) from the taxi rank on the west side of the station. The hotel web site provides all the information you need including a local map and instructions on how to get to the hotel via taxi or train+walking. The hotel includes 13 rooms on two stories (there is an elevator). All rooms have tatami mats rather than beds (and if you find the mats to be hard to sleep on, consult with the staff). You do not wear shoes in the room. There are no chairs in the room -- more reason to get out and about; however there are a couple of tables with benches in the breakfast area. The bathroom is large with a fully outfitted toilet/bidet with heated seat. The shower is also large with great water pressure and lots of hot water.The breakfast is simple, but gets the job done. There is a toaster, thick fresh white bread with jams and peanut butter, tea, coffee and hot water. There is a refrigerator just off the main lobby where you can store whatever you want (for example, we bought fruit plates from the local supermarket to supplement breakfast and kept them in the fridge). The staff is really friendly and helpful (regarding the hotel itself and travel suggestions). We were especially lucky to have the owner, Masa, as our staff person. This was because we stayed over the New Year's period when most locals are on holidays (note that the Imperial Palace and many museums are closed from Dec. 29/30 to Jan. 3/4), including the front desk and cleaning staff at Family Inn Saiko. On New Year's Day, Masa's mother and wife prepared a traditional Japanese breakfast plus gave each of us a couple of small gifts. We really enjoyed this personal, local, cultural experience.
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at Family Inn Saiko for 3 days in December and was extremely happy with my choice. The Inn is located in a quiet neighbourhood in Toshima with reasonable access to Seibu lines and Tokyo Metro. The room was very clean and was moderately sized for Tokyo. However, it must be emphasized that the quick and courteous service and fantastic value for money are the most attractive factors. Furthermore, it was easy to chat with Mr. Masa and the other staff members in English. They are more than capable of giving you an idea of what is around the neighbourhood and providing you with suggestions on what to do.All in all, I would definitely recommend Family Inn Saiko to anyone looking to travel to Tokyo.
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I recently stayed at Family Inn Saiko for 5 nights, the staff were absolutely brilliant from the time I showed up 2hrs early for check in, up until I came back hours after checking out to collect my suitcase.Very clean, traditional rooms, clean facilities and extremely helpful staff, will definitely be staying here again next time I'm in Tokyo.
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A great time... again! Just like the previous times I visited Tokyo I did choose Family Inn Saiko again this November. And just like the times before it is still my first choice. Very friendly staff who always gives you an advice. Be it todays weather forecast, train connections to your daily destinations around Tokyo or even a reservation in a non English speaking Japanese restaurant. The team is really helpful. I also like the "just the right size" rooms which are clean and very quiet. Some guest mentioned the location to be an issue. Yes, it is something to be considered. It is not a place where you step out the door and be in Shibuya nightlife... But if you want to calm down and relax during the night after spending the day in buzzing Tokyo this place should be in your consideration. You can´t beat getting of the train in the evening, have a nice dinner in one of the areal restaurants and slowly take a short walk "home" to Family Inn Saiko.
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at Family Inn for four nights in November, 2017 and would not hesitate to recommend this Inn to others. The room was a good size (small by Western standards but not dissimilar to other rooms I stayed in in Japan), well laid out, and very clean! The staff were all very welcoming, spoke good English, and were very helpful. While it is not located centrally transport in to central Tokyo is very straight forward and doesn't take long. I would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This October, my brothers and I stayed in a triple at the Family Inn Saiko, and it was a fun and memorable experience! We were interested to try a Japanese-style hotel, but were traveling on a bit of a budget. Our stay at this hotel turned out to be the perfect fit - it was very affordable, and we really enjoyed the unique amenities of the hotel. The futons were very comfortable on the tatami floor, and the yukata were a lot of fun to try on. The hotel was also nicely located, about 10-15 minutes' walk from the nearest subway station. The neighboorhood always felt safe to us, even at night. The owner also spoke good English and seemed very personable - he always seemed interested in our travel plans and willing to give us pointers and suggestions. It was nice to know that there was someone we could ask cultural questions if something ever came up.A couple other points: + The hotel helped make our trip from the airport really convenient and simple. On their website, they provide a set of dual-language taxi instructions (part of the PDF travel kit) to get from the west entrance of Ikebukuro Station to the hotel. We were simply able to hail a cab in the taxi lane outside, and show the driver the sheet of instructions. The hotel even reimbursed us for the fare, which was very nice.+ We had planned a day trip to Kyoto, where we checked out Tuesday morning and checked back in Wednesday night. We were allowed to leave most of our luggage at the hotel while we were away, which made our trip much easier to manage.
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This quaint inn located in the neighborhood between Kanamechō and Shiinamachi was our most hospitable and unique accommodation yet. Navigating to the inn by foot brings you into a suburb of Tokyo complete with post office, a school, and other shops for a more culturally immersive experience. The inn provides tatami style complete with yukata included in the room. The facilities were clean and organized, bathrooms were spacious, and we very much appreciated the inclusion of laundry with drying racks to take into your room. Lastly, the staff were so helpful and knowledgeble in both navigating us through Tokyo's complex train lines to attractions, but also helped book the means to make it to our airport when it was time to leave. Family Inn Saiko and their staff truly deserve the high praise for the hard work they put into providing the utmost in Japanese hospitality for their guests. We hope to see them again on our next trip.
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff who work there are so nice and helpful and welcoming. They really made us feel at home! We stayed in a Japanese-style room (tatami mats and futons), and it was very comfortable and clean. The bathroom was much bigger than other places we stayed at in Japan which was a bonus. The location is also 10-15 min walk from two train stations so we found it convenient to travel around the city. I love that the hotel is outside of the main tourist area so we got to see places where the locals go. Travellers who do not like walking may dislike the 10-15 min walk to get to a station but we did not mind at all.
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is my second visit to the same ryokan. The staff who serves me is not as friendly as my previous visit. The mattress is too thin and I suggest the owner should upgrade or change a new one. I visited in the month of Oct 17; whereby, the raining season and it is quite cold. It is difficult to sleep on thin mattress on the floor. Despite of that, the room is clean and is located in very quiet place, where you can really rest and sleep.
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wonderful service, clean and nice room plus access to extra things like vending machine and washing mchine. The location was 10 minutes away from closest station so it is easy to travel more central, and the in is in a really nice quiet area.
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: With this being my first big trip to a foreign country, I did a a good amount of research in comparing places to stay while in Japan. And like many other individuals, I also found the price, area, and extremely positive reviews attractive. I was not disappointed.I spent 13 nights at the Family Inn Saiko, and it was an excellent experience, and a great addition to my immersion, so to speak, into the Japanese culture. The hotel staff were very nice, friendly, and helpful, and really made it feel like I was at home during my stay. If I had any questions about the area, a particular destination I had planned, or just general questions, they were always happy to assist and clarify.The tatami mats and futons my be a negative aspect for some travelers, but I personally found it quite enjoyable and comfortable, and was able to get plenty of rest during my trip.Access to other parts of Tokyo, and Japan as a whole, is a quick 10-15 walk away: Kanamecho for the Subway, and Shiinamachi for the train (depending on your preference and/or destination). If you want to be close to some of the major areas in and around Tokyo, but not necessarily smack in the middle of a heavily populated area, this is definitely a place to consider.The breakfast is self service and consists of: Toast, jelly (various), peanut butter, tea, and coffee.Summary: It's a great place to stay, the price is extremely fair, it is close to the action but not right in the middle of it, and if you have any questions never be afraid to ask one of the hotel staff. If you're looking for a "standard" hotel, keep in mind that the sleeping arrangements may be a little different that what you expect.
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice Japanese style rooms, very quiet at night (practically no motorised traffic).Clean and modern bathrooms. Kind and helpful staff makes you feel welcome.Next train station is less than 10 min. away on foot.
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked this place after reading positive feedback online and it totally holds up! Situated 10 mins walk from Kanamecho or Shinamacchi stations means that access to central Tokyo is only a short train away.The rooms are quaint and are fully air conditioned with amenities. It's the perfect place if you want a quiet nights sleep.The main highlight has got to be the friendly staff. They make you feel so welcome. I was sad when leaving. If I visit Tokyo again in the future I will be sure to stay here again!
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Family Saiko Inn is like living in a Japanese home. It is a easy 30 minutes walk to Ikebukuro station. Ikebukuro is 40 minutes train ride to Tokyo - it is big enough to the shops, departmental stores & have dinner after a busy day in Tokyo. Between Toshima & Ikebukuro has some good eating places. I would recommend this Inn especially if you are staying longer in Tokyo - you would save a lot on accomodation. The room is clean & quiet - it has everything you required. The staff are accomodating & helpful - even the locals in Toshima if you can lost
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was my first ryokan experience, and staying here was very pleasant! It is in a quiet neighborhood and is a nice place to relax after a day of exploring Tokyo.The rooms are immaculately clean and the tatami mats smell SO GOOD! Our room had a view of the shrine outside which we thought was very charming.My favorite part about my stay was the staff. Never have I felt more welcome or at home when staying somewhere away from home!! They truly go above and beyond to help you, and spent a lot of time helping us figure out how to get places, giving recommendations, and helping us learn Japanese. Our Japanese is pretty bad (and truth be told I was a little nervous about this before we came to Japan) but they are very friendly to foreigners and their English is very good.Masa-San and the rest of the Family Inn Saiko staff, we really appreciate all your help making our time in Tokyo an unforgettable and wonderful experience! どうもありがとうございます.
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really good ryokan experience here. We stayed in 4 different hotels in our 2 week trip. 2 western style and 2 ryokan. Really liked this one. It's small and in a residential area which gave it a really authentic Japanese vibe. You'll hardly see any other tourists when walking the clean safe streets here - a real plus point! We asked for an extra futon each which was done without fuss and made sleeping really comfortable. 10-15 min walk to 2 local subway stations which will take you anywhere in the city. The owner and his staff are really helpful, friendly and speak good English, although a few words of Japanese really raise an extra smile! They really want to help out with your plans for the day and to make helpful suggestions. Really can't do enough for you and make you feel really at home. On balance, probably the best value for money out of all 4 hotels we stayed with in. Not luxurious, but clean, comfortable and friendly. Everything you really need is here. Big thumbs up. Would come back tomorrow! Thanks to all the staff here.
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This must be my sixth or seventh time staying at the Family Inn over the course of five years and it remains as good as ever: spotlessly clean, quiet rooms, friendly and helpful service, truly a family style inn.
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect to relax after busy central Tokyo, the staff really make you feel at home and the rooms are a great experience with the tatami mat and yukata. Surrounding area has amazing food yakitori ramen gyoza etc! Thank you I'll be back
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This ryokan was one of the best places we stayed in when we stayed in Tokyo. It's in a residential district, but it took us no time at all to figure out how to get to the train stations by foot, and find all these wonderful local bakeries and eateries (for a lot less $$). The owner is awesome, super considerate and so helpful. There are laundry machines and a shared frig for use. The rooms were very clean and quiet. We loved it - we would absolutely stay here for our next trip to Tokyo.
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staying here is certainly a different experience to others in Tokyo, but a wonderful one. The location is in a residential district about 10 - 15 minutes walk to the closest station. The walk to the station was a peek into real Japanese lives and extremely interesting. If you're in a hurry then this is possibly not the place to stay, but if you can afford to relax a little and take your time in getting into the city center then this is a great option.The room is traditional and comfortable. In the room there were printed instructions clearly stating how to use everything in the room and hotel (something that's extremely useful for people like us unaccustomed to the Japanese way).The staff are extremely friendly and treated us just like family. We were given a tour when we arrived and how to use everything was explained to us. Staying here really felt like a home rather than a hotel.All in all a great experience.
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A little difficult to find at first, but this place is amazing. Based in a local residential area with easy access to the subway. Highly recommend checking out the hot tub as well.10/10 would visit again
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Inn is as described on their website. The staff are very helpful, including sending details on the inn and getting their prior to your visit.Breakfast is basic - just and tea/coffee.Guests have access to communal fridge, microwave and washing machine.Sleeping on the floor is quite comfortable. Very quiet neighbourhood means high sleep quality.Only issue I had is lack of chair in the room. I found sitting on the floor for hours hard as I imagine most westerners would. Perhaps a fold out chair or stool could be provided on request.About 10 minute easy walk from metro station.
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff are great and make it a point to get to know you. They were always interested in what you had planned for the day and asked about it when you returned. One time in particular - our group wanted to see a baseball game and they walked with us all the way to 7/11 to assist in buying tickets. The location was quiet and tucked away from the busyness of Tokyo but just one train stop away from Ikebukuro - very convenient. Will definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was a very pleasant inn to stay. The neighborhood was friendly and quiet at night, definitely good as we returned home late at night after our journey around Tokyo. The room was spacious and we were grateful for that as we had to pack our stuff filled bags.Overall, it was a great experience and hope we get to stay again there for our next visit in Japan.
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here last 2 nights of my vacation in Japan. Service was exceptional as they helped me with directions to the closest subway lines and any sites I wanted to see. Hotel was in a quiet part of a residential neighborhood. Rooms were decently sized with personal bathroom and a ryokan style setup.
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely place to stay! Very friendly and helpful staff! A real homely feel about the place. It's a bit out of town so you have to keep account for some travelling time. But Tokyo is so big that you always have travelling time wherever you go.
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very inconvenient. Room standard poor. Breakfast very poor - overall very disappointing. Not sure how it got such good reviews. Tiny space front where toast and instant coffee available. Futons on concrete floor - very uncomfortable. Overpriced for what is provided. Found much better places at a better price so do shop around.
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wonderful to experience a residential neighborhood in Tokyo. Loved the walk to the train station in the morning. The innkeeper was helpful and friendly and the room, with its soft tatami mat floor was a calm oasis. Slept beautifully on the traditional bed on the floor. I recommend this place as a soothing, family-like place to stay. And not expensive!
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for four days. Loved the traditional feel of my room! It's a couple minutes of a walk away from the train station, but it's only one stop away from Ikebukuro. I would definitely stay here again!
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located in a quiet neighborhood of houses two floors and narrow streets, the Family Inn Saiko is the ideal place to spend your time in Tokyo. The hotel is easily accessible through the JR line and station is located in a few minutes walk. staff is friendly and ready to meet the needs of its customers. to do absolutely the experience of the lesson origami, THE Japanese bathroom and test kimono with the grandmother. Super recommended. thanks to managers
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff here are really welcoming, friendly and very helpful. The location is nice as its away from the hustle and bustle of the city, and its easy to walk to the station and go to Ikebukuro. The room was nice and clean. I would stay here again :)
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is not our first time in the Hotel Family Inn Saiko because we stay there like at home. Nice, friendly and helpful people. You can enjoy japanese style room in a very quite neighbourhood just only a one station fron Ikebukuro one of the principal places of Tokyo.
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I would have never booked here as it is supposedly rated 2 star, but my son convinced me after he read the reviews and I am glad he did. The location was quiet, the staff was helpful and friendly and the Inn was impeccably clean. I put 3 on sleep quality baa it was bright too early in the morning. Bring a eye mask! I would recommend!
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for five nights. Masa and Hiroshi very helpful and attentive. It's really nice to stay just outside of the busy areas of Tokyo in a 'normal' Japanese suburb - relaxing after pounding the streets of Tokyo. No problem getting around on the the extensive metro network.Supermarkets, laundrettes, eateries near-by.Would definitely recommend if you want to experience something more than a generic western-style hotel.Breakfast however very underwhelming - white toast and instant coffee. Definitely need to supplement with items from the supermarket. This is a fun adventure in itself.Thanks for a good stay.
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staying at Family Inn Saiko was one of the best parts of my trip to Tokyo. There is no better way to get the true Japanese experience than by staying in a tatami mat room in a nice residential neighborhood a short train ride from central Tokyo.
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I are in our (very) late 50's, wanted to come to Tokyo but not do the typical generic tourist stuff. Everything about the Family Inn Saiko said Japan. The rooms were compact but comfortable, four nights in and I could easily do a dozen more. The Metro stations are a quick walk and we'd do them a couple of times a day (recommend CityMapper app) and we went all over - parks, museums, nightlife- it was amazing! We had yakatori right down the road, Japan was playing soccer on TV- what fun (they won!)!! Nothing like seeing folks who were there and waving days later. DON'T miss the tub upstairs (so relaxing!) and the Kimono experience was amazing!!!! We'd return here in a moment- thank you so very much for the wonderful experience!!!!
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were a little hesitant towards staying in the outskirts of the "action". But became really happy that we chose to do so. Tokyo is a mouthful, and for small town people like us, the tranquility of the neighbourhood and the Family Inn was a perfect match to the hustle and bustle of the busy areas. An informative "map" was received prior to our trip, so finding the place was easy. And the nice room and friendly staff made our stay a very nice one. Thanks! We hope to come back!
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I'm very happy in the trip! The hotel is very good and the people who in here are very kindly ^^The room is so clean , that make me so comfortable.If I go to Tokyo next time I will chose this hotel again !Thank you^^
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I absolutely fell in love with this little inn. I loved sleeping on tatami, I loved the staff's friendly sightseeing advice, I loved the free laundry and mini-kitchen facilities, and I even loved the walk from the nearest train station.I'd been worried that being a 10-minute walk from the nearest station would be a drain, but it turned out to be a nice experience. Shiinamachi station has a lovely selection of neighbourhood restaurants, bars and shops nearby, and staying here I felt like this was "my" authentic Tokyo neighbourhood.
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Friendly and helpful owners whose English is way better than my Japanese. Basic breakfast of toast and tea/coffee. The single room was perfect with an ensuite bigger than I expected in Japan. Futon was comfy and the doona soft and warm. Reasonably close to the local rail station and then it's only one stop to the JR.
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent three weeks in Japan, and we found that we had the best sleep at the Family Inn Saiko. The best thing is that you have your own air conditioning unit. We always get overheated at the other places, and the bedding is too warm, but here we could turn off the heating overnight and were able to sleep comfortably. This is for a winter stay.It is also great to have the option of getting a second bedroom.The walk from the station that we used was 15 minutes so factor that in, but the trains run regularly.
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great introduction to Tokyo. Lovely hosts who helped us arrange our days. Clean room with traditional bedding. Quiet neighbourhood not far from subway (15min) or main JR station (30min). Highly recommended and excellent value for money.
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Me and my friend stayed here a total of 5 awesome days! Very very lovely staff and helped us out with travel to our airport, everything in our room was flawless !! Just expect a 10 - 15 min walk there
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My first taste of Japan was with the Family Inn Saiko, and it didn't disappoint. The hospitality and generosity shown by the staff here made me feel more like a visiting family member than a guest. Information was clearly available on using the amenities, such serving yourself unlimited tea or coffee, and booking the private use of the bath upstairs (must do!).A basic breakfast is provided, which is quite adequate. A fridge and microwave is provided in the communal kitchen for other meals if you want. The walk to the accommodation from the station takes about 10-15 mins, but is so interesting with shops and the neighbourhood that it took me always a little longer. Transport to other places is very easy as it is only 1 station to Ikebukuro, a major hub.As a solo female traveller, I felt very safe. I would gladly stay at this basic, affordable and kindly ryokan again.
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The inn is run by personable hosts who will take care of you and your needs, offer travel and dining options, and are just lovely all around. It is homey and then rooms are spacious for the price. Conveniently located between two different train lines, each a short trip away from Ikebukuro station. I really enjoyed the fact that it was a more residential neighborhood. Yet filled with restaurants, unique shops, local storefronts, and more. I really felt it was a home away from home! Thank you for just a fantastic experience.
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was a great stay at Family Inn Saiko. The owners are really friendly and always willing to lend a helping hand to introduce where to go, food to eat and how to get to places. Love how cosy the feeling of the inn is. The room is simple and nice (though small, not surprising for any rooms in Tokyo).
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just returned from a 2 week family vacation to Japan(1st timers) & spent our 1st 5 nights there. Wanted to experience a traditional Ryokan before moving on to a 5 star type of accommodation. Have to admit it was as good if not better than the more " glitzy" hotels we stayed at. Reasons?1). After spending all day in the crowds of Tokyo it was a nice change of pace to walk through the streets of Shiinamachi & experience the quietness of the local neighborhood.2). The Inn is very clean. Rooms are quaint but we were not expecting the roominess of the Hotel Chinzanso where we stayed our last 3 nights and paid 3x's more. 3). The staff there is 2nd to none. Masa-San walked us to a local massage parlor to introduce us to the staff & set- up our appointments. Since we don't speak Japanese it proved to be most helpful. He also introduced us to the local Yakatori BBQ chicken vendor which we frequented quite often to get to know him personally.4). It's a 10 min walk to 2 local train stations that will connect you to the Ikebukuro train station that will get you to anywhere else in Tokyo.5). The area has many good restaurants without the waiting we experienced in the more popular parts of Tokyo.6). We rented a mobile wi-fi router for $5(U.S.)/day for navigational purposes from them & it was valuable.7). Every morning either Hiroshi-San or Masa-San would provide train times & directions to areas we wanted to visit that day & they had all the information there. It was a great time to enjoy they're free breakfast( although only toast, jam, peanut butter, tea & coffee it was sufficient for our needs).8). The hot bath upstairs on the 4th floor was free of charge and could be reserved for private use. The Onsen experience at the end of the day is heavenly.9). The would place the flags of the country where the guests are from staying that day & provided a great conversational piece during breakfast.10). They have a kitchen area where we used utensils when we brought back food to eat there. We filled up our water bottles with their water filtration device. Also used their microwave to nuke our food if it was cold.11). They have a washing machine with detergent to use free of charge but no dryer. If needed there's a laundromat about a 1 minute walk if a dryer was needed.12). They introduced us to a tour guide, Kumi Numata of Yorisow Tours who arranged tours of different parts of Tokyo for us. She was wonderful. Since it was our 1st time to Japan and we don't speak the language we were intimidated to learn the culture & history on our own. I highly recommend her.All in all I don't have any negative thing about this place & would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved staying in a quieter neighborhood in Tokyo, especially once we figured out that we could take the Seibu line train to a neighborhood stop rather than walk the 30 minutes from the Ikebukuro subway station. The neighborhood had many good restaurants, shops and a great bakery, and gave a less touristy view of Tokyo; few shopkeepers spoke English. The management was very friendly and helpful, and provided a thorough neighborhood map, restaurant recommendations, and access to laundry onsite. Our room was tight but manageable, We would definitely return!
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: service provided was excellent. host went out of way to arrange airport transfer and located shops that sold items we were interested in. The room is as pictured, basic, and provides what was advertised. Clean and pleasant stay. many thanks.
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I found this inn because I was looking for a Japanese-style inn near where my friends live. The staff are very friendly and the neighborhood is quiet and lovely. If you're looking for a low-key Japanese style inn (tatami mats, futons, Japanese-style bath), this is the place for you!
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent hospitality and very helpful family/host. Despite early arrival, our rooms were ready and provided for, which is a surprise in Japan. Very clean and comfortable environment, and neighborhood. Not to mention excellent value.
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed there with my husband and four other friends for about 4 nights. Family Inn is located in a very quaint neighbourhood and if you are interested in living 'like a local', do stay here. On many occasions, we walked to shiinamachi station's market to get fresh fruits and groceries. Also, I celebrated my birthday there and we shared the cake with the staff! It is a very homely place and you can access the kitchen for plates etc. The room is clean and nice; it is all laid out with tatami. So it was very Japanese indeed. There is a hot tub/public bath upstairs and you can reserve it between 3pm to 10pm.
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great experience. Helpful staff and great directions prior to arrival. Easy walk to conveniences. Staff there to help and provide suggestionsMade our us feel very comfortable during our stayWill stay there again
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great directions and advice prior to arrival. We were very welcomed, got every information we needed. Staff really askes for our interests and needs and lade everything to help us get ready to explore and understand a bit of culture, even patiently teaching some language and signs.Lovely clean room. Nice to get a feel for japanese life style with tatami mats. Many thoughtful details.Very nice area, close to Ikebukuro and circle line but nice and more quiet. For us, as first time visitors in Japan, very interesting to be in a regular living area. Many nice placed to visit within walking distance - university, temple, tea shop, ramen shop and nice café.Only (minor) drawback for us was the quite frugal breakfast (tea or instant coffee, toast bread with jam or peanut butter). A bit on the sweet side for us. However, every other wonderful thing about this place more than made up for that.
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Family Inn Saiko is a home away from home, I felt so comfortable staying there. The location is easily accessible with supermarkets, 24 hrs convenience store and restaurants around the neighbourhood which you don't have to worry about being hungry in the middle of the night. If you wish to experience what is it like living in Tokyo neighbourhood, Family Inn Saiko is the place you trust!
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The owner/manager is very nice and helps making the stay a very pleasant one. The location is interesting: 12 minutes walk from the (blessedly) small Kanamecho metro station, where you can take a direct metro to places like Shinjuku/Harajuku/Shibuya, as well as Ginza. In that sense it is actually very well located. I also liked living in such a quiet residential neighborhood after spending the day among the high-rises in more central Tokyo. It's like Yanaka, or better :-), albeit without Yanak's (somewhat touristy) shops. Although the breakfast is underwhelming (toast, jam, tea), the author tries to make your stay pleasant and convenient in different kinds of ways. The room was very clean. The wifi worked very well. I would be very happy to stay at this property in the future.
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spent three nights in Family Inn Saiko in late October 2016, incidentally my introduction to Japan. A fantastic choice. Knowing very little about the layout (and nothing about the feel) of Tokyo prior to arriving, I was initially a little concerned about the location, i.e., whether it would be too far out of the centre of town and/or difficult to find. It turns out that the location is excellent for a couple of reasons: (1) the Shiinamachi area has its own charm and provides a unique experience of Tokyo, something you won't find in the more touristed areas of Tokyo, and (2) it's only one stop from Ikebukuro station, which easily connects you to the rest of Tokyo (and is on the JR Yamanote line). The location map provided by the Inn is detailed and helpful.As for everything else, absolutely wonderful: friendly and helpful staff, an onsite bath, and a clean, comfortable, quiet room. The vibe of the Inn is of a home away from home.So whether you've stayed in Tokyo before, or are new to it like I was, I would highly recommend making your experience a unique and enjoyable one by staying at the Family Inn Saiko.
hotelName:
27    Family Inn Saiko
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It’s was my first time staying at hostel, like my old college days. Plus first time in Tokyo. At first I was turned off and was not looking forward to my stay. But after the first night I was sold on this place. The bed was great and at night it was relatively quiet. The bathroom and shower were extremely clean along with the dorms. The staff were great and went the extra mile for its guests. The bar was very nice with great selection of drinks. They provided free shampoo and soap in the shower. Plenty of extra towels available too. Great place to stay at a great price. Plus close to major attractions in Tokyo and the subway. I will definitely stay again. Please check out the jazz bar around the block!!! First rate! Thanks again and your beautiful city!!! See you soon. Mark
hotelName:
28    Bunka Hostel Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spent 2 weeks in Japan in a number of hostels and had fantastic experiences throughout - This one was an exception It was so awful that I checked out after one night even though I had paid for five. That is saying something... Now this hostel has great potential but it's managed in an absolutely awful way. Dorms are massive and there's no policy about being quiet i.e. I got absolutely no sleep. The pillow was super hard, the beds are made of super thin plywood so there is zero sound-proofing. People come and go without any respect whatsoever. There's a no eat/drinks rule but noone seemed to really care - people were eating, drinking etc. There's a tiny communal kitchen which for the size of the hostel is a joke. Bathrooms are in reasonable condition but they aren't cleaned much so when I went to shower there was hair everywhere, water splattered everywhere, bins looked as if they hadn't been emptied in days - It was nasty. People were even clipping their nails on the dorm floor.... . To top this off, when I checked out within less than 12 hours of check-in noone seemed to care. No friendly smile, no asking as to the reasons - Clearly they're used to this. Avoid!!
hotelName:
28    Bunka Hostel Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a really great stay here. Hostel very clean and cosy and an amazing staff. The beds are clean, common bathrooms as well. Never had any problem to fell asleep, it's relatively quiet. The breakfast is quiet good. The best thing about Bunka is its location in the center of Asakusa and near subway stations. I recommand it for sure.
hotelName:
28    Bunka Hostel Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean, near to train (Asakusa), sensoji tample and 24 hours shopping mall, the domitory is quite, bathroom was so clean and the staff are so friendly. Will come again when I visit Tokyo. The replace towel everyday and put at our bed. The smell of the entire building was good.
hotelName:
28    Bunka Hostel Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: we booked 3 rooms for 2 nights. The reservation explicitly contains 3 rooms without shade (with bedroom 1: occupants ...., bedroom 2: occupants .... n and bedroom 3: occupants ....). However, on arrival we were made to sleep in a dormitory. Worse, we were charged 6 places while we were only 5 people! never seen ...$Otherwise, the area is very funny and the hostel is clean.
hotelName:
28    Bunka Hostel Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My friend and I stayed in an 8-bed room for two nights. We got to Toyko very early in the morning after an overnight flight from Bangkok and needless to say we were exhausted. Check-in wasn't until later in the afternoon but for an extra fee, we were able to get into our room early and get some sleep. The "pods" were rather interesting instead of the usual bunk beds, and I was comfortable. The curtains are a necessity because the lights in the room automatically dim at midnight but they never fully turn off. There wasn't much of a social atmosphere to speak of. Location-wise, the hostel is fairly close to the stop for the high-speed rail line to Narita Airport. It would be a 20-30 minute walk from the hostel or you can take the metro train from a station closer to the hostel.
hotelName:
28    Bunka Hostel Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was our first time in Tokyo and this place is absolutely perfect for traveler. Great location, great staff, very clean sleeping space and toilet.Walking distance to Kaminarimon gate, Sensoji temple and train stations. Around the hostel there are so many restaurants and shopping mall also in walking distance.Next time I will again stay at this place
hotelName:
28    Bunka Hostel Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I feel good since I enter the hotel, the girl staff speak fluently English, give me a warm welcome by explain everything about the hotel and around area. A dorm is well organize and clean. I like the temperature control in the dorm. With a comfy mattress i have a good sleep. When I check out a friendly staff guy keep my luggage and give a good advice to go to many place i want. If they have a lock for luggage in the dorm, I will give them 5 stars.
hotelName:
28    Bunka Hostel Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very trendy place with an excellent location (five minute walk from two JR stations) and close to Sensō-ji. Very friendly staff and reasonably clean facilities. I found the mixed dorms to be uncomfortably stuffy at night. Some form of air conditioning would’ve been great. Pretty awesome otherwise!
hotelName:
28    Bunka Hostel Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I chose Bunka Hostel because of the suggestion by Booking.com, and it was a good suggestion indeed!Bunka Hostel is strategically located near Tsukuba Express, Ginza Line, and Asakusa Line. From Narita airport, one can take the train directly to Asakusa, and take a long walk, passing by Kaminarimon Gate and shopping streets.Bunka Hostel is also near Don Quijote where you can buy stuff. A cheap bento shop is also near Don Quijote, which is recommended by one of the staff.Asakusa area has lots of places to eat and shop.I'm satisfied with the hostel staff; just the choice of words was a problem. The one who did my payment said "I don't care" instead of "It's up to you [whether you pay in cash or card]" or a better phrase. Take note that not all staff are good in directions, so it's better to ask Google Maps beforehand. Overall, the staff are fun to interact with, especially the one at the night shift to early morning.I even requested the staff to make a reservation for a café in Ōme, a city located at the far end of Tokyo prefecture, and it went out well.The bunk beds are ok; you can have them replaced if you want to. Bathrooms are great, especially the high tech bidet which is famous in many parts of Japan. Shower is great; you can even have a very hot shower, especially that I visited last autumn (November 2017).I will stay at Bunka Hostel if ever I want to visit Tokyo again!
hotelName:
28    Bunka Hostel Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Pros:- proximity from the subway station- proximity to the main sites in Asakusa - on a street with many restaurants - clean- new - privacy curtain for each bunk bed capsuleCons:- no public space to relax in. The dorms have only beds and no space. The common area on the 7th floor is a small table that seats 8. For a hostel with so many beds this is very small. No atmosphere. - almost non-existent kitchen. The said common area has a fridge, a microwave, a kettle and some utensils and plates. No stoves for cooking. - the rails of the ladder going up to the top bunk is a steel and circular - uncomfortable to step on- the room is noisy (shared amongst 30+ people)- bad ventilation (cannot open window), and stuffy - the cubicle (bed) is very bare- unfinished plywood nailed together. Feels very sterile.I think as a place to only sleep for a night it does the job, but as there is no space to relax in (except in your own bed capsule) or cook (unless you order a drink or food at the cafe on the first floor), I would prefer staying elsewhere next time.
hotelName:
28    Bunka Hostel Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Bunka hostel is a super cool hostel right in the heart of Asakusa. The thing that I loved about this place was the size of the dorm 'capsule' beds. Basically you get a little private room thats dark and quiet, which is essential if you're jet lagged. It's definitely an upgrade from your standard hostel dorm room. The bathrooms were super clean and there were even washer/dryers there. The food downstairs is not the best, but breakfast is cheap and there's tons of other food around within walking distance. I'd definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
28    Bunka Hostel Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Popped in late for some food,did'nt realise it was a hostel,but what great service and food. Very large beers went down well and waitress helped with English translation. Food was superb,Beef stew and a Pork noodle dish. Tried saki after,and again helped us out which one to go for. Great value,great service and great food!.
hotelName:
28    Bunka Hostel Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The place itself is very upscale and modern, makes you stay in the hostel for the rest of the day. Location is the best part of the hostel, shops and restaurants are just walking distance, even a 24hr mcdonalds is just beside and 24hr grocery is just a few meters away. Train station is just 7 mins away. Staff are very helpful, We arrived earlier than check in time but they did allow us to use the shower and bathroom to freshen up. This place is great!!!I hope they can put a full length mirror inside the bathroom, The shower rooms can use a little more cleaning. Curtains for me should be in a different cloth type, the air from AC doesn't go through when you close the curtain.But overall the place was almost perfect!
hotelName:
28    Bunka Hostel Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was so easy to find Bunka Hostel. I love it at the first sight. It closes with many attractions around the neighborhood. If you are craving with fast food, there is McDonald right across the hostel. The staffs were nice. I love how they designed the hostel. I stayed in female dormitory, which was located on one floor. There are many bunk beds designed nicely in one floor, each has privacy curtain, plugs and light. The bathrooms are still in the same floor separated by different doors, with the shower rooms and toilets. There is a common room where you can enjoy reading and eating your own food. Nicely arranged. Well done guys.
hotelName:
28    Bunka Hostel Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Almost perfect. I stayed for one night only and mostly my experience is 100% positive. It's a new hostel, in a one of the strategist hostel location i've ever stayed before. Distance to station is only a 5 minutes, across the hostel, there's mcdonald and 24 hours cheap place to eat. 24 hours reception (gosh, i hope most hostel copy Bunka hostel's, it's very helpful if i arrived in tokyo late night ) and the reception staffs are amazing, they speak english very well, and really helpful to many of my questions.Staffs are friendly, sometimes they started a conversation, so it does'nt feel very formal and boring. Rooms Room is clean and nice, bed is comfortable and big enough, i loved the configuration of the bed, so when i climbed to my upper bed, i shouldn't see bottom bed because it's not like usual capsule configuration. 1. Good configuration2. Bed is nice and comfortable3. size of the capsule is big enough4. toilets and shower rooms are clean.5. laundry facilities is great and convinient cons: 1. I wish there're more bigger locker where i can store my bag (my daypack bag can't even fit into the locker) not to mention my small baggage. So i need to take out my laptop and other valuable to be stored. So a disappointment with the size of the locker.2. Since the locker can't fit daypack, so baggage was out of question. The corridor of the capsule was filled with baggage and suitcase, some even in scattered condition, making it kinda messy. Other facilites such as common room in 7th floor, kinda small and packed with people when i went there, so mostly i sticked around in the first floor to enjoy watching people passing by the street. Bar and restaurant was a great experience, it has a nice interior design ( one of the reason i stayed here, because i'm an architect, i stayed here to feel the ambience and the interior) The restaurant has different type of schedule, there're lunch time and dinner time, so better to read carefully before entering. The prices in the restaurant, i should say, it's higher than usual restaurant you'd encounter even in touristic area. but it's okay for me after i've tried the food, the price came with great quality. The food was awesome, i mean, well, good food surely come with price. But don't worry, some ocassion, there're some event or some promotion, when i stayed there, there're happy hour deals, so beers got discounted from 600 yen to 400 yen only from 5pm to 8pm. The beer is great, ice coffee also great to fill the time in the restaurant. The curry karage was one of the dishes i've tasted, pricey, but surely delicious, recommended. top notch by the chef. Staffs is amazing, the dedication to open reception 24 hours is a big plus of Bunka hostel. unfortunately, when i came, there're no schedules tour event or near event created by bunka hostel, so my experience in the hostel was purely only the room experience, staffs and the restaurant
hotelName:
28    Bunka Hostel Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Ate here, didn't stay here but fantastic food, amazing choice of sake and really friendly and chilled staff and atmosphere. We ended up eating here twice in the week it was that good. Great location and decor.
hotelName:
28    Bunka Hostel Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed two nights at Bunka Hostel at the end of our trip to Japan. We really enjoyed our time, the dorms are spacious, modern and clean. Even though the dorms are huge, it's quite enough to sleep and you have a fair bit of privacy with the curtains, which is nice. The beds are comfy and quite big. The restaurant downstairs serves good coffee. Bathrooms are modern and spacious as well, it would only be nice if the showers would be cleaned more frequently - however it was still clean most of the times, but after "shower-rushhour" you could tell that a lot of people were sharing the showers. The location ist great with a few metros and sights in walking distance and heaps of restaurant options around. Staff was super helpful and welcoming too. Would definitely recommend.
hotelName:
28    Bunka Hostel Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Arrived yesterday in japan. First night i slept in Bunka hostel in Asakura Tokyo.its located in a Nice neighborhood with lots of nice little shops and very close to the senso-ji temple which is worth visiting.I slept in a mixed dorm room which was pleasant because you get your own little wooden cabin just big enough for one bed. sanitary provisions were all okay and clean, I was impressed by the toilets here because they look very futuristic.Friendly staff! And free mint water down at the reception!
hotelName:
28    Bunka Hostel Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My cousin and I stayed at BUNKA Hostel for three nights in early July 2017. We booked two beds in the 32-bed female dorm, which cost about $216 USD total.Cons: A little tricky to find, not great for meeting other travelers, bunk design was neat but had some flaws (light from the bunk above/below yours shone through around the mattress edges).Pros: Great location, quiet dorms (a miracle when you consider their size), small lockers for your valuables, free towels replaced daily, good natural light in bathrooms, neat views of the surrounding streets, and did I mention GREAT location?Verdict: I'd definitely stay here again. The Asakusa location is wonderful - near loads of restaurants, shopping, sightseeing, and transportation. The hostel itself was bright, clean, and quiet.
hotelName:
28    Bunka Hostel Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Slept here for three nights during our stay in Tokyo. A popular hostel so one of us got a cube in the floor above (we were three), but cubes are just for sleeping anyways. The cubes are neat with fresh towels and cleaning every morning. Thin walls but that was expected. Clean toilets and showers with shampoo, slippers etc included. Chargers and other things available for rent. Staff was very helpful and we could store our luggage after checkout and print some papers for free. Also a nice locaion with shops and restaurants just outside. Lockers also included. . All in all highly recommended for a short stay!
hotelName:
28    Bunka Hostel Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Super nice and clean hostel. You have your own little sleeping cube with curtains. Free wifi. Friendly staff. Great location. 5 min walk to subway. Free water downstairs. Free shampoo and soap. 200 yen to machine wash clothes. Highly recommended.
hotelName:
28    Bunka Hostel Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The dorms are massive and you can hear everything through the paperthin walls of your cubical. Sleeping was impossible. Staff was not very organized and helpful. Bathrooms were clean. Definitly would not recommand staying here. There are a lot of better budget options in Tokyo.
hotelName:
28    Bunka Hostel Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location here is great where you can find food surrounding area which i would say quite cheap if compare to other are of Tokyo.The mix dormitory was okay, if you are light sleeper you might be woken up by some snoring guest or some guest accessing their lockers. toilets showers are alright.
hotelName:
28    Bunka Hostel Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This my first experience to having hostel on my journey in Tokyo,I thought it's gonna upside down!!but WRONG..everything run smooth,no hassle no drama just STAY. Helpful staff with very fine English especially AYUMI thanks for noticing ONE PIECE logo in my passport honestly I'm impress.meeting other traveler,have nice street food, good location near by sensoji temple,Tokyo Skytree ,very unique location,simple dormitory with spotless condition recommended to every traveler around the globe.seriously rejoice your senses guarantee!!!Domo arrigatou Chris Bellamy
hotelName:
28    Bunka Hostel Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had stayed at Bunka Hostel for 2days.There are so many foreigners at hotel and we enjoyed to chat a lot to exchange the information in Asakusa and Tokyo.They have free Wi-Fi and in front of the hostel, there is a McDonald's!The price is around 3,000 JPY!浅草で遊んでいたら夜遅くなったので、このホステルに泊まる事にしました。外国人の人が多く、夜にはロビーのフリースペースで皆で観光情報の交換をしたり、とっても楽しかった！！目の前にマックがあって、それが外国人の人たちは嬉しいみたいww
hotelName:
28    Bunka Hostel Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here in March 2017 for 4 days, transiting in Tokyo before I continue my trip to Hokkaido. Located near to Asakusa sta. which provide easy access to both Haneda and Narita airport. Great resting place if you fly in through Narita and going on local tour by Haneda airport. A lot of shopping and eating places around the area.The bed and room are clean and pretty convenient within the limited space provided.
hotelName:
28    Bunka Hostel Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Bunka Hostel is absolutely brilliant. I stayed as the first location on a backpacking trip and it was fantastic from start to finish. The pods are roomy and much better than normal hostels. The hostel is immaculate. They give you clean towels daily which is a plus as a backpacker. The location is great with just a short walk to Asakusa station and lots of nice restaurants and drinking bars right in your doorstep. Cheap and perfect for a place to stay in Tokyo which can otherwise be pricey!
hotelName:
28    Bunka Hostel Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at Bunka Hostel Tokyo for 6 nights in winter 2016. The bunk bed was comfortable and with the curtain, I felt I had my private space. The room was warm enough and everyone was generally quiet and considerate. The room, toilets and showers were clean and new (but I stayed there when the hostel was newly open, so I'm not sure of the condition of the place now). The location was really good - close to Asakusa attractions, Don Quijote, restaurants and different subway stations.Have booked this hostel again for my upcoming trip so hopefully my review will still be positive.
hotelName:
28    Bunka Hostel Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My friend and I stayed in the female-only dorm, and it was very clean and quiet. The capsules were spacious and had charging ports inside for convenience. The first floor has a lovely open area, and staff are very helpful and friendly. If you go up to the common kitchen/lounge, there is a small balcony that has an excellent view of the Tokyo Skytree (which is particularly beautiful at night).The hostel is very close to Kaminarimon and Senso-ji temple, and many of the small streets nearby have little shops that are fun to browse. it's 5-10 minutes' walk from two subway stations so there is easy access to the rest of the city.Absolutely would stay here again
hotelName:
28    Bunka Hostel Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Bunka is a modern, clean and friendly hostel. Loved my stay here, it´s kind of far away from every main attraction in Tokyo, but not terrible. Do not recommend it to those that want to meet people. Just one common space wasn´t desiged for that.
hotelName:
28    Bunka Hostel Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Capsule: 318 I've stayed at many hostels around the world and this was the cleanest and most well presented hostel i've ever stayed in! This was the first time i've ever stayed in a capsule and it was just the perfect size and place to lay my head down after a day exploring. Towels, locker (with lock!), soap and shampoo provided so you don't need to bring anything! Very impressed.Also not to mention the location!!! Right next to Sensoji temple in Asakusa within 3mins walking from the hostel and countless eateries left and right as you walk out of the hostel. Absolutely perfect.Will definitely stay there again no hesitation at all. Thank you team!
hotelName:
28    Bunka Hostel Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I loved this place! It was in a fantastic location - just 5-10 minutes from Asakusa Station (actually pretty easy to find - in a covered shopping centre, right by a McDonalds!) which is well connected, and it was a great part of the city to be in. The whole place was spotlessly clean, with plenty of (hot, powerful) showers and sinks. Hairdryers and toiletries were provided, and a new towel was left on the bed each day which is unusual for a hostel! Beds were really comfortable, with plug sockets and a light in each bunk, and a privacy curtain. Everyone had a small locker for valuables, and there was enough room to keep larger cases to the side of the beds (not locked away though). Wifi never cut out, and staff were all really nice.Only thing that might be a problem for some is that it isn't a very sociable hostel - there isn't a lounge as such (only a small kitchen upstairs), and the eating area downstairs is a bar/restaurant in the evening so you can't really just hang out there.
hotelName:
28    Bunka Hostel Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object
