review_body: 今月利用しました。最寄りの駅から比較的近く利便性がよく近くにコンビニもありました。ベット環境はまあまあですが、水回りの髪の毛がかなり散乱、シャワールームも汚れが溜まっていて衛生的ではないです。一番ショックだったのは7階のフリースペースにある冷蔵庫に入れていた食べ物が翌朝全てなくなっていた事です。ルールとして自分の物には部屋番号と名前を書いて貼っておきましたがなくなりました！共有という事ではありますがこれまでいくつかのホステルに泊まりましたが、こんな事は未だかつてなかったです。はっきり言って飲食物だって決して安いものではないです。手間と時間を一気に奪われた感覚になりました。ドミトリーはこうであると思わされたのと、スタッフの対応もよくなかったのでこうした盗難があった施設はもう利用しません。I used this month.It was relatively convenient from the nearest station and there was convenience store near by, too. The bed environment is not so bad, but the hair around the water is considerably scattered, the shower room is dirty and it is not sanitary.The most shocking thing is that the food that I had in the refrigerator in the free space on the 7th floor was all morning morning. I put a room number and name on my stuff as a rule and pasted it, but it disappeared.Although it is sharing, I have stayed at several hostels so far, but this has never happened yet.Clearly, food and drinks are never cheap. It became a sense that I was taken time and effort at once.Because the dormitory was thought to be this and the correspondence of the staff was not goodWe will not use the facility where such theft occurred.
hotelName:
28    Bunka Hostel Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I can't give this hostel enough praise. Friendly staff, Really well designed facilities, cozy beds in the dorms with curtains that made them feel like your own personal room, clean bathrooms, nice common area and all at reasonable prices!
hotelName:
28    Bunka Hostel Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 3 nights at the start of our trip and 2 nights on the way out. Staff were friendly, rooms, bunks and bathrooms were so clean, location was awesome. Had an amazing stay (besides people zipping and unzipping their sutcases 4000 times but thats not the hotels fault). Will definitely stay here again when next in Tokyo! Thank you Bunka it was great
hotelName:
28    Bunka Hostel Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location is great, staff friendly and helpful. Common room kitchen was tiny and hardly any cutlery and crockery.I was booked to stay 4 nights but I didn't realise that the mixed dorms were so big. There were more than 20 people in the dorm so I kept getting woken up during the night. People tried to be quiet but sound carries through the plywood/metal bunks. I ended up staying my last 2 nights at another hostel around the corner which only had 4 bunks to a room
hotelName:
28    Bunka Hostel Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Friendly staff and secure floors. Bed boxes are comfortable and private. Was able to meet some nice people in the small common kitchen on the top floor. Located in a nice spot close to attractions and metro stations.
hotelName:
28    Bunka Hostel Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hostel is amazing. They have friendly staff that are polite and always ready to help. It is a great location close to the station and is close to the famous Sensō-ji. When I come back to Tokyo, this is definitely on my list of spots to stay.
hotelName:
28    Bunka Hostel Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really friendly staff always up for helping you out, great location and close to transport - the most aesthetically pleasing hostel around! We stayed in the mixed dormitory, was fine but definitely worth bringing some ear plugs! For the price it is perfect and can add breakfast for only 350 yen each morning - 100% would stay again.
hotelName:
28    Bunka Hostel Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Simple but well executed concept. Not quite a shell hotel but with the privacy these ones gave. The staff is polite and friendly. And the location! Ideal! Right in the center of Asakusa, few minutes (seconds even) walk from restaurants and shops. The sensoji temple is just 10 mintues walking.
hotelName:
28    Bunka Hostel Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: So good to find this excellent hostel, clean, efficient check in service, good English spoken and staff always helpful. Great facilities for eating in their own restaurant or for self catering. Set in a shopping arcade and easy access to all local sights and supermarket. A couple of points to note: Check in is at 4pm which is difficult if you have arrived after a 12 hour flight and have to wait around to use your room. Room 701 is next to the self catering kitchen, so can be noisy with thoughtless guests. However the view from this family room was lovely. Laundry and cleaning take place in the early hours of the morning, hmmmm!
hotelName:
28    Bunka Hostel Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spent 4 days at Bunka and it was a perfect stay. The location is very convenient, 5-minute walk from subway and the most important temple in Asakusa. The area also is full of restaurants and shopping which makes the location even more convenient. The pods are spacious and mattress and very comfortable. Just some minor negatives point: 1. there was no USB plus on the pods. Foods for thoughts for a future improvement. 2. there was only one shower in my floor. It was not a big deal, but if everyone is leaving at the same time could boring waiting to have shower. Apart from that, perfect stay. Definitely recommend!
hotelName:
28    Bunka Hostel Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As you've probably seen on the Internet, this place has excellent reviews. And I can definitely recommend it if you're looking for a hostel with top notch quality for not that much money.The hostel is Asakusa, which is a nice area on its own. It's close to the famous Senso-Ji temple which you can't miss if you hop out the metro. Asakusa is a bit further out from places like Shinjuku, Shibuya or Harajuku (30min metro). In my opinion it doesn't really matter because public transport within Tokyo is excellent. The hostel itself has friendly staff. The lounge / bar area is nice to hang around in the evenings and they even provide a cheap western breakfast in the mornings. I had a mixed dormitory. There are about 24 bunks on each dormitory, which is quite a lot. You have your own private space which is nice. You have a locker and a free towel each day provided. The bathrooms are brand new and clean. I picked this place for two nights. I stayed my first nights in the western part of the city in Shinjuku and the other nights here. I liked the difference and was able to split up different activities this way.This place is an easy pick if you're looking to save some yen during your stay in Japan. As you've noticed hotels aren't cheap. I really liked the place, but keep in mind that you don't have that much privacy. With 24 people on one room you might be awakened early or in the middle of the night. Once more, excellent place and great staff. Would recommend. (Tip: go to restaurant Gin-Shachi close by, great place and food where you sit near the grill)
hotelName:
28    Bunka Hostel Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I absolutely loved Bunka Hostel in Tokyo. I stayed for a few nights and can't say enough good things about my experience. The staff was kind, the rooms and bathrooms were spotless and the location was very convenient and a quick walk to two main train stations including the Asakusa station (did I mention it's also super close to the sensoji temple as well? - about a 6 min walk). I also enjoyed shopping nearby in the Asakusa shopping areas - I found a great store with vintage kimonos that were absolutely beautiful, floor length and gorgeous for $10 each! Thank you Bunka Hostel for a great stay!
hotelName:
28    Bunka Hostel Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I've stayed here a few times and like this hostel very much. I always find it clean and quiet. The ground floor has a sake bar which also offers authentic Japanese food. The dormitories are larger than the average hostel, but they have lockers to put valuables in which is rare for a hostel. They have a family room if you are visiting Japan with children.
hotelName:
28    Bunka Hostel Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located in the Asakusa Area, its' just a couple of blocks from the Sensoji Temple & Nakamise Market. The hotel is located near a lot of restaurants and stores. There is a 24 hr Don Quixote just 2-3 blocks from the hotel. The hotel had nice and clean rooms. They had clean beds and a good size locker. Sheets and towels were changed daily if you wanted. They have a keycard to ensure only assigned guests are able to enter your room. They have good size washers and dryers. We were able to book an entire room on one of the floors because of how big our group was. Staff were very accommodating and friendly. I like how open and inviting their lobby and restaurant was. Their kitchen area on the top floor was small though compared to other hostels i've stayed at. It had a microwave, refrigerator, sink, and minimal equipment. You'll have to label your drinks and food when leaving stuff in the refrigerator. One of my favourite parts of the hostel is their balcony where you can see the Tokyo Skytree.
hotelName:
28    Bunka Hostel Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: this is the best hostel ive been to yet. super clean and quiet. the staff are so friendly and have good english. the building and facilities are new. it has that sense of safety without being too restrictive. the beds are really comfy. there are lots of restaurants nearby. also near to train stations and the sensoji temple.
hotelName:
28    Bunka Hostel Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I can't speak highly enough of this hostel, it's super modern , clean. I loved the privacy of having my own little sleeping cube. The dorm rooms are so quite you could hear a pin drop. I never had to wait for a shower, their were 3 on my floor. Super cool design and the wifi always worked really well. There is an onsen within 1 minute walk that is open till late, it allows tattoos and is super cheap. Ask staff for directions. I also recommend eating at gyoza hall and the Japanese beef restaurant with the colourful cows outside, both within a 1 minute walk from the hostel. I will stay here again when I'm back in Tokyo some day.
hotelName:
28    Bunka Hostel Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 距離淺草車站非常近，若想逛知名的雷門和淺草寺也非常方便，除了旅館本身的地理位置還算不錯之外，旅館本身很乾淨、員工很親切，而且旅館更設有女生專屬樓層，若要說唯一的缺點大概就是女生層只有3間淋浴間⋯其餘的我都覺得很棒！而且房價不貴！Bunka hostel near Asakusa station. There's 24 hour restaurant (Matsuya) and FamilyMart nearby. The location is really convenient for tourists. Besides, you can have your own locker to keep your valuable item and every single bed have socket for you to charging your electronic product.
hotelName:
28    Bunka Hostel Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Bunka Hostel is almost more of a capsule hotel than a hostel. Each floor has a large dorm room (one floor is female-only) with a number of upper and lower bunks - each of which is mostly enclosed in plywood (except for the area where you climb in which has a curtain - which gives a greater deal of privacy than standard hostels. The mattresses and pillows are new and comfortable, and each bunk includes individual lights and power outlets. The ladders going up to the top bunks are not the most comfortable for walking on barefoot, with tubular metal rungs. Also, there seem to be round holes (for ventilation?) between the top and bottom bunks, which takes a little away from the privacy as light and noise from one bunk to the other passes through.There is locker space in the dorm, though lockers are on the small side (I struggled to fit my medium sized daypack inside), so they are more just for you valuables and most people keep their suitcases next to their bunks. There are 3 showers and 5+ toilets on each floor, along with a row of sinks. Everything is kept incredibly clean and the bathrooms include hairdryers and soap/shampoo in the showers so you don't have to bring your own.The staff are friendly and helpful, there's a small bar/restaurant on the main floor. Wifi was fast and reliable throughout the building, and you need a key card to access the elevator and dorms, so it's quite secure.Bunka's location is great - right in the heart of Asakusa. There are tons of restaurants nearby (the specialty of Asakusa is tempura - enjoy!), and it's near a number of tourist sights in Ueno. It's a 5 minute walk from Asakusa station (which has direct access to and from Narita and Haneda), and about a 10 - 15 minute walk from Ueno station (which is on the circular JR line that stops at all the major sightseeing areas of Tokyo).
hotelName:
28    Bunka Hostel Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is a 5-10 minute walk from the Asakausa station. The staff were very helpful. We booked a familiy private room on the 7th floor. My 11 and 14 year old boys were excited about the accommodations and the box type bed. The mattress, blankets, pillows and towels were like Marriott hotel clean and crisp. The room was spacious enough for 4 of us and there even was a huge couch on side. We had a nice view of the Skytree tower. The common dining area was excellent to microwave and refrigerate food items. There is no TV which was fine because you are in Tokyo to visit places. I would definitely come back to the same hostel if i ever get to visit Japan again.
hotelName:
28    Bunka Hostel Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff was really helpful!!! I was sick and had an upset stomach, ended up sleeping in the lounge at bunka after checking out for the whole day on the bench. The staff was totally nice about it and did not stop me at all, they even offered me blankets and hot water!! And a basket to put my bag. They were so friendly and helpful. The place and showers was clean and really pretty! Will definitely stay again.
hotelName:
28    Bunka Hostel Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I've book thru Booking.com for a single bed in female dorm. The check-in was quick and easy. The staffs are very pleasant and speak good English. The dorm, shared bathroom, toilet, everything were clean and smells good. The bed, pillow and comforter was so comfy. The hostel is located near Sensoji temple area; the closest train station is Asakusa station (about 5-10 minutes walks). The wifi is impressive. Everything is just fine!
hotelName:
28    Bunka Hostel Tokyo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at the JR Blossom Shinjuku for 3 nights while visiting Tokyo in July. Hotel is in an ideal location for traveling around Tokyo. Within a 5 min walk from Shinjuku station (with easy connections to most of the city and direct from NRT on the NEX). Room was reasonable size by Tokyo standards and space was well maximized. Plenty of excellent restaurant choices and shopping within easy walking distance.
hotelName:
29    JR Kyushu Hotel Blossom Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed with my 2 young children and was happy with the cleanliness of the room as when I booked I didn’t know anything about this hotel. Check in staff were very official and not friendly which was a different experience for us as we usually encounter friendlier staff at other hotels. Room was big enough.
hotelName:
29    JR Kyushu Hotel Blossom Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Got to know of this place through a friend - it's his go-to accommodations in Shinjuku and will likely be ours if the price is right at the time of booking. The location is ace - about 5 mins walk from the station with food and shopping options in the vicinity. The aesthetic of the hotel is modern and chic and rooms are cozy and comfortable.
hotelName:
29    JR Kyushu Hotel Blossom Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a very comfortable western style hotel about an hour from the city centre and an hour from Haneda Airport. There is an orange bus Airport Shuttle from Shinjuku Staion 5 mins walk away. Breakfast is a mixed buffet with a range of country styles. Staff are very helpful. McDonalds and KFC are outside. It is close to the very nice Gyoen Park (flower gardens) as well as a short stroll to the high rise (Observatory Metropolitan Government building 1)where you can go to the 45th floor and view the city skyline for free. Better than paying at Skytree! Also hundreds of very good reasonably priced cafes and restaurants nearby - both above and below ground, serving very fresh high quality seafood and beef and noodle menus for all the workers before they take their long train ride home from nearby Shinjuku Station. This train station has 3 million people using it each day! Easy to use and an ideal way to see Tokyo. Coffee is good at Cafes across the lane, but all allow smoking (ugh!). Would highly recommend this Hotel as a base to see Tokyo.
hotelName:
29    JR Kyushu Hotel Blossom Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Convenient location to train and subway and restaurants/nightlife. Room was super tiny, barely room for a single suitcase. Breakfast was appreciated but we would appreciate a larger selection of Western foods- and everything was always cold!! Also, the lighting in the bathroom is so dark you might as well bring a flashlight! Also towels were thin as rags. Staff were nice and location was the biggest plus of staying here. Nothing was bad, but nothing stood out. Probably would try to find somewhere else to stay next time considering the price we paid.
hotelName:
29    JR Kyushu Hotel Blossom Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is located perfectly to stay in Shinjuku. The hotel is nice, the staff is very friendly and the room is spacious for Japan. There are basically no amenities here other than a restaurant, which we did not visit. But the room is clean, quiet, nice, and comfortable. Again, location is KEY and this hotel is perfectly situated close to the Shinjuku Station and walking distance to everything you need to do in Shinjuku,
hotelName:
29    JR Kyushu Hotel Blossom Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were here for a night on 15th April. A decent hotel with very cordial and efficient staff. Medium size rooms and bathrooms. Location is excellent. It’s is central Shinjuku area with the rail station about 5-7 minutes walk.
hotelName:
29    JR Kyushu Hotel Blossom Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is located at a quiet street but not far from the Shinjuku live and noisy area. it's very close to the train station (5 minutes walk). the staff is VERY helpful and informative. they helped me to make reservation to get back to the airport early in the morning.
hotelName:
29    JR Kyushu Hotel Blossom Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here towards the end of the cherry blossom season and got a twin room at SGD$313/ per night inclusive of all taxes. The location is off the main road which made it quiet in the evening but also close enough to transport (bus and train terminals). This made travelling easy. Getting food was also easy as there are a few convenience stores less than 5 minutes walk from the hotel, fast food chains, late night restaurants and food bars across the street (head towards the back lanes of Wendy’s)Room had a good layout that maximised space for the beds, and managing a shower and tub in the bathroom. It was on the pricey end for hotels but we enjoyed our stay and will return here again. I also had a few queries that I communicated with the hotel email, and they replied very quickly. Thank you!Just a note to those taking Narita Express to check the schedule on the last train, as I missed it and took the Skyliner instead to the hotel (change trains at Nippori) however this was pretty manageable with one luggage. If you have heavy lugagge and will reach after peak hours, I would recommend taking the airport bus to the Shinjuku Bus Terminal instead.
hotelName:
29    JR Kyushu Hotel Blossom Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Three of us (two adults and a teen) stayed at JR Blossom Shinjuku for 3 nights during April of this year, right in the middle of peak Hanami. We shared a deluxe twin, with an extra bed, which was a corner room. The hotel itself is easy to find, a short walk across the street from the Southwest entrance to Shinjuku station. Check in was easy (we reserved through Agoda-sorry Tripadvisor) and they had fulfilled our request for a high room (14th floor). It's got a clean ambiance, not fancy but comfortable and warm. The room itself was cosy, with the W.C. located away from the beds and bathroom. Amenities included robes, slippers and toiletries. No room service, but with literally dozens of food options just outside, why would you bother with room service?In April, the weather was mild, so we didn't have to mess with the HVAC system much, but it did the job in keeping our room comfortable. The beds were standard twins with hard pillows, but everything was actually remarkably comfortable and we all slept well each night after a day of hard touristing...We had no problems with noice, odd smells or anything untoward, really.We had breakfast at the Hotel Restaurant-- a good buffet with a mix of Japanese and Western food, as well as omelettes made to order. While some what pricey, like most hotel buffets, it was an easy and very comfortable way to start the day. Overall, would recommend the hotel for its location, comfort and relative cost. We think it's a good choice for the budget conscious family or business traveler who doesn't need to be overly catered to, but wants something comfortable and welcoming to return to at the end of a long Tokyo day.Thank you so much. PS. Don't lose your keycard! There's a 10,000 yen replacement fee...
hotelName:
29    JR Kyushu Hotel Blossom Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 選擇這間酒店是因為想找一間酒店靠近巴士總站，住幾天後要到白馬滑雪，從酒店步行到巴士站只是數分鐘路程，房間在東京來講面積不算少，浴室寬躺，只是價格有點高，如不是要選靠近巴士總站的酒店的話，同等價錢會有很多選擇。I chose this hotel cause I wanted to find a hotel near the Shinjuku bus terminal. After a few days, I would go to Hakuba skiing. It is only a few minutes walk from the hotel to the bus stop. The room is not too small in Tokyo, the bathroom is huge, just the price is a bit high. If you not target a hotel around the bus terminal, there will be many options for the same price.
hotelName:
29    JR Kyushu Hotel Blossom Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: FIVE MINS FROM THE JR STATIONOur travel agent booked this hotel for us for our last night in Tokyo. It was a convenient five minute walk from the JR train station. The hotel is not that obvious from the cross street -- look for the directional signs on the lamp post and the two ominous dark entry doors up a relatively small street.POLITE ENGLISH SPEAKING STAFFThrough the doors you'll find an attractive lobby and polite staff that speak enough English. We arrived around 1PM and were fortunate that they gave us a room right away where we could refresh after our train journey from Hakone before heading out again. ALL THAT YOU NEED EXCEPT...The hotel and rooms are very modern and clean. The room provided pajamas and robes, a flat screen TV, bath and shower, bidet toilet seat, comb, razor, cotton balls, shower gel, conditioner and shampoo in pump bottles. Only body lotion and towel hooks were missing!SOME COLD BREAKFAST ITEMSIn the morning, we had breakfast in the busy dedicated breakfast room where Japanese and Western food was served buffet style including yogurt, fruit, fish, pastries, juice, coffee, and eggs to order. Many items were supposed to be hot were rather cold which is one of the main reasons I gave a 4 out 5.GREAT LOCATIONThe location was very convenient, within easy walking distance to many restaurants (Including McDonald's on the corner if you need to get your Big Mac fix!), the JR station, department stores, the government building (Go up to the observation level for free), Park Hyatt, (Famous for the bar scene in the film 'Lost in Translation'), Starbucks, Eddie Bauer, Franc Franc, Shake Shack, Takashimaya, etc. Overall, a very pleasant and convenient stay. Please click the THANK button if this review was useful in any way. Thx and happy travels! ;)
hotelName:
29    JR Kyushu Hotel Blossom Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had 3 nights at the hotel, great location for exploring Shinjuku, and great access to the station. The rooms are small ( thats Tokyo ) but clean and comfortable. There is a great Ramen place at end of street Fuunji, worth a visit. I would stay again. Tokyo is amazing if not crazy busy.
hotelName:
29    JR Kyushu Hotel Blossom Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location is very convenient with eating places, train station nearby. The room is very clean and cosy. The staff can converse in English and very helpful and friendly. I would recommend this hotel to those wishing to visit Tokyo.
hotelName:
29    JR Kyushu Hotel Blossom Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is super convenient for exploring Tokyo as it's only a few minutes' walk from the Shinjuku Station. (Make sure you take the South Exit out). We were able to easily visit several Tokyo neighborhoods while staying here. If you'd rather just explore Shinjuku, there are plenty of restaurants and shops close by. I recommend the nearby Tokyu Hands and Kinokuniya. Other reviewers have commented on the small rooms; however, having just come from a traditional ryokan inn, our room felt big enough and more like the Western sizes we're accustomed to.
hotelName:
29    JR Kyushu Hotel Blossom Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is well located close to the Shinjuku JR station, walking distance to most of the shopping mall close by and close to the subway stations too. The room size is small than photo shown both on Trip.com and official hotel website, just enough for 2 person. Bathroom is decent size and the shower water pressure is good. The bed mattress itself is too firm for my liking and the double bed size is not so good for big person.Staff are friendly and helpful and no line at the reception desk, which is great.All in all, it is a good hotel if the room price is right. Otherwise, I would prefer the Southern Tower in the same area.
hotelName:
29    JR Kyushu Hotel Blossom Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: On the first night, I slept with the left side of my face on the pillow and in the morning when I woke up my left cheek and ear felt extremely itchy and there are red rashes all over my face, with the right side of my face being completely fine. This has never occurred on me and my face was never in such a condition. Unfortunately, the rashes did not die down during my stay in Tokyo or after I went back to Hong Kong. So I visited a dermatologist on the 25th, and my dermatologist diagnosed that my face was having a serious inflammation, and the rashes occurred due to physical contact which was caused from poor hygiene, very likely by an uncleaned pillow and chemical contact. I was prescripted with steroid in order to cure the condition on my face. There was also a lot of grey dust inside the toilet, by the side of the toilet seat and very strangely, I also saw used toothpicks at my room door on the first day upon my arrival. All the above incidents make me question if they actually clean the rooms PROPERLY or if the hotel is just making the rooms look as if they are cleaned? Everyone knows that hotel rooms cannot be that 'cleaned' however what happened was not an acceptable standard at all. What was more disappointing is that I have sent an e-mail to the hotel but there wasn't a single apology from the hotel and the reply was also rude from their general manager. They simply refer to my allergy to 'detergents at cleaning, materials in pillows, and cover materials' When I was diagnosed with a dermatologist who has seen my face in person. The hotel did not apologise nor did they suggest what changes they will try to make in the future, they just simply refer this to my 'personal problem'.I would not recommend this hotel to anyone since there are so many other choices in the same area. The level of hygiene and cleanliness is not acceptable and the reply I received shows an extremely poor attitude from the hotel. 第一天晚上，我的左臉睡在枕頭上，早上醒來的時候，我的左臉頰和耳朵都感覺非常癢，臉上全是紅色的皮疹，臉的右就完全沒問題。這從未發生在我身上，我的臉從未出現過這種情況。不幸的是，在我在東京逗留期間或者在我回到香港之後，皮疹並沒有消失。所以我第二天去看了一位皮膚科醫生，我的皮膚科醫生診斷出我的臉上有嚴重的發炎，皮疹是由於臉上皮膚與不幹淨，衛生不佳的物品接觸造成的，很可能是由於未清潔的枕頭和化學接觸引起的。為了治愈我臉上的狀況，我開了類固醇處方。我抵達的第一天也發現了廁所有非常非常多的灰塵，由其在馬桶的側面。非常離奇地在我的房門口使用過牙籤。所有上述事件讓我有疑問，他們是否真正地打掃幹淨房間，或者酒店是否只是讓房間看起來像是在清潔？每個人都知道酒店房間不能真的100%“清潔”，但發生的事情根本不可接受。更令人失望的是，我發了一封電子郵件到酒店，但酒店沒有任何道歉，他們的經理的態度也是非常不禮貌的。當我被皮膚科醫生診斷出，他們只是說我是對“清潔用洗滌劑，枕頭材料和封面材料”的過敏，。酒店沒有道歉，他們也沒有建議他們將來會做出哪些改變，他們只是簡單地將這個改為我的“個人問題”。我不會向任何人推薦這家酒店，因為在同一地區有很多其他選擇。衛生和清潔程度是不可接受的，酒店的態度也是極差。
hotelName:
29    JR Kyushu Hotel Blossom Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is located at a great location, the room is very clean and well maintain, suitable for family with kids. Many shopping mall, restaurant nearby, even transport also very convenient. The first night we check in and realize one of our luggage was missing. The staff was very helpful in helping us to contact the courier service and arrange luggage delivery on the second night. But ehe Chinese staff at the receptionist isn’t that friendly and helpful on the second night. The staff just inform us the luggage is not there and pass us the courier service slip despite knowing that it’ll be more convenient for them to help us contact the courier service since we might have some language barrier in communication. After we requested for her help, she called awhile and told us didn’t get through. End up we have to call the courier service and locate our luggage ourselves. We were really disappointed with such service.
hotelName:
29    JR Kyushu Hotel Blossom Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location is great. I prefer blossom more than sunroute which is older. We got the twin room which is the smallest room you can book if you wish to put in a cot. It is abit tight with the cot but bearable. I like staying in this area of shinjuku as it’s close to newoman which has great food options.
hotelName:
29    JR Kyushu Hotel Blossom Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I chose this hotel based on Trip Advisor reviews and I was not disappointed - I loved it!I knew the room would be small (as are most Tokyo hotels) but it was so compact and clean and had everything I needed for a week-long stay. To my surprise, the bed was super comfortable (I had been expecting it to be like concrete!). They provide bottled water, a robe and slippers, the room has a bar fridge and a large TV although English channels are limited.The breakfast buffet is small but has Western and Asian options and the staff are happy and very helpful.Location wise it is nice and close to Shinjuku station - about a 5- 10 minute walk, slightly uphill on the way to the station. There are several convenience stores close by, a couple of Starbucks and of course there are masses of dining options around Shinjuku.I will definitely return here on my next trip to Tokyo
hotelName:
29    JR Kyushu Hotel Blossom Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have been to Japan for over 30 times and this is the worse hotel experience I had. There was one night that the reception called my room at around 10:30pm telling me that my son were too loud and the room on the lower floor is complaining. My son was just talking normally, not shouting, but still, I asked him to lower his voice. 10 mins later, a staff knock on my door even when I had the "Do Not Disturb" sign out, telling me to quiet down again. About 30 mins later, when my son was already asleep. reception called again and woke us up, telling me that lower floor is still complaining and requested me to change room on the next day. It took me over an hour to put my son back to sleep, then I went down to the reception at 1am to understand 1) why I would need to change room when we were never loud, 2) why the staff knock on the door when we had the do not disturb sign, 3) we were already sleeping and they still called near mid-night. The staff had a really bad attitude and just keep telling me that other customer is complaining. This is totally unacceptable and I will not recommend any traveler to stay at this hotel.
hotelName:
29    JR Kyushu Hotel Blossom Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 3 nights with 3 rooms. The nearest exit from shinjuku station is A4. But if you have a wheelchair you can use the A5 exit but it’s a little more walk. It is near mc donalds and there is a lawson store nearby. The breakfast was great but with a few choices. There is a vendo/washing machine in some floors
hotelName:
29    JR Kyushu Hotel Blossom Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is in a great spot just one street back from a lot of the hustle and bustle of town. Close enough to station, shops, eating venues yet quiet enough to sleep well at night without still hearing all the noise around town. Definitely recommend
hotelName:
29    JR Kyushu Hotel Blossom Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Found this hotel on TA, and our family of 2 adults and two teenagers stayed here for 6 nights. Booking was easy and checkin seamless. The location was excellent for access to the JR lines, almost all subway lines, Disney bus shuttle station and airport limousine bus station. The rooms were very clean and well equipped (only missing was the provision of body lotion, a basic amenity and therefore surprising) and of good size for a Japanese hotel. Morning breakfast had a wide selection of good quality food. We also had two meals at the hotel’s Umaya restaurant which serve shabu-shabu abd yakitori. All in all a good stay!
hotelName:
29    JR Kyushu Hotel Blossom Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Arrived before check-in time and the hotel stored our luggage for us behind their reception counter. Was pleasantly surprised that our luggage was already in our hotel room after returning from sightseeing. Hotel also promptly forwarded mail that was directed to us. Staff was friendly. The room was spotless and has a humidifier. The superior twin room fits 3 people comfortably, with enough space to fully open 1 large and 1 medium-sized luggage.There is a family mart right beside the hotel and a 7-eleven 1-2 minutes walk away. It is conveniently located 3 minutes walk from JR Shinjuku Station, BUSTA Shinjuku, Takashimaya, and LUMINE. Wendy's and McDonalds are nearby.The nearest exit from JR Shinjuku Station is New South Gate, Koshu Kaido Gate or South Gate.
hotelName:
29    JR Kyushu Hotel Blossom Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fancy looking reception and room is pretty nice looking. Good bathroom which is connected to The toilet. Sealed glass door separates the toilet from the shower and bath. You don’t have to get into the bath to have a shower like most hotels but is instead next to the bath and the water drains through the drain on the tiled floor. Stayed in twin bedroom which suited us. The room is quite small compared to western hotels but apparently is normal for Japan. Has basic hotel necessities with big flat screen tv, kettle, glasses and mugs, hair dryer, shampoo etc. has an AC with heating and cooling functions but is in Japanese. Very close to Shinjuku station and the hub of Shinjuku - only about a 8-10min walk. There are restaurants as well as fast food outlets at the entrance including a McDonald’s and other food outlets only a few minutes walk away. There’s a food mart near the entrance too. Huge shopping malls with the moderate to higher end retail such as Lumine are at the crossing near the hotel.The workers there speak some English - enough to deal with basic necessities. Some floors have a laundry and dryer if you need. Just need to use coins to operate. Highly recommend this place for a short stay and if you’re planning on being out and about shinjuku.
hotelName:
29    JR Kyushu Hotel Blossom Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked a room for this hotel for 3 nights via hotels quickly form whom they advertise with. When I arrived I was told my booking had been cancelled by hotel quickly, I showed them my receipt and bank statement that the room has been paid for, I then called hotel quickly who then spoke to the hotel staff and I was then given a room and was told everything is ok they will sort it out. Later that evening while I was out I received an email from hotelquickly to say I cannot stay there as jr blossom will not take there payment. When I went back to the hotel I was told that hotelquickly will not do a direct deposit into there account and had not responded there emails. so in the last 3 days It was hard to contact hotelquickly as they would not answer there phone and a recording kept saying that they were unavailable. So it took 26 phone calls and 19 emails before this was sorted out. In the end I had to repay for the booking then get a refund from hotlequickly. This had ruined my last 3 days in Tokyo. It was unproffessional from both Jr blossom and hotelsquickly. Jr blossom should have taken responsibilty for this as they are the ones who chose to advertise there hotel with Hotelsquickly, and hotels quickly should make it easier to contact them and should learn to reply to emails quickly. poor Proffessionalism on both sides. Will now never use hotelsquickly or ever return to Jr blossom shinjuku
hotelName:
29    JR Kyushu Hotel Blossom Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent hotel in a prime location 5 min walk from Shinjuku station. As others have mentioned, the rooms are not that big, but how much space do you need? Clean rooms, nice beds and bathroom with all the usual stuff. Fresh water everyday, coffee and tea facilities. We did not had breakfast here - as it is expensive ( 2300 yen) but across the street you will find a Sagafredo café where you can have coffee, toast and orangejuice for 900 yen.Nice hotel in a quiet street. Check in can't be done before 2.p.m. -
hotelName:
29    JR Kyushu Hotel Blossom Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: You will not be disappointed. Location, quality, service and room are all perfect for your stay in Shinjuku. The train stations are extremely close by so you only have to cart your luggage a short distance on arrival from the airport off the Narita express.
hotelName:
29    JR Kyushu Hotel Blossom Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located in the heart of busy Shinjuku. Right across the Shinjuku train station. Hotel rooms very clean. Modern minimalist design, small but all the amenities are of a 5 star hotel. I especially like the bathroom, bath tub and toilet are separated which means no wet floor after shower. Hotel staff are prompt and friendly and professional. Secure elevator -only hotel guest can enter, you tap in with your room key only to the designated floor. Overall,i think it is a pleasant stay and will stay there again if opportunity arises.
hotelName:
29    JR Kyushu Hotel Blossom Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a lovely time staying in this hotel. I fell in love with it at first sight. The lobby was soothing and welcoming. The hotel is very new and looks new. The staff is helpful and welcoming too.We booked the Superior Twin Room as we needed an extra bed put in for our son. The room is still spacious after including the 3rd bed. The spacious bathroom is a lovely surprise with separate sections for the toilet and shower area. The shower space is very very spacious even with a full-sized bathtub inside.The beds are from Simmons and we slept very well every night. Wifi is strong and reliable.Location of the hotel is superb as it is only 5mins' walk away from Shinjuku Station. It is less than 10mins' walk away from the major shopping centres.There are also many small eateries near the hotel serving fantastic food. U do not have to go far to enjoy a good tonkatsu or yakitori meal.
hotelName:
29    JR Kyushu Hotel Blossom Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel was within walking distance from Shinjuku Station. There was a Lawson and Ta-Q-Bin next to the hotel. Mcdonalds, Yoshinoya, Family Mart and 7-11 were also nearby. It was easy to go to the airport limousine bus station if you need to catch a bus to the airport.The room was spacious for 2 people. We can open our luggage fully and they have 2 chairs for seating. Room cleaning needs to be improved. They did not wash our used cups on the first day. They merely covered the cups with cup mat. We tried it on the 2nd day. And they did the same thing again, without washing the cup. It wasn't a big deal, we were just puzzled why they didn't wash our cup during the room cleaning.Overall still satisfied with our stay.
hotelName:
29    JR Kyushu Hotel Blossom Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were looking for a comfort hotel in Shinjuku area and found this hotel. This turned out to be a very good deal. We stayed here for 4 night. Rooms are clean and a bit more spacious compare to other hotels in this area. Beds are super comfy. There are both bath tub and shower in the bathroom. Great bath amenities. Staffs are friendly and very helpful. Good location. 5-min. walk to Shinjuku JR and metro.
hotelName:
29    JR Kyushu Hotel Blossom Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I originally wrote a scathing review of this hotel but had removed it and rewrote it as things had actually gotten so bad as our stay progressed that the hotel had eventually done something about it. We stayed at Jr hotel blossom Shinjuku for 2 nights in October 2018 having previously enjoyed our last long stay in 2016. The hotel's website doesn't quite work so we booked a double room (same room type we stayed before) through a large online travel agent. As it was the end of a long trip and before a long haul flight, we knew that the double room is spacious enough for packing and relaxing. The hotel is also a short walk away from the South East exit at Shinjuku station, making it really accessible to and from the Narita Express. This made us willing to pay the pricey ~USD$250/night stay.When we attempted to check-in, the clerk at reception actually did not honour our booking, and was quick to blame the OTA for the mess up. They had actually downgraded us to a semi-double room. The clerk was unhelpful in that respect, despite being shown the confirmation we received of the room type, not offering us any options but simply stating we needed to contact the OTA ourselves to sort this out. We did, and after spending over an hour going back and forth, the OTA said that they had spoken to the hotel who continued to refuse to honour the reservation, and as a solution they said the hotel said we could upgrade to a double room by paying the difference; the OTA will then reimburse us. Lo and behold, when I returned to speak to the clerk, it was only then that she told me that they had no double rooms available, perhaps I might want to upgrade to a much pricier twin room? As I couldn't reach the OTA again to verify without spending another hour or so tearing my hair out, and as we were travelling as a couple so paying so much extra for a twin room is not really appropriate, we begrudgingly settled for the semi-double. The clerks all knew that we weren't happy but we're unwilling to help.Meanwhile, we spotted a mouse in the lobby and reported to the staff who managed to chase it down and capture it...The semi-double, compared to the double room, was much smaller. The bed was pushed against the wall, and there isn't enough room to open 2 luggages. The bathroom was thankfully a decent size. The room was filthy though, the surfaces were sticky and there was a thick layer of dust in the corners and on surfaces like the outside of the fridge. There were also mould/mildew marks on the walls in the room and in the bathroom. When we returned to the room late at night, we were horrified to see a cockroach scurry across the desk and onto the curtain. We were lucky that we were quick enough to kill it. This unsettled us a lot and we called the front desk to ask for a room change immediately, only to be told that it will not be possible as they are now... Fully booked. Hmm? Given the exchange we had earlier in the day it seemed more like they just didn't want to give us a better room, as a good hotelier might have done that from the start instead of downgrading us. As a compromise we requested that they provided us with some form of insecticide. The staff that came up with the spray was probably the first helpful and sincere person we encountered here, and he helpfully sprayed all the surfaces down inside as well as outside of the room. We also had him take away the body of the dead cockroach as we didn't want it in the room with us. Perhaps the dead body was what gave them to push, and we received a call shortly after informing us that they could change the room... But the next day around midday so we had to check out of this disgusting room the next day.As you can imagine, we were not able to rest well that night. We had to repack everything and also wondered whether there were more cockroaches hiding inside our baggages. Given the behaviour of the hotel so far we were also uncertain about whether the next room is going to be any better and to be honest we considered going elsewhere. Since it was past midnight now and we were exhausted we decided to just stick it out.When we returned at the end of the 2nd day to check into our new room, the staff checking in then apologised profusely but only for the cockroach, not the room type mix-up. They had also helped moved our baggage to the new room which was nice.We were very pleasantly surprised to find that they had checked us into a twin room with a view towards Shinjuku station/government tower, given that our experience with their hospitality had been so bad the day before. This was a nice touch, unfortunately since we were checking out very early the next morning, so we only used this room for about 7 hours or so. What really baffled us was how this room was many, many folds cleaner than the previous room. While there were still mark on the wall and in the bathroom, the marks were more consistent with age and wear and tear, rather than from the lack of care. It was perhaps what we would have expected the double room we booked to be. It suggests to us that the hotel does provide a different level of service in accordance to the room types, so if you're thinking of taking the cheapest room it might not be worth it at all. Sadly for us we had the cockroach to thank for our better second night... Not the fact that we had actually paid for a standard double.When we checked out the clerk was nice and offered to help us post our pocket WiFi back without prompting. So many things went wrong from the start and it was only at the very end that the hotel made some attempt to help us. Unfortunately the attempts were far too late to change our overall negative impression of the place, and while we recognise that some effort was made, we still feel that we cannot recommend this place not are we likely to return. The service we received was completely inconsistent. To be fair to the hotel we had also provided this feedback directly, so perhaps they might improve their cleanliness and service level for the future. This was certainly not the 4 star hotel we were expecting.TLDR: at the time of our stay there was a hygiene and cleanliness issue at the hotel, with some level of mice and cockroaches infestation. Cheaper rooms were not cleaned properly. Beware of booking via OTAs as the hotel might not honour the bookings and actually will downgrade customers than upgrade. The hotel's booking website might not work - it never showed us any advanced availability. The service we received varied a lot - we had interacted with staff a lot during our short 2 night stay but only a handful towards the end didn't make us feel unwanted.
hotelName:
29    JR Kyushu Hotel Blossom Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is just a short walk from the JR Shinjuku station and the airport limousine bus terminal. Therefore, it's extremely convenient to get to anywhere in Tokyo, as well as day trips out of Tokyo.The room is spacious, clean, comfortable and quiet. Perfect rest stop for travelers.
hotelName:
29    JR Kyushu Hotel Blossom Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a great value hotel with very helpful staff. Short walk from the Shinjuku Station and in an excellent location. Close to all the facilities with a Lawson store next door to pick up whatever small things you need. The rooms are small but all we needed them for was to sleep and shower, and they were perfect for it. The bed was very comfy and the bathroom although tiny had all the amenities needed. The staff were super helpful and went out of the way to give us directions etc when required.
hotelName:
29    JR Kyushu Hotel Blossom Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location near the Shinjuku station area, with comfortable beds, pillows and quiet rooms. We (2 people) stayed 5 nights in a room with two twin beds, 2 chairs and a small table. I actually expected smaller, and have stayed in smaller with more storage. Japanese are so good at creating efficient storage, but that was not happening here-- no drawers, no shelves, no hooks, no place to stash your suitcase if there were more than one person staying in the room. It rained quite hard while we were there and there was no place to hang a coat to dry unless you crammed it into the tiny space that held 4 hangers, thereby getting other clothing wet.
hotelName:
29    JR Kyushu Hotel Blossom Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived at this hotel after a long flight from Australia and then a bus trip to Shinjuku train station. We had no problems locating the hotel at all. On our arrival we were greeted by the staff who were very polite and helpful. Our room wasn’t huge, but fine for the two of us. It was clean and quiet and breakfast was excellent. The location is absolutely fantastic, so close to train, shops and restaurants. Free Wifi and they offer a handi phone to use during your stay. Can highly recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
29    JR Kyushu Hotel Blossom Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good hotel fairly new and location near Shinjuku Station (5 minute walk) room is on the small side. Free use of mobile with free data. Value for money would recommend for a couple of nights stay. Try Afuri nearby for excellent ramen.
hotelName:
29    JR Kyushu Hotel Blossom Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a very clean hotel in a good location close to the station and lots of restaurants and shopping. The rooms are a good size and spotless, the bathroom is as new with good quality ammenities. Efficient helpful check in staff. We didn't have breakfast but we did have a late supper and drink one night and not overly impressed with the restaurant.
hotelName:
29    JR Kyushu Hotel Blossom Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The previous reviews are bang-on, great location in Shinjuku, close to major transportation (trains, buses), restaurants and shopping. We took the NEX train from Narita airport, which was simple and easy to use. I went for the Deluxe room (corner room, with a little sitting area, mini walk-in closet, and toilet down the hall away from the beds). We were on the 13th floor with a great view of Shinjuku.I never heard any other guests while in the room, so it's very quiet. I also got the breakfast package since I didn't want to bother hunting around for breakfast in the morning (it is very busy around this hotel), it was a tad expensive (what isn't in Japan, LOL). However, I thought the Japanese breakfast and the service was outstanding. The washer/dryer on every 3rd or 4th floor was handy (the washer includes detergent when you run a cycle, so you don't need to buy any). One thing that is amazing is that you get an Android web-enabled phone (you can't call with it, but can access all Android apps, like Google Maps), this was awesome to have during our day outings, I was able to access Google Maps, TripAdvisor, Yelp all without using my own roaming plan. This was a great savings! The hotel was very helpful forwarding our luggage to our next hotel in Kyoto. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again if in Tokyo.
hotelName:
29    JR Kyushu Hotel Blossom Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is a short walk to the main entrance of Shinjuku station.This makes it handy to pretty much get anywhere, including to the airport via the NEX.It's located off the main street, so noise levels at night are quite okay. There is a family mart close by as well.Front desk service was friendly and helpful.We did not ask them for much however.We stayed in a standard double room. The room was bigger then some of the other hotels in Tokyo, but like all hotels in Tokyo they are still small.Room was very clean, had everything we needed.Given the ease of access to transport, the size and price of the room I would stay here again.There is nothing unique/special about it, but when your out all day and most of the night enjoying Tokyo its all you need really.Clean, convenient and good value.
hotelName:
29    JR Kyushu Hotel Blossom Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: this hotel is conveniently located with easy assess to the metro, shopping and eating all within walking distance. The best way to get to this hotel from the narita airport is by bus which stop at the sunroute plaza hotel which is just right at the back of this hotel. This is a bit closer than stopping at the central bus station. The room is bigger than regular hotel rooms around here and we still got a small table and seats by the window. Everything is good and staff are friendly. There is also free bottled water from Kyushu.
hotelName:
29    JR Kyushu Hotel Blossom Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My daughter and I stayed here for three nights in July. We stayed at Keio Plaza before, but I’d definitely come back to JR Kyushu in a heartbeat. It’s literally 3 minuets away from the express bus station and 5 minuets away from JR Station! There are ton of restaurants, dept. stores, shops, and convenience stores around. We booked a twin room which is roomier than I expected. Clean and efficient. The only complaint is that there was an occasionally musty smell in the shower room. It puzzled me because the bath/shower room was spotless.
hotelName:
29    JR Kyushu Hotel Blossom Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have stayed here twice now. Once in March 2017 and once in July 2018. Shinjuku station is literally 5 minutes away by foot (main entrance) and less than that to some of the many other entrances and exits (you'll find you will head to the main entrance as it's quite a complex station for tourists. From Shinjuku station you can pretty get anywhere you want with ease.I travelled with my son and booked a twin room which is adequate although not too much in the way of hanging space for clothes. However in July it was shorts and T shirts and when I visit again in 2020 I'll pack less clothes.I arranged for my main luggage to be sent from Osaka to this hotel whilst we travelled around rural Japan, and on arrival at the Blossom the cases were already in our room (very cheap and easy to organise)Unless you are looking to wine and dine at your chosen hotel in Tokyo, I can't see what more one could want.The rooms are clean, air con is good, staff are professional and pleasant. I wouldn't stay anywhere else because this hotel caters for all of my needs.It's not 5 star, nor is it 5 star prices, and twice now when staying at this hotel it's been typically out of the room by 10.30am and return by midnight. That's Tokyo for me.I've spent 35 days in Japan over the last 2 years and JR Kyushu Hotel Blossom Shinjuku is perfect for me. I prefer Harajuku as an area, but I wouldn't want to be based there. I booked direct with the hotel as that is always my preference.Using the adage 'if it ain't broken don't fix it', I can not see myself choosing elsewhere next time I visit which hopefully will be for the summer Olympics.
hotelName:
29    JR Kyushu Hotel Blossom Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Overall - really enjoyed my stay in the hotel. 1) Rooms - small (but within expectation), very clean with the bathroom amenities replenished daily. Bathroom has a full bath tub and not those half or 3/4 bath tub some hotels have to save space. Only issue I had was that we had 2 24inch luggage and we struggled to find space to open both flat.2) Location - absolute winner. Hotel is literally a stone’s throw away from Shinjuku and a Lawson (useful for any last minute drink or coffee purchases late in the evening). I would estimate a walk to the subway (Oedo and Shinjuku line) to be about 3 mins, JR Shinjuku Station to be about 5 mins and another subway (Marounichi) to be about 8 mins. It is also easy to get from Haneda airport to this hotel as the airport limousine stops at Sunroute which is only 1 street away. Suggest if this option is not available since there are limited timings on when the bus stops at Sunroute, you can also consider dropping off at the bus terminal and making your way here. 3) Service - allowed for an early checkin at 1pm and also helped to make reservations at other dining options. It was a pleasure dealing with the front desk.Would stay again and would recommend others to try if they are looking for a reasonably priced hotel in the Shinjuku area. :)
hotelName:
29    JR Kyushu Hotel Blossom Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed three nights at JR Kyushu Hotel Blossom Shinjuku this time and still great! We booked it via the official site and selected a double bedroom. It's slightly smaller than a twin room however still have plenty of room to move round. Love that a bath is available instead of a walk-in shower. Bed is comfortable. Friends are friendly and with a smile. Not to mention the location is excellent. Highly recommended if you are looking for a hotel stay in Shinjuku!
hotelName:
29    JR Kyushu Hotel Blossom Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here in June 2018 with a group of friends!Pros- Quiet - Close to Shinjuku station- Restaurant on site - great for grabbing a few drinks- Close to bars and restaurants- CleanCons- can’t think of anythingWe would definitely stay here again!!
hotelName:
29    JR Kyushu Hotel Blossom Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: the hotel is located near the south entrance of jr station. there are shops like mcdonalds, lawson, wendy's first chicken, 磯丸水產 nearby so u wont be hungry anytime. the area is tranquil and shops close at around 10. i have to use the room card to enter the hotel at night and to enter my room so it is actually very safe. the communication is ok and the staff is friendly. the room is spacious and the interior design is awesome. there are washing machines and free iced water. also, there are vending machines on some floors. however, the corridors and the room are too dim. except for this, everything is perfect.
hotelName:
29    JR Kyushu Hotel Blossom Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Check in was super speedy, staff had good enough English for all our requests.Room was cosy but perfectly big enough.Beds (we had two large twins that were each almost as big as a double) and pillows were comfy. Good block out curtains. A couple of English channels on tv (including World Cup games - v important!)Shower was super powerful - a joy to stand under.Bathroom had toiletries, fancy toilet seat, good ducting (for steam and smells!)Hotel was exceedingly well positioned and sent effective instructions (with pictures) for reaching it.Lawson and 7-11 both v close, both with ATMs for foreign cash withdrawal, alcohol and good snacks.
hotelName:
29    JR Kyushu Hotel Blossom Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent 3 nights at this stylish downtown hotel. The rooms were small which was to be expected due to it’s location and we were unable to get a double due to the popularity of this hotel.The rooms were comfortable and had everything you could reasonably expect in them including a very powerful shower and the wonderful toilets with a heated seats and various other interesting gadgets.The staff were efficient and polite the whole place was immaculately clean. The best bit without doubt was the location a short 5 minute walk to Shinjuku station and great restaurants and bars within easy walking distance.The hotel is great if you want a comfortable place to stay in the epicentre of Tokyo. Probably not the place to stay if you want more of a resort experience as the facilities aren’t there if that is what you are seeking. Plenty of cheap breakfast options nearby. I would be happy to stay here again.
hotelName:
29    JR Kyushu Hotel Blossom Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved staying here. The location in the heart of Shinjuku is excellent, the staff were delightful, the breakfast buffet was delicious, and we were very pleasantly surprised to be given a room upgrade - which made our stay even more enjoyable. All in all a fabulous experience.
hotelName:
29    JR Kyushu Hotel Blossom Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was our base for exploring Tokyo. It is very close to the major Railway station Shinjuku which makes getting anyway simple. Rooms very nice and clean, and the service was impeccable like most places in Japan
hotelName:
29    JR Kyushu Hotel Blossom Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location is great but standard double room is too small and there are many choices when you paid such a high rate. It's difficult to open two suitcase and you can hardly feel comfortable. The Front Desk staff is quite efficient but cold. Breakfast is average but staff attitude is better than Front Desk.
hotelName:
29    JR Kyushu Hotel Blossom Shinjuku
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hostel ! Smily staff really welcoming and helpfull. All the hostel is always super clean ! Very confortable beds. You'll find all the little things you need. Location is very near from shibuya station and day/night life but "far" enough to be quiet at night. I higly recomend !
hotelName:
30    WISE OWL HOSTELS SHIBUYA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very good and modern facilities, friendly staff, great bar for meeting travellers. Good capsule style bunks and good layout - made 28-bed dorm feel more like an 8 bed! Maybe a bit pricey, and would have liked a couple of extras such as free tea and coffee for this price, but this isnt a big issue. Location was perfect, I was happy to walk the 15 mins to central Shibuya but there is a bus if you need it. Loved walking to all the bars in the evenings, and all the shops etc in the day time. Great hub for exploring other parts of Tokyo too! I'd definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
30    WISE OWL HOSTELS SHIBUYA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Free towels!15 min walk to shibuyaFantastic hostsVery clean!Smoking area right outside the hostel300 yen happy hour on drinksThe price was cheap compared to what you get.Honestly, what more could you ask for?
hotelName:
30    WISE OWL HOSTELS SHIBUYA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lounge area was amazing! The staff, Ali and Mari in particular, was extremely helpful! They made our stay the best it could be! The beds were soft, and everything was extremely clean! I can't wait to stay again! Mahalo!
hotelName:
30    WISE OWL HOSTELS SHIBUYA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Convenient location in a quiet area, but just 20 minutes from Hachiko, it was a little cool in the morning and it would be a good idea to ventilate the living room. Send a letter with a detailed description of the path to the hostel, which is very convenient.
hotelName:
30    WISE OWL HOSTELS SHIBUYA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Can't say enough about this place! The place is conveniently located a short distance from Shibuya station, the rooms are clean and comfortable. Great value for the price.bLast but not least the staff are the nicest and most helpful inviduals I have met in my travels. Thank you Wise Owls ❤️
hotelName:
30    WISE OWL HOSTELS SHIBUYA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My trip was really nice. Met a lot of cool people and the atmosphere was super friendly. 24 front desk and bar was nice too. Close enough to Shibuya station where you could walk which was super helpful since you can get all around Tokyo from there. Fresh new towels every day are also a plus as well as free slippers. I'd definitely recommend staying here. My only nitpick is that the pillows are a little harder than I am used to but that's no big deal.
hotelName:
30    WISE OWL HOSTELS SHIBUYA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Decent hostel with a nice common space downstairs. The rooms are very clean and the showers are amazing. Twin room was very small and we struggled to use the space well but it is Tokyo and we expected space to be right. Decent location with a short walk to Shibuya.
hotelName:
30    WISE OWL HOSTELS SHIBUYA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Twin room;This was my first time in the twin room but my third time for wise owls. Some points for us were the limited space in the room and the heater was directly above the top bunk. However, for the price and location it was excellent. I would book again We’ve also travelled through Japan and both agreed this has been the best hostel so far
hotelName:
30    WISE OWL HOSTELS SHIBUYA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a three night stay here in a bunk room. Small but has all you need. All facilities were very clean and free shampoo conditioner etc. It is in a great location - advisable to get a bus from Shibuya Station with luggage but otherwise walkable to the famous crossing without being too close so not too noisy in surrounding streets. The walls are thin so can hear adjoining rooms - to be expected in a hostel though. They provide towels daily for free and can also check in early for 1000 yen per person. Overall great service would definitely recommend.
hotelName:
30    WISE OWL HOSTELS SHIBUYA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at this hostel for 4 nights in total.Very nice and hip little reception (ambiance wise), lobby and bar area. However, the lobby/ reception area has a very strong stench and smells like the toilet and so does the lift, especially the lift since it is such a small and enclosed space. The stench is unbearable. It was very stuffy and warm at the lobby area as well. Combine the stench and warm area, we did not want to hang round the area for any longer than we should, it is a shame because we did not get much chance to interact with other guests staying at the hostel. Room was decently cleaned for the most part, however given we can only check in at 4pm, you would think and expect a more thorough clean of the rooms. It was very dusty at some parts of the room and this was a little disappointing. Furthermore, we realised whenever it came to a certain time in the morning, the air-conditioning in the room will not work any more and will just be blowing out room temperature air which made the room a little too stuffy and warm. The cold air will only come back rather late at night.Toilet was clean and like most of the toilets in Japan, they have the bidet which was awesome.Shower room was only average, we have been to other hostels which had more occupants and had managed to maintain a much cleaner shower room. Amenities provided in the shower was quite standard like other hostels, you have your shampoo, conditioner and body wash. Then came the ultimatum, when we were asking for information at the reception one night, one of the staff member was clearly intoxicated and could not hold an otherwise simple and easy conversation. All the reception staff members spoke a decent level of English.Overall ok experience, will think twice about coming back to stay at this hostel.
hotelName:
30    WISE OWL HOSTELS SHIBUYA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great staff, very close to Shibuya Station.Very clean. 10/10. You get a fresh towel everyday. There are many events organised. You can easily get in touch with other travellers in the lobby + they make great food & drinks.
hotelName:
30    WISE OWL HOSTELS SHIBUYA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wise Owl was extremely conveniently located (a 12 minute walk from all the bars and restaraunts in Shibuya), very clean and well managed, and very cheap! Great for backpackers or anyone wanting to spend a weekend in Shibuya. Plus they have lots of gathering opportunities to meet everyone else staying in the hostel (Saturday nights)!
hotelName:
30    WISE OWL HOSTELS SHIBUYA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place was a remarkable find. The rooms were a tiny bit on the small side (we had trouble making room for our luggage), but for our group of 12 this was perfect. The beds were comfortable and yleverything was impeccably clean. The style is slick and minimalistic. The staff was good enough to bring all out bathing towels to one room so that they we didn't need to send 12 individuals every day. The room on the main floor was perfect for students to grab breakfast at the convenience store and have everyone sit together. I can't stress how impressed I was with this place! The card key system was also excellent and made the place secure and safe for both students and chaperones at this hostel. 10/10 would stay again in a heartbeat. HUGE thank you to Matsuda-san for helping us with preparations since February!
hotelName:
30    WISE OWL HOSTELS SHIBUYA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We checked in on a Saturday night and joined their weekly Meet Up session where we had a chance to chat with the local Japanese. It was also the perfect opportunity to make new friends amongst the other people staying in the hostel. After the event was over, a group of us continued chit chatting and we eventually headed out. The hostel staff helped us booked a taxi at 5am as we didn’t want to lug our luggage to the Shibuya Station as we head to the airport. He also spoke to the taxi driver to ensure we got dropped off at the correct entrance. We truly appreciated it as the taxi driver did not speak any Japanese. The rooms and shower rooms are clean and we had a comfortable stay.
hotelName:
30    WISE OWL HOSTELS SHIBUYA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: its good hostel. but you need to walk a little to go to the center of the tokyoThe party that is held every weekend is very interesting.Also, there are many opportunities to experience culture such as nacho party and takoyaki party that is held occasionally.
hotelName:
30    WISE OWL HOSTELS SHIBUYA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was my first trip to Japan and I had a lot of worries about where to stay. Browsing online, I found this place and found the photos and reviews to be promising. I love that this place is very close to Shibuya Station. I had a wonderful stay, the staff were very nice and helpful and my first ever trip to Japan couldn't go any smoother.
hotelName:
30    WISE OWL HOSTELS SHIBUYA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Winner in Shibuya . A perfect mix of safety, comfort and warm hearted staff.No hesitation in recommending Wise owl to my friend. I'll come back again soon.Keep it up guys.See you again soon.Ben Burke
hotelName:
30    WISE OWL HOSTELS SHIBUYA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have stayed at this hostel twice now and both times i have enjoyed my experience. The facilities are great and clean. The staff are really helpful and nice and the area is great. You can get a bus into Shibuya or walk (10 mins or so) which means you're near enough to Shibuya it's convenient but not so near you will be kept awake by noise! Highly recommend!
hotelName:
30    WISE OWL HOSTELS SHIBUYA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great room, nice staff and very clean. A 10 minute walk from Shibuya station which was very convenient with the JR pass. Had a nice private twin room, was very quiet and they even showed the world cup in the common room.
hotelName:
30    WISE OWL HOSTELS SHIBUYA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice staff, nice atmosphere, really tiny room, a too high price for a very tiny room, no cooking spot, only microwave.Could have been cheaper since the services wasn't good enough for the price paid. I wouldn't be as disappointed if it had been cheaper. But it is a great location, not far away from Shibuya and Shibuya station. Although it was very loud from the corridor and other rooms, and also from the big road just outside the hostel building.
hotelName:
30    WISE OWL HOSTELS SHIBUYA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect for a short stay in Tokyo. Rooms are ‘cosy’ but cannot fault cleanliness (especially of bathroom and toilet facilities)! Walls a bit thin - woken up by noisy drunk people two nights running around 4-5am
hotelName:
30    WISE OWL HOSTELS SHIBUYA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This Hostel was just amazing at the Saturday meet up I made some amazing friends. Its a great place to stay for solo travelling. The staff are incredibly helpful and friendly, they advised me on coin lockers and how to get around difficult station. The bathroom are amazingly clean as well as the comfortable sleeping area I would 100% recommend this hostel. I Will definitely come back to this hostel when I return to Tokyo.
hotelName:
30    WISE OWL HOSTELS SHIBUYA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wise Owl was absolutely incredible! The rooms are extremely clean and the beds are so cozy! I highly recommend it especially if you are solo traveling. You will feel extremely comfortable and you will definitely meet so awesome travelers!
hotelName:
30    WISE OWL HOSTELS SHIBUYA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed with a friend in a twin room. The room was absolutely tiny, you open the door and have the bunk bed right in front of you. That was to be expected though, and it was actually kind of cozy :) The only downside was that the room was not very soundproof and loud guests were coming in at around 1-2am, so this may not be the best option for those who go to sleep a bit earlier.The toilets and showers were kept very clean.
hotelName:
30    WISE OWL HOSTELS SHIBUYA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wise Owl is great. Personally I think its the staff that creates a social, likeable and open atmosphere. Had a great time there and would recommend it to everyone visiting Tokyo. Location is great, people are great, activities are great. No complains or tips.
hotelName:
30    WISE OWL HOSTELS SHIBUYA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hostel is great. Beds are comfortable, and the curtains make them private. The staff are extremely helpful, and the space on the first floor nice for meeting people. My only issue was the closest subway was a little walk and Shibuya station is a subway away. Not an issue for me as i enjoy the walk, but given subway closes early, it would be nice if it was closer. Not a personal complaint, just something to note. Overall a very positive experience and i would stay there again
hotelName:
30    WISE OWL HOSTELS SHIBUYA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The pictures on the front page of their website still reflect that this hostel has a bustling first floor atmosphere with a restaurant and bar, but the restaurant has since moved on apparently, they still offer some canned beer however, so still kinda a bar. But if that's not an important detail for you, the rooms, showers and kitchen area are definitely satisfactory. In fact the beds are quite comfortable! My only complaint would be, well atleast in my room there was no way to control the heat or air, but it was very hot so we slept with the window open, but there is a smoking pavilion of sorts behind the hotel, where apparently people like to gather at in the middle of the night and it can get very, very noisy, so bring earplugs! ;-)
hotelName:
30    WISE OWL HOSTELS SHIBUYA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice place with comfy beds and really nice showers. Everything was clean and cosy. It seemed a little pricey to me, but I'm not sure how it compares to other hostels in the area, so maybe the price is reasonable. It's about 15-20 minutes walk from Shibuya station, so not very central, but that meant it was fairly quiet at night which was nice.
hotelName:
30    WISE OWL HOSTELS SHIBUYA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located close to Shibuya and cool Daikanyama - a quick walk on 10-15 minutes and you are in the organised chaos at Shibuya Crossing. The hostel is new, clean and we had a really pleasant stay. Would stay there again.
hotelName:
30    WISE OWL HOSTELS SHIBUYA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hostel has a great location ! About 15-20 mins walk from Shibuya station and famous crossing (which is a little longer than what they say - and a bit hard work if you have bags so many get a cab like I did ). Staff are super friendly , great for meeting new people !
hotelName:
30    WISE OWL HOSTELS SHIBUYA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: pretty far from Shibuya station. not nearly as crazy or social as advertised... especially due to the small common areas. staff also coded our key cards incorrectly which was pretty bad in the evening after going out.
hotelName:
30    WISE OWL HOSTELS SHIBUYA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hostel was a 10 minute walk to Shibuya Station. Staff are always friendly are happy to answer any questions. I had a couple of nights with poor sleep because of loud guests but it was a rare occurrence.
hotelName:
30    WISE OWL HOSTELS SHIBUYA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed in the female-only dormitory for one night. The sleeping area is spacious enough for a comfy sleep. The common space in the room may be a bit small if you have big luggage but otherwise substantial for 6 persons to share. The place is clean and well-kept. Felt safe within the room, hostel, and the surrounding area. The staff were attentive and I very much appreciate that they've taken note of my request surrounding locker space. Can certainly recommend this place and look forward to staying again on my next trip to Japan.
hotelName:
30    WISE OWL HOSTELS SHIBUYA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Simple but enough to stay for few days. Place feels very new and clean. Access to the rooms are controlled by access card, so it feels pretty secured.
